And he added: "O my sons! Do not enter [the city all] by one
			gate, but enter by different gates.<sup class='fn'>65</sup> Yet [even so,] I
			can be of no avail whatever to you against [anything that may be
			willed by] God: judgment [as to what is to happen] rests with
			none but God. In Him have I placed my trust: for, all who have
			trust [in His existence] must place their trust in Him alone."

But although<sup class='fn'>66</sup> they entered [Joseph's city] in the way
			their father had bidden them, this proved of no avail whatever to
			them against [the plan of] God.<sup class='fn'>67</sup> [His request] had
			served only to satisfy Jacob's heartfelt desire [to protect
			them]:<sup class='fn'>68</sup> for, behold, thanks to what We had imparted
			unto him, he was indeed endowed with the knowledge [that God's
			will must always prevail<sup class='fn'>69</sup> ]; but most people know it
			not.

AND WHEN [the sons of Jacob] presented themselves before Joseph,
			he drew his brother [Benjamin] unto himself, saying [to him in
			secret]: "Behold, I am thy brother! So grieve thou not over their
			past doings!"<sup class='fn'>70</sup>

And [later,] when he had provided them with their provisions, he
			placed the [King's] drinking-cup in his brother's camel-pack. And
			[as they were leaving the city,] a herald<sup class='fn'>71</sup> called out:
			"O you people of the caravan! Verily, you are
			thieves!"<sup class='fn'>72</sup>
Turning towards the herald and his companions, the brothers\n\t\t\tasked:<sup class='fn'>73</sup> "What is it that you miss?"
They answered: "We miss the King's goblet; and he who produces it\n\t\t\tshall receive a camel-load [of grain as reward]!" And [the herald\n\t\t\tadded:] "I pledge myself to this [promise]!"
Said [the brothers]: "By God! Well do you know that we have not\n\t\t\tcome to commit deeds of corruption in this land, and that we have\n\t\t\tnot been thieving!"
[The Egyptians] said: "But what shall be the requital of this\n\t\t\t[deed] if you are [proved to be] liars?"

[The brothers] replied: "Its requital? He in whose camel-pack
			[the cup] is found - he shall be [enslaved as] a requital
			thereof! Thus do we [ourselves] requite the doers of [such]
			wrong."<sup class='fn'>74</sup>

Thereupon [they were brought before Joseph to be searched; and]
			he began with the bags of his half-brothers<sup class='fn'>75</sup> before the
			bag of his brother [Benjamin]: and in the end he brought forth
			the drinking-cup<sup class='fn'>76</sup> out of his brother's bag. In this way
			did We contrive for Joseph [the attainment of his heart's
			desire]: under the King's law, he would [otherwise] not have been
			able to detain his brother, had not God so willed. We do raise to
			[high] degrees [of knowledge] whomever We will - but above
			everyone who is endowed with knowledge there is One who knows
			all.<sup class='fn'>77</sup>

[As soon as the cup came to light out of Benjamin's bag, the
			brothers] exclaimed: "If he has stolen - well, a brother of his
			used to steal aforetime!"<sup class='fn'>78</sup> Thereupon Joseph said to
			himself, without revealing his thought to them:<sup class='fn'>79</sup> "You
			are far worse in this respect, and God is fully aware of what you
			are saying."<sup class='fn'>80</sup>
They said: "O thou great one! Behold, he has a father, a very old\n\t\t\tman: detain, therefore, one of us in his stead. Verily, we see\n\t\t\tthat thou art a doer of good!"
He answered: "May God preserve us from [the sin of] detaining any\n\t\t\tother than him with whom we have found our property - for then,\n\t\t\tbehold, we would indeed be evildoers!"

And so, when they lost all hope of [moving] him, they withdrew to
			take counsel [among themselves]. The eldest of them said: "Do you
			not remember<sup class='fn'>81</sup> that your father has bound you by a
			solemn pledge before God - and how, before that, you had failed
			with regard to Joseph? Hence, I shall not depart from this land
			till my father gives me leave or God passes judgment in my
			favour:<sup class='fn'>82</sup> for He is the best of all judges.

[And as for you others,] return to your father and say: 'O our
			father! Behold, thy son has stolen - but we [can] bear witness to
			no more than what has become known to us;<sup class='fn'>83</sup> and
			[although we gave you our pledge,] we could not guard against
			something that [lay hidden in the future and, hence,] was beyond
			the reach of our perception.<sup class='fn'>84</sup>
And ask thou in the town in which we were [at the time], and of\n\t\t\tthe people of the caravan with whom we travelled hither, and\n\t\t\t[thou wilt find that] we are indeed telling the truth!'"

[AND WHEN they returned to their father and told him what had
			happened,] he exclaimed: "Nay, but it is your [own] minds that
			have made [so terrible] a happening seem a matter of little
			account to you! But [as for myself,] patience in adversity is
			most goodly; God may well bring them all [back] unto
			me:<sup class='fn'>85</sup> verily, He alone is all-knowing, truly wise!"
But he turned away from them and said: "O woe is me for Joseph!"\n\t\t\t- and his eyes became dim<sup class='fn'>86</sup> from the grief with which he\n\t\t\twas filled.
Said [his sons]: "By God! Thou wilt never cease to remember\n\t\t\tJoseph till thou art broken in body and spirit or art dead!"
He answered: "It is only to God that I complain of my deep grief\n\t\t\tand my sorrow: for I know, from God, something that you do not\n\t\t\tknow.<sup class='fn'>87</sup>

[Hence,] O my sons, go forth and try to obtain some tidings of
			Joseph and his brother; and do not lose hope of God's life-giving
			mercy:<sup class='fn'>88</sup> verily, none but people who deny the truth can
			ever lose hope of God's life-giving mercy."

[AND THE SONS of Jacob went back to Egypt and to Joseph;] and
			when they presented themselves before him, they said: "O thou
			great one! Hardship has visited us and our folk, and so we have
			brought but scanty merchandise;<sup class='fn'>89</sup> but give us a full
			measure [of grain], and be charitable to us: behold, God rewards
			those who give in charity!"
Replied he: "Do you remember<sup class='fn'>90</sup> what you did to Joseph\n\t\t\tand his brother when you were still unaware [of right and\n\t\t\twrong]?"<sup class='fn'>91</sup>

They exclaimed: "Why - is it indeed thou who art Joseph?" He
			answered: "I am Joseph, and this is my brother. God has indeed
			been gracious unto us. Verily, if one is<sup class='fn'>92</sup> conscious of
			Him and patient in adversity - behold, God does not fail to
			requite the doers of good!"
[The brothers] said: "By God! Most certainly has God raised thee\n\t\t\thigh above us, and we were indeed but sinners!"
Said he: "No reproach shall be uttered today against you. May God\n\t\t\tforgive you your sins: for He is the most merciful of the\n\t\t\tmerciful!
[And now] go and take this tunic of mine and lay it over my\n\t\t\tfather's face, and he will recover his sight.<sup class='fn'>93</sup> And\n\t\t\tthereupon come [back] to me with all your family."

AND AS SOON as the caravan [with which Jacob's sons were
			travelling] was on its way,<sup class='fn'>94</sup> their father said [to the
			people around him]: "Behold, were it not that you might consider
			me a dotard, [I would say that] I truly feel the breath of Joseph
			[in the air]!"
They answered: "By God! Thou art indeed still lost in thy old\n\t\t\taberration!"

But when the bearer of good tidings came [with Joseph's tunic],
			he laid it over his face; and he regained his sight, [and]
			exclaimed: "Did I not tell you, 'Verily, I know, from God,
			something that you do not know'?"<sup class='fn'>95</sup>
[His sons] answered: "O our father! Ask God to forgive us our\n\t\t\tsins, for, verily, we were sinners."
He said: "I shall ask my Sustainer to forgive you: He alone is\n\t\t\ttruly forgiving, a true dispenser of grace!"

AND WHEN they [all arrived in Egypt and] presented themselves
			before Joseph, he drew his parents unto himself,<sup class='fn'>96</sup>
			saying, "Enter Egypt! If God so wills, you shall be secure [from
			all evil]!"

And he raised his parents to the highest place of
			honour;<sup class='fn'>97</sup> and they [all] fell down before Him,
			prostrating themselves in adoration.<sup class='fn'>98</sup> Thereupon
			[Joseph] said: "O my father! This is the real meaning of my dream
			of long ago, which my Sustainer has made come true.<sup class='fn'>99</sup>
			And He was indeed good to me when He freed me from the prison,
			and [when] He brought you [all unto me] from the desert after
			Satan had sown discord between me and my brothers. Verily, my
			Sustainer is unfathomable in [the way He brings about] whatever
			He wills:<sup class='fn'>100</sup> verily, He alone is all-knowing, truly
			wise!

"O my Sustainer! Thou hast indeed bestowed upon me something of
			power,<sup class='fn'>101</sup> and hast imparted unto me some knowledge of
			the inner meaning of happenings.<sup class='fn'>102</sup> Originator of the
			heavens and the earth! Thou art near unto me in this world and in
			the life to come: let me die as one who has surrendered himself
			unto Thee, and make me one with the righteous!"

THIS ACCOUNT of something that was beyond the reach of thy
			perception We [now] reveal unto thee, [O Prophet:] for thou wert
			not with Joseph's brothers<sup class='fn'>103</sup> when they resolved upon
			what they were going to do and wove their schemes [against him].
Yet - however strongly thou mayest desire it - most people will\n\t\t\tnot believe [in this revelation],
although thou dost not ask of them any reward for it: it is but\n\t\t\t[God's] reminder unto all mankind.
But [then] - how many a sign is there in the heavens and on earth\n\t\t\twhich they pass by [unthinkingly], and on which they turn their\n\t\t\tbacks!
And most of them do not even believe in God without [also]\n\t\t\tascribing divine powers to other beings beside Him.

Do they, then, feel free from the fear that there might fall upon
			them the overwhelming terror of God's chastisement, or that the
			Last Hour might come upon them of a sudden, without their being
			aware [of its approach]?

Say [O Prophet]: "This is my way: Resting upon conscious insight
			accessible to reason, I am calling [you all] unto God<sup class='fn'>104</sup>
			- I and they who follow me. And [say:] "Limitless is God in His
			glory; and I am not one of those who ascribe divinity to aught
			beside Him!"

And [even] before thy time, We never sent [as Our apostles] any
			but [mortal] men, whom We inspired, [and whom We always chose]
			from among the people of the [very] communities [to whom the
			message was to be brought].<sup class='fn'>105</sup> Have, then, they [who
			reject this divine writ] never journeyed about the earth and
			beheld what happened in the end to those [deniers of the truth]
			who lived before them? - and [do they not know that] to those who
			are conscious of God the life in the hereafter is indeed better
			[than this world]? Will they not, then, use their reason?

[All the earlier apostles had to suffer persecution for a long
			time;] but at last<sup class='fn'>106</sup> - when those apostles had lost all
			hope and saw themselves branded as liars<sup class='fn'>107</sup> - Our
			succour attained to them: whereupon everyone whom We willed [to
			be saved] was saved [and the deniers of the truth were
			destroyed]: for, never can Our punishment be averted from people
			who are lost in sin.

Indeed, in the stories of these men<sup class='fn'>108</sup> there is a lesson
			for those who are endowed with insight. [As for this
			revelation,<sup class='fn'>109</sup> ] it could not possibly be a discourse
			invented [by man]: nay indeed,<sup class='fn'>110</sup> it is [a divine writ]
			confirming the truth of whatever there still remains [of earlier
			revelations], clearly spelling out everything,<sup class='fn'>111</sup> and
			[offering] guidance and grace unto people who will believe.

Alif. Lam. Mim. Ra.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> THESE ARE MESSAGES of
			revelation:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and what has been bestowed upon thee from
			on high by thy Sustainer is the truth - yet most people will not
			believe [in it].<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

It is God who has raised the heavens without any supports that
			you could see, and is established on the throne of His
			almightiness;<sup class='fn'>4</sup> and He [it is who] has made the sun and
			the moon subservient [to His laws], each running its course for a
			term set [by Him].<sup class='fn'>5</sup> He governs all that exists. Clearly
			does He spell out these messages, so that you might be certain in
			your innermost that you are destined to meet your Sustainer [on
			Judgment Day].<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

And it is He who has spread the earth wide and placed on it firm
			mountains and running waters, and created thereon two sexes of
			every [kind of] plant;<sup class='fn'>7</sup> [and it is He who] causes the
			night to cover the day. Verily, in all this there are messages
			indeed for people who think!

And there are on earth [many] tracts of land close by one another
			[and yet widely differing from one another<sup class='fn'>8</sup> ]; and
			[there are on it] vinyards, end fields of grain, and date-palms
			growing in clusters from one root or standing alone,<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
			[all] watered with the same water: and yet, some of them have We
			favoured above others by way of the food [which they provide for
			man and beast].<sup class='fn'>10</sup> Verily, in all this there are messages
			indeed for people who use their reason!

BUT IF thou art amazed [at the marvels of God's creation],
			amazing, too, is their saying, "What! After we have become dust,
			shall we indeed be [restored to life] in a new act of
			creation?"<sup class='fn'>11</sup> It is they who [thus show that they] are
			bent on denying their Sustainer;<sup class='fn'>12</sup> and it is they who
			carry the shackles [of their own making] around their
			necks;<sup class='fn'>13</sup> and it is they who are destined for the fire,
			therein to abide.

And [since, O Prophet, they are bent on denying the truth,] they
			challenge thee to hasten the coming upon them of evil instead of
			[hoping for] good<sup class='fn'>14</sup> - although [they ought to know that]
			the exemplary punishments [which they now deride] have indeed
			come to pass before their time. Now, behold, thy Sustainer is
			full of forgiveness unto men despite all their
			evildoing:<sup class='fn'>15</sup> but, behold, thy Sustainer is [also] truly
			severe in retribution!

However, they who are bent on denying the truth [refuse to
			believe and] say, "Why has no miraculous sign ever been bestowed
			on him from on high by his Sustainer?"<sup class='fn'>16</sup> [But] thou art
			only a warner; and [in God] all people have a guide.<sup class='fn'>17</sup>

God knows what any female bears [in her womb], and by how much
			the wombs may fall short [in gestation], and by how much they may
			increase [the average period]:<sup class='fn'>18</sup> for with Him everything
			is [created] in accordance with its scope and purpose.<sup class='fn'>19</sup>

He knows all that is beyond the reach of a created being's
			perception as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature's
			senses or mind<sup class='fn'>20</sup> - the Great One, the One far above
			anything that is or could ever be!<sup class='fn'>21</sup>

It is all alike [to Him] whether any of you conceals his
			thought<sup class='fn'>22</sup> or brings it into the open, and whether he
			seeks to hide [his evil deeds] under the cover of night or walks
			[boldly] in the light of day,<sup class='fn'>23</sup>

[thinking that] he has hosts of helpers - both such as can be
			perceived by him and such as are hidden from him<sup class='fn'>24</sup> -
			that could preserve him from whatever God may have
			willed.<sup class='fn'>25</sup> Verily, God does not change men's condition
			unless they change their inner selves;<sup class='fn'>26</sup> and when God
			wills people to suffer evil [in consequence of their own evil
			deeds], there is none who could avert it: for they have none who
			could protect them from Him.
HE IT IS who displays before you the lightning, to give rise to\n\t\t\t[both] fear and hope,<sup class='fn'>27</sup> and calls heavy clouds into\n\t\t\tbeing;

and the thunder extols His limitless glory and praises Him, and
			[so do] the angels, in awe of Him; and He [it is who] lets loose
			the thunderbolts and strikes with them whom He wills. And yet
			they stubbornly argue about God,<sup class='fn'>28</sup> notwithstanding [all
			evidence] that He alone has the power to contrive whatever His
			unfathomable wisdom wills!<sup class='fn'>29</sup>

Unto Him [alone] is due all prayer aiming at the Ultimate
			Truth,<sup class='fn'>30</sup> since those [other beings or powers] whom men
			invoke instead of God<sup class='fn'>31</sup> cannot respond to them in any
			way - [so that he who invokes them is] but like one who stretches
			his open hands<sup class='fn'>32</sup> towards water, [hoping] that it will
			reach his mouth, the while it never reaches him. Hence, the
			prayer of those who deny the truth amounts to no more than losing
			oneself in grievous error.

And before God prostrate themselves, willingly or unwillingly,
			all [things and beings] that are in the heavens and on
			earth,<sup class='fn'>33</sup> as do their shadows in the mornings and the
			evenings.<sup class='fn'>34</sup>

Say "Who is the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth?" Say:
			"[It is] God." Say: "[Why,] then, do you take for your
			protectors, instead of Him, such as have it not within their
			power to bring benefit to, or avert harm from, themselves?" Say:
			"Can the blind and the seeing be deemed equal? - or can the
			depths of darkness and the light be deemed equal?" Or do they
			[really] believe that there are, side by side with God, other
			divine powers<sup class='fn'>35</sup> that have created the like of what He
			creates, so that this act of creation appears to them to be
			similar [to His]?<sup class='fn'>36</sup> Say: "God is the Creator of all
			things; and He is the One who holds absolute sway over all that
			exists."

[Whenever] He sends down water from the sky, and [once-dry]
			river-beds are running high<sup class='fn'>37</sup> according to their
			measure, the stream carries scum on its surface;<sup class='fn'>38</sup> and,
			likewise, from that [metal] which they smelt in the fire in order
			to make ornaments or utensils, [there rises] scum. In this way
			does God set forth the parable of truth and falsehood: for, as
			far as the scum is concerned, it passes away as [does all] dross;
			but that which is of benefit to man abides on earth. In this way
			does God set forth the parables

of those who have responded to their Sustainer with a goodly
			response, and of those who did not respond to Him.<sup class='fn'>39</sup> [As
			for the latter,] if they possessed all that is on earth, and
			twice as much,<sup class='fn'>40</sup> they would surely offer it as ransom
			[on the Day of Judgment]:<sup class='fn'>41</sup> a most evil reckoning awaits
			them, and their goal is hell: and how evil a resting-place!

CAN, THEN, he who knows that whatever has been bestowed from on
			high upon thee by thy Sustainer is the truth be deemed equal to
			one who is blind? Only they who are endowed with insight keep
			this in mind:
they who are true to their bond with God and never break their\n\t\t\tcovenant;<sup class='fn'>42</sup>

and who keep together what God has bidden to be
			joined,<sup class='fn'>43</sup> and stand in awe of their Sustainer and fear
			the most evil reckoning [which awaits such as do not respond to
			Him];

and who are patient in adversity out of a longing for their
			Sustainer's countenance, and are constant in prayer, and spend on
			others, secretly and openly, out of what We provide for them as
			sustenance, and [who] repel evil with good.<sup class='fn'>44</sup> It is
			these that shall find their fulfilment in the
			hereafter:<sup class='fn'>45</sup>

gardens of perpetual bliss, which they shall enter together with
			the righteous from among their parents, their spouses, and their
			offspring;<sup class='fn'>46</sup> and the angels will come unto them from
			every gate [and will say]:
"Peace be upon you, because you have persevered!" How excellent,\n\t\t\tthen, this fulfilment in the hereafter!

But as for those who break their bond with God after it has been
			established [in their nature],<sup class='fn'>47</sup> and cut asunder what
			God has bidden to be joined, and spread corruption on earth -
			their due is rejection [by God],<sup class='fn'>48</sup> and theirs is a most
			evil fate [in the life to come].

GOD GRANTS abundant sustenance, or gives it in scant measure,
			unto whomever He wills; and they [who are given abundance]
			rejoice in the life of this world - even though, as compared with
			the life to come, the life of this world is nought but a fleeting
			pleasure.

NOW THOSE who are bent on denying the truth [of the Prophet's
			message] say, "Why has no miraculous sign ever been bestowed upon
			him from on high by his Sustainer?"<sup class='fn'>49</sup> Say: "Behold, God
			lets go astray him who wills [to go astray],<sup class='fn'>50</sup> just as
			He guides unto Himself all who turn unto Him -
those who believe, and whose hearts find their rest in the\n\t\t\tremembrance of God - for, verily, in the remembrance of God\n\t\t\t[men's] hearts do find their rest -:
[and so it is that] they who attain to faith and do righteous\n\t\t\tdeeds are destined for happiness [in this world] and the most\n\t\t\tbeauteous of all goals [in the life to come]!"

Thus<sup class='fn'>51</sup> have We raised thee [O Muhammad] as Our Apostle
			amidst a community [of unbelievers] before whose time [similar]
			communities have come and gone,<sup class='fn'>52</sup> so that thou might
			propound to them what We have revealed unto thee: for [in their
			ignorance] they deny the Most Gracious!<sup class='fn'>53</sup> Say: "He is
			my Sustainer. There is no deity save Him. In Him have I placed my
			trust, and unto Him is my recourse!"

Yet even if [they should listen to] a [divine] discourse by which
			mountains could be moved, or the earth cleft asunder, or the dead
			made to speak - [they who are bent on denying the truth would
			still refuse to believe in it]!<sup class='fn'>54</sup> Nay, but God alone has
			the power to decide what shall be.<sup class='fn'>55</sup> Have, then, they
			who have attained to faith not yet come to know that, had God so
			willed, He would indeed have guided all mankind
			aright?<sup class='fn'>56</sup> But as for those who are bent on denying the
			truth - in result of their [evil] deeds, sudden calamities will
			always befall them or will alight close to their
			homes;<sup class='fn'>57</sup> [and this will continue] until God's promise
			[of resurrection] is fulfilled: verily, God never fails to fulfil
			His promise!

And, indeed, [even] before thy time have [God's] apostles been
			derided, and for a while I gave rein to those who were [thus]
			bent on denying the truth: but then I took them to task - and how
			awesome was My retribution!

IS, THEN, HE who has every living being<sup class='fn'>58</sup> in His
			almighty care, [dealing with each] according to what it
			deserves<sup class='fn'>59</sup> - [is, then, He like anything else that
			exists]? And yet, they ascribe to other beings a share in God's
			divinity! Say: "Give them any name [you please]:<sup class='fn'>60</sup> but
			do you [really think that you could] inform Him of anything on
			earth that He does not know - or [do you] but play with
			words?"<sup class='fn'>61</sup> Nay, goodly seems their false
			imagery<sup class='fn'>62</sup> to those who are bent on denying the truth,
			and so they are turned away from the [right] path: and he whom
			God lets go astray can never find any guide.<sup class='fn'>63</sup>

For such, there is suffering in the life of this
			world;<sup class='fn'>64</sup> but, truly, [their] suffering in the life to
			come will be harder still, and they will have none to shield them
			from God.

THE PARABLE of the paradise promised to those who are conscious
			of God [is that of a garden] through which running waters
			flow:<sup class='fn'>65</sup> [but, unlike an earthly garden,] its fruits will
			be everlasting, and [so will be] its shade.<sup class='fn'>66</sup> Such will
			be the destiny of those who remain conscious of God - just as the
			destiny of those who deny the truth will be the fire.<sup class='fn'>67</sup>

Hence, they unto whom We have vouchsafed this
			revelation<sup class='fn'>68</sup> rejoice at all that has been bestowed upon
			thee [O Prophet] from on high;<sup class='fn'>69</sup> but among the followers
			of other creeds there are such as deny the validity of some of
			it.<sup class='fn'>70</sup> Say [unto them, O Prophet]: "I have only been
			bidden to worship God, and not to ascribe divine powers to aught
			beside Him:<sup class='fn'>71</sup> unto Him do I call [all mankind], and He
			is my goal!"

Thus, then, have We bestowed from on high this [divine writ] as
			an ordinance in the Arabic tongue.<sup class='fn'>72</sup> And, indeed, if
			thou shouldst defer to men's likes and dislikes<sup class='fn'>73</sup> after
			all the [divine] knowledge that has come unto thee, thou wouldst
			have none to protect thee from God, and none to shield thee [from
			Him].

And, truly, We sent forth apostles before thee, and We appointed
			for them wives and offspring;<sup class='fn'>74</sup> and it was not given to
			any apostle to produce a miracle save at God's behest.<sup class='fn'>75</sup>
			Every age has had its revelation:<sup class='fn'>76</sup>
God annuls or confirms whatever He wills [of His earlier\n\t\t\tmessages] - for with Him is the source of all\n\t\t\trevelation.<sup class='fn'>77</sup>

BUT WHETHER We let thee see [in thy lifetime, O Prophet, the
			fulfilment of] some of what We have promised them,<sup class='fn'>78</sup> or
			whether We cause thee to die [before its fulfilment] - thy duty
			is no more than to deliver the message; and the reckoning is
			Ours.

Have, then, they [who deny the truth] never yet seen
			how<sup class='fn'>79</sup> We visit the earth [with Our punishment],
			gradually depriving it of all that is best thereon?<sup class='fn'>80</sup>
			For, [when] God judges, there is no power that could repel His
			judgment: and swift in reckoning is He!

Now those who lived before these [sinners] did, too, devise many
			a blasphemy<sup class='fn'>81</sup> - but the most subtle devising is that of
			God, who knows what each human being deserves:<sup class='fn'>82</sup> and the
			deniers of the truth will [in time] come to know to whom the
			future belongs.<sup class='fn'>83</sup>

And [if] they who are bent on denying the truth say [unto thee, O
			Prophet], "Thou hast not been sent [by God]", say thou: "None can
			bear witness between me and you as God does; and [none can bear
			witness as does] he who truly understands this divine
			writ."<sup class='fn'>84</sup>

Alif. Lam. Ra.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> A DIVINE WRIT [is this - a revelation]
			which We have bestowed upon thee from on high in order that thou
			might bring forth all mankind, by their Sustainer's leave, out of
			the depths of darkness into the light: onto the way that leads to
			the Almighty, the One to whom all praise is due -
to God, unto whom all that is in the heavens and all that is on\n\t\t\tearth, belongs. But woe unto those who deny the truth: for\n\t\t\tsuffering severe

awaits those who choose the life of this world as the sole object
			of their love,<sup class='fn'>2</sup> preferring it to [all thought of] the
			life to come, and who turn others away from the path of God and
			try to make it appear crooked. Such as these have indeed gone far
			astray!

AND NEVER have We sent forth any apostle otherwise than [with a
			message] in his own people's tongue, so that he might make [the
			truth] clear unto them;<sup class='fn'>3</sup> but God lets go astray him that
			wills [to go astray], and guides him that wills [to be guided] -
			for He alone is almighty, truly wise.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>

And [thus], indeed, have We sent forth Moses with Our messages
			[and this Our command]: "Lead thy people out of the depths of
			darkness into the light, and remind them of the Days of
			God!"<sup class='fn'>5</sup> Verily, in this [reminder] there are messages
			indeed for all who are wholly patient in adversity and deeply
			grateful [to God].

And, lo,<sup class='fn'>6</sup> Moses spoke [thus] unto his people: "Remember
			the blessings which God bestowed upon you when He saved you from
			Pharaoh's people who afflicted you with cruel suffering, and
			slaughtered your sons, and spared [only] your women<sup class='fn'>7</sup> -
			which was an awesome trial from your Sustainer.

And [remember the time] when your Sustainer made [this promise]
			known: 'If you are grateful [to Me], I shall most certainly give
			you more and more;<sup class='fn'>8</sup> but if you are ungrateful, verily,
			My chastisement will be severe indeed!'"
And Moses added: "If you should [ever] deny the truth - you and\n\t\t\twhoever else lives on earth, all of you - [know that,] verily,\n\t\t\tGod is indeed self-sufficient, ever to be praised!"

HAVE THE STORIES of those [deniers of the truth] who lived before
			you never yet come within your ken - [the stories of] the people
			of Noah, and of [the tribes of] 'Ad and Thamud, and of those who
			came after them? None knows them [now] save God.<sup class='fn'>9</sup> There
			came unto them their apostles with all evidence of the truth -
			but they covered their mouths with their hands<sup class='fn'>10</sup> and
			answered: "Behold, we refuse to regard as true the message with
			which you [claim to] have been entrusted; and, behold, we are in
			grave doubt, amounting to suspicion, about [the meaning of] your
			call to us!"<sup class='fn'>11</sup>

Said the apostles sent unto them:<sup class='fn'>12</sup> "Can there be any
			doubt about [the existence and oneness of] God, the Originator of
			the heavens and the earth? It is He who calls unto you, so that
			He may forgive you [whatever is past] of your sins and grant you
			respite until a term [set by Him is fulfilled]."<sup class='fn'>13</sup> [But]
			they replied: "You are nothing but mortal men like ourselves! You
			want to turn us away from what our forefathers were wont to
			worship: well, then, bring us a clear proof [of your being God's
			message-bearers]!"

Their apostles answered them: "True, we are nothing but mortal
			men like yourselves: but God bestows His favour upon whomever He
			wills of His servants. Withal, it is not within our power to
			bring you a proof [of our mission], unless it be by God's leave -
			and [so] it is in God that all believers must place their
			trust.<sup class='fn'>14</sup>

And how could we not place our trust in God, seeing that it is He
			who has shown us the path which we are to follow?<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
			"Hence, we shall certainly bear with patience whatever hurt you
			may do us: for, all who have trust [in His existence] must place
			their trust in God [alone]!"

But they who denied the truth spoke [thus] unto their apostles:
			"We shall most certainly expel you from our land, unless you
			return forthwith to our ways!"<sup class='fn'>16</sup> Whereupon their
			Sustainer revealed this to His apostles:<sup class='fn'>17</sup> "Most
			certainly shall We destroy these evildoers,

and most certainly shall We cause you to dwell on earth [long]
			after they have passed away:<sup class='fn'>18</sup> this is [My promise] unto
			all who stand in awe of My presence, and stand in awe of My
			warning!"<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
And they prayed [to God] that the truth be made to\n\t\t\ttriumph.<sup class='fn'>20</sup> And [thus it is:] every arrogant enemy of the\n\t\t\ttruth shall be undone [in the life to come],
with hell awaiting him;<sup class='fn'>21</sup> and he shall be made to drink\n\t\t\tof the water of most bitter distress,<sup class='fn'>22</sup>

gulping it [unceasingly,] little by little, and yet hardly able
			to swallow it.<sup class='fn'>23</sup> And death will beset him from every
			quarter - but he shall not die: for [yet more] severe suffering
			lies ahead of him.

[This, then, is] the parable of those who are bent on denying
			their Sustainer: all their works<sup class='fn'>24</sup> are as ashes which
			the wind blows about fiercely on a stormy day: [in the life to
			come,] they cannot achieve any benefit whatever from all [the
			good] that they may have wrought: for this [denial of God] is
			indeed the farthest one can go astray.<sup class='fn'>25</sup>

ART THOU NOT aware that God has created the heavens and the earth
			in accordance with [an inner] truth?<sup class='fn'>26</sup> He can, if He so
			wills, do away with you and bring forth a new mankind [in your
			stead]:<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
nor is this difficult for God.

And all [mankind] will appear before God [on the Day of
			Judement]; and then the weak<sup class='fn'>28</sup> will say unto those who
			had gloried in their arrogance: "Behold, We were but your
			followers: can you, then, relieve us of something of God's
			chastisement?" [And the others] will answer: "If God would but
			show us the way [to salvation], we would indeed guide you
			[towards it].<sup class='fn'>29</sup> It is [now] all one, as far as we are
			concerned, whether we grieve impatiently or endure [our lot] with
			patience: there is no escape for us!"

And when everything will have been decided, Satan will say:
			"Behold, God promised you something that was bound to come
			true!<sup class='fn'>30</sup> I, too, held out [all manner of] promises to you
			- but I deceived you. Yet I had no power at all over you: I but
			called you - and you responded unto me. Hence, blame not me, but
			blame yourselves.<sup class='fn'>31</sup> It is not for me to respond to your
			cries, nor for you to respond to mine:<sup class='fn'>32</sup> for, behold, I
			have [always] refused to admit that there was any truth in your
			erstwhile belief that I had a share in God's
			divinity."<sup class='fn'>33</sup> Verily, for all evildoers<sup class='fn'>34</sup> there
			is grievous suffering in store.

But those who shall have attained to faith and done righteous
			deeds will be brought into gardens through which running waters
			flow, therein to abide by their Sustainer's leave, and will be
			welcomed with the greeting, "Peace!"<sup class='fn'>35</sup>
ART THOU NOT aware how God sets forth the parable of a good\n\t\t\tword?<sup class='fn'>36</sup> [It is] like a good tree, firmly rooted,\n\t\t\t[reaching out] with its branches towards the sky,

yielding its fruit at all times by its Sustainer's leave. And\n\t\t\t[thus it is that] God propounds parables unto men, so that they\n\t\t\tmight bethink themselves [of the truth].<sup class='fn'>37</sup>
And the parable of a corrupt word is that of a corrupt tree, torn\n\t\t\tup [from its roots] onto the face of the earth, wholly unable to\n\t\t\tendure.<sup class='fn'>38</sup>

[Thus,] God grants firmness unto those who have attained to faith
			through the word that is unshakably true<sup class='fn'>39</sup> in the life
			of this world as well as in the life to come; but the wrongdoers
			He lets go astray:<sup class='fn'>40</sup> for God does whatever He wills.

ART THOU NOT aware of those who have preferred a denial of the\n\t\t\ttruth to God's blessings,<sup class='fn'>41</sup> and [thereby] invited their\n\t\t\tpeople to alight in that abode of utter desolation
- hell - which they [themselves] will have to endure?<sup class='fn'>42</sup>\n\t\t\tAnd how vile a state to settle in!

For, they claimed that there are powers that could rival
			God,<sup class='fn'>43</sup> and so they strayed from His path. Say: "Enjoy
			yourselves [in this world], but, verily, the fire will be your
			journey's end!"

[And] tell [those of] My servants who have attained to faith that
			they should be constant in prayer and spend [in Our way],
			secretly and openly, out of what We provide for them as
			sustenance,<sup class='fn'>44</sup> ere there come a Day when there will be no
			bargaining, and no mutual befriending.<sup class='fn'>45</sup>

[And remember that] it is God who has created the heavens and the
			earth, and who sends down water from the sky and thereby brings
			forth [all manner] of fruits for your sustenance; and who has
			made ships subservient to you, so that they may sail through the
			sea at His behest; and has made the rivers subservient [to His
			laws, so that they be of use] to you;

and has made the sun and the moon, both of them constant upon
			their courses, subservient [to His laws, so that they be of use]
			to you; and has made the night and the day subservient [to His
			laws, so that they be of use] to you.<sup class='fn'>46</sup>

And [always] does He give you something out of what you may be
			asking of Him;<sup class='fn'>47</sup> and should you try to count God's
			blessings, you could never compute them. [And yet,] behold, man
			is indeed most persistent in wrongdoing, stubbornly ingrate!

AND [remember the time] when Abraham spoke [thus]:<sup class='fn'>48</sup> "O\n\t\t\tmy Sustainer! Make this land secure <sup class='fn'>49</sup> and preserve me and my\n\t\t\tchildren from ever worshipping idols<sup class='fn'>50</sup> -

for, verily, O my Sustainer, these [false objects of worship]
			have led many people astray! "Hence, [only] he who follows me [in
			this my faith] is truly of me;<sup class='fn'>51</sup> and as for him who
			disobeys me - Thou art, verily, much-forgiving, a dispenser of
			grace!

"O our Sustainer! Behold, I have settled some of my offspring in
			a valley in which there is no arable land,<sup class='fn'>52</sup> close to
			Thy sanctified Temple, so that, O our Sustainer, they might
			devote themselves to prayer: cause Thou, therefore, people's
			hearts to incline towards them,<sup class='fn'>53</sup> and grant them
			fruitful sustenance, so that they might have cause to be
			grateful.

"O our Sustainer! Thou truly knowest all that we may hide [in our\n\t\t\thearts] as well as all that we bring into the open: for nothing\n\t\t\twhatever, be it on earth or in heaven, remains hidden from God.
"All praise is due to God, who has bestowed upon me, in my old\n\t\t\tage, Ishmael and Isaac! Behold, my Sustainer hears indeed all\n\t\t\tprayer:
[hence,] O my Sustainer, cause me and [some] of my offspring to\n\t\t\tremain constant in prayer!<sup class='fn'>54</sup> "And, O our Sustainer,\n\t\t\taccept this my prayer:
Grant Thy forgiveness unto me, and my parents, and all the\n\t\t\tbelievers, on the Day on which the [last] reckoning will come to\n\t\t\tpass!"
AND DO NOT think that God is unaware of what the evildoers are\n\t\t\tdoing: He but grants them respite until the Day when their eyes\n\t\t\twill stare in horror,<sup class='fn'>55</sup>

the while they will be running confusedly to and fro, with their\n\t\t\theads upraised [in supplication], unable to look away from what\n\t\t\tthey shall behold,<sup class='fn'>56</sup> and their hearts an abysmal void.

Hence, warn men of the Day when this suffering may befall them,
			and when those who did wrong [in their lifetime] will exclaim: "O
			our Sustainer! Grant us respite for a short while, so that we
			might respond to Thy call and follow the apostles!"<sup class='fn'>57</sup>
			[But God will answer:] "Why - were you not aforetime wont to
			swear that no kind of resurrection and retribution awaited
			you?<sup class='fn'>58</sup>

And yet, you dwelt in the dwelling-places of those who had sinned
			against their own selves [before your time],<sup class='fn'>59</sup> and it
			was made obvious to you how We had dealt with them: for We have
			set forth unto you many a parable [of sin, resurrection and
			divine retribution]."<sup class='fn'>60</sup>

And [this retribution will befall all evildoers because] they
			devise that false imagery of theirs<sup class='fn'>61</sup> - and all their
			false imagery is within God's knowledge. [And never can the
			blasphemers prevail against the truth - not] even if their false
			imagery were so [well-devised and so powerful] that mountains
			could be moved thereby.
HENCE, do not think that God will fail to fulfil the promise\n\t\t\twhich He gave to His apostles:<sup class='fn'>62</sup> verily, God is\n\t\t\talmighty, an avenger of evil!

[His promise will be fulfilled] on the Day when the earth shall
			be changed into another earth, as shall be the
			heavens,<sup class='fn'>63</sup> and when [all men] shall appear before God,
			the One who holds absolute sway over all that exists.
For on that Day thou wilt see all who were lost in sin linked\n\t\t\ttogether in fetters,<sup class='fn'>64</sup>
clothed in garments of black pitch, with fire veiling their\n\t\t\tfaces.<sup class='fn'>65</sup>
[And all shall be judged on that Day,] so that God may requite\n\t\t\tevery human being for all that he has earned [in life]: verily,\n\t\t\tGod is swift in reckoning!
THIS IS A MESSAGE unto all mankind. Hence, let them be warned\n\t\t\tthereby, and let them know that He is the One and Only God; and\n\t\t\tlet those who are endowed with insight take this to heart!
Alif. Lam. Ra.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> THESE ARE MESSAGES of revelation - of a\n\t\t\tdiscourse clear in itself and clearly showing the\n\t\t\ttruth.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
And it will come to pass that those who are [now] bent on denying\n\t\t\tthis truth will wish that they had surrendered themselves to God\n\t\t\t[in their lifetime].<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Leave them alone; let them eat and enjoy themselves the while the\n\t\t\thope [of vain delights] beguiles them: for in time they will come\n\t\t\tto know [the truth].
And never have We destroyed any community [for its wrongdoing]\n\t\t\tunless a divine writ had [previously] been made known to\n\t\t\tit;<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
[but remember that] no community can ever forestall [the end of]\n\t\t\tits term - and neither can they delay [it].<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
And yet, they [who deny the truth] say: "O thou unto whom this\n\t\t\treminder has [allegedly] been bestowed from on high: verily, thou\n\t\t\tart mad!
Why dost thou not bring before us angels, if thou art a man of\n\t\t\ttruth?"<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

[Yet] We never send down angels otherwise than in accordance with
			the [demands of] truth;<sup class='fn'>7</sup> and [were the angels to appear
			now,] lo! they [who reject this divine writ] would have no
			further respite!<sup class='fn'>8</sup>

Behold, it is We Ourselves who have bestowed from on high, step\n\t\t\tby step, this reminder:<sup class='fn'>9</sup> and, behold, it is We who shall\n\t\t\ttruly guard it [from all corruption].<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
AND, INDEED, [O Prophet,] even before thy time did We send [Our\n\t\t\tapostles] unto communities<sup class='fn'>11</sup> of old -
and never yet came an apostle to them without their deriding him.
Even so do We [now] cause this [scorn of Our message] to pervade\n\t\t\tthe hearts of those who are lost in sin,
who do not believe in it,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> although the way which those\n\t\t\t[evildoers] of olden times had to go has long been within their\n\t\t\tken.<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
Yet even had We opened to them a gateway to heaven and they had\n\t\t\tascended, on and on, up to it,
they would surely have said, "It is only our eyes that are\n\t\t\tspellbound! Nay, we have been bewitched!"<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
AND, INDEED, We have set up in the heavens great\n\t\t\tconstellations,<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and endowed them with beauty for all\n\t\t\tto behold;
and We have made them secure against every satanic force\n\t\t\taccursed<sup class='fn'>16</sup> -
so that anyone who seeks to learn [the unknowable] by stealth is\n\t\t\tpursued by a flame clear to see.<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
And the earth - We have spread it out wide, and placed on it\n\t\t\tmountains firm, and caused [life] of every kind to grow on it in\n\t\t\ta balanced manner,
and provided thereon means of livelihood for you [O men] as well\n\t\t\tas for all [living beings] whose sustenance does not depend on\n\t\t\tyou.<sup class='fn'>18</sup>

For, no single thing exists that does not have its source with\n\t\t\tUs;<sup class='fn'>19</sup> and nought do We bestow from on high unless it be\n\t\t\tin accordance with a measure well-defined.<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
And We let loose the winds to fertilize [plants],<sup class='fn'>21</sup> and\n\t\t\tWe send down water from the skies and let you drink thereof: and\n\t\t\tit is not you who dispose of its source -
for, behold, it is We - We alone - who grant life and deal death,\n\t\t\tand it is We alone who shall remain after all else will have\n\t\t\tpassed away!<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
And well do We know [the hearts and deeds of all human beings -\n\t\t\tboth] those who lived before you and those who will come after\n\t\t\tyou;<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
and, behold, it is thy Sustainer who will gather them all\n\t\t\ttogether [on Judgment Day]: verily, He is wise, all-knowing!
AND, INDEED, We have created man out of sounding clay, out of\n\t\t\tdark slime transmuted<sup class='fn'>24</sup> -
whereas the invisible beings We had created, [long] before that,\n\t\t\tout of the fire of scorching winds.<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
And lo! Thy Sustainer said unto the angels: "Behold, I am about\n\t\t\tto create mortal man out of sounding clay, out of dark slime\n\t\t\ttransmuted;
and when I have formed him fully and breathed into him of My\n\t\t\tspirit, fall down before him in prostration!"<sup class='fn'>26</sup>
Thereupon the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together,
save Iblis: he refused to be among those who prostrated\n\t\t\tthemselves.<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
Said He: "O Iblis! What is thy reason for not being among those\n\t\t\twho have prostrated themselves?"
[Iblis] replied: "It is not for me to prostrate myself before\n\t\t\tmortal man whom Thou hast created out of sounding clay, out of\n\t\t\tdark slime transmuted!"
Said He: "Go forth, then, from this [angelic state]: for, behold,\n\t\t\tthou art [henceforth] accursed,
and [My] rejection shall be thy due<sup class='fn'>28</sup> until the Day of\n\t\t\tJudgment!"
Said [Iblis]: "Then, O my Sustainer, grant me a respite till the\n\t\t\tDay when all shall be raised from the dead!"
Answered He: "Verily, so be it: thou shalt be among those who are\n\t\t\tgranted respite
till the Day the time whereof is known [to Me alone]."

[Whereupon Iblis] said: "O my Sustainer! Since Thou hast thwarted
			me,<sup class='fn'>29</sup> I shall indeed make [all that is evil] on earth
			seem goodly to them, and shall most certainly beguile them into
			grievous error -
[all] save such of them as are truly Thy servants!"<sup class='fn'>30</sup>
Said He: "This is, with Me, a straight way:<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
verily, thou shalt have no power over My creatures - unless it be\n\t\t\tsuch as are [already] lost in grievous error and follow thee [of\n\t\t\ttheir own will]:<sup class='fn'>32</sup>
and for all such, behold, hell is the promised goal,
with seven gates leading into it, each gate receiving its\n\t\t\tallotted share of sinners."<sup class='fn'>33</sup>
VERILY, those who are conscious of God [shall find themselves in\n\t\t\tthe hereafter] amidst gardens and springs,
[having been received with the greeting,] "Enter here in peace,\n\t\t\tsecure!"

And [by then] We shall have removed whatever unworthy thoughts or
			feelings may have been [lingering] in their breasts, [and they
			shall rest] as brethren, facing one another [in love] upon
			thrones of happiness.<sup class='fn'>34</sup>
No weariness shall ever touch them in this [state of bliss], and\n\t\t\tnever shall they have to forgo it.<sup class='fn'>35</sup>
Tell My servants that I - I alone - am truly forgiving, a true\n\t\t\tdispenser of grace;
and [also,] that the suffering which I shall impose [on sinners]\n\t\t\twill indeed be a suffering most grievous.<sup class='fn'>36</sup>
AND TELL THEM [once again] about Abraham's guests<sup class='fn'>37</sup> -
[how,] when they presented themselves before him and bade him\n\t\t\tpeace, he answered: "Behold, we are afraid of you!"<sup class='fn'>38</sup>
Said they: "Fear not! Behold, we bring thee the glad tiding of\n\t\t\t[the birth of] a son who will be endowed with deep\n\t\t\tknowledge."<sup class='fn'>39</sup>
Said he: "Do you give me this glad tiding despite the fact that\n\t\t\told age has overtaken me? Of what [strange thing], then, are you\n\t\t\tgiving me a tiding!"
They answered: "We have given thee the glad tiding of something\n\t\t\tthat is bound to come true:<sup class='fn'>40</sup> so be not of those who\n\t\t\tabandon hope!"
[Abraham] exclaimed: "And who - other than those who have utterly\n\t\t\tlost their way - could ever abandon the hope of his Sustainer's\n\t\t\tgrace?"
He added: "And what [else] may you have in view, O you [heavenly]\n\t\t\tmessengers?"
They answered: "We are sent to people lost in sin<sup class='fn'>41</sup> [who\n\t\t\tare to be destroyed],
barring Lot's household, all of whom, behold, we shall save -
excepting only his wife, [of whom God says,] 'We have ordained\n\t\t\t[that], behold, she should be among those who stay\n\t\t\tbehind!'"<sup class='fn'>42</sup>
AND WHEN the messengers [of God] came to the house of Lot,
he said: "Behold, you are people unknown [here]!"<sup class='fn'>43</sup>
They answered: "Nay, but we have come unto thee with [the\n\t\t\tannouncement of] something that they [who are given to evil] have\n\t\t\talways been wont to call in question,<sup class='fn'>44</sup>
and we are bringing thee the certainty [of its\n\t\t\tfulfilment]:<sup class='fn'>45</sup> for, behold, we are speaking the truth\n\t\t\tindeed.
Go, then, with thy household while it is yet night, with thyself\n\t\t\tfollowing them in the rear, and let none of you look\n\t\t\tback,<sup class='fn'>46</sup> but proceed whither you are bidden."
And [through Our messengers] We revealed unto him this decree:\n\t\t\t"The last remnant of those [sinners] shall be wiped\n\t\t\tout<sup class='fn'>47</sup> in the morn."
And the people of the city came [unto Lot], rejoicing at the glad\n\t\t\ttiding.<sup class='fn'>48</sup>
Exclaimed [Lot]: "Behold, these are my guests: so put me not to\n\t\t\tshame,
but be conscious of God and disgrace me not!"
They answered: "Have we not forbidden thee [to offer protection]\n\t\t\tto any kind of people?"<sup class='fn'>49</sup>
[Lot] said: "[Take instead] these daughters of mine,<sup class='fn'>50</sup>\n\t\t\tif you must do [whatever you intend to do]!"

[But the angels spoke thus:] "As thou livest, [O Lot, they will\n\t\t\tnot listen to thee:]<sup class='fn'>51</sup> behold, in their delirium [of\n\t\t\tlust] they are but blindly stumbling to and fro!"
And thereupon the blast [of Our punishment] overtook\n\t\t\tthem<sup class='fn'>52</sup> at the time of sunrise,
and We turned those [sinful towns] upside down, and rained down\n\t\t\tupon them stone-hard blows of chastisement\n\t\t\tpre-ordained.<sup class='fn'>53</sup>
Verily, in all this there are messages indeed for those who can\n\t\t\tread the signs:<sup class='fn'>54</sup>
for, behold, those [towns] stood by a road that still\n\t\t\texists.<sup class='fn'>55</sup>
Verily, herein lies a message indeed for all who believe [in\n\t\t\tGod].
AND THE DWELLERS of the wooded dales [of Madyan, too,] were\n\t\t\tinveterate evildoers,<sup class='fn'>56</sup>
and so We inflicted Our retribution on them. And, behold, both\n\t\t\tthese [sinful communities] lived by a highway, [to this day]\n\t\t\tplain to see.<sup class='fn'>57</sup>
AND, [likewise,] indeed, the people of Al-Hijr<sup class='fn'>58</sup> gave\n\t\t\tthe lie to [Our] message-bearers:
for We did vouchsafe them Our messages, but they obstinately\n\t\t\tturned their backs upon them -
notwithstanding that they had been wont [to enjoy Our blessings\n\t\t\tand] to hew out dwellings from the mountains, [wherein they could\n\t\t\tlive] in security<sup class='fn'>59</sup> -:
and so the blast [of Our punishment] overtook them at early morn,
and of no avail to them was all [the power] that they had\n\t\t\tacquired.

AND [remember:] We have not created the heavens and the earth and
			all that is between them without [an inner] truth;<sup class='fn'>60</sup>
			but, behold, the Hour [when this will become clear to all] is
			indeed yet to come. Hence, forgive [men's failings] with fair
			forbearance:
verily, thy Sustainer is the all-knowing Creator of all\n\t\t\tthings!<sup class='fn'>61</sup>
AND, INDEED, We have bestowed upon thee seven of the oft-repeated\n\t\t\t[verses], and [have, thus, laid open before thee] this sublime\n\t\t\tQur'an:<sup class='fn'>62</sup>

[so] turn not shine eyes [longingly] towards the worldly benefits
			which We have granted unto some<sup class='fn'>63</sup> of those [that deny
			the truth]. And neither grieve over those [who refuse to heed
			thee], but spread the wings of thy tenderness over the
			believers,<sup class='fn'>64</sup>
and say: "Behold, I am indeed the plain warner [promised by\n\t\t\tGod]!"<sup class='fn'>65</sup>
[For, thou art the bearer of a divine writ<sup class='fn'>66</sup>] such as We\n\t\t\thave bestowed from on high upon those who [afterwards] broke it\n\t\t\tup into parts,<sup class='fn'>67</sup>
[and] who [now] declare this Qur'an to be [a tissue of]\n\t\t\tfalsehoods!<sup class='fn'>68</sup>
But, by thy Sustainer! [On the Day of Judgment] We shall indeed\n\t\t\tcall them to account, one and all,
for whatever they have done!
Hence, proclaim openly all that thou hast been bidden [to say],\n\t\t\tand leave alone all those who ascribe divinity to aught beside\n\t\t\tGod:
verily, We shall suffice thee against all who [now] deride [this\n\t\t\tmessage - all]
who assert that there are, side by side with God, other divine\n\t\t\tpowers as well:<sup class='fn'>69</sup> for in time they will come to know\n\t\t\t[the truth].
And well do We know that thy bosom is constricted by the\n\t\t\t[blasphemous] things that they say:
but extol thou thy Sustainer's limitless glory and, praise Him,\n\t\t\tand be of those who prostrate themselves [before Him] in\n\t\t\tadoration,
and worship thy Sustainer till death comes to thee.<sup class='fn'>70</sup>

GOD'S JUDGMENT is [bound to] come: do not, therefore, call for
			its speedy advent!<sup class='fn'>1</sup> Limitless is He in His glory and
			sublimely exalted above anything to which men may ascribe a share
			in His divinity!

He causes the angels to descend with this divine
			inspiration,<sup class='fn'>2</sup> [bestowed] at His behest upon whomever He
			wills of His servants: "Warn [all human beings] that there is no
			deity save Me: be, therefore, conscious of Me!"

He has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with [an\n\t\t\tinner] truth;<sup class='fn'>3</sup> sublimely exalted is He above anything to\n\t\t\twhich men may ascribe a share in His divinity!<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
He creates man out of a [mere] drop of sperm: and lo! this same\n\t\t\tbeing shows himself endowed with the power to think and to\n\t\t\targue!<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
And He creates cattle: you derive warmth from them, and [various\n\t\t\tother] uses; and from them you obtain food;
and you find beauty in them when you drive them home in the\n\t\t\tevenings and when you take them out to pasture in the mornings.

And they carry your loads to [many] a place which [otherwise] you
			would be unable to reach without great hardship to yourselves.
			Verily, your Sustainer is most compassionate, a dispenser of
			grace!

And [it is He who creates] horses and mules and asses for you to\n\t\t\tride, as well as for [their] beauty: and He will yet create\n\t\t\tthings of which [today] you have no knowledge.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

And [because He is your Creator,] it rests with God alone to show
			you the right path:<sup class='fn'>7</sup> yet there is [many a one] who
			swerves from it. However, had He so willed, He would have guided
			you all aright.<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
It is He who sends down water from the skies; you drink thereof,\n\t\t\tand thereof [drink] the plants upon which you pasture your\n\t\t\tbeasts;

[and] by virtue thereof He causes crops to grow for you, and
			olive trees, and date-palms, and grapes, and all [other] kinds of
			fruit: in this, behold, there is a message indeed for people who
			think!

And He has made the night and the day and the sun and the moon
			subservient [to His laws, so that they be of use] to
			you;<sup class='fn'>9</sup> and all the stars are subservient to His command:
			in this, behold, there are messages indeed for people who use
			their reason!
And all the [beauty of] many hues which He has created for you on\n\t\t\tearth: in this, behold, there is a message for people who [are\n\t\t\twilling to] take it to heart!

And He it is who has made the sea subservient [to His laws], so
			that you might eat fresh meat from it, and take from it gems
			which you may wear. And on that [very sea] one sees<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
			ships ploughing through the waves, so that you might [be able to]
			go forth in quest of some of His bounty, and thus have cause to
			be grateful [to Him].
And he has placed firm mountains on earth, lest it sway with\n\t\t\tyou,<sup class='fn'>11</sup> and rivers and paths, so that you might find your\n\t\t\tway,
as well as [various other] means of orientation: for [it is] by\n\t\t\tthe stars that men find their way.<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
IS, THEN, HE who creates comparable to any [being] that cannot\n\t\t\tcreate? Will you not, then, bethink yourselves?
For, should you try to count God's blessings, you could never\n\t\t\tcompute them! Behold, God is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser\n\t\t\tof grace;
and God knows all that you keep secret as well as all that you\n\t\t\tbring into the open.
Now those beings that some people invoke<sup class='fn'>13</sup> beside God\n\t\t\tcannot create anything, since they themselves are but created:
they are dead, not living,<sup class='fn'>14</sup> and they do not [even] know\n\t\t\twhen they will be raised from the dead!
Your God is the One God: but because of their false pride, the\n\t\t\thearts of those who do not believe in the life to come refuse to\n\t\t\tadmit this [truth].<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
Truly, God knows all that they keep secret as well as all that\n\t\t\tthey bring into the open - [and,] behold, He does not love those\n\t\t\twho are given to arrogance,
and [who], whenever they are asked, "What is it that your\n\t\t\tSustainer has bestowed from on high?" - are wont to answer,\n\t\t\t"Fables of ancient times!"<sup class='fn'>16</sup>

Hence,<sup class='fn'>17</sup> on Resurrection Day they shall bear the full
			weight of their own burdens, as well as some of the burdens of
			those ignorant ones whom they have led astray:<sup class='fn'>18</sup> oh, how
			evil the load with which they shall be burdened!

Those who lived before them did, too, devise many a
			blasphemy<sup class='fn'>19</sup> - whereupon God visited with destruction all
			that they had ever built,<sup class='fn'>20</sup> [striking] at its very
			foundations, so that the roof fell in upon them from
			above,<sup class='fn'>21</sup> and suffering befell them without their having
			perceived whence it came.

And then, on Resurrection Day, He will cover them [all] with
			ignominy,<sup class='fn'>22</sup> and will say: "Where, now, are those beings
			to whom you ascribed a share in My divinity,<sup class='fn'>23</sup> [and] for
			whose sake you cut yourselves off [from My guidance]?"<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
			[Whereupon] those who [in their lifetime] were endowed with
			knowledge<sup class='fn'>25</sup> will say: "Verily, ignominy and misery [have
			fallen] this day upon those who have been denying the truth -

those whom the angels have gathered in death while they were
			still sinning against themselves!" Then will they [who are thus
			arraigned] proffer their submission, [saying:] "We did not [mean
			to] do any evil!"<sup class='fn'>26</sup> [But they will be answered:] "Yea,
			verily, God has full knowledge of all that you were
			doing!<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
Hence, enter the gates of hell, therein to abide!" And evil,\n\t\t\tindeed, shall be the state of all who are given to false pride!

But [when] those who are conscious of God are asked, "What is it
			that your Sustainer has bestowed from on high?" - they answer,
			"Goodness supreme!" Good fortune awaits, in this world, all who
			persevere in doing good;<sup class='fn'>28</sup> but their ultimate state will
			be far better still: for, how excellent indeed will be the state
			of the God-conscious [in the life to come]!

Gardens of perpetual bliss will they enter - [gardens] through\n\t\t\twhich running waters flow - having therein all that they might\n\t\t\tdesire. Thus will God reward those who are conscious of Him -
those whom the angels gather in death while they are in a state\n\t\t\tof inner purity, greeting them thus: "Peace be upon you! Enter\n\t\t\tparadise by virtue of what you were doing [in life]!"

ARE THEY [who deny the truth] but waiting for the angels to
			appear unto them, or for God's judgment to become
			manifest?<sup class='fn'>29</sup> Even thus did behave those [stubborn
			sinners] who lived before their time; and [when they were
			destroyed,] it was not God who wronged them, but it was they who
			had wronged themselves:
for all the evil that they had done fell [back] upon them, and\n\t\t\tthey were overwhelmed by the very thing which they had been wont\n\t\t\tto deride.<sup class='fn'>30</sup>

Now they who ascribe divinity to aught beside God say, "Had God
			so willed, we would not have worshipped aught but Him - neither
			we nor our forefathers; nor would we have declared aught as
			forbidden without a commandment from Him."<sup class='fn'>31</sup> Even thus
			did speak those [sinners] who lived before their time; but, then,
			are the apostles bound to do more than clearly deliver the
			message [entrusted to them]?<sup class='fn'>32</sup>

And indeed, within every community<sup class='fn'>33</sup> have We raised up
			an apostle [entrusted with this message]: "Worship God, and shun
			the powers of evil!"<sup class='fn'>34</sup> And among those [past
			generations] were people whom God graced with His
			guidance,<sup class='fn'>35</sup> just as there was among them [many a one]
			who inevitably fell prey to grievous error:<sup class='fn'>36</sup> go, then,
			about the earth and behold what happened in the end to those who
			gave the lie to the truth!

[As for those who are bent on denying the truth -] though thou be
			ever so eager to show them the right way, [know that,] verily,
			God does not bestow His guidance upon any whom He judges to have
			gone astray;<sup class='fn'>37</sup> and such shall have none to succour them
			[on Resurrection Day].

As it is,<sup class='fn'>38</sup> they swear by God with their most solemn
			oaths, "Never will God raise from the dead anyone who has
			died!"<sup class='fn'>39</sup> Yea indeed! [This very thing has God promised]
			by a promise which He has willed upon Himself; but most people
			know it not.

[He will resurrect them] to the end that He might make clear unto
			them all whereon they [now] hold divergent views,<sup class='fn'>40</sup> and
			that they who are bent on denying the truth [of resurrection]
			might come to know that they were liars.
Whenever We will anything to be, We but say unto it Our word "Be"\n\t\t\t- and it is.

NOW as for those who forsake the domain of evil<sup class='fn'>41</sup> in the
			cause of God, after having suffered wrong [on account of their
			faith] - We shall most certainly grant them a station of good
			fortune in this world:<sup class='fn'>42</sup> but their reward in the life to
			come will be far greater yet. If they [who deny the truth] could
			but understand<sup class='fn'>43</sup>
those who, having attained to patience in adversity, in their\n\t\t\tSustainer place their trust!<sup class='fn'>44</sup>

AND [even] before thy time, [O Muhammad,] We never sent [as Our
			apostles] any but [mortal] men, whom We inspired:<sup class='fn'>45</sup> and
			if you have not [yet] realized this, ask the followers of
			[earlier] revelation,<sup class='fn'>46</sup>

[and they will tell you that their prophets, too, were but mortal
			men whom We had endowed] with all evidence of the truth and with
			books of divine wisdom.<sup class='fn'>47</sup> And upon thee [too] have We
			bestowed from on high this reminder, so that thou might make
			clear unto mankind all that has ever been thus bestowed upon
			them,<sup class='fn'>48</sup> and that they might take thought.

Can, then, they who devise evil schemes<sup class='fn'>49</sup> ever feel sure
			that God will not cause the earth to swallow them,<sup class='fn'>50</sup> or
			that suffering will not befall them without their perceiving
			whence [it came]? -
or that He will not take them to task [suddenly] in the midst of\n\t\t\ttheir comings and goings,<sup class='fn'>51</sup> without their being able to\n\t\t\telude [Him],
or take them to task through slow decay?<sup class='fn'>52</sup> And yet, behold, your\n\t\t\tSustainer is most compassionate, a dispenser of grace!<sup class='fn'>53</sup>

HAVE, THEN, they [who deny the truth] never considered any of the
			things that God has created<sup class='fn'>54</sup> - [how] their shadows turn
			right and left, prostrating themselves before God and utterly
			submissive [to His will]?<sup class='fn'>55</sup>

For, before God prostrates itself all that is in the heavens and
			all that is on earth - every beast that moves, and the
			angels:<sup class='fn'>56</sup> [even] these do not bear themselves with false
			pride:
they fear their Sustainer high above them, and do whatever they\n\t\t\tare bidden to do.<sup class='fn'>57</sup>
And God has said: "Do not take to worshipping two [or more]\n\t\t\tdeities.<sup class='fn'>58</sup> He is the One and Only God: hence, of Me, of\n\t\t\tMe alone stand in awe!"<sup class='fn'>59</sup>
And His is all that is in the heavens and on earth, and to Him\n\t\t\t[alone] obedience is always due: will you, then, pay reverence to\n\t\t\taught but Him?
For, whatever good thing comes to you, comes from God; and\n\t\t\twhenever harm befalls you, it is unto Him that you cry for\n\t\t\thelp<sup class='fn'>60</sup> -
yet as soon as He has removed the harm from you, lo! some of you\n\t\t\t[begin to] ascribe to other powers a share in their Sustainer's\n\t\t\tdivinity,<sup class='fn'>61</sup>
[as if] to prove their ingratitude for all that We have granted\n\t\t\tthem! Enjoy, then, your [brief] life: but in time you will come\n\t\t\tto know [the truth]!

As it is, they ascribe - out of what We provide for them as
			sustenance - a share unto things of which they know
			nothing.<sup class='fn'>62</sup> By God, you shall most certainly be called to
			account for all your false imagery!

And [thus, too,] they ascribe daughters unto God, who is\n\t\t\tlimitless in His glory<sup class='fn'>63</sup> - whereas for themselves [they\n\t\t\twould choose, if they could, only] what they desire:<sup class='fn'>64</sup>
for, whenever any of them is given the glad tiding of [the birth\n\t\t\tof] a girl,<sup class='fn'>65</sup> his face darkens, and he is filled with\n\t\t\tsuppressed anger,

avoiding all people because of the [alleged] evil of the glad
			tiding which he has received, [and debating within himself:]
			Shall he keep this [child] despite the contempt [which he feels
			for it] - or shall he bury it in the dust? Oh, evil indeed is
			whatever they decide!<sup class='fn'>66</sup>

[Thus it is that] the attribute of evil applies to all who do not
			believe in the life to come<sup class='fn'>67</sup> - whereas unto God applies
			the attribute of all that is most sublime: for He alone is
			almighty, truly wise!

Now if God were to take men [immediately] to task for all the
			evil that they do [on earth], He would not leave a single living
			creature upon its face. However, He grants them respite until a
			term set [by Him]:<sup class='fn'>68</sup> but when the end of their term
			approaches, they can neither delay it by a single moment, nor can
			they hasten it.<sup class='fn'>69</sup>

As it is, they ascribe to God something that they [themselves]
			dislike<sup class='fn'>70</sup> - and [all the while] their tongues utter the
			lie that [by doing so] they earn supreme merit!<sup class='fn'>71</sup> Truly,
			they earn but the fire, and will be left out [of God's
			grace]!<sup class='fn'>72</sup>

By God, [O Prophet,] even before thy time have We sent apostles
			unto [various] communities: but [those who were bent on denying
			the truth have always refused to listen to Our messages because]
			Satan has made all their own doings seem goodly to them: and he
			is [as] close to them today<sup class='fn'>73</sup> [as he was to the sinners
			of yore]; hence, grievous suffering awaits them.

And upon thee [too] have We bestowed from on high this divine
			writ for no other reason than that thou might make clear unto
			them all [questions of faith] on which they have come to hold
			divergent views, and [thus offer] guidance and grace unto people
			who will believe.

AND GOD sends down water from the skies, giving life thereby to\n\t\t\tthe earth after it had been lifeless:<sup class='fn'>74</sup> in this, behold,\n\t\t\tthere is a message indeed for people who [are willing to] listen.

And, behold, in the cattle [too] there is indeed a lesson for
			you: We give you to drink of that [fluid] which is [secreted
			from] within their bellies between that which is to be eliminated
			[from the animal's body] and [its] life-blood: milk pure and
			pleasant to those who drink it.<sup class='fn'>75</sup>

And [We grant you nourishment] from the fruit of date-palms and
			vines: from it you derive intoxicants as well as wholesome
			sustenance - in this, behold, there is a message indeed for
			people who use their reason!<sup class='fn'>76</sup>

And [consider how] thy Sustainer has inspired the bee:<sup class='fn'>77</sup>\n\t\t\t"Prepare for thyself dwellings in mountains and in trees, and in\n\t\t\twhat [men] may build [for thee by way of hives];

and then eat of all manner of fruit, and follow humbly the paths
			ordained for thee by thy Sustainer."<sup class='fn'>78</sup> [And lo!] there
			issues from within these [bees] a fluid of many hues, wherein
			there is health for man. In all this, behold, there is a message
			indeed for people who think!

AND GOD has created you, and in time will cause you to die; and
			many a one of you is reduced in old age to a most abject state,
			ceasing to know anything of what he once knew so well.<sup class='fn'>79</sup>
			Verily, God is all-knowing, infinite in His power!

And on some of you God has bestowed more abundant means of
			sustenance than on others: and yet, they who are more abundantly
			favoured are [often] unwilling to share their sustenance with
			those whom their right hands possess, so that they [all] might be
			equal in this respect.<sup class='fn'>80</sup> Will they, then, God's
			blessings [thus] deny?

And God has given you mates of your own kinds<sup class='fn'>81</sup> and has
			given you, through your mates, children and children's children,
			and has provided for you sustenance out of the good things of
			life. Will men,<sup class='fn'>82</sup> then, [continue to] believe in things
			false and vain, and thus blaspheme against God's blessings? -

and will they [continue to] worship, instead of God, something
			that has it not within its power to provide for them any
			sustenance whatever from the heavens or the earth,<sup class='fn'>83</sup> and
			can do nothing at all?
Hence, do not coin any similitudes for God!<sup class='fn'>84</sup> Verily,\n\t\t\tGod knows [all], whereas you have no [real] knowledge.

God propounds [to you] the parable of [two men -] a man enslaved,
			unable to do anything of his own accord, and a [free] man upon
			whom We have bestowed goodly sustenance [as a gift] from
			Ourselves, so that he can spend thereof [at will, both] secretly
			and openly. Can these [two] be deemed equal?<sup class='fn'>85</sup> All
			praise is due to God [alone]: but most of them do not understand
			it.

And God propounds [to you] the parable of two [other] men - one
			of them dumb,<sup class='fn'>86</sup> unable to do anything of his own accord,
			and a sheer burden on his master: to whichever task the latter
			directs him,<sup class='fn'>87</sup> he accomplishes no good. Can such a one
			be considered the equal of [a wise man] who enjoins the doing of
			what is right and himself follows a straight way?<sup class='fn'>88</sup>

And<sup class='fn'>89</sup> God's [alone] is the knowledge of the hidden reality of the
			heavens and the earth.<sup class='fn'>90</sup> And so, the advent of the Last
			Hour will but manifest itself [in a single moment,] like the
			twinkling of an eye, or closer still:<sup class='fn'>91</sup> for, behold, God
			has the power to will anything.
And God has brought you forth from your mothers' wombs knowing\n\t\t\tnothing - but He has endowed you with hearing, and sight, and\n\t\t\tminds, so that you might have cause to be grateful.

Have, then, they [who deny the truth] never considered the birds,
			enabled [by God] to fly in mid-air,<sup class='fn'>92</sup> with none but God
			holding them aloft? In this, behold, there are messages indeed
			for people who will believe!

And God has given you [the ability to build] your houses as
			places of rest, and has endowed you with [the skill to make]
			dwellings out of the skins of animals<sup class='fn'>93</sup> - easy for you
			to handle when you travel and when you camp - and [to make]
			furnishings and goods for temporary use of their [rough] wool and
			their soft, furry wool<sup class='fn'>94</sup> and their hair.

And among the many objects of His creation,<sup class='fn'>95</sup> God has
			appointed for you [various] means of protection:<sup class='fn'>96</sup> thus,
			He has given you in the mountains places of shelter, and has
			endowed you with [the ability to make] garments to protect you
			from heat [and cold],<sup class='fn'>97</sup> as well as such garments as
			might protect you from your [mutual] violence.<sup class='fn'>98</sup> In this
			way does He bestow the full measure of His blessings on you, so
			that you might surrender yourselves unto Him.
BUT IF they turn away [from thee, O Prophet, remember that] thy\n\t\t\tonly duty is a clear delivery of the message [entrusted to thee].

They [who turn away from it] are fully aware of God's blessings,\n\t\t\tbut nonetheless they refuse to acknowledge them [as such],\n\t\t\tsince most of them are given to denying the truth.<sup class='fn'>99</sup>

But one Day We shall raise up a witness out of every
			community,<sup class='fn'>100</sup> whereupon they who were bent on denying
			the truth will not be allowed to plead [ignorance],<sup class='fn'>101</sup>
			and neither will they be allowed to make amends.

And when they who were bent on evildoing behold the suffering
			[that awaits them, they will realize that] it will not be
			lightened for them [by virtue of their pleading]; and neither
			will they be granted respite.

And when they who were wont to ascribe divinity to beings other
			than God behold [on Judgment Day] those beings to whom they were
			wont to ascribe a share in His divinity,<sup class='fn'>102</sup> they will
			exclaim: "O our Sustainer! These are the beings to whom we
			ascribed a share in Thy divinity, and whom we were wont to invoke
			instead of Thee!"<sup class='fn'>103</sup> - whereupon [those beings] will
			fling at them the retort: "Behold, you have indeed been lying [to
			yourselves]!"<sup class='fn'>104</sup>
And on that Day will they [who had thus been sinning, belatedly]\n\t\t\tproffer their surrender to God; and all their false imagery will\n\t\t\thave forsaken them.
Upon all who were bent on denying the truth and who turned others\n\t\t\taway from the path of God will We heap suffering upon suffering\n\t\t\tin return for all the corruption that they wrought:

for one Day We shall raise up within every community a witness
			against them from among themselves.<sup class='fn'>105</sup> And thee [too, O
			Prophet,] have We brought forth to bear witness regarding those
			[whom thy message may have reached],<sup class='fn'>106</sup> inasmuch as We
			have bestowed from on high upon thee, step by step, this divine
			writ, to make everything clear,<sup class='fn'>107</sup> and to provide
			guidance and grace and a glad tiding unto all who have
			surrendered themselves to God.

BEHOLD, God enjoins justice, and the doing of good, and
			generosity towards [one's] fellow-men;<sup class='fn'>108</sup> and He forbids
			all that is shameful and all that runs counter to
			reason,<sup class='fn'>109</sup> as well as envy; [and] He exhorts you
			[repeatedly] so that you might bear [all this] in mind.

And be true to your bond with God whenever you bind yourselves by
			a pledge,<sup class='fn'>110</sup> and do not break [your] oaths after having
			[freely] confirmed them<sup class='fn'>111</sup> and having called upon God to
			be witness to your good faith:<sup class='fn'>112</sup> behold, God knows all
			that you do.

Hence, be not like her who breaks and completely untwists the
			yarn which she [herself] has spun and made strong - [be not like
			this by] using your oaths as a means of deceiving one
			another,<sup class='fn'>113</sup> simply because some of you may be more
			powerful than others.<sup class='fn'>114</sup> By all this, God but puts you
			to a test - and [He does it] so that on Resurrection Day He might
			make clear unto you all that on which you were wont to
			differ.<sup class='fn'>115</sup>

For, had God so willed, He could surely have made you all one
			single community;<sup class='fn'>116</sup> however, He lets go astray him that
			wills [to go astray], and guides aright him that wills [to be
			guided];<sup class='fn'>117</sup> and you will surely be called to account for
			all that you ever did!<sup class='fn'>118</sup>

And do not use your oaths as a means of deceiving one another -
			or else [your] foot will slip after having been firm,<sup class='fn'>119</sup>
			and then you will have to taste the evil
			[consequences]<sup class='fn'>120</sup> of your having turned away from the
			path of God, with tremendous suffering awaiting you [in the life
			to come].
Hence, do not barter away your bond with God for a trifling gain!\n\t\t\tVerily, that which is with God is by far the best for you, if you\n\t\t\tbut knew it:
