all that is with you is bound to come to an end, whereas that
			which is with God is everlasting. And most certainly shall We
			grant unto those who are patient in adversity their reward in
			accordance with the best that they ever did.

As for anyone - be it man or woman - who does righteous deeds,
			and is a believer withal - him shall We most certainly cause to
			live a good life;<sup class='fn'>121</sup> and most certainly shall We grant
			unto such as these their reward in accordance with the best that
			they ever did.
NOW whenever thou happen to read this Qur'an, seek refuge with\n\t\t\tGod from Satan, the accursed.<sup class='fn'>122</sup>
Behold, he has no power over those who have attained to faith and\n\t\t\tin their Sustainer place their trust:
he has power only over those who are willing to follow\n\t\t\thim,<sup class='fn'>123</sup> and who [thus] ascribe to him a share in God's\n\t\t\tdivinity.<sup class='fn'>124</sup>

And now that We replace one message by another<sup class='fn'>125</sup> -
			since God is fully aware of what He bestows from on high, step by
			step<sup class='fn'>126</sup> - they [who deny the truth] are wont to say,
			"Thou but inventest it!" Nay, but most of them do not understand
			it!<sup class='fn'>127</sup>

Say: "Holy inspiration<sup class='fn'>128</sup> has brought it down from thy
			Sustainer by stages, setting forth the truth, so that it might
			give firmness unto those who have attained to faith, and provide
			guidance and a glad tiding unto all who have surrendered
			themselves to God."

And, indeed, full well do We know that they say, "It is but a
			human being that imparts [all] this to him!"<sup class='fn'>129</sup> -
			[notwithstanding that] the tongue of him to whom they so
			maliciously point is wholly outlandish,<sup class='fn'>130</sup> whereas this
			is Arabic speech, clear [in itself] and clearly showing the truth
			[of its source].<sup class='fn'>131</sup>
Verily, as for those who will not believe in God's messages, God\n\t\t\tdoes not guide them aright; and grievous suffering will be their\n\t\t\tlot [in the life to come].
It is but they who will not believe in God's messages that invent\n\t\t\tthis falsehood;<sup class='fn'>132</sup> and it is they, they who are lying!

As for anyone who denies God after having once attained to faith
			- and this, to be sure, does not apply to<sup class='fn'>133</sup> one who
			does it under duress, the while his heart remains true to his
			faith,<sup class='fn'>134</sup> but [only to] him who willingly opens up his
			heart to a denial of the truth -: upon all such [falls] God's
			condemnation, and tremendous suffering awaits them:
all this, because they hold this world's life in greater esteem\n\t\t\tthan the life to come, and because God does not bestow His\n\t\t\tguidance upon people who deny the truth.
They whose hearts and whose hearing and whose sight God has\n\t\t\tsealed - it is they, they who are heedless!<sup class='fn'>135</sup>
Truly it is they, they who in the life to come shall be the\n\t\t\tlosers!

And yet, behold, thy Sustainer [grants His forgiveness] unto
			those who forsake the domain of evil after having succumbed to
			its temptation,<sup class='fn'>136</sup> and who thenceforth strive hard [in
			God's cause] and are patient in adversity: behold, after such
			[repentance] thy Sustainer is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser
			of grace!

[Be conscious, then, of] the Day when every human being shall
			come to plead for himself [alone] and every human being shall be
			repaid in full for whatever he has done, and none shall be
			wronged.

AND GOD propounds [to you] a parable: [Imagine] a town which was
			[once] secure and at ease, with its sustenance coming to it
			abundantly from all quarters, and which thereupon blasphemously
			refused to show gratitude for God's blessings: and therefore God
			caused it to taste the all-embracing misery<sup class='fn'>137</sup> of hunger
			and fear in result of all [the evil] that its people had so
			persistently wrought.<sup class='fn'>138</sup>

And indeed, there had come unto them an apostle from among
			themselves - but they gave him the lie; and therefore suffering
			overwhelmed them while they were thus doing wrong [to
			themselves].

AND SO, partake of all the lawful, good things which God has\n\t\t\tprovided for you as sustenance, and render thanks unto God for\n\t\t\tHis blessings, if it is [truly] Him that you worship.<sup class='fn'>139</sup>

He has forbidden to you only carrion, and blood, and the flesh of
			swine, and that over which any name other than God's has been
			invoked; but if one is driven [to it] by necessity - neither
			coveting it nor exceeding his immediate need - verily, God is
			much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.<sup class='fn'>140</sup>

Hence, do not utter falsehoods by letting your tongues determine
			[at your own discretion], "This is lawful and that is forbidden",
			thus attributing your own lying inventions to God:<sup class='fn'>141</sup>
			for, behold, they who attribute their own lying inventions to God
			will never attain to a happy state!
A brief enjoyment [may be theirs in this world] - but grievous\n\t\t\tsuffering awaits them [in the life to come]!

And [only] unto those who followed the Jewish faith did We forbid
			all that We have mentioned to thee ere this;<sup class='fn'>142</sup> and no
			wrong did We do to them, but it was they who persistently wronged
			themselves.

And once again:<sup class='fn'>143</sup> Behold, thy Sustainer [shows mercy]
			to those who do evil out of ignorance and afterwards repent and
			live righteously: behold, after such [repentance] thy Sustainer
			is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.

VERILY, Abraham was a man who combined within himself all
			virtues,<sup class='fn'>144</sup> devoutly obeying God's will, turning away
			from all that is false,<sup class='fn'>145</sup> and not being of those who
			ascribe divinity to aught beside God:
[for he was always] grateful for the blessings granted by Him who\n\t\t\thad elected him and guided him onto a straight way.
And so We vouchsafed him good in this world; and, verily, in the\n\t\t\tlife to come [too] he shall find himself among the righteous.

And lastly,<sup class='fn'>146</sup> We have inspired thee, [O Muhammad, with
			this message:] "Follow the creed of Abraham, who turned away from
			all that is false, and was not of those who ascribe divinity to
			aught beside God;

[and know that the observance of] the Sabbath was ordained only
			for those who came to hold divergent views about him;<sup class='fn'>147</sup>
			but, verily, God will judge between them on Resurrection Day with
			regard to all on which they were wont to differ."<sup class='fn'>148</sup>

CALL THOU [all mankind] unto thy Sustainer's path with wisdom and
			goodly exhortation, and argue with them in the most kindly
			manner:<sup class='fn'>149</sup> for, behold, thy Sustainer knows best as to
			who strays from His path, and best knows He as to who are the
			right-guided.

Hence, if you have to respond to an attack [in argument], respond
			only to the extent of the attack leveled against you;<sup class='fn'>150</sup>
			but to bear yourselves with patience is indeed far better for
			[you, since God is with] those who are patient in adversity.

Endure, then, with patience [all that they who deny the truth may
			say] - always remembering that it is none but God who gives thee
			the strength to endure adversity<sup class='fn'>151</sup> - and do not grieve
			over them, and neither be distressed by the false arguments which
			they devise:<sup class='fn'>152</sup>
for, verily, God is with those who are conscious of Him and are\n\t\t\tdoers of good withal!

LIMITLESS in His glory is He who transported His servant by night
			from the Inviolable House of Worship [at Mecca] to the Remote
			House of Worship [at Jerusalem] - the environs of which We had
			blessed<sup class='fn'>1</sup> - so that We might show him some of Our
			symbols: for, verily, He alone is all-hearing,
			all-seeing<sup class='fn'>2</sup>.

And [thus, too,] We vouchsafed revelation unto Moses,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
			and made it a [source of] guidance for the children of Israel,
			[commanding them:] "Do not ascribe to any but Me the power to
			determine your fate,<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
O you descendants of those whom We caused to be borne [in the\n\t\t\tark] with Noah! Behold, he was a most grateful servant [of\n\t\t\tOurs]!"

And we made [this] known to the children of Israel through\n\t\t\trevelation:<sup class='fn'>5</sup> "Twice, indeed, will you spread corruption\n\t\t\ton earth and will indeed become grossly overbearing!"<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

Hence, when the prediction of the first of those two [periods of
			iniquity] came true, We sent against you some of Our bondmen of
			terrible prowess in war, and they wrought havoc throughout the
			land: and so the prediction was fulfilled.<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
And after a time We allowed you to prevail against them once\n\t\t\tagain,<sup class='fn'>8</sup> and aided you with wealth and offspring, and\n\t\t\tmade you more numerous [than ever].

[And We said:] "If you persevere in doing good, you will but be
			doing good to yourselves; and if you do evil, it will be [done]
			to yourselves. "And so, when the prediction of the second [period
			of your iniquity] came true, [We raised new enemies against you,
			and allowed them] to disgrace you utterly,<sup class='fn'>9</sup> and to enter
			the Temple as [their forerunners] had entered it once before, and
			to destroy with utter destruction all that they had conquered.

Your Sustainer may well show mercy unto you; but if you revert
			[to sinning], We shall revert [to chastising you]. And [remember
			this:] We have ordained that [in the hereafter] hell shall close
			upon all who deny the truth.
VERILY, this Qur'an shows the way to all that is most\n\t\t\tupright,<sup class='fn'>10</sup> and gives the believers who do good deeds the\n\t\t\tglad tiding that theirs will be a great reward;
and [it announces, too,] that We have readied grievous suffering\n\t\t\tfor those who will not believe in the life to come.

As it is,<sup class='fn'>11</sup> man [often] prays for things that are bad as\n\t\t\tif he were praying for something that is good:<sup class='fn'>12</sup> for man\n\t\t\tis prone to be hasty [in his judgments].

And We have established the night and the day as two
			symbols;<sup class='fn'>13</sup> and thereupon We have effaced the symbol of
			night and set up [in its place] the light-giving symbol of
			day,<sup class='fn'>14</sup> so that you might seek to obtain your Sustainer's
			bounty and be aware of the passing years<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and of the
			reckoning [that is bound to come]. For clearly, have We spelt out
			everything!<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
And every human being's destiny have We tied to his\n\t\t\tneck;<sup class='fn'>17</sup> and on the Day of Resurrection We shall bring\n\t\t\tforth for him a record which he will find wide open;
[and he will be told:] "Read this thy record! Sufficient is thine\n\t\t\town self today to make out thine account!"<sup class='fn'>18</sup>

Whoever chooses to follow the right path, follows it but for his
			own good; and whoever goes astray, goes but astray to his own
			hurt; and no bearer of burdens shall be made to bear another's
			burden.<sup class='fn'>19</sup> Moreover, We would never chastise [any
			community for the wrong they may do] ere We have sent an apostle
			[to them].<sup class='fn'>20</sup>

But when [this has been done, and] it is Our will to destroy a
			community, We convey Our last warning<sup class='fn'>21</sup> to those of its
			people who have lost themselves entirely in the pursuit of
			pleasures;<sup class='fn'>22</sup> and [if] they [continue to] act sinfully,
			the sentence [of doom] passed on the community takes effect, and
			We break it to smithereens.
And how many a generation have We [thus] destroyed after [the\n\t\t\ttime of] Noah! For, none has the like of thy Sustainer's\n\t\t\tawareness and insight into His creatures' sins.

Unto him who cares for [no more than the enjoyment of] this
			fleeting life We readily grant thereof as much as We please,
			[giving] to whomever it is Our will [to give]; but in the end We
			consign him to [the suffering of] hell,<sup class='fn'>23</sup> which he will
			have to endure disgraced and disowned!

But as for those who care for the [good of the] life to come, and
			strive for it as it ought to be striven for, and are [true]
			believers withal<sup class='fn'>24</sup> - they are the ones whose striving
			finds favour [with God]!
All [of them] - these as well as those - do We freely endow with\n\t\t\tsome of thy Sustainer's gifts, since thy Sustainer's giving is\n\t\t\tnever confined [to one kind of man].

Behold how We bestow [on earth] more bounty on some of them than\n\t\t\ton others: but [remember that] the life to come will be far\n\t\t\thigher in degree and far greater in merit and bounty.<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
DO NOT set up any other deity side by side with God, lest thou\n\t\t\tfind thyself disgraced and forsaken:

for thy Sustainer has ordained that you shall worship none but
			Him. And do good unto [thy] parents.<sup class='fn'>26</sup> Should one of
			them, or both, attain to old age in thy care, never say
			"Ugh"<sup class='fn'>27</sup> to them or scold them, but [always] speak unto
			them with reverent speech,

and spread over them humbly the wings of thy tenderness,<sup class='fn'>28</sup>\n\t\t\tand say: "O my Sustainer! Bestow Thy grace upon them, even as\n\t\t\tthey cherished and reared me when I was a child!"

Your Sustainer is fully aware of what is in your hearts. If you
			are righteous, [He will forgive you your errors]:<sup class='fn'>29</sup> for,
			behold, He is much-forgiving to those who turn unto Him again and
			again.

And give his due to the near of kin,<sup class='fn'>30</sup> as well as to the\n\t\t\tneedy and the wayfarer,<sup class='fn'>31</sup> but do not squander [thy\n\t\t\tsubstance] senselessly.<sup class='fn'>32</sup>
Behold, the squanderers are, indeed, of the ilk of the satans -\n\t\t\tinasmuch as Satan has indeed proved most ungrateful to his\n\t\t\tSustainer.<sup class='fn'>33</sup>

And if thou [must] turn aside from those [that are in want,
			because thou thyself art] seeking to obtain thy Sustainer's grace
			and hoping for it,<sup class='fn'>34</sup> at least speak unto them with gentle
			speech.

And neither allow thy hand to remain shackled to thy
			neck,<sup class='fn'>35</sup> nor stretch it forth to the utmost limit [of thy
			capacity], lest thou find thyself blamed [by thy dependents], or
			even destitute.
Behold, thy Sustainer grants abundant sustenance, or gives it in\n\t\t\tscant measure, unto whomever He wills: verily, fully aware is He\n\t\t\tof [the needs of] His creatures, and sees them all.
Hence, do not kill your children for fear of poverty:<sup class='fn'>36</sup>\n\t\t\tit is We who shall provide sustenance for them as well as for\n\t\t\tyou. Verily, killing them is a great sin.
And do not commit adultery<sup class='fn'>37</sup> - for, behold, it is an\n\t\t\tabomination and an evil way.

And do not take any human being's life - [the life] which God has
			willed to be sacred - otherwise than in [the pursuit of]
			justice.<sup class='fn'>38</sup> Hence, if anyone has been slain wrongfully,
			We have empowered the defender of his rights [to exact a just
			retribution];<sup class='fn'>39</sup> but even so, let him not exceed the
			bounds of equity in [retributive] killing.<sup class='fn'>40</sup> [And as for
			him who has been slain wrongfully -] behold, he is indeed
			succoured [by God]!<sup class='fn'>41</sup>

And do not touch the substance of an orphan, save to improve it,
			before he comes of age.<sup class='fn'>42</sup> And be true to every promise -
			for, verily, [on Judgment Day] you will be called to account for
			every promise which you have made!<sup class='fn'>43</sup>
And give full measure whenever you measure, and weigh with a\n\t\t\tbalance that is true:<sup class='fn'>44</sup> this will be [for your own]\n\t\t\tgood, and best in the end.

And never concern thyself with anything of which thou hast no\n\t\t\tknowledge:<sup class='fn'>45</sup> verily, [thy] hearing and sight and heart -\n\t\t\tall of them - will be called to account for it [on Judgment Day]!
And walk not on earth with haughty self-conceit for, verily thou\n\t\t\tcanst never rend the earth asunder, nor canst thou ever grow as\n\t\t\ttall as the mountains!
The evil of all this is odious in thy Sustainer's\n\t\t\tsight:<sup class='fn'>46</sup>

this is part of that knowledge of right and wrong with which thy
			Sustainer has inspired thee.<sup class='fn'>47</sup> Hence, do not set up any
			other deity side by side with God,<sup class='fn'>48</sup> lest thou be cast
			into hell, blamed [by thyself] and rejected [by Him]!

HAS, THEN, your Sustainer distinguished you by [giving you] sons,\n\t\t\tand taken unto Himself daughters in the guise of\n\t\t\tangels?<sup class='fn'>49</sup> Verily, you are uttering a dreadful saying!
And, indeed, many facets have We given [to Our message] in this\n\t\t\tQur'an, so that they [who deny the truth] might take it to heart:\n\t\t\tbut all this only increases their aversion.

Say: "If there were - as some people assert - [other] deities
			side by side with Him, surely [even] they would have to strive to
			find a way unto Him who is enthroned on His
			almightiness?"<sup class='fn'>50</sup>
Limitless is He in His glory, and sublimely, immeasurably exalted\n\t\t\tabove anything that men may say [about Him]!<sup class='fn'>51</sup>

The seven heavens<sup class='fn'>52</sup> extol His limitless glory, and the
			earth, and all that they contain; and there is not a single thing
			but extols His limitless glory and praise: but you [O men] fail
			to grasp the manner of their glorifying Him!<sup class='fn'>53</sup> Verily,
			He is forbearing, much-forgiving!
But [thus it is:]<sup class='fn'>54</sup> whenever thou recitest the Qur'an,\n\t\t\tWe place an invisible barrier between thee and those who will not\n\t\t\tbelieve in the life to come:

for, over their hearts We have laid veils which prevent them from
			grasping its purport, and into their ears, deafness.<sup class='fn'>55</sup>
			And so, whenever thou dost mention, while reciting the Qur'an,
			thy Sustainer as the one and only Divine Being,<sup class='fn'>56</sup> they
			turn their backs [upon thee] in aversion.

We are fully aware of what they are listening for when they
			listen to thee:<sup class='fn'>57</sup> for when they are secluded among
			themselves, lo! these wrongdoers say [unto one another], "If you
			were to follow [Muhammad, you would follow] only a man
			bewitched!"
See to what they liken thee, [O Prophet, simply] because they\n\t\t\thave gone astray and are now unable to find a way [to the truth]!
And [thus, too,] they say, "After we will have become bones and\n\t\t\tdust, shall we, forsooth, be raised from the dead in a new act of\n\t\t\tcreation?"
Say: "[You will be raised from the dead even though] you be\n\t\t\tstones or iron

or any [other] substance which, to your minds, appears yet
			farther removed [from life]!"<sup class='fn'>58</sup> And [if] thereupon they
			ask, "Who is it that will bring us back [to life]?" - say thou:
			"He who has brought you into being in the first instance." And
			[if] thereupon they shake their heads at thee [in disbelief] and
			ask, "When shall this be?" - say thou: "It may well be soon,
on a Day when He will call you, and you will answer by praising\n\t\t\tHim, thinking all the while that you have tarried [on earth] but\n\t\t\ta little while."<sup class='fn'>59</sup>

AND TELL My servants that they should speak in the most kindly
			manner [unto those who do not share their beliefs]:<sup class='fn'>60</sup>
			verily, Satan is always ready to stir up discord between
			men<sup class='fn'>61</sup> - for, verily, Satan is man's open foe!

Your Sustainer is fully aware of what you are [and what you
			deserve]: if He so wills, he will bestow [His] grace upon you;
			and if He so wills, He will chastise you. Hence, We have not sent
			thee [unto men, O Prophet,] with the power to determine their
			fate,<sup class='fn'>62</sup>

seeing that thy Sustainer is fully aware of [what is in the minds
			of] all beings that are in the heavens and on earth. But, indeed,
			We did endow some of the prophets more highly than
			others<sup class='fn'>63</sup> - just as We bestowed upon David a book of
			divine wisdom [in token of Our grace]<sup class='fn'>64</sup> .

SAY:<sup class='fn'>65</sup> "Call upon those [beings] whom you imagine [to be
			endowed with divine powers] beside Him<sup class='fn'>66</sup> - and [you will
			find that] they have it not in their power to remove any
			affliction from you, or to shift it [elsewhere].<sup class='fn'>67</sup>

Those [saintly beings] whom they invoke are themselves striving
			to obtain their Sustainer's favour - [even] those among them who
			are closest [to Him]<sup class='fn'>68</sup> - hoping for His grace and
			dreading His chastisement: for, verily, thy Sustainer's
			chastisement is something to beware of!

And [bear in mind:] there is no community which We will not
			destroy before the Day of Resurrection,<sup class='fn'>69</sup> or chastise
			[even earlier, if it proves sinful,] with suffering severe: all
			this is laid down in Our decree.<sup class='fn'>70</sup>

And nothing has prevented Us from sending [this message, like the
			earlier ones,] with miraculous signs [in its wake], save [Our
			knowledge] that the people of olden times [only too often] gave
			the lie to them:<sup class='fn'>71</sup> thus, We provided for [the tribe of]
			Thamud the she-camel as a light-giving portent, and they sinned
			against it.<sup class='fn'>72</sup> And never did We send those signs for any
			other purpose than to convey a warning.

And lo! We said unto thee, [O Prophet:] "Behold, thy Sustainer
			encompasses all mankind [within His knowledge and might]: and so
			We have ordained that the vision which We have shown
			thee<sup class='fn'>73</sup> - as also the tree [of hell,] cursed in this
			Qur'an - shall be but a trial for men.<sup class='fn'>74</sup> Now [by Our
			mentioning hell] We convey a warning to them: but [if they are
			bent on denying the truth,] this [warning] only increases their
			gross, overweening arrogance."

AND LO! We said unto the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before
			Adam" - whereupon they all prostrated themselves, save
			Iblis.<sup class='fn'>75</sup> Said he: "Shall I prostrate myself before one
			whom Thou hast created out of clay?"

[And] he added: "Tell me, is this [foolish being] the one whom
			Thou hast exalted above me? Indeed, if Thou wilt but allow me a
			respite till the Day of Resurrection, I shall most certainly
			cause his descendants - all but a few - to obey me
			blindly!"<sup class='fn'>76</sup>
[God] answered: "Go [the way thou hast chosen]! But as for such\n\t\t\tof them as shall follow thee - behold, hell will be the\n\t\t\trecompense of you [all], a recompense most ample!

Entice, then, with thy voice such of them as thou canst, and bear
			upon them with all thy horses and all thy men,<sup class='fn'>77</sup> and be
			their partner in [all sins relating to] worldly goods and
			children,<sup class='fn'>78</sup> and hold out [all manner of] promises to
			them: and [they will not know that] whatever Satan promises them
			is but meant to delude the mind.<sup class='fn'>79</sup>
"[And yet,] behold, thou shalt have no power over [such of] My\n\t\t\tservants [as place their trust in Me]:<sup class='fn'>80</sup> for none is as\n\t\t\tworthy of trust as thy Sustainer."
YOUR SUSTAINER is He who causes ships to move onward for you\n\t\t\tthrough the sea, so that you might go about in quest of some of\n\t\t\tHis bounty: verily, a dispenser of grace is He unto you.

And whenever danger befalls you at sea, all those [powers] that
			you are wont to invoke forsake you, [and nothing remains for you]
			save Him: but as soon as He has brought you safe ashore, you turn
			aside [and forget Him] - for, indeed, bereft of all gratitude is
			man!

Can you, then, ever feel sure that He will not cause a tract of
			dry land to swallow you up, or let loose upon you a deadly
			stormwind,<sup class='fn'>81</sup> whereupon you would find none to be your
			protector?

Or can you, perchance, feel sure that He will not make you put
			back to sea<sup class='fn'>82</sup> once again, and then let loose upon you a
			raging tempest and cause you to drown in requital of your
			ingratitude - whereupon you would find none to uphold you against
			Us?

NOW, INDEED, We have conferred dignity on the children of
			Adam,<sup class='fn'>83</sup> and borne them over land and sea, and provided
			for them sustenance out of the good things of life, and favoured
			them far above most of Our creation:

[but] one Day We shall summon all human beings [and judge them]
			according to the conscious disposition which governed their deeds
			[in life]:<sup class='fn'>84</sup> whereupon they whose record shall be placed
			in their right hand<sup class='fn'>85</sup> - it is they who will read their
			record [with happiness]. Yet none shall be wronged by as much as
			a hair's breadth:<sup class='fn'>86</sup>
for whoever is blind [of heart] in this [world] will be blind in\n\t\t\tthe life to come [as well], and still farther astray from the\n\t\t\tpath [of truth].<sup class='fn'>87</sup>

AND, behold, they [who have gone astray] endeavour to tempt thee
			away from all [the truth] with which We have inspired thee, [O
			Prophet,] with a view to making thee invent something else in Our
			name - in which case they would surely have made thee their
			friend!<sup class='fn'>88</sup>
And had We not made thee firm [in faith], thou might have\n\t\t\tinclined to them a little<sup class='fn'>89</sup> -

in which case We would indeed have made thee taste double
			[chastisement] in life and double [chastisement] after
			death,<sup class='fn'>90</sup> and thou wouldst have found none to succour
			thee against Us!

And [since they see that they cannot persuade thee,] they
			endeavour to estrange thee from the land [of thy
			birth]<sup class='fn'>91</sup> with a view to driving thee away from it - but,
			then, after thou wilt have left,<sup class='fn'>92</sup> they themselves will
			not remain [in it] for more than a little while:<sup class='fn'>93</sup>
[such has been Our] way with all of Our apostles whom We sent\n\t\t\tbefore thy time;<sup class='fn'>94</sup> and no change wilt thou find in Our\n\t\t\tways.

BE CONSTANT in [thy] prayer from the time when the sun has passed
			its zenith till the darkness of night, and [be ever mindful of
			its] recitation at dawn:<sup class='fn'>95</sup> for, behold, the recitation
			[of prayer] at dawn is indeed witnessed [by all that is
			holy].<sup class='fn'>96</sup>

And rise from thy sleep and pray during part of the night [as\n\t\t\twell], as a free offering from thee,<sup class='fn'>97</sup> and thy Sustainer\n\t\t\tmay well raise thee to a glorious station [in the life to come].

And say [in thy prayer]: "O my Sustainer! Cause me to enter [upon
			whatever I may do] in a manner true and sincere, and cause me to
			leave [it] in a manner true and sincere, and grant me, out of Thy
			grace, sustaining strength!"
And say: "The truth has now come [to light], and falsehood has\n\t\t\twithered away: for, behold, all falsehood is bound to wither\n\t\t\taway!"

THUS, step by step, We bestow from on high through this Qur'an
			all that gives health [to the spirit] and is a grace unto those
			who believe [in Us], the while it only adds to the ruin of
			evildoers:<sup class='fn'>98</sup>

for [it often happens that] when We bestow Our blessings upon
			man, he turns away and arrogantly keeps aloof [from any thought
			of Us]; and when evil fortune touches him, he abandons all
			hope.<sup class='fn'>99</sup>
Say: "Everyone acts in a manner peculiar to himself - and your\n\t\t\tSustainer is fully aware as to who has chosen the best path." <sup class='fn'>100</sup>

AND THEY will ask thee about [the nature of] divine inspiration. <sup class='fn'>101</sup>
			Say: "This inspiration [comes] at my Sustainer's behest; and [you
			cannot understand its nature, O men, since] you have been granted
			very little of [real] knowledge."

And if We so willed, We could indeed take away whatever We have\n\t\t\trevealed unto thee, and in that [state of need] thou wouldst find\n\t\t\tnone to plead in thy behalf before Us.<sup class='fn'>102</sup>
[Thou art spared] only by thy Sustainer's grace: behold, His\n\t\t\tfavour towards thee is great indeed!

Say: "If all mankind and all invisible beings<sup class='fn'>103</sup> would
			come together with a view to producing the like of this Qur'an,
			they could not produce its like even though they were exert all
			their strength in aiding one another!"

For, indeed, many facets have We given in this Qur'an to every
			kind of lesson [designed] for [the benefit of]
			mankind!<sup class='fn'>104</sup> However, most men are unwilling to accept
			anything but blasphemy<sup class='fn'>105</sup> -
and so they say: "[O Muhammad,] we shall not believe thee till\n\t\t\tthou cause a spring to gush forth for us from the\n\t\t\tearth,<sup class='fn'>106</sup>
or thou have a garden of date-palms and vines and cause rivers to\n\t\t\tgush forth in their midst in a sudden rush,<sup class='fn'>107</sup>
or thou cause the skies to fall down upon us in smithereens, as\n\t\t\tthou hast threatened,<sup class='fn'>108</sup> or [till] thou bring God and\n\t\t\tthe angels face to face before us,

or thou have a house [made] of gold, or thou ascend to heaven -
			but nay, we would not [even] believe in thy ascension unless thou
			bring down to us [from heaven] a writing which we [ourselves]
			could read!"<sup class='fn'>109</sup> Say thou, [O Prophet:] Limitless in His
			glory is my Sustainer!<sup class='fn'>110</sup> Am I, then, aught but a mortal
			man, an apostle?"

Yet whenever [God's] guidance came to them  [through a prophet,]
			nothing has ever kept people from believing [in him] save this
			their objection:<sup class='fn'>111</sup> "Would God have sent a [mere] mortal
			man as His apostle?"
Say: "If angels were walking about on earth as their natural\n\t\t\tabode, We would indeed have sent down unto them an angel out of\n\t\t\theaven as Our apostle."
Say: "None can bear witness between me and you as God does:\n\t\t\tverily, fully aware is He of His creatures, and He sees all [that\n\t\t\tis in their hearts]."

And he whom God guides, he alone has found the right way; whereas
			for those whom He lets go astray thou canst never find anyone to
			protect them from Him: and [so, when] We shall gather them
			together on the Day of Resurrection, [they will lie] prone upon
			their faces, blind and dumb and deaf, with hell as their goal;
			[and] every time [the fire] abates, We shall increase for them
			[its] blazing flame.<sup class='fn'>112</sup>

Such will be their requital for having rejected Our messages and
			having said, "After we will have become bones and dust, shall we,
			forsooth, be raised from the dead in a new act of
			creation?"<sup class='fn'>113</sup>

Are they, then, not aware that God, who has created the heavens
			and the earth, has the power to create them anew in their own
			likeness,<sup class='fn'>114</sup> having, beyond any doubt, set a term for
			their resurrection?<sup class='fn'>115</sup> However, all [such] evildoers are
			unwilling to accept anything but blasphemy!<sup class='fn'>116</sup>

Say: "If you were to own all the treasure-houses of my
			Sustainer's bounty,<sup class='fn'>117</sup> lo! you would still try to hold
			on [to them] tightly for fear of spending [too much]: for man has
			always been avaricious whereas God is limitless in His
			bounty]."<sup class='fn'>118</sup>

AND, INDEED, We gave unto Moses nine clear<sup class='fn'>119</sup> messages.
			Ask, then, the children of Israel<sup class='fn'>120</sup> [to tell thee what
			happened] when he came unto them, [and appealed to
			Pharaoh,<sup class='fn'>121</sup> ] and Pharaoh said unto him, "Verily, O
			Moses, I think that thou art full of sorcery!"<sup class='fn'>122</sup>

Answered [Moses]: "Thou knowest well that none but the Sustainer
			of the heavens and the earth has bestowed these [miraculous
			signs] from on high, as a means of insight [for
			thee];<sup class='fn'>123</sup> and, verily, O Pharaoh, [since thou hast
			chosen to reject them,] I think that thou art utterly lost!"
And then Pharaoh resolved to wipe them off [the face of] the\n\t\t\tearth - whereupon We caused him and all who were with him to\n\t\t\tdrown [in the sea].<sup class='fn'>124</sup>

And after that We said unto the children of Israel: "Dwell now
			securely on earth - but [remember that] when the promise of the
			Last Day shall come to pass, We will bring you forth as [parts
			of] a motley crowd!"<sup class='fn'>125</sup>

AND AS a guide towards the truth<sup class='fn'>126</sup> have We bestowed
			this [revelation] from on high; with this [very] truth has it
			come down [unto thee, O Prophet]:<sup class='fn'>127</sup> for We have sent
			thee but as a herald of glad tidings and a warner,

[bearing] a discourse which We have gradually
			unfolded,<sup class='fn'>128</sup> so that thou might read it out to mankind
			by stages, seeing that We have bestowed it from on high step by
			step, as [one] revelation.<sup class='fn'>129</sup>

Say: "Believe in it or do not believe." Behold, those who are
			already<sup class='fn'>130</sup> endowed with [innate] knowledge fall down
			upon their faces in prostration as soon as this [divine writ] is
			conveyed unto them,
and say, "Limitless in His glory is our Sustainer! Verily, our\n\t\t\tSustainer's promise has been fulfilled!"<sup class='fn'>131</sup>
And so they fall down upon their faces, weeping, and [their\n\t\t\tconsciousness of God's grace] increases their humility.

Say: "Invoke God, or invoke the Most Gracious: by whichever name
			you invoke Him, [He is always the One - for] His are all the
			attributes of perfection."<sup class='fn'>132</sup> And [pray unto Him; yet]
			be not too loud in thy prayer nor speak it in too low a voice,
			but follow a way in-between;

and say: "All praise is due to God, who begets no
			offspring,<sup class='fn'>133</sup> and has no partner in His dominion, and
			has no weakness, and therefore no need of any aid"<sup class='fn'>134</sup> -
			and [thus] extol His limitless greatness.
ALL PRAISE is due to God who has bestowed this divine writ from\n\t\t\ton high upon His servant, and has not allowed any deviousness to\n\t\t\tobscure its meaning<sup class='fn'>1</sup> :

[a divine writ] unerringly straight, mean to warn [the godless]
			of a severe punishment from Him, and to give unto the believers
			who do good works the glad tiding that theirs shall be a goodly
			reward -
[a state of bliss] in which they shall dwell beyond the count of\n\t\t\ttime.
Furthermore, [this divine writ is meant] to warn all those who\n\t\t\tassert, "God has taken unto Himself a son."

No knowledge whatever have they of Him,<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and neither had\n\t\t\ttheir forefathers: dreadful is this saying that comes out of\n\t\t\ttheir mouths, [and] nothing but falsehood do they utter!
But wouldst thou, perhaps,<sup class='fn'>3</sup> torment thyself to death\n\t\t\twith grief over them if they are not willing to believe in this\n\t\t\tmessage?<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
Behold, We have willed that all beauty on earth be a means by\n\t\t\twhich We put men to a test,<sup class='fn'>5</sup> [showing] which of them are\n\t\t\tbest in conduct;
and, verily, [in time] We shall reduce all that is on it to\n\t\t\tbarren dust!

[AND SINCE the life of this world is but a test,]<sup class='fn'>6</sup> dost
			thou [really] think that [the parable of] the Men of the Cave and
			of [their devotion to] the scriptures could be deemed more
			wondrous than any [other] of Our messages?<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

When those youths took refuge in the cave, they prayed: "O our
			Sustainer! Bestow on us grace from Thyself, and endow us,
			whatever our [outward] condition, with consciousness of what is
			right!"<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
And thereupon We veiled their ears in the cave<sup class='fn'>9</sup> for many\n\t\t\ta year,

and then We awakened them:<sup class='fn'>10</sup> [and We did all this] so
			that We might mark out [to the world]<sup class='fn'>11</sup> which of the two
			points of view showed a better comprehension of the time-sup
			during which they had remained in this state.<sup class='fn'>12</sup>

[And now] We shall truly relate to thee their story:<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
			Behold, they were young men who had attained to faith in their
			Sustainer: and [so] We deepened their consciousness of the right
			way<sup class='fn'>14</sup>

and endowed their hearts with strength, so that they stood
			up<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and said [to one another]: "Our Sustainer is the
			Sustainer of the heavens and the earth. Never shall we invoke any
			deity other than Him: [if we did,] we should indeed have uttered
			an enormity!

These people of ours have taken to worshipping [other] deities
			instead of Him, without being able to<sup class='fn'>16</sup> adduce any
			reasonable evidence in support of their beliefs;<sup class='fn'>17</sup> and
			who could be more wicked than he who invents a lie about
			God?<sup class='fn'>18</sup>

Hence, now that you have withdrawn from them and from all that
			they worship instead of God, take refuge in that cave: God will
			spread His grace over you, and will endow you - whatever your
			[outward] condition - with all that your souls may
			need!"<sup class='fn'>19</sup>

And [for many a year] thou might have seen the sun, on its
			rising, incline away from their cave on the right, and, on its
			setting, turn aside from them on the left, while they lived on in
			that spacious chamber,<sup class='fn'>20</sup> [bearing witness to] this of
			God's messages: He whom God guides, he alone has found the right
			way; whereas for him whom He lets go astray thou canst never find
			any protector who would point out the right way.

And thou wouldst have thought that they were awake, whereas they
			lay asleep. And We caused them, to turn over repeatedly, now to
			the right, now to the left; and their dog [lay] on the threshold,
			its forepaws outstretched. Hadst thou come upon them
			[unprepared], thou wouldst surely have turned away from them in
			flight, and wouldst surely have been filled with awe of
			them.<sup class='fn'>21</sup>

And so, [in the course of time,] We awakened them;<sup class='fn'>22</sup> and
			they began to ask one another [as to what had happened to
			them].<sup class='fn'>23</sup> One of them asked: "How long have you remained
			thus?" [The others] answered: "We have remained thus a day, or
			part of a day."<sup class='fn'>24</sup> Said they [who were endowed with
			deeper insight]: "Your Sustainer knows best how long you have
			thus remained.<sup class='fn'>25</sup> Let, then, one of you go with these
			silver coins to the town, and let him find out what food is
			purest there, and bring you thereof [some] provisions. But let
			him behave with great care and by no means make anyone aware of
			you:

for, behold, if they should come to know of you, they might stone\n\t\t\tyou to death or force you back to their faith - in which case you\n\t\t\twould never attain to any good!"<sup class='fn'>26</sup>

AND IN THIS way<sup class='fn'>27</sup> have We drawn [people's] attention to
			their story,<sup class='fn'>28</sup> so that they might know - whenever they
			debate among themselves as to what happened to those [Men of the
			Cave]<sup class='fn'>29</sup> - that God's promise [of resurrection] is true,
			and that there can be no doubt as to [the coming of] the Last
			Hour. And so, some [people] said: "Erect a building in their
			memory;<sup class='fn'>30</sup> God knows best what happened to them." Said
			they whose opinion prevailed in the end: "Indeed, we must surely
			raise a house of worship in their memory!"

[And in times to come] some will say,<sup class='fn'>31</sup> "[They were]
			three, the fourth of them being their dog," while others will
			say, "Five, with their dog as the sixth of them" - idly guessing
			at something of which they can have no knowledge - and [so on,
			until] some will say, "[They were] seven, the eighth of them
			being their dog." Say: "My Sustainer knows best how may they
			were. None but a few have any [real] knowledge of them. Hence, do
			not argue about them otherwise than by way of an obvious
			argument,<sup class='fn'>32</sup> and do not ask any of those [storytellers]
			to enlighten thee about them."
AND NEVER say about anything, "Behold, I shall do this tomorrow,"

without [adding], "if God so wills."<sup class='fn'>33</sup> And if thou
			shouldst forget [thyself at the time, and become aware of it
			later], call thy Sustainer to mind and say: "I pray that my
			Sustainer guide me, even closer than this, to a consciousness of
			what is right!"
AND [some people assert], "They remained in their cave three\n\t\t\thundred years"; and some have added nine [to that\n\t\t\tnumber].<sup class='fn'>34</sup>

Say: "God knows best how long they remained [there]. His [alone]
			is the knowledge of the hidden reality of the heavens and the
			earth: how well does He see and hear! No guardian have they apart
			from Him, since He allots to no one a share in His rule!"

AND CONVEY [to the world] whatever has been revealed to thee of
			thy Sustainer's writ. There is nothing that could alter His
			words;<sup class='fn'>35</sup> and thou canst find no refuge other than with
			Him.

And contain thyself in patience by the side of all who at morn
			and at evening invoke their Sustainer, seeking His countenance,
			and let not thine eyes pass beyond them in quest of the beauties
			of this world's life:<sup class='fn'>36</sup> and pay no heed to any whose
			heart We have rendered heedless of all remembrance of
			Us<sup class='fn'>37</sup> because he had always followed [only] his own
			desires, abandoning all that is good and true.<sup class='fn'>38</sup>

And say: "The truth [has now come] from your Sustainer: let,
			then, him who wills, believe in it, and let him who wills, reject
			it. "Verily, for all who sin against themselves [by rejecting Our
			truth]<sup class='fn'>39</sup> We have readied a fire whose billowing folds
			will encompass them from all sides;<sup class='fn'>40</sup> and if they beg
			for water, they will be given water [hot] like molten lead, which
			will scald their faces: how dreadful a drink, and how evil a
			place to rest!
[But,] behold, as for those who attain to faith and do righteous\n\t\t\tdeeds - verily, We do not fail to requite any who persevere in\n\t\t\tdoing good:

theirs shall be gardens of perpetual bliss - [gardens] through
			which running waters flow wherein they will be adorned with
			bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of silk and
			brocade, [and] wherein upon couches they will recline:<sup class='fn'>41</sup>
			how excellent a recompense, and how goodly a place to rest!

AND PROPOUND unto them the parable of two men, upon one of whom\n\t\t\tWe had bestowed two vineyards, and surrounded them with\n\t\t\tdate-palms, and placed a field of grain in-between.<sup class='fn'>42</sup>
Each of the two gardens yielded its produce and never failed\n\t\t\ttherein in any way, for We had caused a stream to gush forth in\n\t\t\tthe midst of each of them.

And so [the man] had fruit in abundance. And [one day] he said to
			his friend, bandying words with him, "More wealth have I than
			thou, and mightier am I as regards [the number and power of my]
			followers!"
And having [thus] sinned against himself, he entered his garden,\n\t\t\tsaying, "I do not think that this will ever perish!

And neither do I think that the Last Hour will ever come. But
			even if [it should come, and] I am brought before my
			Sustainer,<sup class='fn'>43</sup> I will surely find something even better
			than this as [my last] resort!"

And his friend answered him in the course of their argument:
			"Wilt thou blaspheme against Him who has created thee out of
			dust,<sup class='fn'>44</sup> and then out of a drop of sperm, and in the end
			has fashioned thee into a [complete] man?
But as for myself, [I know that] He is God, my Sustainer; and I\n\t\t\tcannot attribute divine powers to any but my\n\t\t\tSustainer."<sup class='fn'>45</sup>

And [he continued:] "Alas,<sup class='fn'>46</sup> if thou hadst but said, on
			entering thy garden, Whatever God wills [shall come to pass, for]
			there is no power save with God!' Although, as thou seest, I have
			less wealth and offspring than thou,

yet it may well be that my Sustainer will give me something
			better than thy garden - just as He may let loose a calamity out
			of heaven upon this [thy garden], so that it becomes a heap of
			barren dust
or its water sinks deep into the ground, so that thou wilt never\n\t\t\tbe able to find it again!"

And [thus it happened:] his fruitful gardens were encompassed [by
			ruin], and there he was, wringing his hands over all that he had
			spent on that: which now lay waste, with its trellises caved in;
			and he could but say, "Oh, would that I had not attributed divine
			powers to any but my Sustainer!"
for now he had nought<sup class='fn'>47</sup> to succour him in God's stead,\n\t\t\tnor could he succour himself.
For thus it is: all protectve power belongs to God alone, the\n\t\t\tTrue One. He is the best to grant recompense, and the best to\n\t\t\tdetermine what is to be.<sup class='fn'>48</sup>

AND PROPOUND unto them the parable of the life of this world: [it
			is] like the water which We send down from the skies, and which
			is absorbed by the plants of the earth: but [in time] they turn
			into dry stubble which the winds blow freely about. And it is God
			[alone] who determines all things.

Wealth and children are an adornment of this world's life: but
			good deeds, the fruit whereof endures forever, are of far greater
			merit in thy Sustainer's sight, and a far better source of
			hope.<sup class='fn'>49</sup>

Hence, [bear in mind] the Day on which We shall cause the
			mountains to disappear and thou shalt behold the earth void and
			bare: for [on that Day] We will [resurrect the dead and] gather
			them all together, leaving out none of them.

And they will be lined up before thy Sustainer, [and He will
			say:<sup class='fn'>50</sup> ] "Now, indeed, you have come unto Us [in a
			lonely state], even as We created you in the first
			instance<sup class='fn'>51</sup> - although you were wont to assert that We
			would never appoint for you a meeting [with Us]!"

And the record [of everyone's deeds] will be laid open; and thou
			wilt behold the guilty filled with dread at what [they see]
			therein; and they will exclaim: "Oh, woe unto us! What a record
			is this! It leaves out nothing, be it small or great, but takes
			everything into account!" For they will find all that they ever
			wrought [now] facing them, and [will know that] thy Sustainer
			does not wrong anyone.

AND [remember that] when We told the angels, "Prostrate
			yourselves before Adam,"<sup class='fn'>52</sup> they all prostrated
			themselves, save Iblis: he too was one of those invisible
			beings,<sup class='fn'>53</sup> but then he turned away from his Sustainer's
			command. Will you, then, take him and his cohorts<sup class='fn'>54</sup> for
			[your] masters instead of Me, although they are your foes? How
			vile an exchange on the evildoers' part!<sup class='fn'>55</sup>

I did not make them witnesses of the creation of the heavens and
			the earth, nor of the creation of their own selves;<sup class='fn'>56</sup>
			and neither do I [have any need to] take as My helpers those
			[beings] that lead [men] astray.<sup class='fn'>57</sup>

Hence, [bear in mind] the Day on which He will say, "Call [now]
			unto those beings whom you imagined to have a share in My
			divinity!"<sup class='fn'>58</sup> - whereupon they will invoke them, but
			those [beings] will not respond to them: for We shall have placed
			between them an unbridgeable gulf.<sup class='fn'>59</sup>
And those who were lost in sin will behold the fire, and will\n\t\t\tknow that they are bound to fall into it, and will find no way of\n\t\t\tescape therefrom.

THUS, INDEED, have We given in this Qur'an many facets to every
			kind of lesson [designed] for [the benefit of]
			mankind.<sup class='fn'>60</sup> However, man is, above all else, always given
			to contention:

for, what is there to keep people from attaining to faith now
			that guidance has come unto them, and from asking their Sustainer
			to forgive them their sins - unless it be [their wish] that the
			fate of the [sinful] people of ancient times should befall them
			[as well], or that the [ultimate] suffering should befall them in
			the hereafter?<sup class='fn'>61</sup>

But We send [Our] message-bearers only as heralds of glad tidings
			and as warners - whereas those who are bent on denying the truth
			contend [against them] with fallacious arguments, so as to render
			void the truth thereby, and to make My messages and warnings a
			target of their mockery.

And who could be more wicked than he to whom his Sustainer's
			messages are conveyed and who thereupon turns away from them,
			forgetting all [the evil] that his hands may have
			wrought?<sup class='fn'>62</sup> Behold, over their hearts have We laid veils
			which prevent them from grasping the truth, and into their ears,
			deafness; and though thou call them onto the right
			path,<sup class='fn'>63</sup> they will never allow themselves to be guided.

Yet, [withal,] thy Sustainer is the Truly-Forgiving One,
			limitless in His grace. Were He to take them [at once] to task
			for whatever [wrong] they commit, He would indeed bring about
			their speedy punishment [then and there]:<sup class='fn'>64</sup> but nay,
			they have a time-limit beyond which they shall find no
			redemption<sup class='fn'>65</sup> -
as [was the case with all] those communities that We destroyed\n\t\t\twhen they went on and on doing wrong:<sup class='fn'>66</sup> for We had set a\n\t\t\ttime-limit for their destruction.

AND LO!<sup class='fn'>67</sup> [In the course of his wanderings,] Moses said
			to his servant:<sup class='fn'>68</sup> "I shall not give up until I reach the
			junction of the two seas, even I [have to] spend untold years [in
			my quest]!"
But when they reached the junction between the two [seas], they\n\t\t\tforgot all about their fish, and it took its way into the sea and\n\t\t\tdisappeared from sight.<sup class='fn'>69</sup>
And after the two had walked some distance, [Moses] said to his\n\t\t\tservant: "Bring us our mid-day meal; we have indeed suffered\n\t\t\thardship on this [day of] our journey!"

Said [the servant]: "Wouldst thou believe it?<sup class='fn'>70</sup> When we
			betook ourselves to that rock for a rest, behold, I forgot about
			the fish - and none but Satan made me thus forget it!<sup class='fn'>71</sup>
			and it took its way into the sea! How strange!"
[Moses] exclaimed: "That [was the place] which we were\n\t\t\tseeking!"<sup class='fn'>72</sup> And the two turned back, retracing their\n\t\t\tfootsteps,
and found one of Our servants, on whom We had bestowed grace from\n\t\t\tOurselves and unto whom We had imparted knowledge [issuing] from\n\t\t\tOurselves.<sup class='fn'>73</sup>
Moses said unto him: "May I follow thee on the understanding that\n\t\t\tthou wilt impart to me some thing of that consciousness of what\n\t\t\tright which has been imparted to thee?"
[The other] answered: "Behold, thou wilt never be able to have\n\t\t\tpatience with me -
for how couldst thou be patient about something that thou canst\n\t\t\tnot comprehend within the compass of [thy]\n\t\t\texperience?"<sup class='fn'>74</sup>
Replied [Moses]: "Thou wilt find me patient, if God so wills: and\n\t\t\tI shall not disobey thee in anything!"
Said [the sage]: "Well, then, if thou art to follow me, do not\n\t\t\tquestion me about aught [that I may do] until I myself give thee\n\t\t\tan account thereof."

And so the two went on their way, till [they reached the
			seashore; and] when they disembarked from the boat [that had
			ferried them across], the sage<sup class='fn'>75</sup> made a hole in it -
			[whereupon Moses] exclaimed: "Hast thou made a hole in it in
			order to drown the people who may be [travelling] in it? Indeed,
			thou hast done a grievous thing!"
He replied: "Did I not tell thee that thou wilt never be able to\n\t\t\thave patience with me?"
Said [Moses]: "Take me not to task for my having forgotten\n\t\t\t[myself], and be not hard on me on account of what I have done!"

And so the two went on, till, when they met a young man, [the
			sage] slew him - [whereupon Moses] exclaimed: "Hast thou slain an
			innocent human being without [his having taken] another man's
			life? Indeed, thou hast done a terrible thing!"
He replied: "Did I not tell thee that thou wilt never be able to\n\t\t\thave patience with me?"
Said [Moses]: "If, after this, I should ever question thee, keep\n\t\t\tme not in thy company: [for by] now thou hast heard enough\n\t\t\texcuses from me."

And so the two went on, till, when they came upon some village
			people, they asked them<sup class='fn'>76</sup> for food; but those [people]
			refused them all hospitality. And they saw in that [village] a
			wall which was on the point of tumbling down, and [the sage]
			rebuilt it - [whereupon Moses] said: "Hadst thou so wished,
			surely thou couldst [at least] have obtained some payment for
			it?"
[The sage] replied: "This is the parting of ways between me and\n\t\t\tthee. [And now] I shall let thee know the real meaning of all\n\t\t\t[those events] that thou wert unable to bear with patience:

"As for that boat, it belonged to some needy people who toiled
			upon the sea - and I desired to damage it<sup class='fn'>77</sup> because [I
			knew that] behind them was a king who is wont to seize every boat
			by brute force.

"And as for that young man, his parents were [true] believers -
			whereas we had every reason to fear<sup class='fn'>78</sup> that he would
			bring bitter grief upon them by [his] overweening wickedness and
			denial of all truth:
and so we desired that their Sustainer grant them in his stead [a\n\t\t\tchild] of greater purity than him, and closer [to them] in loving\n\t\t\ttenderness.

"And as for that wall, it belonged to two orphan boys [living] in
			the town, and beneath it was [buried], a treasure belonging to
			them [by right].<sup class='fn'>79</sup> Now their father had been a righteous
			man, and so thy Sustainer willed it that when they come of age
			they should bring forth their treasure by thy Sustainer's grace.
			"And I did not do [any of] this of my own accord:<sup class='fn'>80</sup> this
			is the real meaning of all [those events] that thou wert unable
			to bear with patience."
AND THEY will ask thee about the Two-Horned One. Say: "I will\n\t\t\tconvey unto you something by which he ought to be\n\t\t\tremembered."<sup class='fn'>81</sup>
Behold, We established him securely on earth, and endowed him\n\t\t\twith [the knowledge of] the right means to achieve\n\t\t\tanything<sup class='fn'>82</sup> [that he might set out to achieve];
and so he chose the right means [in whatever he did].<sup class='fn'>83</sup>

[And he marched westwards] till, when he came to the setting of
			the sun,<sup class='fn'>84</sup> it appeared to him that it was setting in a
			dark, turbid sea;<sup class='fn'>85</sup> and nearby he found a people [given
			to every kind of wrongdoing]. We said: "O thou Two-Horned One!
			Thou mayest either cause [them] to suffer or treat them with
			kindness!"<sup class='fn'>86</sup>

He answered: "As for him who does wrong [unto others<sup class='fn'>87</sup> ]
			- him shall we, in time, cause to suffer; and thereupon he shall
			be referred to his Sustainer, and He will cause him to suffer
			with unnameable suffering.<sup class='fn'>88</sup>

But as for him who believes and does righteous deeds - he will
			have the ultimate good [of the life to come] as his reward; and
			[as for us,] we shall make binding on him [only] that which is
			easy to fulfill."<sup class='fn'>89</sup>
And once again<sup class='fn'>90</sup> he chose the right means [to achieve a\n\t\t\tright end].

[And then he marched eastwards] till, when he came to the rising\n\t\t\tof the sun,<sup class='fn'>91</sup> he found that it was rising on a people\n\t\t\tfor whom We had provided no coverings against it:
thus [We had made them, and thus he left them<sup class='fn'>92</sup> ]; and\n\t\t\tWe did encompass with Our knowledge all that he had in\n\t\t\tmind.<sup class='fn'>93</sup>
And once again he chose the right means [to achieve a right end].

[And he marched on] till, when he reached [a place] between the\n\t\t\ttwo mountain-barriers,<sup class='fn'>94</sup> he found beneath them a people\n\t\t\twho could scarcely understand a word [of his language].

They said: "O thou Two-Horned One! Behold, Gog and
			Magog<sup class='fn'>95</sup> are spoiling this land. May we, then pay unto
			thee a tribute on the understanding that thou wilt erect a
			barrier between us and them?"

He answered: "That wherein my Sustainer has so securely
			established me is better [than anything that you could give
			me];<sup class='fn'>96</sup> hence, do but help me with [your labour's]
			strength, [and] I shall erect a rampart between you and them!

Bring me ingots of iron!" Then, after he had [piled up the iron
			and] filled the gap between the two mountain-sides, he said:
			"[Light a fire and] ply your bellows!"<sup class='fn'>97</sup> At length, when
			he had made it [glow like] fire, he commanded: "Bring me molten
			copper which I may pour upon it."
And thus [the rampart was built, and] their enemies<sup class='fn'>98</sup>\n\t\t\twere unable to scale it, and neither were they able to pierce it.

Said [the King]: "This is a mercy from my Sustainer! Yet when the
			time appointed by my Sustainer<sup class='fn'>99</sup> shall come, He will
			make this [rampart] level with the ground: and my Sustainer's
			promise always comes true!"<sup class='fn'>100</sup>

AND ON that Day<sup class='fn'>101</sup> We shall [call forth all mankind and]
			leave them to surge like waves [that dash] against one another;
			and the trumpet [of judgment] will be blown, and We shall gather
			them all together.
And on that Day We shall place hell, for all to see, before those\n\t\t\twho denied the truth -
those whose eyes had been veiled against any remembrance of Me\n\t\t\tbecause they could not bear to listen [to the voice of truth]!

Do they who are bent on denying the truth think, perchance, that
			they could take [any of] My creatures for protectors against
			Me?<sup class='fn'>102</sup> Verily, We have readied hell to welcome all who
			[thus] deny the truth!<sup class='fn'>103</sup>
Say: "Shall we tell you who are the greatest losers in whatever\n\t\t\tthey may do?
"[It is] they whose labour has gone astray in [the pursuit of no\n\t\t\tmore than] this world's life, and who nonetheless think that\n\t\t\tthey are doing good works:

it is they who have chosen to deny their Sustainer's messages and
			the truth that they are destined to meet Him." Hence, all their
			[good] deeds come to nought, and no weight shall We assign to
			them on Resurrection Day.<sup class='fn'>104</sup>
That will be their recompense - [their] hell - for having denied\n\t\t\tthe truth and made My messages and My apostles a target of their\n\t\t\tmockery.
[But,] verily, as for those who attain to faith and do righteous\n\t\t\tdeeds - the gardens of paradise will be there to welcome them;
therein will they abide, [and] never will they desire any change\n\t\t\ttherefrom.

SAY: "If all the sea were ink for my Sustainer's words, the sea
			would indeed be exhausted ere my Sustainer's words are exhausted!
			And [thus it would be] if we were to add to it sea upon sea."
			<sup class='fn'>105</sup>

Say [O Prophet]: "I am but a mortal man like all of you. It has
			been revealed unto me that your God is the One and Only God.
			Hence, whoever looks forward [with hope and awe] to meeting his
			Sustainer [on Judgment Day], let him do righteous deeds, and let
			him not ascribe unto anyone or anything a share in the worship
			due to his Sustainer!"
Kaf. Ha. Ya. 'Ayn. Sad.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
AN ACCOUNT of the grace which thy Sustainer bestowed upon His\n\t\t\tservant Zachariah:<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
When he called out to his Sustainer in the secrecy of his\n\t\t\theart,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

he prayed: "O my Sustainer! Feeble have become my bones, and my\n\t\t\thead glistens with grey hair. But never yet, O my Lord, has my\n\t\t\tprayer unto Thee remained unanswered.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>

"Now, behold, I am afraid of [what] my kinsfolk [will do] after\n\t\t\tI am gone,<sup class='fn'>5</sup> for my wife has always been barren. Bestow,\n\t\t\tthen, upon me, out of Thy grace, the gift of a successor
who will be my heir as well as an heir [to the dignity] of the\n\t\t\tHouse of Jacob; and make him, O my Sustainer, well-pleasing to\n\t\t\tThee!"

[Thereupon the angels called out unto him:<sup class='fn'>6</sup> ] "O
			Zachariah! We bring thee the glad tiding of [the birth of] a son
			whose name shall be John. [And God says,] 'Never have We given
			this name to anyone before him.'"<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
[Zachariah] exclaimed: "O my Sustainer! How can I have a son when\n\t\t\tmy wife has always been barren and I have become utterly infirm\n\t\t\tthrough old age?"
Answered [the angel]: "Thus it is; [but] thy Sustainer says,\n\t\t\t'This is easy for Me - even as I have created thee aforetime out\n\t\t\tof nothing.'"<sup class='fn'>8</sup>

[Zachariah] prayed: "O my Sustainer! Appoint a sign for me!" Said\n\t\t\t[the angel]: "Thy sign shall be that for full three nights [and\n\t\t\tdays] thou wilt not speak unto men."<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
Thereupon he came out of the sanctuary unto his people and\n\t\t\tsignified to them [by gestures]: "Extol His limitless glory by\n\t\t\tday and by night!"

[And when the son was born and grew up<sup class='fn'>10</sup>, he was told,] "O John!\n\t\t\tHold fast unto the divine writ with [all thy] strength!" - for We\n\t\t\tgranted him wisdom while he was yet a little boy,
as well as, by Our grace, [the gift of] compassion<sup class='fn'>11</sup> and\n\t\t\tpurity; and he was [always] conscious of Us
and full of piety towards his parents; and never was he haughty\n\t\t\tor rebellious.
Hence, [God's] peace was upon him on the day  when he was born,\n\t\t\tand on the day of his death, and will be [upon him] on the day\n\t\t\twhen he shall be raised to life [again].
AND CALL to mind, through this divine writ,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> Mary. Lo!\n\t\t\tShe withdrew from her family to an eastern place

and kept herself in seclusion from them,<sup class='fn'>13</sup> whereupon We\n\t\t\tsent unto her Our angel of revelation, who appeared to her in the\n\t\t\tshape of a well-made human being.<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
She exclaimed: "Verily, I seek refuge from thee with the Most\n\t\t\tGracious! [Approach me not] if thou art conscious of Him!"
[The angel] answered: "I am but a messenger of thy Sustainer,\n\t\t\t[who says,] 'I shall bestow upon thee the gift of a son endowed\n\t\t\twith purity.'"
Said she: "How can I have a son when no man has ever touched me?\n\t\t\t- for, never have I been a loose woman!"

[The angel] answered: "Thus it is; [but] thy Sustainer says,
			'This is easy for Me;<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and [thou shalt have a son,] so
			that We might make him a symbol unto mankind and an act of grace
			from Us."<sup class='fn'>16</sup> And it was a thing decreed [by God]:
and in time she conceived him, and then she withdrew with him to\n\t\t\ta far-off place.

And [when] the throes of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a\n\t\t\tpalm-tree,<sup class='fn'>17</sup> she exclaimed: "Oh, would that I had died\n\t\t\tere this, and had become a thing forgotten, utterly forgotten!"
Thereupon [a voice] called out to her from beneath that\n\t\t\t[palm-tree]:<sup class='fn'>18</sup> "Grieve not! Thy Sustainer has provided a\n\t\t\trivulet [running] beneath thee;
and shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards thee: it will drop\n\t\t\tfresh, ripe dates upon thee.

Eat, then, and drink, and let thine eye be gladdened! And if thou
			shouldst see any human being, convey this unto him:<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
			'Behold, abstinence from speech have I vowed unto the Most
			Gracious; hence, I may not speak today to any
			mortal.'"<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
And in time she returned to her people, carrying the child with\n\t\t\ther.<sup class='fn'>21</sup> They said: "O Mary! Thou hast indeed done an\n\t\t\tamazing thing!
O sister of Aaron!<sup class='fn'>22</sup> Thy father was not a wicked man,\n\t\t\tnor was thy mother a loose woman!"
Thereupon she pointed to him. They exclaimed: "How can we talk to\n\t\t\tone who [as yet] is a little boy in the cradle?"
[But] he said:<sup class='fn'>23</sup> "Behold, I am a servant of God. He has\n\t\t\tvouchsafed unto me revelation and made me a prophet,<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
and made me blessed wherever I may be; and He has enjoined upon\n\t\t\tme prayer and charity as long as I live,
and [has endowed me with] piety towards my mother; and He has\n\t\t\tnot made me haughty or bereft of grace.
"Hence, peace was upon me on the day when I was born, and [will\n\t\t\tbe upon me] on the day of my death, and on the day when I shall\n\t\t\tbe raised to life [again]!"
SUCH WAS, in the words of truth, Jesus the son of Mary, about\n\t\t\twhose nature they so deeply disagree.<sup class='fn'>25</sup>

It is not conceivable that God should have taken unto Himself a\n\t\t\tson: limitless is He in His glory!<sup class='fn'>26</sup> When He wills a\n\t\t\tthing to be, He but says unto it "Be" - and it is!
And [thus it was that Jesus always said]: "Verily, God is my\n\t\t\tSustainer as well as your Sustainer; so worship [none but] Him:\n\t\t\tthis [alone] is a  straight way."<sup class='fn'>27</sup>

And yet, the sects [that follow the Bible] are at variance among
			themselves [about the nature of Jesus]!<sup class='fn'>28</sup> Woe, then,
			unto all who deny the truth when that awesome Day will
			appear!<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
How well will they hear and see [the truth] on the Day when they\n\t\t\tcome before Us! Today, however, these evildoers are obviously\n\t\t\tlost in error:
hence, warn them of [the coming of] the Day of Regrets, when\n\t\t\teverything will have been decided - for as yet they are heedless,\n\t\t\tand they do not believe [in it].
Behold, We alone shall remain after the earth and all who live on\n\t\t\tit have passed away,<sup class='fn'>30</sup> and [when] unto Us all will have\n\t\t\tbeen brought back.
AND CALL to mind, through this divine writ, Abraham.<sup class='fn'>31</sup>\n\t\t\tBehold, he was a man of truth, [already] a prophet
when he spoke [thus] unto his father: "O my father! Why dost thou\n\t\t\tworship something that neither hears nor sees and can be of no\n\t\t\tavail whatever to thee?

"O my father! Behold, there has indeed come to me [a ray] of\n\t\t\tknowledge such as has never yet come unto thee:<sup class='fn'>32</sup> follow\n\t\t\tme, then; I shall guide thee onto a perfect way.
"O my father! Do not worship Satan - for verily, Satan is a rebel\n\t\t\tagainst the Most Gracious!<sup class='fn'>33</sup>
O my father! I dread lest a chastisement from the Most Gracious\n\t\t\tbefall thee, and then thou wilt become [aware of having been]\n\t\t\tclose unto Satan!"<sup class='fn'>34</sup>
He answered: "Dost thou dislike my gods, O Abraham? Indeed, if thou\n\t\t\tdesist not, I shall most certainly cause thee to be stoned to\n\t\t\tdeath! Now begone from me for good!"
[Abraham] replied: "Peace be upon thee! I shall ask my Sustainer to\n\t\t\tforgive thee: for, behold, He has always been kind unto me.

But I shall withdraw from you all and from whatever you invoke
			instead of God, and shall invoke my Sustainer [alone]: it may
			well be that my prayer [for thee] will not remain unanswered by
			my Sustainer."<sup class='fn'>35</sup>
And after he had withdrawn from them and from all that they\n\t\t\twere worshipping instead of God, We bestowed upon him Isaac and\n\t\t\tJacob, and made of them a prophet;
We bestowed upon them [manifold] gifts out of Our grace, and\n\t\t\tgranted them a lofty power to convey the truth [unto\n\t\t\tothers].<sup class='fn'>36</sup>
AND CALL to mind, through this divine writ, Moses. Behold, he was\n\t\t\ta chosen one, and was an apostle [of God], a prophet.<sup class='fn'>37</sup>
And [remember how] We called upon him from the right-hand slope\n\t\t\tof Mount Sinai<sup class='fn'>38</sup> and drew him near [unto Us] in mystic\n\t\t\tcommunion,
and [how], out of Our grace, We granted unto him his brother\n\t\t\tAaron, to be a prophet [by his side].
AND CALL to mind, through this divine writ, Ishmael.<sup class='fn'>39</sup>\n\t\t\tBehold, he was always true to his promise, and was an apostle [of\n\t\t\tGod], a prophet,
who used to enjoin upon his people prayer and charity,<sup class='fn'>40</sup>\n\t\t\tand found favour in his Sustainer's sight.
AND CALL to mind, through this divine writ, Idris.<sup class='fn'>41</sup>\n\t\t\tBehold, he was a man of truth, a prophet,
whom We exalted onto a lofty station.<sup class='fn'>42</sup>

THESE WERE some of the prophets upon whom God bestowed His
			blessings - [prophets] of the seed of Adam and of those whom We
			caused to be borne [in the ark] with Noah, and of the seed of
			Abraham and Israel<sup class='fn'>43</sup> : and [all of them were] among
			those whom We had guided and elected; [and] whenever the messages
			of the Most Gracious were conveyed unto them, they would fall
			down [before Him], prostrating themselves and
			weeping.<sup class='fn'>44</sup>

Yet they were succeeded by generations [of people] who lost all\n\t\t\t[thought of] prayer and followed [but] their own lusts; and these\n\t\t\twill, in time, meet with utter disillusion.<sup class='fn'>45</sup>

Excepted, however, shall be those who repent and attain to faith\n\t\t\tand do righteous deeds: for it is they who will enter paradise\n\t\t\tand will not be wronged in any way:<sup class='fn'>46</sup>

[theirs will be the] gardens of perpetual bliss which the Most
			Gracious has promised unto His servants, in a realm which is
			beyond the reach of human perception:<sup class='fn'>47</sup> [and,] verily,
			His promise is ever sure of fulfilment!

No empty talk will they hear there - nothing but [tidings of] inner\n\t\t\tsoundness and peace;<sup class='fn'>48</sup> and there will they have their\n\t\t\tsustenance by day and by night:<sup class='fn'>49</sup>
this is the paradise which We grant as heritage unto such of Our\n\t\t\tservants as are conscious of Us.

AND [the angels say]: "We do not descend [with revelation], again
			and again, other than by thy Sustainer's command: unto Him
			belongs all that lies open before us and all that is hidden from
			us and all that in-between.<sup class='fn'>50</sup> And never does thy
			Sustainer forget [anything]-

the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is
			between them! Worship, then, Him alone, and remain steadfast in
			His worship! Dost thou know any whose name is worthy to be
			men-tioned side by side with His?"
WITH ALL THIS, man [often] says, "What! Once I am dead, shall I\n\t\t\tagain be brought forth alive?"
But does man not bear in mind that We have created him aforetime\n\t\t\tout of nothing?<sup class='fn'>51</sup>

And so, by thy Sustainer, [on Judgment Day] We shall most
			certainly bring them forth together with the satanic forces
			[which impelled them in life],<sup class='fn'>52</sup> and then We shall most
			certainly gather them, on their knees, around hell;

and thereupon We shall, indeed, draw forth from every group [of\n\t\t\tsinners] the ones that had been most determined in their\n\t\t\tdisdainful rebellion against the Most Gracious:<sup class='fn'>53</sup>
for, indeed, We know best as to which of them is most deserving\n\t\t\tof the fires of hell.<sup class='fn'>54</sup>
And every one of you will come within sight of it:<sup class='fn'>55</sup>\n\t\t\tthis is, with thy Sustainer, a decree that must be fulfilled.
And once again:<sup class='fn'>56</sup> We shall save [from hell] those who\n\t\t\thave been conscious of Us; but We shall leave in it the\n\t\t\tevildoers, on their knees.<sup class='fn'>57</sup>

AS IT IS, whenever Our messages are conveyed to them in all their
			clarity, those who are bent on denying the truth are wont to say
			unto those who have attained to faith: "which of the two kinds of
			man<sup class='fn'>58</sup> is in a stronger position and superior as a
			community?"<sup class='fn'>59</sup>
And yet, how many a generation have We destroyed before their\n\t\t\ttime - [people] who surpassed them in material power<sup class='fn'>60</sup>\n\t\t\tand in outward show!

Say: "As for him who lives in error, may the Most Gracious
			lengthen the sup of his life!"<sup class='fn'>61</sup> [And let them say
			whatever they say<sup class='fn'>62</sup> ] until the time when they behold
			that [doom] of which they were forewarned - whether it be
			suffering [in this world] or [at the coming of] the Last Hour-:
			for then they will understand which [of the two kinds of man] was
			worse in station and weaker in resources!<sup class='fn'>63</sup>

And God endows those who avail themselves of [His] guidance with
			an ever-deeper consciousness of the right way;<sup class='fn'>64</sup> and
			good deeds, the fruit whereof endures forever, are, in thy
			Sustainer's sight, of far greater merit [than any worldly goods],
			and yield far better returns.<sup class='fn'>65</sup>
And hast thou ever considered [the kind of man] who is bent on\n\t\t\tdenying the truth of Our messages and says, "I will surely be\n\t\t\tgiven wealth and children"?<sup class='fn'>66</sup>
Has he, perchance, attained to a realm which is beyond the reach\n\t\t\tof a created being's perception?<sup class='fn'>67</sup> - or has he concluded\n\t\t\ta covenant with the Most Gracious?
Nay! We shall record what he says, and We shall lengthen the\n\t\t\tlength of his suffering [in the hereafter],
and divest him of<sup class='fn'>68</sup> all that he is [now] speaking of:\n\t\t\tfor [on Judgment Day] he will appear before Us in a lonely\n\t\t\tstate.<sup class='fn'>69</sup>
For [such as] these have taken to worshipping deities other than\n\t\t\tGod, hoping that they would be a [source of] strength for\n\t\t\tthem.<sup class='fn'>70</sup>
But nay! [On Judgment Day] these [very objects of adoration] will\n\t\t\tdisavow the worship that was paid to them, and will turn against\n\t\t\tthose [who had worshipped them]!

ART THOU NOT aware that We have let loose all [manner of] satanic\n\t\t\tforces<sup class='fn'>71</sup> upon those who deny the truth - [forces] that\n\t\t\timpel them [towards sin] with strong impulsion?<sup class='fn'>72</sup>
Hence, be not in haste [to call down God's punishment] upon them:\n\t\t\tfor We but number the number of their days.<sup class='fn'>73</sup>
On the Day when We shall gather the God-conscious unto [Us,] the\n\t\t\tMost Gracious, as honoured guests,
and drive those who were lost in sin unto hell as a thirsty herd\n\t\t\tis driven to a well -
[or that Day] none will have [the benefit of] intercession unless\n\t\t\the has [in his lifetime] entered into a bond with the Most\n\t\t\tGracious.<sup class='fn'>74</sup>
As it is,<sup class='fn'>75</sup> some assert, "The Most Gracious has taken\n\t\t\tunto Himself a son"!<sup class='fn'>76</sup>
Indeed, [by this assertion] you have brought forth something\n\t\t\tmonstrous,
whereat the heavens might well-nigh be rent into fragments, and\n\t\t\tthe earth be split asunder, and the mountains fall down in ruins!
That men should ascribe a son to the Most Gracious,
although it is inconceivable that the Most Gracious should take\n\t\t\tunto Himself a son!<sup class='fn'>77</sup>
Not one of all [the beings] that are in the heavens or on earth\n\t\t\tappears before the Most Gracious other than a servant:<sup class='fn'>78</sup>
indeed, He has full cognizance of them, and has numbered them\n\t\t\twith [unfailing] numbering;
and every one of them will appear before Him on Resurrection Day\n\t\t\tin a lonely state.<sup class='fn'>79</sup>
VERILY, those who attain to faith and do righteous deeds will the\n\t\t\tMost Gracious endow with love:<sup class='fn'>80</sup>

and only to this end have We made this [divine writ] easy to
			understand, in thine own tongue, [O Prophet,]<sup class='fn'>81</sup> so that
			thou might convey thereby a glad tiding to the God-conscious, and
			warn thereby those who are given to [futile] contention:
for, how many a generation<sup class='fn'>82</sup> have We destroyed before\n\t\t\ttheir time - [and] canst thou perceive any one of them [now], or\n\t\t\thear any whisper of them?
O MAN!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
We did not bestow the Qur'an on thee from on high to make thee\n\t\t\tunhappy,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
but only as an exhortation to all who stand in awe [of God]:
a revelation from Him who has created the earth and the high\n\t\t\theavens -
the Most Gracious, established on the throne of His\n\t\t\talmightiness.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Unto Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on\n\t\t\tearth, as well as all that is between them and all that is\n\t\t\tbeneath the sod.
And if thou say anything aloud, [He hears it - ] since, behold,\n\t\t\tHe knows [even] the secret [thoughts of man] as well as all that\n\t\t\tis yet more hidden [within him].<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
God - there is no deity save Him; His [alone] are the attributes\n\t\t\tof perfection!<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
AND HAS the story of Moses ever come within thy ken?<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

Lo! he saw a fire [in the desert];<sup class='fn'>7</sup> and so he said to
			his family: "Wait here! Behold, I perceive a fire [far away]:
			perhaps I can bring you a brand therefrom, or find at the fire
			some guidance."
But when he came close to it, a voice called out:<sup class='fn'>8</sup> "O\n\t\t\tMoses!
Verily, I am thy Sustainer! Take off, then, thy sandals! Behold,\n\t\t\tthou art in the twice-hallowed valley,<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
and I have chosen thee [to be My apostle]: listen, then, to what\n\t\t\tis being revealed [unto thee].
"Verily, I - I alone - am God; there is no deity save Me. Hence,\n\t\t\tworship Me alone, and be constant in prayer, so as to remember\n\t\t\tMe!<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
