"Behold, [although] I have willed to keep it<sup class='fn'>11</sup> hidden,
			the Last Hour is bound to come, so that every human being may be
			recompensed in accordance with what he strove for [in
			life].<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
Hence, let not anyone who does not believe in its\n\t\t\tcoming<sup class='fn'>13</sup> and follows [but] his own desires divert thee\n\t\t\tfrom [belief in] it, lest thou perish!
"Now, what is this in thy right hand, O Moses?"
He answered: "It is my staff; I lean on it; and with it I beat\n\t\t\tdown leaves for my sheep; and [many] other uses have I for it."
Said He: "Throw it down, O Moses!"
So he threw it - and lo! it was a snake, moving rapidly.
Said He: "Take hold of it, and fear not: We shall restore it to\n\t\t\tits former state.<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
"Now place thy hand within thy armpit: it will come forth\n\t\t\t[shining] white, without blemish,<sup class='fn'>15</sup> as another sign [of\n\t\t\tOur grace],
so that We might make thee aware of some of Our greatest wonders.
"[And now] go thou unto Pharaoh: for, verily, he has transgressed\n\t\t\tall bounds of equity."<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
Said [Moses]: "O my Sustainer! Open up my heart [to Thy light],
and make my task easy for me,
and loosen the knot from my tongue
so that they might fully understand my speech,<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
and appoint for me, out of my kinsfolk, one who will help me to\n\t\t\tbear my burden:<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
Aaron, my brother.
Add Thou through him to my strength,
and let him share my task,
so that [together] we might abundantly extol Thy limitless glory
and remember Thee without cease!<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
Verily. Thou seest all that is within us!"
Said He: "Thou art granted all that thou hast asked for, O Moses!
"And, indeed, We bestowed Our favour upon thee at a time long\n\t\t\tsince past,<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
when We inspired thy mother with this inspiration:

'Place him in a chest and throw it into the river, and thereupon
			the river will cast him ashore, [and] one who is an enemy unto Me
			and an enemy unto him will adopt him.<sup class='fn'>21</sup> "And [thus
			early] I spread Mine Own love over thee - and [this] in order
			that thou might be formed under Mine eye.<sup class='fn'>22</sup>

"[And thou wert under Mine eye] when thy sister went forth and
			said [to Pharaoh's people], 'Shall I guide you unto [a woman] who
			might take charge of him?<sup class='fn'>23</sup> And so We returned thee unto
			thy mother, so that her eye be gladdened, and that she might not
			sorrow [any longer].<sup class='fn'>24</sup> "And [when thou camest of
			age,<sup class='fn'>25</sup> ] thou didst slay a man: but We did save thee
			from all grief, although We tried thee with various
			trials.<sup class='fn'>26</sup> "And then thou didst sojourn for years among
			the people of Madyan;<sup class='fn'>27</sup> and now thou hast come [here] as
			ordained [by Me], O Moses:
for I have chosen thee for Mine Own service.
"Go forth, [then,] thou and thy brother, with My messages, and\n\t\t\tnever tire of remembering Me:
go forth. both of you, unto Pharaoh: for, verily, he has\n\t\t\ttransgressed all bounds of equity!
But speak; unto him in a mild manner, so that he might bethink\n\t\t\thimself or [at least] be filled with apprehension."<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
The two [brothers] said: "O our Sustainer! Verily, we fear lest\n\t\t\the act hastily with regard to us,<sup class='fn'>29</sup> or lest he [continue\n\t\t\tto] transgress all bounds of equity."
Answered He: "Fear not! Verily, I shall be with you two, hearing\n\t\t\tand seeing [all].

Go, then, you two unto him and say, 'Behold, we are apostles sent
			by thy Sustainer: let, then, the children of Israel go with us,
			and cause them not to suffer [any longer].<sup class='fn'>30</sup> We have now
			come unto thee with a message from thy Sustainer; and [know that
			His] peace shall be [only] on those who follow [His] guidance:
for, behold, it has been revealed to us that [in the life to\n\t\t\tcome] suffering shall befall all who give the lie to the truth\n\t\t\tand turn away [from it]!'"
[But when God's message was conveyed unto Pharaoh,] he said:\n\t\t\t"Who, now, is this Sustainer of you two, O Moses?"
He replied: "Our Sustainer is He who gives unto every thing [that\n\t\t\texists] its true nature and form, and thereupon guides it\n\t\t\t[towards its fulfilment]."<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
Said [Pharaoh]: "And what of all the past\n\t\t\tgenerations?"<sup class='fn'>32</sup>

[Moses] answered: "Knowledge thereof rests with my Sustainer\n\t\t\t[alone, and is laid down] in His decree;<sup class='fn'>33</sup> my Sustainer\n\t\t\tdoes not err, and neither does He forget."<sup class='fn'>34</sup>

HE IT IS who has made the earth a cradle for you, and has traced
			out for you ways [of livelihood] thereon,<sup class='fn'>35</sup> and [who]
			sends down waters from the sky: and by this means We bring forth
			various kinds<sup class='fn'>36</sup> of plants.
Eat, [then, of this produce of the soil,] and pasture your cattle\n\t\t\t[thereon]. In all this, behold, there are messages indeed for\n\t\t\tthose who are endowed with reason:
out of this [earth] have We created you, and into it shall We\n\t\t\treturn you, and out of it shall We bring you forth once\n\t\t\tagain.<sup class='fn'>37</sup>
AND, INDEED, We made Pharaoh aware of<sup class='fn'>38</sup> all Our messages\n\t\t\t- but he gave them the lie and refused [to heed them].<sup class='fn'>39</sup>
He said: "Hast thou come to drive us out of our land<sup class='fn'>40</sup>\n\t\t\tby thy sorcery, O Moses?

In that case, we shall most certainly produce before thee the
			like thereof! Appoint, then, a tryst between us and thee - which
			we shall not fail to keep, nor [mayest] thou - at a suitable
			place!"
Answered [Moses]: "Your tryst shall be the day of the\n\t\t\tFestival;<sup class='fn'>41</sup> and let the people assemble when the sun is\n\t\t\trisen high."
Thereupon Pharaoh withdrew [with his counsellors] and decided\n\t\t\tupon the scheme which he would pursue;<sup class='fn'>42</sup> and then he\n\t\t\tcame [to the tryst].

Said Moses to them: "Woe unto you! Do not invent lies against\n\t\t\tGod,<sup class='fn'>43</sup> lest He afflict you with most grievous suffering:\n\t\t\tfor He who contrives [such] a lie is already undone!"
So they debated among themselves as to what to do; but they kept\n\t\t\ttheir counsel secret,

saying [to one another]: "These two are surely sorcerers intent\n\t\t\ton driving you from your land<sup class='fn'>44</sup> by their sorcery, and on\n\t\t\tdoing away with your time-honoured way of life.<sup class='fn'>45</sup>

Hence, [O sorcerers of Egypt,] decide upon the scheme which you
			will pursue, and then come forward in one single body:<sup class='fn'>46</sup>
			for, indeed, he who prevails today shall prosper
			indeed!"<sup class='fn'>47</sup>
Said [the sorcerers]: "O Moses! Either thou throw [thy staff\n\t\t\tfirst], or we shall be the first to throw."
He answered: "Nay, you throw [first]. "And lo! by virtue of their\n\t\t\tsorcery, their [magic] ropes and staffs seemed to him to be\n\t\t\tmoving rapidly:
and in his heart Moses became apprehensive.<sup class='fn'>48</sup>
[But] We said: "Fear not! Verily, it is thou who shalt prevail!

And [now] throw that [staff] which is in thy right hand - it
			shall swallow up all that they have wrought: [for] they have
			wrought only a sorcerer's artifice, and the sorcerer can never
			come to any good, whatever he may aim at!"<sup class='fn'>49</sup>

[And so it happened<sup class='fn'>50</sup> -] and down fell the sorcerers,\n\t\t\tprostrating themselves in adoration,<sup class='fn'>51</sup> [and] exclaimed:\n\t\t\t"We have come to believe in the Sustainer of Moses and Aaron!"

Said [Pharaoh]: "Have you come to believe in him<sup class='fn'>52</sup> ere I
			have given you permission? Verily, he must be your master who has
			taught you magic! But I shall most certainly cut off your hands
			and feet in great numbers, because of [your] perverseness, and I
			shall most certainly crucify you in great numbers on trunks of
			palm-trees:<sup class='fn'>53</sup> and [I shall do this] so that you might
			come to know for certain as to which of us [two]<sup class='fn'>54</sup> can
			inflict a more severe chastisement, and [which] is the more
			abiding!"

They answered: "Never shall we prefer thee to all the evidence of
			the truth that has come unto us, nor to Him who has brought us
			into being! Decree, then, whatever thou art going to decree: thou
			canst decree only [something that pertains to] this worldly
			life!<sup class='fn'>55</sup>

As for us, behold, we have come to believe in our Sustainer,
			[hoping] that He may forgive us our faults and all that magic
			unto which thou hast forced us:<sup class='fn'>56</sup> for God is the best
			[to look forward to], and the One who is truly
			abiding."<sup class='fn'>57</sup>

VERILY, as for him who shall appear before his Sustainer [on\n\t\t\tJudgment Day] lost in sin-his [portion], behold, shall be hell:\n\t\t\the will neither die therein nor live;<sup class='fn'>58</sup>
whereas he who shall appear before Him as a believer who has done\n\t\t\trighteous deeds<sup class='fn'>59</sup> - it is such that shall have lofty\n\t\t\tstations [in the life to come]:
gardens of perpetual bliss, through which running waters flow,\n\t\t\ttherein to abide: for that shall be the recompense of all who\n\t\t\tattain to purity.

AND, INDEED, [a time came<sup class='fn'>60</sup> when] We thus inspired
			Moses: "Go forth with My servants by night, and strike out for
			them a dry path through the sea; [and] fear not of being
			overtaken, and dread not [the sea]."<sup class='fn'>61</sup>
And Pharaoh pursued them with his hosts: and they were\n\t\t\toverwhelmed by the sea which was destined to overwhelm\n\t\t\tthem<sup class='fn'>62</sup>
because Pharaoh had led his people astray and had not guided\n\t\t\t[them] aright.

O children of Israel! [Thus] We saved you from your enemy, and
			[then] We made a covenant with you on the right-hand slope of
			Mount Sinai,<sup class='fn'>63</sup> and repeatedly sent down manna and quails
			unto you, [saying,]

"Partake of the good things which We have provided for you as
			sustenance,<sup class='fn'>64</sup> but do not transgress therein the bounds
			of equity<sup class='fn'>65</sup> lest My condemnation fall upon you: for, he
			upon whom My condemnation falls has indeed thrown himself into
			utter ruin!"<sup class='fn'>66</sup>
Yet withal, behold, I forgive all sins unto any who repents and\n\t\t\tattains to faith and does righteous deeds, and thereafter keeps\n\t\t\tto the right path.
[AND GOD SAID:<sup class='fn'>67</sup> ] "Now what has caused thee, O Moses,\n\t\t\tto leave thy people behind in so great a haste?"<sup class='fn'>68</sup>
He answered: "They are treading in my foot-steps<sup class='fn'>69</sup> while\n\t\t\tI have hastened unto Thee, O my Sustainer, so that Thou might be\n\t\t\twell-pleased [with me]."
Said He: "Then [know that], verily, in thy absence We have put\n\t\t\tthy people to a test, and the Samaritan has led them\n\t\t\tastray."<sup class='fn'>70</sup>

Thereupon Moses returned to his people full of wrath and sorrow,
			[and] exclaimed: "O my people! Did not your Sustainer hold out
			[many] a goodly promise to you? Did, then, [the fulfilment of]
			this promise seem to you too long in coming?<sup class='fn'>71</sup> Or are
			you, perchance, determined to see your Sustainer's condemnation
			fall upon you,<sup class='fn'>72</sup> and so you broke your promise to me?"

They answered: "We did not break our promise to thee of our own
			free will, but [this is what happened:] we were loaded with the
			[sinful] burdens of the [Egyptian] people's ornaments, and so we
			threw them [into the firel,<sup class='fn'>73</sup> and likewise did this
			Samaritan cast [his into it]."

But then, [so they told Moses,<sup class='fn'>74</sup> the Samaritan] had
			produced for them [out of the molten gold] the effigy of a calf,
			which made a lowing sound;<sup class='fn'>75</sup> and thereupon they said [to
			one another], "This is your deity, and the deity of Moses-but he
			has forgotten [his past]!"<sup class='fn'>76</sup>
Why - did they not see that [the thing] could not give them any\n\t\t\tresponse, and had no power to harm or to benefit them?

And, indeed, even before [the return of Moses] had Aaron said
			unto them: "O my people! You are but being tempted to evil by
			this [idol] - for, behold, your [only] Sustainer is the Most
			Gracious! Follow me, then, and obey my bidding!"<sup class='fn'>77</sup>
[But] they answered: "By no means shall we cease to worship it\n\t\t\tuntil Moses comes back to us!"
[And now that he had come back, Moses] said: "O Aaron! What has\n\t\t\tprevented thee, when thou didst see that they had gone astray,
from [abandoning them and] following me? Hast thou, then,\n\t\t\t[deliberately] disobeyed my commandment?"<sup class='fn'>78</sup>

Answered [Aaron]: "O my mother's son! Seize me not by my beard,
			nor by my head!<sup class='fn'>79</sup> Behold, I was afraid lest [on thy
			return] thou say, 'Thou hast caused a split among the children of
			Israel, and hast paid no heed to my bidding!'"<sup class='fn'>80</sup>
Said [Moses]: "What, then, didst thou have in view, O Samaritan?"

He answered: "I have gained insight into something which they
			were unable to see:<sup class='fn'>81</sup> and so I took hold of a handful of
			the Apostle's teachings and cast it away: for thus has my mind
			prompted me [to act]<sup class='fn'>82</sup> .

Said [Moses]; "Begone, then! And, behold, it shall be thy lot to
			say throughout [thy] life, 'Touch me not!'<sup class='fn'>83</sup> But,
			verily, [in the life to come] thou shalt be faced with a destiny
			from which there will be no escape!<sup class='fn'>84</sup> And [now] look at
			this deity of shine to whose worship thou hast become so devoted:
			we shall most certainly burn it, and then scatter [whatever
			remains of] it far and wide over the sea!
Your only deity is God - He save whom there is no deity, [and\n\t\t\twho] embraces all things within His knowledge!"
THUS DO WE relate unto thee some of the stories of what happened\n\t\t\tin the past; and [thus] have We vouchsafed unto thee, out of Our\n\t\t\tgrace, a reminder.<sup class='fn'>85</sup>
All who shall turn away from it will, verily, bear a [heavy]\n\t\t\tburden on the Day of Resurrection:
they will abide in this [state], and grievous for them will be\n\t\t\tthe weight [of that burden] on the Day of Resurrection -
on the Day when the trumpet is blown: for on that Day We will\n\t\t\tassemble all such as had been lost in sin, their eyes\n\t\t\tdimmed<sup class='fn'>86</sup> [by terror],
whispering unto one another, "You have spent but ten [days on\n\t\t\tearth]...."<sup class='fn'>87</sup>
[But] We know best<sup class='fn'>88</sup> what they will be saying when the\n\t\t\tmost perceptive of them shall say, "You have spent [there] but\n\t\t\tone day!"
AND THEY WILL ask thee about [what will happen to] the mountains\n\t\t\t[when this world comes to an end]. Say, then: "My Sustainer will\n\t\t\tscatter them far and wide,
and leave the earth<sup class='fn'>89</sup> level and bare,
[so that] thou wilt see no curve thereon, and no\n\t\t\truggedness."<sup class='fn'>90</sup>

On that Day, all will follow the summoning Voice from which there
			will be no escape;<sup class='fn'>91</sup> and all sounds will be hushed
			before the Most Gracious, and thou wilt hear nothing but a faint
			sough in the air.

On that Day, intercession shall be of no avail [to any] save him\n\t\t\tin whose case the Most Gracious will have granted leave therefor,\n\t\t\tand whose word [of faith] He will have accepted:<sup class='fn'>92</sup>
[for] He knows all that lies open before men and all that is\n\t\t\thidden from them,<sup class='fn'>93</sup> whereas they cannot encompass Him\n\t\t\twith their knowledge.

And [on that Day] all faces will be humbled before the\n\t\t\tEver-Living, the Self-Subsistent Fount of All Being; and undone\n\t\t\tshall be he who bears [a burden of] evildoing<sup class='fn'>94</sup> -

whereas anyone who will have done [whatever he could] of\n\t\t\trighteous deeds, and was a believer withal, need have no fear of\n\t\t\tbeing wronged or deprived [of aught of his me it].<sup class='fn'>95</sup>

AND THUS<sup class='fn'>96</sup> have We bestowed from on high this [divine
			writ] as a discourse in the Arabic tongue,<sup class='fn'>97</sup> and have
			given therein many facets to all manner of warnings, so that men
			might remain conscious of Us, or that it give rise to new
			awareness in them.<sup class='fn'>98</sup>

[Know,] then, [that] God is sublimely exalted, the Ultimate
			Sovereign, the Ultimate Truth:<sup class='fn'>99</sup> and [knowing this,] do
			not approach the Qur'an in haste,<sup class='fn'>100</sup> ere it has been
			revealed unto thee in full, but [always] say: "O my Sustainer,
			cause me to grow in knowledge!<sup class='fn'>101</sup>
AND, INDEED, long ago did We impose Our commandment on\n\t\t\tAdam;<sup class='fn'>102</sup> but he forgot it, and We found no firmness of\n\t\t\tpurpose in him.
For [thus it was:] when We told the angels, "Prostrate yourselves\n\t\t\tbefore Adam!" - they all prostrated themselves, save Iblis, who\n\t\t\trefused [to do it],<sup class='fn'>103</sup>
and thereupon We said: "O Adam! Verily, this is a foe unto thee\n\t\t\tand thy wife: so let him not drive the two of you out of this\n\t\t\tgarden and renderthee unhappy.<sup class='fn'>104</sup>
Behold, it is provided for thee that thou shalt not hunger here\n\t\t\tor feel naked,<sup class='fn'>105</sup>
and that thou shalt not thirst here or suffer from the heat of\n\t\t\tthe sun."
But Satan whispered unto him, saying: "O Adam! Shall I lead thee\n\t\t\tto the tree of life eternal, and [thus] to a kingdom that will\n\t\t\tnever decay?"<sup class='fn'>106</sup>

And so the two ate [of the fruit] thereof: and thereupon they
			became conscious of their nakedness and began to cover themselves
			with pieced-together leaves from the garden. And [thus] did Adam
			disobey his Sustainer, and thus did he fall into grievous
			error.<sup class='fn'>107</sup>
Thereafter, [however,] his Sustainer elected him [for His grace],\n\t\t\tand accepted his repentance, and bestowed His guidance upon him,

saying: "Down with you all<sup class='fn'>108</sup> from this [state of
			innocence, and be henceforth] enemies unto one another! None the
			less, there shall most certainly come unto you guidance from Me:
			and he who follows My guidance will not go astray, and neither
			will he be unhappy.
But as for him who shall turn away from remembering Me - his\n\t\t\tshall be a life of narrow scope;<sup class='fn'>109</sup> and on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection We shall raise him up blind."
[And so, on Resurrection Day, the sinner] will ask: "O my\n\t\t\tSustainer! Why hast Thou raised me up blind, whereas [on earth] I\n\t\t\twas endowed with sight?"
[God] will reply: "Thus it is: there came unto thee Our messages,\n\t\t\tbut thou wert oblivious of them; and thus shalt thou be today\n\t\t\tconsigned to oblivion!"

For, thus shall We recompense him who wastes his own
			self<sup class='fn'>110</sup> and does not believe in his Sustainer's
			messages: and, indeed, the suffering [of such sinners] in the
			life to come shall be most severe and most enduring!

CAN, THEN, they [who reject the truth] learn no lesson by
			recalling how many a generation We have destroyed before their
			time<sup class='fn'>111</sup> - [people] in whose dwelling-places they
			[themselves now] walk about? In this, behold, there are messages
			indeed for those who are endowed with reason!

Now were it not for a decree that has already gone forth from thy
			Sustainer, setting a term<sup class='fn'>112</sup> [for each sinner's
			repentance], it would inescapably follow [that all who sin must
			be doomed at once].<sup class='fn'>113</sup>

Hence, bear with patience whatever they [who deny the truth] may
			say, and extol thy Sustainer's limitless glory and praise Him
			before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and extol
			His glory, too, during some of the hours of the night as well as
			during the hours of the day,<sup class='fn'>114</sup> so that thou might
			attain to happiness.

And never turn shine eyes [with longing] towards whatever
			splendour of this world's life We may have allowed so many
			others<sup class='fn'>115</sup> to enjoy in order that We might test them
			thereby: for the sustenance which by sustainer provides [for
			thee] is better more enduring.<sup class='fn'>116</sup>

And bid thy people to pray, and persevere therein. [But
			remember:] We do not ask thee to provide sustenance [for
			Us]:<sup class='fn'>117</sup> it is We who provide sustenance for thee. And
			the future belongs to the God-conscious.<sup class='fn'>118</sup>

NOW THEY [who are blind to the truth] are wont to say, "If
			[Muhammad] would but produce for us a miracle from his
			Sustainer!"<sup class='fn'>119</sup> [But] has there not come unto them a
			clear evidence [of the truth of this divine writ] in what is [to
			be found] in the earlier scriptures?<sup class='fn'>120</sup>

For [thus it is:] had We destroyed them by means of a
			chastisement ere this [divine writ was revealed], they would
			indeed [be justified to] say [on Judgment Day]: "O our Sustainer!
			If only Thou hadst sent an apostle unto us, we would have
			followed Thy messages rather than be humiliated and disgraced [in
			the hereafter]!"<sup class='fn'>121</sup>

Say: "Everyone is hopefully waiting [for what the future may
			bring]:<sup class='fn'>122</sup> wait, then, [for the Day of Judgment - ] for
			then you will come to know as to who has followed the even path,
			and who has found guidance!"
CLOSER DRAWS unto men their reckoning: and yet they remain\n\t\t\tstubbornly heedless [of its approach].<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Whenever there comes unto them any new reminder from their\n\t\t\tSustainer, they but listen to it with playful\n\t\t\tamusement,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>

their hearts set on passing delights; yet they who are [thus]
			bent on wrongdoing conceal their innermost thoughts<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
			[when they say to one another], "Is this [Muhammad] anything but
			a mortal like yourselves? Will you, then, yield to [his]
			spellbinding eloquence with your eyes open?"<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
Say:<sup class='fn'>5</sup> "My Sustainer knows whatever is spoken in heaven\n\t\t\tand on earth; and He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing."

"Nay," they say, "[Muhammad propounds] the most involved and
			confusing of dreams!"<sup class='fn'>6</sup> - "Nay, but he has invented [all]
			this!" - "Nay, but he is [only] a poet!" - [and,] "Let him, then,
			come unto us with a miracle, just as those [prophets] of old were
			sent [with miracles]!"

Not one of the communities that We destroyed in bygone\n\t\t\ttimes<sup class='fn'>7</sup> would ever believe [their prophets]: will these,\n\t\t\tthen, [be more willing to] believe?<sup class='fn'>8</sup>

For [even] before thy time, [O Muhammad,] We never sent [as Our
			apostles] any but [mortal] men, whom We inspired-hence, [tell the
			deniers of the truth,] "If you do not know this, ask the
			followers of earlier revelation"<sup class='fn'>9</sup> -
and neither did We endow them with bodies that could dispense\n\t\t\twith food,<sup class='fn'>10</sup> nor were they immortal.

In the end, We made good unto them Our promise, and We saved them\n\t\t\tand all whom We willed [to save],<sup class='fn'>11</sup> and We destroyed\n\t\t\tthose who had wasted their own selves.<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
[O MEN!] We have now bestowed upon you from on high a divine writ\n\t\t\tcontaining all that you ought to bear in mind:<sup class='fn'>13</sup> will\n\t\t\tyou not, then, use your reason?
For, how many a community that persisted in evildoing have We\n\t\t\tdashed into fragments, and raised another people in its\n\t\t\tstead!<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
And [every time,] as soon as they began to feel Our punishing\n\t\t\tmight, lo! they tried to flee from it-

[and at the same time they seemed to hear a scornful voice]: "Do
			not try to flee, but return to all that [once] gave you pleasure
			and corrupted your whole being.<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and [return] to your
			homes, so that you might be called to account [for what you have
			done]!"<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
And they could only cry:<sup class='fn'>17</sup> "Oh, woe unto us! Verily, we\n\t\t\twere wrongdoers!"
And that cry of theirs did not cease until We caused them to\n\t\t\tbecome [like] a field mown down, still and silent as ashes.
AND [know that] We have not created the heavens and the earth and\n\t\t\tall that is between them in mere idle play:<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
[for,] had We willed to indulge in a pastime, We would indeed\n\t\t\thave produced it from within Ourselves-if such had been Our will\n\t\t\tat all!<sup class='fn'>19</sup>

Nay, but [by the very act of creation] We hurl the truth against
			falsehood,<sup class='fn'>20</sup> and it crushes the latter: and lo! it
			withers away.<sup class='fn'>21</sup> But woe unto you for all your [attempts
			at] defining [God]<sup class='fn'>22</sup> -

for, unto Him belong all [beings] that are in the heavens and on\n\t\t\tearth, and those that are with Him<sup class='fn'>23</sup> are never too proud\n\t\t\tto worship Him and never grow weary [thereof]:
they extol His limitless glory by night and by day, never\n\t\t\tflagging [therein].

And yet,<sup class='fn'>24</sup> some people choose to worship certain earthly\n\t\t\tthings or beings as deities<sup class='fn'>25</sup> that [are supposed to]\n\t\t\tresurrect [the dead; and they fail to realize that],

had there been in heaven or on earth<sup class='fn'>26</sup> any deities other
			than God, both [those realms] would surely have fallen into
			ruin!But limitless in His glory is God, enthroned in His awesome
			almightiness<sup class='fn'>27</sup> [far] above anything that men may devise
			by way of definition!<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
He cannot be called to account for whatever He does, whereas they\n\t\t\twill be called to account:

and yet,<sup class='fn'>29</sup> they choose to worship [imaginary] deities
			instead of Him!Say [O Prophet]: "Produce an evidence for what you
			are claiming:<sup class='fn'>30</sup> this is a reminder [unceasingly voiced]
			by those who are with me, just as it was a reminder [voiced] by
			those who came before me."<sup class='fn'>31</sup> But nay, most of them do
			not know the truth, and so they stubbornly turn away [from
			it]<sup class='fn'>32</sup>

and [this despite the fact that even] before thy time We never
			sent any apostle without having revealed to him that there is no
			deity save Me, [and that,] therefore, you shall worship Me
			[alone]!

And [yet,] some say, "The Most Gracious has taken unto Himself a
			son"!Limitless is He in His glory!<sup class='fn'>33</sup> Nay, [those whom
			they regard as God's "offspring"<sup class='fn'>34</sup> are but His] honoured
			servants:
they speak not until He has spoken unto them,<sup class='fn'>35</sup> and\n\t\t\t[whenever they act,] they act at His behest.

He knows all that lies open before them and all that is hidden
			from them:<sup class='fn'>36</sup> hence, they cannot in-tercede for any but
			those whom He has [already] graced with His goodly
			acceptance,<sup class='fn'>37</sup> since they themselves stand in reverent
			awe of Him.
And if any of them were to say, "Behold, I am a deity beside Him"\n\t\t\t- that one We should requite with hell: thus do We requite all\n\t\t\t[such] evildoers.

ARE, THEN, they who are bent on denying the truth not aware that
			the heavens and the earth were [once] one single entity, which We
			then parted asunder?<sup class='fn'>38</sup> - and [that] We made out of water
			every living thing? Will they not. then. begin to
			believe?<sup class='fn'>39</sup>

And [are they not aware that] We have set up firm mountains on\n\t\t\tearth, lest it sway with them<sup class='fn'>40</sup> and [that] We have\n\t\t\tappointed thereon broad paths, so that they might find their way,
and [that] We have set up the sky as a canopy\n\t\t\twell-secured?<sup class='fn'>41</sup> And yet, they stubbornly turn away from\n\t\t\t[all] the signs of this [creation],
and [fail to see that] it is He who has created the night and the\n\t\t\tday and the sun and the moon - all of them floating through\n\t\t\tspace!

AND [remind those who deny thee, O Prophet,<sup class='fn'>42</sup> that]
			never have We granted life everlasting to any mortal before
			thee:<sup class='fn'>43</sup> but do they, perchance, hope that al-though thou
			must die, they will live forever?<sup class='fn'>44</sup>
Every human being is bound to taste death; and We test you [all]\n\t\t\tthrough the bad and the good [things of life] by way of trial:\n\t\t\tand unto Us you all must return.<sup class='fn'>45</sup>

But [thus it is:] whenever they who are bent on denying the truth
			consider thee,<sup class='fn'>46</sup> they make thee but a target of their
			mockery, [saying to one another,] "Is this the one who speaks [so
			contemptuously] of your gods?"<sup class='fn'>47</sup> And yet, it is they
			themselves who, at [every] mention of the Most Gracious, are wont
			to deny the truth!<sup class='fn'>48</sup>
Man is a creature of haste;<sup class='fn'>49</sup> [but in time] I shall make\n\t\t\tobvious to you [the truth of] My messages: do not, then, ask Me\n\t\t\tto hasten [it]!<sup class='fn'>50</sup>

But they [who reject My messages are wont to] ask, "When is that\n\t\t\tpromise [of God's judgment] to be fulfilled? [Answer this, O you\n\t\t\twho believe in it,] if you are men of truth!"<sup class='fn'>51</sup>

If they but knew - they who are bent on deny-ing the truth -
			[that there will come] a time when they will not be able to ward
			off the fire from their faces, nor from their backs, and will not
			find any succour!
Nay, but [the Last Hour] will come upon them of a sudden, and\n\t\t\twill stupefy them: and they will be unable to avert it, and\n\t\t\tneither will they be allowed any respite.

And, indeed, [O Muhammad, even] before thy time have [God's]
			apostles been derided - but those who scoffed at them were [in
			the end] overwhelmed by the very thing which they had been wont
			to deride.<sup class='fn'>52</sup>
Say: "Who could protect you, by night or by day, from the Most\n\t\t\tGracious?"<sup class='fn'>53</sup> And yet, from a remembrance of their\n\t\t\tSustainer do they stubbornly turn away!

Do they [really think that they] have deities that could shield
			them from Us? Those [alleged dei-ties] are not [even] able to
			succour themselves: hence, neither can they [who worship them
			hope to] be aided [by them] against Us.

Nay, We have allowed these [sinners] - as [We allowed] their
			forebears - to enjoy the good things of life for a great length
			of time:<sup class='fn'>54</sup> but then - have they never yet seen how We
			visit the earth [with Our punishment], gradually depriving it of
			all that is best thereon?<sup class='fn'>55</sup> Can they, then, [hose tol be
			the winners?
SAY [unto all men]: "I but warn you on the strength of divine\n\t\t\trevelation!"But the deaf [of heart] will not hearken to this\n\t\t\tcall, however often they are warned.<sup class='fn'>56</sup>
And yet, if but a breath of thy Sustainer's chastisement touches\n\t\t\tthem, they are sure to cry, "Oh, woe unto us! Verily, we were\n\t\t\tevildoers!"

But We shall set up just balance-scales on Resurrection Day, and
			no human being shall be wronged in the least: for though there be
			[in him but] the weight of a mustard-seed [of good or evil], We
			shall brin it forth; and none can take count as We do!

AND, INDEED, We vouchsafed unto Moses and Aaron [Our revelation
			as] the standard by which to discern the true from the
			false,<sup class='fn'>57</sup> and as a [guiding] light and a reminder for the
			God-conscious
who stand in awe of their Sustainer although He is beyond the\n\t\t\treach of human perception,<sup class='fn'>58</sup> and who tremble at the\n\t\t\tthought of the Last Hour.
And [like those earler revelations,] this one, too, is a blessed\n\t\t\treminder which We have bestowed from on high: will you, then,\n\t\t\tdisavow it?
AND, INDEED, long before [the time of Moses] We vouchsafed unto\n\t\t\tAbraham his consciousness of what is right;<sup class='fn'>59</sup> and We\n\t\t\twere aware of [what moved] him
when he said unto his father and his people, "What are these\n\t\t\timages to which you are so intensely devoted?"
They answered: "We found our forefathers worshipping them."
Said he: "Indeed, you and your forefathers have obviously gone\n\t\t\tastray!"
They asked: "Hast thou come unto us [with this claim] in all\n\t\t\tearnest-or art thou one of those jesters?"
He answered: "Nay. but your [true] Sustainer is the Sustainer of\n\t\t\tthe heavens and the earth-He who has brought them into being: and\n\t\t\tI am one of those who bear witness to this [truth]!"
And [he added to himself,] "By God, I shall most certainly bring\n\t\t\tabout the downfall of your idols as soon as you have turned your\n\t\t\tbacks and gone away!"
And then he broke those [idols] to pieces, [all] save the biggest\n\t\t\tof them, so that they might [be able to] turn to it.<sup class='fn'>60</sup>
[When they saw what had happened,] they said: "Who has done this\n\t\t\tto our gods? Verily, one of the worst wrongdoers is he!"
Said some [of them]: "We heard a youth speak of these [gods with\n\t\t\tscorn]: he is called Abraham."
[The others] said: "Then bring him before the people's eyes, so\n\t\t\tthat they might bear witness [against him]!"
[And when he came,] they asked: "Hast thou done this to our gods,\n\t\t\tO Abraham?"
He answered: "Nay, it was this one, the biggest of them, that did\n\t\t\tit: but ask them [yourselves] - provided they can speak!"
And so they turned upon one another,<sup class='fn'>61</sup> saying, "Behold,\n\t\t\tit is you who are doing wrong."<sup class='fn'>62</sup>
But then they relapsed into their former way of\n\t\t\tthinking<sup class='fn'>63</sup> and said: "Thou knowest very well that these\n\t\t\t[idols] cannot speak!"
Said [Abraham]: "Do you then worship, instead of God, something\n\t\t\tthat cannot benefit you in any way, nor harm you?
Fie upon you and upon all that you worship instead of God! Will\n\t\t\tyou not, then, use your reason?"
They exclaimed: "Burn him, and [thereby] succour your gods, if\n\t\t\tyou are going to do [anything]!"
[But] We said: "O fire! Be thou cool, and [a source of] inner\n\t\t\tpeace for Abraham!"<sup class='fn'>64</sup> -
and whereas they sought to do evil unto him, We caused them to\n\t\t\tsuffer the greatest loss:<sup class='fn'>65</sup>
for We saved him and Lot, [his brother's son, by guiding them] to\n\t\t\tthe land which We have blessed for all times to come.<sup class='fn'>66</sup>
And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Llsaac s son] Jacob as an\n\t\t\tadditional gift,<sup class='fn'>67</sup> and caused all of them to be\n\t\t\trighteous men,

and made them leaders who would guide [others] in accordance with
			Our behest: for We inspired them [with a will] to do good works,
			and to be constant in prayer, and to dispense charity: and Us
			[alone] did they worship.

AND UNTO Lot, too, We vouchsafed sound judg-ment and knowledge
			[of right and wrong], and saved him from that community which was
			given to deeds of abomination.<sup class='fn'>68</sup> [We destroyed those
			people - for,] verily, they were people lost in evil, depraved -
whereas him We admitted unto Our grace: for, behold, he was among\n\t\t\tthe righteous.

AND [remember] Noah- [how,] when He called out [unto Us], long
			before [the time of Abraham and Lot], We responded to him and
			saved him and his house- hold from that awesome
			calamity;<sup class='fn'>69</sup>
and [how] We succoured him against the people who had given the\n\t\t\tlie to Our messages: verily, they were people lost in evil - and\n\t\t\t[so] We caused them all to drown.

AND [remember] David and Solomon - [how it was] when both of them
			gave judgment concerning the field into which some people's sheep
			had strayed by night and pastured therein, and [how] We bore
			witness to their judgment:<sup class='fn'>70</sup>

for, [though] We made Solomon understand the case [more
			profoundly], yet We vouchsafed unto both of them sound judgment
			and knowledge [of right and wrong].<sup class='fn'>71</sup> And We
			caused<sup class='fn'>72</sup> the mountains to join David in extolling Our
			limitless glory, and likewise the birds:<sup class='fn'>73</sup> for We are
			able to do [all things].

And We taught him how to make garments [of God-consciousness] for\n\t\t\tyou, [O men,] so that they might fortify you against all that may\n\t\t\tcause you fear: but are you erateful Ifor this boonl?<sup class='fn'>74</sup>

And unto Solomon [We made subservient] the stormy wind, so that
			it sped at his behest towar'ds the land which We had
			blessed:<sup class='fn'>75</sup> for it is We who have knowledge of
			everything.

And among the rebel-lious forces [which We made subservient to
			him]<sup class='fn'>76</sup> there were some that dived for him [into the sea]
			and performed other works besides: but it was We who kept watch
			over them.<sup class='fn'>77</sup>
AND [remember] Job, when he cried out to his Sus-tainer,\n\t\t\t"Affliction has befallen me: but Thou art the most merciful of\n\t\t\tthe merciful!"<sup class='fn'>78</sup> -

whereupon We responded unto him and removed all the affliction
			from which he suffered; and We gave him new offspring,<sup class='fn'>79</sup>
			doubling their number as an act of grace from Us. and as a
			reminder unto all who worship Us.

AND [remember] Ishmael and Idris,<sup class='fn'>80</sup> and every one who\n\t\t\t[like them] has pledged himself [unto God]:<sup class='fn'>81</sup> they all\n\t\t\twere among those who are patient in adversity,
and so We admitted them unto Our grace: behold, they were among\n\t\t\tthe righteous!

AND [remember] him of the great fish<sup class='fn'>82</sup> - when he went
			off in wrath, thinking that We had no power over him!<sup class='fn'>83</sup>
			But then he cried out in the deep darkness [of his distress]:
			"There is no deity save Thee! Limitless art Thou in Thy glory!
			Verily, I have done wrong!<sup class='fn'>84</sup>
And so We responded unto him and delivered him from [his]\n\t\t\tdistress: for thus do We deliver all who have faith.

AND [thus did We deliver] Zachariah when he cried out unto his
			Sustainer: "O my Sustainer! Leave me not childless! But [even if
			Thou grant me no bodily heir, I know that] Thou wilt remain when
			all else has ceased to be!"<sup class='fn'>85</sup>

And so We responded unto him, and bestowed upon him the gift of
			John, having made his wife fit to bear him a child:<sup class='fn'>86</sup>
			[and,] verily, these [three] would vie with one another in doing
			good works, and would call unto Us in yearning and awe; and they
			were always humble before Us.

AND [remember] her who guarded her chastity, whereupon We
			breathed into her of Our spirit<sup class='fn'>87</sup> and caused her,
			together with her son, to become a symbol [of Our grace] unto all
			people.<sup class='fn'>88</sup>
VERILY, [O you who believe in Me,] this communIty of yours is one\n\t\t\tsingle community, since I am the Sustainer of you all: worship,\n\t\t\tthen, Me [alone]!<sup class='fn'>89</sup>
But men have torn their unity wide asunder,<sup class='fn'>90</sup>\n\t\t\t[forgetting that] unto Us they all are bound to return.

And yet, whoever does [the least] of righteous deeds and is a\n\t\t\tbeliever withal, his endeavour shall not be disowned: for,\n\t\t\tbehold, We shall record it in his favour.<sup class='fn'>91</sup>

Hence, it has been unfailingly true of<sup class='fn'>92</sup> any community\n\t\t\twhom We have ever destroyed that they [were people who] would\n\t\t\tnever turn back [from their sinful ways]<sup class='fn'>93</sup>
until such a time as Gog and Magog are let loose [upon the world]\n\t\t\tand swarm down from every corner [of the earth],<sup class='fn'>94</sup>

the while the true promise [of resurrection] draws close [to its
			fulfilment].But then, lo! the eyes of those who [in their
			lifetime] were bent on denying the truth will stare in horror,
			[and they will exclaim:] "Oh, woe unto us! We were indeed
			heedless of this [promise of resurrection] - nay, we were [bent
			on] doing evil!"<sup class='fn'>95</sup>
[Then they will be told:] "Verily, you and all that you [were\n\t\t\twont to] worship instead of God are but the fuel of hell: that is\n\t\t\twhat you are destined for.<sup class='fn'>96</sup>
If those [false objects of your worship] had truly been divine,\n\t\t\tthey would not have been destined for it: but [as it is, you] all\n\t\t\tshall abide therein!"
Moaning will be their lot therein, and nothing [else] will they\n\t\t\thear therein.<sup class='fn'>97</sup>
[But,] behold, as for those for whom [the decree of] ultimate\n\t\t\tgood has already gone forth from Us<sup class='fn'>98</sup> - these will be\n\t\t\tkept far away from that [hell]:
no sound thereof will they hear; and they will abide in all that\n\t\t\ttheir souls have ever desired.

The supreme awesomeness [of the Day of Resurrection] will cause
			them no grief, since the angels will receive them with the
			greeting, "This is your Day [of triumph - the Day] which you were
			promised!"

On that Day We shall roll up the skies as written scrolls are
			rolled up; [and] as We brought into being the first creation, so
			We shall bring it forth anew<sup class='fn'>99</sup> - a promise which We have
			willed upon Ourselves: for, behold, We are able to do fall
			things]!

AND, INDEED, after having exhorted [man],<sup class='fn'>100</sup> We laid it\n\t\t\tdown in all the books of divine wisdom that My righteous servants\n\t\t\tshall inherit the earth :<sup class='fn'>101</sup>
herein, behold, there is a message for people who [truly] worship\n\t\t\tGod.
And [thus, O Prophet,] We have sent thee as [an evidence of Our]\n\t\t\tgrace towards all the worlds.<sup class='fn'>102</sup>
Say: "It has but been revealed unto me<sup class='fn'>103</sup> that your God\n\t\t\tis the One and Only God: will you, then, surrender yourselves\n\t\t\tunto Him?"

But if they turn away, say: "I have proclaimed this in equity
			unto all of you alike;<sup class='fn'>104</sup> but I do not know whether that
			[judgment] which you are promised [by God] is near - or far [in
			time].
"Verily, He knows all that is said openly, just as He [alone]\n\t\t\tknows all that you would conceal.
But [as for me,] I do not know whether, perchance, this [delay in\n\t\t\tGod's judgment! is but a trial for you, and a [merciful! respite\n\t\t\tfor a while."<sup class='fn'>105</sup>

Say<sup class='fn'>106</sup> "O my Sustainer! Judge Thou in truth!" - and
			[say]: "Our Sustainer is the Most Gracious, the One whose aid is
			ever to be sought against all your [attempts at] defining
			[Him]!"<sup class='fn'>107</sup>
O MEN! Be conscious of your Sustainer: for, verily, the violent\n\t\t\tconvulsion of the Last Hour will be an awesome thing!

On the Day when you behold it, every woman that feeds a child at
			her breast will utterly forget her nursling, and every woman
			heavy with child will bring forth her burden [before her time];
			and it will seem to thee that all mankind is drunk,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
			although they will not be drunk - but vehement will be [their
			dread of] God's chastisement.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
And yet, among men there is many a one who argues about God\n\t\t\twithout having any knowledge [of Him], and follows every\n\t\t\trebellious satanic force<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
about which it has been decreed that whoever entrusts himself to\n\t\t\tit, him will it lead astray and guide towards the suffering of\n\t\t\tthe blazing flame!

O MEN! If you are in doubt as to the [truth of] resurrection,
			[remember that,] verily, We have created [every one of] you out
			of dust, then out of a drop of sperm, then out of a germ-cell,
			then out of an embryonic lump complete [in itself] and yet
			incomplete,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> so that We might make [your origin] clear
			unto you. And whatever We will [to be born] We cause to rest in
			the [mothers'] wombs for a term set [by Us], and then We bring
			you forth as infants and [allow you to live] so that [some of]
			you might attain to maturity: for among you are such as are
			caused to die [in childhood], just as many a one of you is
			reduced in old age to a most abject state, ceasing to know
			anything of what he once knew so well.<sup class='fn'>5</sup> And [if, O man,
			thou art still in doubt as to resurrection, consider this:] thou
			canst see the earth dry and lifeless - and [suddenly,] when We
			send down waters upon it, it stirs and swells and puts forth
			every kind of lovely plant!
All this [happens] because God alone is the Ultimate\n\t\t\tTruth,<sup class='fn'>6</sup> and because He alone brings the dead to life,\n\t\t\tand because He has the power to will anything.
And [know, O man] that the Last Hour is bound to come, beyond any\n\t\t\tdoubt, and that God will [indeed] resurrect all who are in their\n\t\t\tgraves.
And yet, among men there is many a one that argues about God\n\t\t\twithout having any knowledge [of Him], without any guidance, and\n\t\t\twithout any light-giving revelation -

scornfully turning aside [from the truth] so as to lead [others]
			astray from the path of God. Disgrace [of the spirit] is in store
			for him in this world;<sup class='fn'>7</sup> and on the Day of Resurrection
			We shall make him taste suffering through fire;
[and he shall be told:] "This is an outcome of what thine own\n\t\t\thands have wrought - for, never does God do the least wrong to\n\t\t\tHis creatures!"

And there is, too, among men many a one who worships God on the
			border-line [of faith]:<sup class='fn'>8</sup> thus, if good befalls him, he
			is satisfied with Him; but if a trial assails him, he turns away
			utterly,<sup class='fn'>9</sup> losing [thereby both] this world and the life
			to come: [and] this, indeed, is a loss beyond compare!<sup class='fn'>10</sup>

[By behaving thus,] he invokes, instead of God, something that\n\t\t\tcan neither harm nor benefit him:<sup class='fn'>11</sup> [and] this is indeed\n\t\t\tthe utmost one can go astray.<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
[And sometimes] he invokes [another human being -] one that is\n\t\t\tfar more likely to cause harm than benefit: vile, indeed, is such\n\t\t\ta patron, and vile the follower!<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
VERILY, God will admit those who have attained to faith and have\n\t\t\tdone righteous deeds into gardens through which running waters\n\t\t\tflow: for, behold, God does whatever He wills.

If anyone thinks that God will not succour him<sup class='fn'>14</sup> in this
			world and in the life to come, let him reach out unto heaven by
			any [other] means and [thus try to] make headway:<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and
			then let him see whether this scheme of his will indeed do away
			with the cause of his anguish.<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
And thus have We bestowed from on high this [divine writ] in the\n\t\t\tshape of clear messages: for [thus it is] that God guides him who\n\t\t\twills [to be guided].<sup class='fn'>17</sup>

Verily, as for those who have attained to faith [in this divine
			writ], and those who follow the Jewish faith, and the
			Sabians,<sup class='fn'>18</sup> and the Christians, and the
			Magians,<sup class='fn'>19</sup> [on the one hand,] and those who are bent on
			ascribing divinity to aught but God, [on the other,]<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
			verily, God will decide between them on Resurrection Day: for.
			behold. God is witness unto everything.

ART THOU NOT aware that before God prostrate themselves all
			[things and beings] that are in the heavens and all that are on
			earth<sup class='fn'>21</sup> - the sun, and the moon, and the stars, and the
			mountains, and the trees, and the beasts? And many human beings
			[submit to God con-sciously],<sup class='fn'>22</sup> whereas many [others,
			having defied Him,will inevitably have to suffer [in the life to
			come];<sup class='fn'>23</sup> and he whom God shall scorn [on Resurrection
			Day] will have none who could bestow honour on him: for, verily,
			God does what He wills.

These two contrary kinds of man<sup class='fn'>24</sup> have become engrossed
			in contention about their Sustainer! But [thus it is:] as for
			those who are bent on denying the truth<sup class='fn'>25</sup> - garments of
			fire shall be cut out for them [in the life to come]; burning
			despair<sup class='fn'>26</sup> will be poured over their heads,
causing all that is within their bodies, as well as the skins, to\n\t\t\tmelt away.<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
And they shall be held [in this state as if] by iron\n\t\t\tgrips;<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
and every time they try in their anguish to come out of it, they\n\t\t\tshall be returned thereto and [be told]: "Taste suffering through\n\t\t\tfire [to the full]!"

[As against this,] behold, God will admit those who attain to
			faith and do righteous deeds into gardens through which running
			waters flow, wherein they will be adorned with bracelets of gold
			and pearls, and where silk will be their raiment:<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
for they were [willing to be] guided towards the best of all\n\t\t\ttenets,<sup class='fn'>30</sup> and so they were guided onto the way that\n\t\t\tleads to the One unto whom all praise is due.

BEHOLD, as for those who are bent on denying the truth and bar
			[others] from the path of God<sup class='fn'>31</sup> and from the Inviolable
			House of Worship which We have set up for all people alike -
			[both] those who dwell there and those who come from abroad - and
			all who seek to profane it<sup class='fn'>32</sup> by [deliberate] evildoing:
			[all] such shall We cause to taste grievous suffering [in the
			life to come.]<sup class='fn'>33</sup>

For, when We assigned unto Abraham the site of this
			Temple,<sup class='fn'>34</sup> [We said unto him:] "Do not ascribe divinity
			to aught beside Me!"<sup class='fn'>35</sup> - and: "Purify My Temple for
			those who will walk around it,<sup class='fn'>36</sup> and those who will
			stand before it [in meditation], and those who will bow down and
			prostrate themselves [in prayer]."

Hence, [O Muhammad,] proclaim thou unto all people the [duty of]
			pilgrimage:<sup class='fn'>37</sup> they will come unto thee on foot and on
			every [kind of] fast mount,<sup class='fn'>38</sup> coming from every far-away
			point [on earth],

so that they might experience much that shall be of benefit to
			them,<sup class='fn'>39</sup> and that they might extol the name of God on the
			days appointed [for sacrifice], over whatever heads of cattle He
			may have provided for them<sup class='fn'>40</sup> [to this end]: eat, then,
			thereof, and feed the unfortunate poor.<sup class='fn'>41</sup>

Thereafter let them bring to an end their state of
			self-denial,<sup class='fn'>42</sup> and let them fulfil the vows which they
			[may] have made, and let them walk [once again] around the Most
			Ancient Temple.<sup class='fn'>43</sup>

All this [is ordained by God]; and if one honours God's sacred
			commandments, it will redound to his own good in his Sustainer's
			sight. And all [kinds of] cattle have been made lawful to you
			[for sacrifice and food], save what is mentioned to you [as
			forbidden].<sup class='fn'>44</sup> Shun, then, [all that God has forbidden
			and, most of all,] the loathsome evil of idolatrous beliefs and
			practices;<sup class='fn'>45</sup> and shun every word that is untrue,

[inclining] towards God, [and] turning away from all that is
			false,<sup class='fn'>46</sup> without ascribing divine qualities to aught
			beside Him: for he who ascribes divinity to aught but God is like
			one who is hurtling down from the skies - whereupon the birds
			carry him off, or the wind blows him away onto a far-off place.

This is [to be borne in mind]. And anyone who honours the symbols
			set up by God<sup class='fn'>47</sup> [shall know that,] verily, these
			[symbols derive their value] from the God-consciousness in the
			[believers'] hearts.

In that [God-consciousness] you shall find benefits until a term\n\t\t\tset [by Him is fulfilled],<sup class='fn'>48</sup> and [you shall know that]\n\t\t\tits goal and end is the Most Ancient Temple.<sup class='fn'>49</sup>

And [thus it is:] unto every community [that has ever believed in
			Us] have We appointed [sacrifice as] an act of worship, so that
			they might extol the name of God over whatever heads of cattle He
			may have provided for them [to this end].<sup class='fn'>50</sup> And [always
			bear in mind:] your God is the One and Only God: hence, surrender
			yourselves unto Him. And give thou the glad tiding [of God's
			acceptance] unto all who are humble -

all whose hearts tremble with awe whenever God is mentioned, and
			all who patiently bear whatever ill befalls them, and all who are
			constant in prayer and spend on others out of what We provide for
			them as sustenance.<sup class='fn'>51</sup>

And as for the sacrifice of cattle, We have ordained it for you
			as one of the symbols set up by God,<sup class='fn'>52</sup> in which there is
			[much] good for you. Hence, extol the name of God over them when
			they are lined up [for sacrifice]; and after they have fallen
			lifeless to the ground, eat of their flesh,<sup class='fn'>53</sup> and feed
			the poor who is contented with his lot [and does not beg], as
			well as him who is forced to beg. It is to this end<sup class='fn'>54</sup>
			that We have made them<sup class='fn'>55</sup> subservient to your needs, so
			that you might have cause to be grateful.

[But bear in mind:] never does their flesh reach God, and neither
			their blood: it is only your Godconsciousness that reaches Him.
			It is to this end that We have made them subservient to your
			needs, so that you might glorify God for all the guidance with
			which He has graced you. And give thou this glad tiding unto the
			doers of good:
Verily, God will ward off [all evil] from those who attain to\n\t\t\tfaith; [and,] verily, God does not love anyone who betrays his\n\t\t\ttrust and is bereft of gratitude.<sup class='fn'>56</sup>
PERMISSION [to fight] is given to those against whom war is being\n\t\t\twrongfully waged<sup class='fn'>57</sup> - and, verily, God has indeed the\n\t\t\tpower to succour them -:

those who have been driven from their homelands against all right
			for no other reason than their saying, "Our Sustainer is God!"
			For, if God had not enabled people to defend themselves against
			one another,<sup class='fn'>58</sup> [all] monasteries and churches and
			synagogues and mosques - in [all of] which God's name is
			abundantly extolled - would surely have been destroyed [ere
			now].<sup class='fn'>59</sup> And God will most certainly succour him who
			succours His cause: for, verily, God is most powerful, almighty,

[well aware of] those who, [even] if We firmly establish them on
			earth, remain constant in prayer, and give in charity, and enjoin
			the doing of what is right and forbid the doing of what is wrong;
			but with God rests the final outcome of all events.

AND IF THEY [who are bent on denying the truth] give thee the
			lie, [O Muhammad, remember that, long] before their time, the
			people of Noah and [the tribes of] 'Ad and Thamud gave the lie
			[to their prophets],
as did the people of Abraham, and the people of Lot,

and the dwellers of Madyan; and [so, too,] Moses was given the
			lie [by Pharaoh].<sup class='fn'>60</sup> And [in every case] I gave rein, for
			a while, to the deniers of the truth: but then I took them to
			task - and how awesome was My denial [of them]!

And how many a township have We destroyed because it had been
			immersed in evildoing- and now they [all] lie deserted, with
			their roofs caved in! And how many a well lies abandoned, and how
			many a castle that [once] stood high!

Have they, then, never journeyed about the earth, letting their
			hearts gain wisdom, and causing their ears to hear?<sup class='fn'>61</sup>
			Yet, verily, it is not their eyes that have become blind - but
			blind have become the hearts that are in their breasts!

And [so, O Muhammad,] they challenge thee to hasten the coming
			upon them of [God's] chastisement:<sup class='fn'>62</sup> but God never fails
			to fulfil His promise - and, behold, in thy Sustainer's sight a
			day is like a thousand years of your reckoning.<sup class='fn'>63</sup>
And to how many a community that was im-mersed in evildoing have\n\t\t\tI given rein for a while! But then I took it to task: for with Me\n\t\t\tis all journeys' end!
SAY [O Muhammad]: "O men! I am but a plain warner [sent by God]\n\t\t\tunto you!"
And [know that] those who attain to faith and do righteous deeds\n\t\t\tshall be granted forgiveness of sins and a most excellent\n\t\t\tsustenance;<sup class='fn'>64</sup>
whereas those who strive against Our messages, seeking to defeat\n\t\t\ttheir purpose - they are destined for the blazing fire.

Yet whenever We sent forth any apostle or prophet before thee,
			and he was hoping<sup class='fn'>65</sup> [that his warnings would be heeded],
			Satan would cast an asper-sion on his innermost aims:<sup class='fn'>66</sup>
			but God renders null and void whatever aspersion Satan may cast;
			and God makes His messages clear in and by themselves<sup class='fn'>67</sup>
			- for God is all-knowing, wise.

[And He allows doubts to arise] so that He might cause whatever
			aspersion Satan may cast [against His prophets] to become a trial
			for all in whose hearts is disease<sup class='fn'>68</sup> and all whose
			hearts are hardened: for, verily, all who are [thus] sinning
			[against themselves<sup class='fn'>69</sup> are most deeply in the wrong.

And [God renders Satan's aspersions null and void] so that they
			who are endowed with [innate] knowledge might know that this
			[divine writ] is the truth from thy Sustainer, and that they
			might believe in it, and that their hearts might humbly submit
			unto Him. For, behold, God does guide onto a straight way those
			who have attained to faith -

whereas those who are bent on denying the truth will not cease to
			be in doubt about Him until the Last Hour comes suddenly upon
			them and [supreme] suffering befalls them on a Day void of all
			hope.<sup class='fn'>70</sup>

On that Day, all dominion shall [visibly] belong to God. He shall
			judge [all men and make a distinction] between them: thus, all
			who had attained to faith and did righteous deeds shall find
			themselves in gardens of bliss,
whereas for those who were bent on denying the truth and gave the\n\t\t\tlie to Our messages, there shall be shameful suffering in store.

AND AS FOR those who forsake the domain of evil<sup class='fn'>71</sup> [and
			strive] in God's cause, and then are slain or die - God will most
			certainly provide for them a goodly sustenance [in the life to
			come]: for, verily, God - He alone - is the best of providers;
[and] He will most certainly cause them to enter upon a state [of\n\t\t\tbeing] that shall please them well :<sup class='fn'>72</sup> for, verily, God\n\t\t\tis all-knowing, most forbearing.

Thus shall it be. And as for him who responds to aggression only
			to the extent of the attack levelled against him,<sup class='fn'>73</sup> and
			is thereupon [again] treacherously attacked - God will most
			certainly succour him: for, behold, God is indeed an absolver of
			sins, much-forgiving.<sup class='fn'>74</sup>

Thus it is, because God [is almighty<sup class='fn'>75</sup> - the One who]
			makes the night grow longer by shortening the day, and makes the
			day grow longer by shortening the night; and because God is
			all-hearing, all-seeing.<sup class='fn'>76</sup>
Thus it is, because God alone is the Ultimate Truth,<sup class='fn'>77</sup>\n\t\t\tso that all that men invoke beside Him is sheer falsehood, and\n\t\t\tbecause God alone is exalted, great!
Art thou not aware that it is God who sends down water from the\n\t\t\tskies, whereupon the earth becomes green? Verily, God is\n\t\t\tunfathomable [in His wisdom] all-aware.<sup class='fn'>78</sup>
Unto Him belongs all that is in the heavens and al that is on\n\t\t\tearth; and, verily, God - He alone - is self sufficient, the One\n\t\t\tto whom all praise is due.

Art thou not aware that it is God who has made subservient to you
			all that is on earth,<sup class='fn'>79</sup> and the ships that sail through
			the sea at His behest - and [that it is He who] holds the
			celestial bodies<sup class='fn'>80</sup> [in their orbits], so that they may
			not fall upon the earth otherwise than by His leave?<sup class='fn'>81</sup>
			Verily, God is most compassionate towards men, a dispenser of
			grace -
seeing that it is He who gave you life, and then will cause you\n\t\t\tto die, and then will bring you back to life: [but,] verily,\n\t\t\tbereft of all eratitude is man!

UNTO every community have We appointed [different] ways of
			worship,<sup class='fn'>82</sup> which they ought to observe. Hence, [O
			believer,] do not let those [who follow ways other than shine]
			draw thee into disputes on this score,<sup class='fn'>83</sup> but summon
			[them all] unto thy Sustainer: for, behold, thou art indeed on
			the right way.
And if they [try to] argue with thee, say [only]: "God knows best\n\t\t\twhat you are doing."<sup class='fn'>84</sup>
[For, indeed,] God will judge between you [all] on Resurrection\n\t\t\tDay with regard to all on which you werebwont to\n\t\t\tdiffer.<sup class='fn'>85</sup>
Dost thou not know that God knows all that occurs in heaven as\n\t\t\twell as on earth? All this, behold, is in [God's] record: verily,\n\t\t\t[to know] all this is easy for God.

And yet,<sup class='fn'>86</sup> they [who claim to believe in Him often]
			worship [other beings or forces] beside God- something for which
			He has never bestowed any warrant from on high,<sup class='fn'>87</sup> and
			[of the reality] whereof they cannot have any
			knowledge:<sup class='fn'>88</sup> and such evildoers shall have none to
			succour them [on Judgment Day].

As it is, whenever Our messages are conveyed unto them in all
			their clarity, thou canst perceive utter repugnance on the faces
			of those who are bent on denying the truth: they would almost
			assault those who convey Our messages unto them! Say: "Shall I,
			then, tell you of something worse than what you feel at
			present?<sup class='fn'>89</sup> It is the fire [of the hereafter] that God
			has promised to those who are bent on denying the truth: and how
			vile a journey's end!"

O MEN! A parable is set forth [herewith]; hearken, then, to it!
			Behold, those beings whom you invoke instead of God cannot create
			[as much as] a fly, even were they to join all their forces to
			that end! And if a fly robs them of anything, they cannot [even]
			rescue it from him! Weak indeed is the seeker, and [weak] the
			sought!
No true understanding of God have they [who err in this way]:\n\t\t\tfor, verily, God is most powerful, almighty!
[In His almightiness,] God chooses message-bearers from among the\n\t\t\tangels as well as from among men. But, behold, God [alone] is\n\t\t\tall-hearing, all-see-ing:<sup class='fn'>90</sup>
[whereas their knowledge is limited,] He knows all that lies open\n\t\t\tbefore them and all that is hidden from them<sup class='fn'>91</sup> - for all\n\t\t\tthings go back to God [as their source].
O YOU who have attained to faith! Bow down and prostrate\n\t\t\tyourselves, and worship your Sustainer [alone], and do good, so\n\t\t\tthat you might attain to a happy state!

And strive hard in God's cause with all the striving that is due
			to Him: it is He who has elected you [to carry His message], and
			has laid no hardship on you in [anything that pertains to]
			religion,<sup class='fn'>92</sup> [and made you follow] the creed of your
			forefather Abraham.<sup class='fn'>93</sup> It is He who has named you - in
			bygone times as well as in this [divine writ] - "those who have
			surrendered themselves to God",<sup class='fn'>94</sup> so that the Apostle
			might bear witness to the truth before you, and that you might
			bear witness to it before all mankind. Thus, be constant in
			prayer, and render the purifying dues, and hold fast unto God. He
			is your Lord Supreme: and how excellent is this Lord Supreme, and
			how excellent this Giver of Succour!
TRULY, to a happy state shall the believers:
those who humble themselves in their prayer,
and who turn away from all that is frivolous,
and who are intent on inner purity;<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and who are mindful of their chastity,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>

[not giving way to their desires] with any but their spouses -\n\t\t\tthat is, those whom they rightfully possess [through wedlock] -\n\t\t\t:<sup class='fn'>3</sup> for then, behold, they are free of all blame,
whereas such as seek to go beyond that [limit] are truly\n\t\t\ttransgressors;
and who are faithful to their trusts and to their pledges,
and who guard their prayers [from all worldly intent].
It is they, they who shall be the inheritors
that will inherit the paradise; [and] therein shall they abide.
NOW, INDEED, We create man out of the essence of clay,<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and then We cause him to remain as a drop of sperm in [the\n\t\t\twomb's] firm keeping,

and then We create out of the drop of sperm a germ-cell, and then
			We create out of the germ-cell an embryonic lump, and then We
			create within the embryonic lump bones, and then We clothe the
			bones with flesh - and then We bring [all] this into being as a
			new creation:<sup class='fn'>5</sup> hallowed, therefore, is God, the best of
			artisans!<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
And then, behold! after all this, you are destined to die;
and then, behold! you shall be raised from the dead on\n\t\t\tResurrection Day.
And, indeed, We have created above you seven [celestial]\n\t\t\torbits;<sup class='fn'>7</sup> and never are We unmindful of [any aspect of\n\t\t\tOur] creation.

And We send down water from the skies in accordance with a
			measure [set by Us], and then We cause it to lodge in the earth:
			but, behold, We are most certainly able to withdraw this
			[blessing]!
And by means of this [water] We bring forth for you gardens of\n\t\t\tdate-palms and vines, wherein you have fruit abundant and whereof\n\t\t\tyou eat,
as well as a tree that issues from [the lands adjoining] Mount\n\t\t\tSinai,<sup class='fn'>8</sup> yielding oil and relish for all to eat.

And, behold, in the cattle [too] there is indeed a lesson for
			you: We give you to drink of that [milk] which is within their
			bellies; and you derive many [other] uses from them: for, you eat
			of their flesh,<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
and by them - as by the ships [over the sea] - you are borne\n\t\t\t[overland].

AND, INDEED, We sent forth Noah unto his people,<sup class='fn'>10</sup> and\n\t\t\the said: "O my people! Worship God [alone]: you have no deity\n\t\t\tother than Him. Will you not, then, become conscious of Him?"

But the great ones among his people, who refused to acknowledge
			the truth, replied: "This [man] is nothing but a mortal like
			yourselves who wants to make himself superior to you! For, if God
			had willed [to convey a message unto us], He would surely have
			sent down angels; [moreover,] we have never heard [any-thing
			like] this from our forebears of old!<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
He is nothing but a madman: so bear with him for a while."
Said [Noah]: "O my Sustainer! Succour me against their accusation\n\t\t\tof Iying!"

Thereupon We inspired him thus: "Build, un-der Our
			eyes<sup class='fn'>12</sup> and according to Our inspiration, the ark [that
			shall save thee and those who follow thee].<sup class='fn'>13</sup> And when
			Our judgment comes to pass, and waters gush forth in torrents
			over the face of the earth, place on board of this [ark] one pair
			of each [kind of animal] of either sex, as well as thy family -
			excepting those on whom sentence has already been passed-; and do
			not appeal to Me [any more] in behalf of those who are bent on
			evildoing - for, behold, they are destined to be drowned!
"And as soon as thou and those who are with thee are settled in\n\t\t\tthe ark, say: 'All praise is due to God, who has saved us from\n\t\t\tthose evildoing folk!'

"And say: 'O my Sustainer! Cause me to reach a destination\n\t\t\tblessed [by Thee] <sup class='fn'>14</sup> -for Thou art the best to show man\n\t\t\thow to reach his [true] destination!<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
In this [story], behold, there are messages indeed [for those who\n\t\t\tthink]: for, verily, We always out Imanl to a test.
AND AFTER those [people of old] We gave rise to new\n\t\t\tgenerations;<sup class='fn'>16</sup>

and [every time] We sent unto them an apostle from among
			themselves, [he told them:] "Worship God [alone]: you have no
			deity other than Him. Will you not, then, become conscious of
			Him?"<sup class='fn'>17</sup>

And [every time] the great ones among his people, who refused to
			acknowledge the truth and gave the lie to the announcement of a
			life to come-[simply] because We had granted them ease and plenty
			in [their] worldly life, and they had become corrupted by
			it<sup class='fn'>18</sup> - [every time] they would say: "This [man] is
			nothing but a mortal like yourselves, eating of what you eat, and
			drinking of what you drink:
and, indeed, if you pay heed to a mortal like your-selves, you\n\t\t\twill surely be the losers!
Does he promise you that, after you have died and become [mere]\n\t\t\tdust and bones, you shall be brought forth [to a new life]?
Far-fetched, far-fetched indeed is what you are promised!
There is no life beyond our life in this world: we die and we\n\t\t\tlive [but once], and we shall never be raised from the dead!
He is nothing but a man who attributes his own lying inventions\n\t\t\tto God, and we are not going to believe him!"
[Whereupon the prophet] would say: "O my Sustainer! Succour me\n\t\t\tagainst their accusation of lying!
[And God] would say: "After a little while they will surely be\n\t\t\tsmitten with remorse!"<sup class='fn'>19</sup>

And then the blast [of Our punishment] over-took them, justly and
			unavoidably,<sup class='fn'>20</sup> and We caused them to become as the
			flotsam of dead leaves and the scum borne on the surface of a
			torrent: and so - away with those evildoing folk!
AND AFTER them We gave rise to new genera-tions:<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
[for,] no community can ever forestall [the end of] its term -\n\t\t\tand neither can they delay [its coming].<sup class='fn'>22</sup>

And We sent forth Our apostles, one after another: [and] every
			time their apostle came to a community, they gave him the lie:
			and so We caused them to follow one another [into the grave], and
			let them become [mere] tales: and so - away with the folk who,
			would not believe!
AND THEN We sent forth Moses and his brother Aaron with Our\n\t\t\tmessages and a manifest authority [from Us]
unto Pharaoh and his great ones;<sup class='fn'>23</sup> but these behaved\n\t\t\twith arrogance, for they were people wont to glorify [only]\n\t\t\tthemselves.
And so they said: "Shall we believe [them-] two mortals like\n\t\t\tourselves - although their people are our slaves?"
Thus, they gave the lie to those two, and earned [thereby] their\n\t\t\tplace among the doomed:<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
for. indeed. We had vouchsafed revelation unto Moses in order\n\t\t\tthat they might find the right way.

And [as We exalted Moses, so, too,] We made the son of Mary and
			his mother a symbol [of Our grace],<sup class='fn'>25</sup> and provided for
			both an abode in a lofty mace of lasting restfulness and
			unsullied springs,<sup class='fn'>26</sup>
O YOU APOSTLES! Partake of the good things of life,<sup class='fn'>27</sup>\n\t\t\tand do righteous deeds: verily, I have full knowledge of all that\n\t\t\tyou do.
And, verily, this community of yours is one single community,\n\t\t\tsince I am the Sustainer of you all: remain, then, conscious of\n\t\t\tMe!<sup class='fn'>28</sup>

But they [who claim to follow you] have torn their unity wide\n\t\t\tasunder,<sup class='fn'>29</sup> piece by piece, each group delighting in\n\t\t\t[but] what they themselves possess [by way of tenets].<sup class='fn'>30</sup>
But leave them alone, lost in their ignorance, until a [future]\n\t\t\ttime.<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
Do they think that by all the wealth and offspring with which We\n\t\t\tprovide them
We [but want to] make them vie with one another in doing [what\n\t\t\tthey consider] good works?<sup class='fn'>32</sup> Nay, but they do not\n\t\t\tperceive [their error]!
Verily, [only] they who stand in reverent awe of their Sustainer,
and who believe in their Sustainer's messages,
and who do not ascribe divinity to aught but their Sustainer,
and who give whatever they [have to] give<sup class='fn'>33</sup> with their\n\t\t\thearts trembling at the
it is they who vie with one another in doing good works, and it\n\t\t\tis they who outrun [all others] in attaining to them!

And [withal,] We do not burden any human being with more than he\n\t\t\tis well able to bear: for with Us is a record that speaks the\n\t\t\ttruth [about what men do and can dol; and none shall be wronged.

NAY, [as for those who have torn asunder the unity of faith-]
			their hearts are lost in ignorance of all this!<sup class='fn'>34</sup> But
			apart from that [breach of unity] they have [on their conscience
			even worse] deeds;<sup class='fn'>35</sup> and they will [continue to] commit
			them

until - after We shall have taken to task, through suffering,\n\t\t\tthose from among them who [now] are lost in the pursuit of\n\t\t\tpleasures<sup class='fn'>36</sup> - they cry out in [belated] supplication.
[But they will be told:] "Cry not in supplication today: for,\n\t\t\tbehold, you shall not be succoured by Us!
Time and again<sup class='fn'>37</sup> were My messages conveyed unto you, but\n\t\t\t[every time] you would turn about on your heels
[and,] impelled by your arrogance, you would talk senselessly far\n\t\t\tinto the night."<sup class='fn'>38</sup>
Have they, then, never tried to understand this word [of God]? Or\n\t\t\thas there [now] come to them something that never came to their\n\t\t\tforefathers of old?<sup class='fn'>39</sup>
Or is it, perchance, that they have not recognized their Apostle,\n\t\t\tand so they disavow him?
Or do they say, "There is madness in him"? Nay, he has brought\n\t\t\tthem the truth - and the truth do most of them detest!<sup class='fn'>40</sup>

But if the truth<sup class='fn'>41</sup> were in accord with their own likes
			and dislikes, the heavens and the earth would surely have fallen
			into ruin, and all that lives in them [would long ago have
			perished]!<sup class='fn'>42</sup> Nay, [in this divine writ] We have conveyed
			unto them all that they ought to bear in mind:<sup class='fn'>43</sup> and
			from this their reminder they [heedlessly] turn away!

Or cost thou [O Muhammad] ask of them any worldly recompense? But\n\t\t\t[they ought to know that] a recompense from thy Sustainer is\n\t\t\tbest, since He is the best of nroviders!<sup class='fn'>44</sup>
And, verily, thou callest them onto a straight way-
but, behold, those who will not believe in the life to come are\n\t\t\tbound to deviate from that way.

And even were We to show them mercy and remove whatever distress
			might befall them [in this life],<sup class='fn'>45</sup> they would still
			persist in their overweening arrogance, blindly stumbling to and
			fro.
And, indeed, We tested them<sup class='fn'>46</sup> through suffering, but\n\t\t\tthey did not abase themselves before their Sustainer; and they\n\t\t\twill never humble themselves
until We open before them a gate of [truly] severe suffering [in\n\t\t\tthe life to come]: and then, lo! they will be broken in\n\t\t\tspirit<sup class='fn'>47</sup>
[O MEN! Pay heed to God's messages,] for it is He who has endowed\n\t\t\tyou with hearing, and sight, and minds: [yet] how seldom are you\n\t\t\tgrateful!
And He it is who has caused you to multiply on earth; and unto\n\t\t\tHim you shall be gathered.
And He it is who grants life and deals death; and to Him is due\n\t\t\tthe alternation of night and day. Will you not, then, use your\n\t\t\treason?
But nay, they speak as the people of olden times did speak:
they say: "What! After we have died and become mere dust and\n\t\t\tbones, shall we, forsooth, be raised from the dead?
Indeed, this [very thing] we have been promised - we and our\n\t\t\tforefathers-long ago! This is nothing but fables of ancient\n\t\t\ttimes!"
Say: "Unto whom belongs the earth and all that lives\n\t\t\tthereon?<sup class='fn'>48</sup> [Tell me this] if you happen to know [the\n\t\t\tanswer]!"
[And] they will reply: "Unto God.Say: "Will you not, then,\n\t\t\tbethink yourselves [of Him]?"
Say: "Who is it that sustains the seven heavens and is enthroned\n\t\t\tin His awesome almightiness?"<sup class='fn'>49</sup>
[And] they will reply: "[All this power belongs] to God. Say:\n\t\t\t"Will you not, then, remain conscious of Him?"

Say: "In whose hand rests the mighty dominion over all things,\n\t\t\tand who is it that protects, the while there is no protection\n\t\t\tagainst Him? [Tell me this] if you happen to know [the answer]!"
[And] they will reply: "[All this power belongs] to God."Say:\n\t\t\t"How, then, can you be so deluded?"<sup class='fn'>50</sup>
Nay, We have conveyed unto them the truth: and yet, behold, they\n\t\t\tare intent on Iying [to them-selves]!<sup class='fn'>51</sup>

Never did God take unto Himself any offspring,<sup class='fn'>52</sup> nor has
			there ever been any deity side by side with Him: [for, had there
			been any,] lo! each deity would surely have stood apart [from the
			others] in whatever it had created,<sup class='fn'>53</sup> and they would
			surely have [tried to] overcome one another! Limitless in His
			glory is God, [far] above anything that men may devise by way of
			definition.<sup class='fn'>54</sup>

knowing all that is beyond the reach of a created being's
			perception as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature's
			senses or mind<sup class='fn'>55</sup> - and, hence, sublimely exalted is He
			above anything to which they may ascribe a share in His divinity!
SAY: "O my Sustainer! If it be Thy will to let me\n\t\t\twitness<sup class='fn'>56</sup> [the fulfilment of] whatever they [who\n\t\t\tblaspheme against Thee] have been promised [to suffer] -
do not, O my Sustainer, let me be one of those evildoing folk!"
[Pray thus-] for, behold, We are most certainly able to let thee\n\t\t\twitness [the fulfilment, even in this world, of] whatever We\n\t\t\tpromise them!
