[But whatever they may say or do,] repel the evil [which they\n\t\t\tcommit] with something that is better:<sup class='fn'>57</sup> We are fully\n\t\t\taware of what they attribute [to Us].
And say: "O my Sustainer! I seek refuge with Thee from the\n\t\t\tpromptings of all evil impulses;<sup class='fn'>58</sup>
and I seek refuge with Thee, O my Sustainer, lest they come near\n\t\t\tunto me!"

[AS FOR THOSE who will not believe in the life to come, they go
			on lying to themselves<sup class='fn'>59</sup> ] until, when death approaches
			any of them, he prays: "O my Sustainer! Let me return, let me
			return<sup class='fn'>60</sup> [to life],

so that I might act righteously in whatever I have failed
			[aforetime]!"<sup class='fn'>61</sup> Nay, it is indeed but a [meaningless]
			word that he utters: for behind those [who leave the world] there
			is a barrier [of death] until the Day when all will be raised
			from the dead!
Then, when the trumpet [of resurrection] is blown, no ties of\n\t\t\tkinship will on that Day prevail among them, and neither will\n\t\t\tthey ask about one another.
And they whose weight [of righteousness] is heavy in the balance\n\t\t\t- it is they, they who will have attained to a happy state,
whereas they whose weight is light in the balance - it is they\n\t\t\twho will have squandered their own selves, [destined] to abide in\n\t\t\thell:
the fire will scorch their faces, and they will abide therein\n\t\t\twith their lips distorted in pain.
[And God will say:] "Were not My messages conveyed unto you,and\n\t\t\twere [not] wont give the the lie?"
They will exclaim: "O our Sustainer! Our bad luck has overwhelmed\n\t\t\tus, and so we went as ray!<sup class='fn'>62</sup>
O our Sustainer! Cause us to come out of this [suffering]-and\n\t\t\tthen, if ever We revert [to sinning], may we truly be [deemed]\n\t\t\tevildoers!"
[But] He will say: "Away with you into this\n\t\t\t[ignominy]!<sup class='fn'>63</sup> And speak no more unto Me!

"Behold, there were among My servants such as would pray, 'O our
			Sustainer! We have come to believe [in Thee]; forgive, then, our
			sins and bestow Thy mercy on us: for Thou art the truest bestower
			of mercy!'<sup class='fn'>64</sup>
- but you made them a target of your derision to the point where\n\t\t\tit made you forget<sup class='fn'>65</sup> all remembrance of Me; and you went\n\t\t\ton and on laughing at them.
[But,] behold, today I have rewarded them for their patience in\n\t\t\tadversity: verily, it is they, they who have achieved a triumph!"
[And] He will ask [the doomed]: "What number of years have you\n\t\t\tspent on earth?"
They will answer: "We have spent there a day, or part of a day;\n\t\t\tbut ask those who [are able to]count [time] . "<sup class='fn'>66</sup>
[Whereupon] He will say: "You have spent there but a short while:\n\t\t\thad you but known [how short it was to be]!
Did you, then, think that We created you in mere idle play, and\n\t\t\tthat you would not have to return to Us?"<sup class='fn'>67</sup>

KNOW, then. [thatl God is sublimely exalted. the Ultimate
			Sovereign, the Ultimate Truth:<sup class='fn'>68</sup> there is no deity save
			Him, the Sustainer, in bountiful almightiness
			enthroned!<sup class='fn'>69</sup>

Hence, he who invokes, side by side with God, any other deity [ -
			a deity] for whose existence he has no evidence - shall but find
			his reckoning with his Sustainer: [and,] verily, such deniers of
			the truth will never attain to a happy state!
Hence, [O believer,] say: "O my Sustainer! Grant [me] forgiveness\n\t\t\tand bestow Thy mercy [upon mel: for Thou art the truest bestower\n\t\t\tof mercy!"

A SURAH [is this] which We have bestowed from on high, and which
			We have laid down in plain terms;<sup class='fn'>1</sup> and in it have We
			bestowed from on high messages which are clear [in themselves],
			so that you might keep [them] in mind.

AS FOR the adulteress and the adulterer<sup class='fn'>2</sup> - flog each of
			them with a hundred stripes, and let not com-passion with them
			keep you from [carrying out] this law of God, if you [truly]
			believe in God and the Last Day; and let a group of the believers
			witness their chastisement<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

[Both are equally guilty:] the adulterer couples with none other
			than an adulteress - that is, a woman who accords [to her own
			lust] a place side by side with God;<sup class='fn'>4</sup> and with the
			adulteress couples none other than an adulterer-that is, a man
			who accords [to his own lust] a place side by side with God: and
			this is forbidden unto the believers.<sup class='fn'>5</sup>

And as for those who accuse chaste women [of adultery],<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
			and then are unable to produce four wit-nesses [in support of
			their accusation], flog them with eiphty stripes;<sup class='fn'>7</sup> and
			ever after refuse to accept from them any testimony-since it is
			they, they that are truly depraved"-
excepting [from this interdict] only those who afterwards repent\n\t\t\tand made amends:<sup class='fn'>8</sup> for, behold, God is much-forgiving, a\n\t\t\tdispenser of grace.

And as for those who accuse their own wives [of adultery], but
			have no witnesses except them-selves, let each of these
			[accusers] call God four times to witness<sup class='fn'>9</sup> that he is
			indeed telling the truth,
and the fifth time, that God's curse be upon him if he is telling\n\t\t\ta lie.
But [as for the wife, all] chastisement shall be averted from her\n\t\t\tby her calling God four times to witness that he is indeed\n\t\t\ttelling a lie,
and the fifth [time], that God's curse be upon her if he is\n\t\t\ttelling the truth.<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
AND WERE it not for God's favour upon you, [O man,] and His\n\t\t\tgrace, and that God is a wise acceptor of repentance . . .\n\t\t\t!<sup class='fn'>11</sup>

Verily, numerous among you are those who would falsely accuse
			others of unchastity:<sup class='fn'>12</sup> [but, O you who are thus
			wronged,] deem it not a bad thing for you: nay, it is good for
			you!<sup class='fn'>13</sup> [As for the slanderers,] unto every one of them
			[will be accounted] all that he has earned by [thus] sinning; and
			awesome suffering awaits any of them who takes it upon himself to
			enhance this [sin]!<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
Why do not the believing men and women, whenever such [a rumour]\n\t\t\tis heard,<sup class='fn'>15</sup> think the best of one another and say, "This\n\t\t\tis an obvious falsehood"?

Why do they not [demand of the accusers<sup class='fn'>16</sup> that they]
			produce four witnesses to prove their allegation?<sup class='fn'>17</sup> -
			for, if they do not produce such wit-nesses, it is those
			[accusers] who, in the sight of God, are liars indeed!

And were it not for God's favour upon you, [O men,] and His grace
			in this world and in the life to come, awesome suffering would
			indeed have afflicted you<sup class='fn'>18</sup> in result of all [the
			calumny] in which you indulge

when you take it up with your tongues, uttering with your mouths\n\t\t\tsomething of which you have no knowledge, and deeming it a light\n\t\t\tmatter whereas in the sight of God it is an awful thing!

And [once again]: Why do you not say, whenever you hear such [a\n\t\t\trumour], "It does not behove us to speak of this, O Thou who art\n\t\t\tlimitless in Thy glory: this is an awesome calumny"?<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
God admonishes you [hereby] lest you ever revert to the like of\n\t\t\tthis Isinl. if you are [truly] believers;
for God makes [His] messages clear unto you-and God is all\n\t\t\tknowing, wise!

Verily, as for those who like [to hear] foul slander<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
			spreadagainst [any of] those who have attained to faith-grievous
			suffering awaits them in this world <sup class='fn'>21</sup> and in the life
			to come: for God knows [the full truth], whereas you know [it]
			not.<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
And were it not for God's favour upon you and His grace, and that\n\t\t\tGod is compasionate, a dispenser of grace...!<sup class='fn'>23</sup>

O YOU who have attained to faith! Follow not Satan's footsteps:
			for he who follows Satan's footsteps [will find that], behold, he
			enjoins but deeds of abomination and all that runs counter to
			reason.<sup class='fn'>24</sup> And were it not for God's favour upon you and
			His grace, not one of you would ever have remained pure. For
			[thus it is:] it is God who causes whomever He wills to grow in
			purity: for God is all-hearing, all-knowing.

Hence, [even if they have been wronged by slander,] let not those
			of you who have been graced with [God's] favour and ease of life
			ever become remiss in helping<sup class='fn'>25</sup> [the erring ones among]
			their near of kin, and the needy, and those who have forsaken the
			domain of evil for the sake of God,<sup class='fn'>26</sup> but let them
			pardon and forbear. [For,] do you not desire that God should
			forgive you your sins, seeing that God is much-forgiving, a
			dispenser of grace?<sup class='fn'>27</sup>

[But,] verily, those who [falsely, and without
			repentance,<sup class='fn'>28</sup> ] accuse chaste women who may have been
			unthinkingly careless but have remained true to their
			faith,<sup class='fn'>29</sup> shall be rejected [from God's grace] in this
			world as well as in the life to come: and awesome suffering
			awaits them
on the Day when their own tongues and hands and feet will bear\n\t\t\twitness against them by [recalling] all that they did!

On that day will God pay them in full their just due, and they
			will come to know that God alone is the Ultimate Truth, manifest,
			and manifesting [the true nature of all that has ever been
			done].<sup class='fn'>30</sup>

[In the nature of things,] corrupt women are for corrupt men, and
			corrupt men, for corrupt women - just as good women are for good
			men, and good men, for good women. [Since God is aware that]
			these are innocent of all that evil tongues may impute to
			them,<sup class='fn'>31</sup> forgiveness of sins shall be theirs, and a mr`~t
			excellent cilstenance!<sup class='fn'>32</sup>

O YOU who have attained to faith! Do not enter houses other than
			your own unless you have obtained permission and greeted their
			inmates. This is [enjoyed by you] for your own good, so that you
			might bear [your mutual rights] in mind.<sup class='fn'>33</sup>

Hence, [even] if you find no one within [the house], do not enter
			it until you are given leave;<sup class='fn'>34</sup> and if you are told,
			"Turn back," then turn back. This will be most conducive to your
			purity; and God has full knowledge of all that you do.

[On the other hand,] you will incur no sin if you [freely] enter
			houses not intended for living in but serving a purpose useful to
			you:<sup class='fn'>35</sup> but [always remember that] God knows all that you
			do openly, and all that you would conceal.

TELL the believing men to lower their gaze and to be mindful of\n\t\t\ttheir chastity:<sup class='fn'>36</sup> this will be most con-ducive to their\n\t\t\tpurity- [and,] verily, God is aware of all that they do.

And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and to be
			mindful of their chastity, and not to display their charms [in
			public] beyond what may [decently] be apparent
			thereof;<sup class='fn'>37</sup> hence, let them draw their head-coverings
			over their bosoms.<sup class='fn'>38</sup> And let them not display [more of]
			their charms to any but their husbands, or their fathers, or
			their husbands' fathers, or their sons, or their husbands' sons,
			or their brothers, or their brothers' sons, or their sisters'
			sons, or their womenfolk, or those whom they rightfully possess,
			or such male attendants as are beyond all sexual
			desire,<sup class='fn'>39</sup> or children that are as yet unaware of women's
			nakedness; and let them not swing their legs [in walking] so as
			to draw attention to their hidden charms.<sup class='fn'>40</sup> And
			[always], O you believers-all of you-turn unto God in repentance,
			so that you might attainto a happy state!<sup class='fn'>41</sup>

AND [you ought to] marry the single from among you<sup class='fn'>42</sup> as
			well as such of your male and female slaves as are fit [for
			marriage].<sup class='fn'>43</sup> If they [whom you intend to marry] are
			poor, [let this not deter you;] God will grant them sufficiency
			out of His bounty - for God is infinite [in His mercy],
			all-knowing.

And as for those who are unable to marry,<sup class='fn'>44</sup> let them
			live in continence until God grants them sufficiency out of his
			bounty. And ay of one those whom you rightfully
			possess<sup class='fn'>45</sup> desire [to obtain] a deed of freedom, write it
			out for them if you are awareof any good in them:<sup class='fn'>46</sup> and
			give them [their share] of the wealth of God which He has given
			you.<sup class='fn'>47</sup> And do not, in order to gain<sup class='fn'>48</sup> some of
			the fleeting pleasures of this worldly life, coerce your [slave]
			maidens into whoredom if they happen to be desirous of
			marriage;<sup class='fn'>49</sup> and if anyone should coerce them, then,
			verily, after they have been compelled [to submit in their
			helplessness], God will be much-forgiving. a dispenser of grace!

AND, INDEED, from on high have We bestowed upon you messages
			clearly showing the truth, and [many] a lesson from [the stories
			of] those who have passed away before you, and [many] an
			admonition to the God conscious

God is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The parable of His
			light is, as it were,<sup class='fn'>50</sup> that of a niche containing a
			lamp; the lamp is [enclosed] in glass, the glass [shining] like a
			radiant star:<sup class='fn'>51</sup> [a lamp] lit from a blessed tree -an
			olive-tree that is neither of the east nor of the west<sup class='fn'>52</sup>
			- the oil whereof [is so bright that it] would well-nigh give
			light [of itself] even though fire had not touched it: light upon
			light!<sup class='fn'>53</sup> God guides unto His light him that wills [to be
			guided];<sup class='fn'>54</sup> and [to this end] God propounds parables unto
			men, since God [alone] has full knowledge of all
			things.<sup class='fn'>55</sup>

IN THE HOUSES [of worship] which God has allowed to be raised so\n\t\t\tthat His name be remembered in them,<sup class='fn'>56</sup> there [are such\n\t\t\tas] extol His limitless glory at morn and evening-

people whom neither [worldly] commerce nor striving after
			gain<sup class='fn'>57</sup> can divert from the remembrance of God, and from
			con-stancy in prayer, and from charity:<sup class='fn'>58</sup> [people] who
			are filled with fear [at the thought] of the Day on which all
			hearts and eyes will be convulsed,

[and who only hope] that God may reward them in accordance with
			the best that they ever did, and give them, out of His bounty,
			more [than they deserve]: for, God grants sustenance unto whom He
			wills, beyond all reckon-ing.

But as for those who are bent on denying the truth, their [good]
			deeds are like a mirage in the desert, which the thirsty supposes
			to be water - until, when he approaches it, he finds that it was
			nothing:<sup class='fn'>59</sup> instead, he finds [that] God [has always been
			present] with him, and [that] He will pay him his account in
			full-for God is swift in reckoning!

Or [else, their deeds<sup class='fn'>60</sup> are] like the depths of darkness
			upon an abysmal sea, made yet more dark by wave billowing over
			wave, with [black] clouds above it all: depths of darkness, layer
			upon layer<sup class='fn'>61</sup> [so that] when one holds up his hand, he
			can hardly see it: for he to whom God gives no light, no light
			whatever has he!

ART THOU NOT aware that it is God whose limit-less glory all
			[creatures] that are in the heavens and on earth extol, even the
			birds as they spread out their wings?<sup class='fn'>62</sup> Each [of them]
			knows indeed how to pray unto Him and to glorify Him; and God has
			full knowledge of all that they do:
for, God's is the dominion over the heavens and the earth, and\n\t\t\twith God is all journeys' end.

Art thou not aware that it is God who causes the clouds to move
			onward, then joins them together, then piles them up in masses,
			until thou canst see rain come forth from their midst? And He it
			is who sends down from the skies, by degrees, mountainous masses
			[of clouds] charged with hail, striking therewith whomever He
			wills and averting it from whomever He wills, [the while] the
			flash of His lightning well-nigh deprives [men of their] sight!
It is God who causes night and day to alter-nate: in this [too],\n\t\t\tbehold, there is surely a lesson for all who have eyes to see!

And it is God who has created all animals out of
			water;<sup class='fn'>63</sup> and [He has willed that] among them are such as
			crawl on their bellies, and such as walk on two legs, and such as
			walk on four. God creates what He wills: for, verily, God has the
			power to will anything.
INDEED. from on high have We bestowed messages clearly showing\n\t\t\tthe truth; but God guides onto a straight way [only] him that\n\t\t\twills [to be guided].<sup class='fn'>64</sup>

For, [many are] they [who] say, "We believe in God and in the
			Apostle, and we pay heed!" - but then, some of them turn away
			after this [assertion]: and these are by no means [true]
			believers.
And [so it is that] whenever they are summoned unto God and His\n\t\t\tApostle in order that [the divine writ] might judge between\n\t\t\tthem,<sup class='fn'>65</sup> lo! some of them turn away;
but if the truth happens to be to their liking, they are quite\n\t\t\twilling to accept it!<sup class='fn'>66</sup>

Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they begun to doubt
			[that this is a divine writ]? Or do they fear that God and His
			Apostle might deal unjustly with them?<sup class='fn'>67</sup> Nay, it is
			[but] they, they who are doing wrong [to themselves]!

The only response of believers, whenever they are summoned unto
			God and His Apostle in order that [the divine writ] might judge
			between them, can be no other than,<sup class='fn'>68</sup> "We have heard,
			and we pay heed!" - and it is they, they who shall attain to a
			happy state:
for, they who pay heed unto God and His Apostle, and stand in awe\n\t\t\tof God and are conscious of Him, it is they, they who shall\n\t\t\ttriumph [in the end]!

Now [as for those half-hearted ones,] they do swear by God with
			their most solemn oaths that if thou [O Apostle] shouldst ever
			bid them to do so, they would most certainly go forth [and
			sacrifice themselves].<sup class='fn'>69</sup> Say: "Swear not! Reasonable
			compliance [with God's message is all that is required of
			you].<sup class='fn'>70</sup> Verily, God is aware of all that you do!"

Say: "Pay heed unto God, and pay heed unto the Apostle." And if
			you turn away [from the Apostle, know that] he will have to
			answer only for whatever he has been charged with, and you, for
			what you have been charged with; but if you pay heed unto him,
			you will be on the right way. Withal, the Apostle is not bound to
			do more than clearly deliver the message [entrust-ed to him].

God has promised those of you who have attained to faith and do
			righteous deeds that, of a certainty, He will cause them to
			accede to power on earth,<sup class='fn'>71</sup> even as He caused [some of]
			those who lived before them to accede to it; and that, of a
			certainty, He will firmly establish for them the religion which
			He has been pleased to bestow on them;<sup class='fn'>72</sup> and that, of a
			certainty, He will cause their erstwhile state of fear to be
			replaced bv a sense of security<sup class='fn'>73</sup> - [Iseeine that] they
			worship Me [alone], not ascribing divine powers to aught beside
			Me.<sup class='fn'>74</sup> But all who, after [having understood] this,
			choose to deny the truth - it is they, they who are truly
			iniquitous!
Hence, [O believers,] be constant in prayer, and render the\n\t\t\tpurifying dues,<sup class='fn'>75</sup>  and pay heed unto the Apostle, so\n\t\t\tthat you might be graced with God's mercy.

[And] think not that those who are bent on denying the truth can
			elude [their final reckoning even if they remain unscathed] on
			earth:<sup class='fn'>76</sup> the fire is their goal [in the life to comel -
			and vile indeed is such a iournev's end!

O YOU who have attained to faith!<sup class='fn'>77</sup> At three times [of
			day], let [even] those whom you rightfully possess,<sup class='fn'>78</sup> as
			well as those from among you who have not yet attained to
			puberty,<sup class='fn'>79</sup> ask leave of you [before intruding upon your
			privacy]: before the prayer of daybreak, and whenever you lay
			aside your garments in the middle of the day, and after the
			prayer of nightfall:<sup class='fn'>80</sup> the three occasions on which your
			naked-ness is likely to be bared.<sup class='fn'>81</sup> Beyond these
			[occasions], neither you nor they will incur any sin if they move
			[freely] about you, attending to [the needs of] one another. In
			this way God makes clear unto you His mes-sages: for God is
			all-knowing, wise!

Yet when the children among you attain to puberty, let them ask\n\t\t\tleave of you [at all times], even as those [who have reached\n\t\t\tmaturity] before them have been enjoined to ask it.<sup class='fn'>82</sup>

AND<sup class='fn'>83</sup> [know that] women advanced in years, who no longer
			feel any sexual desire,<sup class='fn'>84</sup> incur no sin if they discard
			their [outer] garments, provided they do not aim at a showy
			display of [their] charms. But [even so,] it is better for them
			to abstain [from this]: and God is all-hearing, all-knowing.

[ALL OF YOU, O believers, are brethren:<sup class='fn'>85</sup> hence,] no
			blame attaches to the blind, nor does blame attach to the lame,
			nor does blame attach to the sick [for accepting charity from the
			hale], and neither to your-selves for eating [whatever is offered
			to you by others, whether it be food obtained] from your
			[chil-dren's] houses,<sup class='fn'>86</sup> or your fathers' houses, or your
			mothers' houses, or your brothers' houses, or your sisters'
			houses, or your paternal uncles' houses, or your paternal aunts'
			houses, or your maternal uncles' houses, or your maternal aunts'
			houses, or [houses] the keys whereof are in your
			charge,<sup class='fn'>87</sup> or [the house] of any of your friends; nor
			will you incur any sin by eating in company or separately. But
			whenever you enter [any of these] houses, greet one another with
			a blessed, goodly greeting, as enjoined by God. In this way God
			makes clear unto you His messages, so that you might [learn to]
			use your reason.

[TRUE] BELIEVERS are only they who have attained to faith in God
			and His Apostle, and who, whenever they are [engaged] with him
			upon a matter of concern to the whole community,<sup class='fn'>88</sup> do
			not depart [from whatever has been decided upon] unless they have
			sought [and obtained] his leave.<sup class='fn'>89</sup> Verily, those who [do
			not abstain from the agreed-upon action unless they] ask leave of
			thee - it is [only] they who [truly] believe in God and His
			Apostle! Hence, when they ask leave of thee for some [valid]
			reason of their own, grant thou this leave to whomsoever of them
			thou choose [to grant it],<sup class='fn'>90</sup> and ask God to forgive
			them: for, behold, God is much -forgiving a dispenser of
			grace!<sup class='fn'>91</sup>

DO NOT regard the Apostle's summons to you<sup class='fn'>92</sup> [in the
			same light] as a summons of one of you to another: God is indeed
			aware of those of you who would withdraw surreptitiously: so let
			those who would go against His bidding beware, lest a [bitter]
			trial befall them [in this world] or grievous suffering befall
			them [in the life to come].

Oh, verily, unto God belongs all that is in the heavens and on
			earth: well does He know where you stand and at what you
			aim!<sup class='fn'>93</sup> And one Day, all [who have ever lived] will be
			brought back unto Him, and then He will make them [truly]
			understand all that they were doing [in life]: for, God has full
			knowledge of everything.

HALLOWED is He who from on high, step by step, has bestowed upon\n\t\t\tHis servant the standard by which to discern the true from the\n\t\t\tfalse,<sup class='fn'>1</sup> so that to all the world it might be a warning:

He to whom the dominion over the heavens and the earth belongs,
			and who begets no offspring,<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and has no partner in His
			dominion: for it is He who creates every thing and determines its
			nature in accordance with [His own] design.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

And yet, some choose to worship, instead of Him, [imaginary]
			deities that cannot create anything hut are themselves
			created.<sup class='fn'>4</sup> and have it not within their power to avert
			harm from, or bring benefit to, themselves, and have no power
			over death, nor over life, nor over resurrection!

Moreover, those who are bent on denying the truth are wont to
			say, "This [Qur'an] is nothing but a lie which he [himself] has
			devised with the help of other people,<sup class='fn'>5</sup> who thereupon
			have perverted the truth and brought a falsehood into
			being."<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
And they say, "Fables of ancient times which he has caused to be\n\t\t\twritten down,<sup class='fn'>7</sup> so that they might be read out to him at\n\t\t\tmorn and evening!"
Say [O Muhammad]: "He who knows all the mysteries of the heavens\n\t\t\tand the earth has bestowed from on high this [Qur'an upon me]!\n\t\t\tVerily, He is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!"

Yet they say: "What sort of apostle is this [man] who eats food
			[like all other mortals] and goes about in the market-places? Why
			has not an angel [visibly] been sent down unto him, to act as a
			warner together with him?"

Or: "[Why has not] a treasure been granted to him [by God]?" Or:
			"He should [at least] have a [bountiful] garden, so that he could
			eat thereof [without effort]!"<sup class='fn'>8</sup> And so these evildoers
			say [unto one another], "If you were to follow [Muhammad, you
			would follow] but a man bewitched!"
See to what they liken thee, [O Prophet, simply] because they\n\t\t\thave gone astray and are now unable to find a way [to the truth]!

Hallowed is He who, if it be His will, shall give thee something
			better than that [whereof they speak] - gardens through which
			running waters flow - and shall assign to thee mansions [of bliss
			in the life to come].
But nay! It is [the very coming of] the Last Hour to which they\n\t\t\tgive the lie! However, for such as give the lie to [the\n\t\t\tannouncement of] the Last Hour We have readied a blazing flame:
when it shall face them from afar,<sup class='fn'>9</sup> they will hear its\n\t\t\tangry roar and its hiss;
and when they are flung, linked [all] together, into a tight\n\t\t\tspace within, they will pray for extinction there and\n\t\t\tthen!<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
[But they will be told:] "Pray not today for one single\n\t\t\textinction, but pray for many extinctions!"<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
Say: "Which is better-that, or the paradise of life abiding which\n\t\t\thas been promised to the God-conscious as their reward and their\n\t\t\tjourney's end-
a promise given by thy Sustainer, [always] to be prayed for?"

BUT [as for people who are oblivious of thy Sus-tainer's
			oneness<sup class='fn'>12</sup> -] one Day He will gather them together with
			all that they [now] worship instead of God, and will ask [those
			to whom divinity was falsely ascribed<sup class='fn'>13</sup> ]: "Was it you
			who led these My creatures astray, or did they by themselves
			stray from the right path?"

They will answer: "Limitless art Thou in Thy glory! It was
			inconceivable for us to take for our masters anyone but
			Thyself!<sup class='fn'>14</sup> But [as for them -] Thou didst allow them and
			their forefathers to enjoy [the pleasures of] life to such an
			extent that<sup class='fn'>15</sup> they forgt all remembrance [of thee]: for
			they were people devoid of all good,"

[Thereupon God will say:] "And now, they [whom you regarded as
			divine] have given the lie to all your [past] assertions, and you
			can neither ward off [your punishment] nor obtain any succour!
			For, whoever of you has committed [such] evil, him shall We cause
			to taste areas suffering!"

AND [even] before thee, Lo Muhammad,] We never sent as Our
			message-bearers any but [mortal men,] who indeed ate food [like
			other human beings] and went about in the market-places: for [it
			is thus that] We cause you [human beings] to be a means of
			testing one another.'<sup class='fn'>16</sup> Are you<sup class='fn'>17</sup> able to
			endure [this test] with patience? For [remember, O man,] thy
			Sustainer is truly all-seeing!

But those who do not believe that they are destined to meet
			Us<sup class='fn'>18</sup> are wont to say, "Why have no angels been sent down
			to us?" - or, "Why do we not see our Sustainer?" Indeed, they are
			far too proud of themselves, hav-ing rebelled [against God's
			truth] with utter disdain!

[Yet] on that Day - the Day on which they shall see the
			angels<sup class='fn'>19</sup> - there will be no glad tiding for those who
			were lost in sin; and they will exclaim, "By a forbidding ban
			[are we from God's grace debarred]!"-
for We shall have turned towards all the [supposedly good] deeds\n\t\t\tthey ever wrought, and shall have transformed them into scattered\n\t\t\tdust-
[whereas] on that same Day those who are destined for paradise\n\t\t\twill be graced with the best of abodes and the fairest place of\n\t\t\trepose.<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
And on the Day on which the skies, together with the clouds,\n\t\t\tshall burst asunder, and the angels are made to descend in a\n\t\t\tmighty descent-
on that Day [it will become obvious to all that] true\n\t\t\tsover-eignty belongs to the Most Gracious [alone]: hence, a Day\n\t\t\tof distress will it be for all who deny the truth,
and a Day on which the evildoer will bite his hands [in despair],\n\t\t\texclaiming: "Oh, would that I had followed the path shown to me\n\t\t\tby the apostle!<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
Oh, woe is me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so for a friend!
Indeed, he led me astray from the remembrance [of God] after it\n\t\t\thad come unto me!" For [thus it is:] Satan is ever a betrayer of\n\t\t\tman.<sup class='fn'>22</sup>

AND [on that Day] the Apostle will say:<sup class='fn'>23</sup> "O my\n\t\t\tSustainer! Behold, [some of] my people have come to regard this\n\t\t\tQur'an as something [that ought to be] discarded!" <sup class='fn'>24</sup>
For so it is that against every prophet We have set up enemies\n\t\t\tfrom among those who are lost in sin:<sup class='fn'>25</sup> yet none can\n\t\t\tguide and give succour as thy Sustainer does!

Now they who are bent on denying the truth are wont to ask, "Why
			has not the Qur'an been bestowed on him from on high in one
			single re-velation?" <sup class='fn'>26</sup> [It has been revealed] in this
			manner so that We might strengthen thy heart thereby-for We have
			so arranged its component parts that they from one consistent
			whole.<sup class='fn'>27</sup>

and [that] they [who deny the truth] might never taunt thee with
			any deceptive half-truth<sup class='fn'>28</sup> without Our conveying to thee
			the [full] truth and [providing thee] with the best
			explanation.<sup class='fn'>29</sup>

[And so, tell those who are bent on denying the truth that] they
			who shall be gathered unto hell upon their faces<sup class='fn'>30</sup> - it
			is they who [in the life to come] will be worst in station and
			still farther astray from the path [of truth]!<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
AND, INDEED, [long before Muhammad] We vouchsafed revelation unto\n\t\t\tMoses, and appointed his brother Aaron to help him to bear his\n\t\t\tburden;<sup class='fn'>32</sup>
and We said, "Go you both unto the people who have given the lie\n\t\t\tto Our messages!"-and thereupon We broke those [sinners] to\n\t\t\tsmithereens.

And [think of] the people of Noah: when they gave the lie to [one
			of] the apostles, We caused them to drown, and made them a symbol
			for all mankind: for, grievous suffering have We readied for all
			who [knowingly] do wrong!
And [remember how We punished the tribes ofl'Ad and Thamud, and\n\t\t\tthe people of Ar-Rass,<sup class='fn'>33</sup> and many generations [of\n\t\t\tsinners] in-between:
and unto each of them did We proffer lessons,<sup class='fn'>34</sup> and each\n\t\t\tof them did We destroy with utter destruction.

And they [who now deny Our messages] must surely have come across
			that town which was rained upon by a rain of evil:<sup class='fn'>35</sup>
			have they, then, never beheld it [with their mind's eye]? But
			nay, they would not believe in resurrection!<sup class='fn'>36</sup>
Hence, whenever they consider thee, [O Muhammad,] they but make\n\t\t\tthee a target of their mockery, [saying:] "Is this the one whom\n\t\t\tGod has sent as an apostle?

Indeed, he would well-nigh have led us astray from our deities,
			had we not been [so] steadfastly attached to them!" But in time,
			when they see the suffering [that awaits them], they will come to
			know who it was that went farthest astray from the path [of
			truth]!
Hast thou ever considered [the kind of man] who makes his own\n\t\t\tdesires his deity? Couldst thou, then, [O Prophet,] be held\n\t\t\tresponsible for him?

Or cost thou think that most of them listen [to thy message] and\n\t\t\tuse their reason? Nay, they are but like cattle - nay, they are\n\t\t\teven less conscious of the right way!<sup class='fn'>37</sup>

ART THOU NOT aware of thy Sustainer [through His works]? - how He
			causes the shadow to lengthen [towards the night] when, had He so
			willed, He could indeed have made it stand still: but then, We
			have made the sun its guide;
and then, [after having caused it to lengthen,] We draw it in\n\t\t\ttowards Our-selves<sup class='fn'>38</sup> with a gradual drawing-in.
And He it is who makes the night a garment for you, and [your]\n\t\t\tsleep a rest, and causes every [new] day to be a resurrection.
And He it is who sends forth the winds as a glad tiding of His\n\t\t\tcoming grace; and [thus, too,] We cause pure water to descend\n\t\t\tfrom the skies,
so that We may bring dead land to life thereby, and give to drink\n\t\t\tthereof to many [beings] of Our creation, beasts as well as\n\t\t\thumans.
And, indeed, many times have We repeated [all] this unto\n\t\t\tmen,<sup class='fn'>39</sup> so that they might take it to heart: but most men\n\t\t\trefuse to be aught but ingrate.
Now had We so willed, We could have [con-tinued as before and]\n\t\t\traised up a [separate] warner in every single\n\t\t\tcommunity:<sup class='fn'>40</sup>
hence, do not defer to [the likes and dislikes of] those who deny\n\t\t\tthe truth, but strive hard against them, by means of this [divine\n\t\t\twrit], with utmost striving.

AND HE it is who has given freedom of movement to the two great
			bodies of water<sup class='fn'>41</sup> - the one sweet and thirst-allaying,
			and the other salty and bitter - and yet has wrought between them
			a barrier and a forbiddin ban.<sup class='fn'>42</sup>

And He it is who out of this [very] water has created
			man,<sup class='fn'>43</sup> and has endowed him with [the con-sciousness of]
			descent and marriage-tie:<sup class='fn'>44</sup> for thy Sustainer is ever
			infinite in His power.

And yet, some people<sup class='fn'>45</sup> worship, instead of God, things\n\t\t\tthat can neither benefit them nor harm them: thus, he who denies\n\t\t\tthe truth does indeed turn his back on his Sustainer!
Yet [withal, O Prophet,] We have sent thee only as a herald of\n\t\t\tglad tidings and a warner.
Say: "For this, no reward do I ask of you [- no reward] other\n\t\t\tthan that he who so wills may unto his Sustainer find a way!"
Hence, place thy trust in the Living One who dies not, and extol\n\t\t\tHis limitless glory and praise: for none is as aware of His\n\t\t\tcreatures' sins as He -

He who has created the heavens and the earth and all that is
			between them in six aeons, and is established on the throne of
			His almightiness: <sup class='fn'>46</sup> the Most Gracious! Ask, then, about
			Him, Ithel One who is[truly] aware.<sup class='fn'>47</sup>

Yet when they [who are bent on denying the truth] are told,
			"Prostrate yourselves before the Most Gracious," they are wont to
			ask, "And [who and] what is the Most Gracious? Are we to
			prostrate ourselves before whatever thou biddest us [to
			worship]?"- and so [thy call] but increases their aversion.
HALLOWED is He who has set up in the skies great constellations,\n\t\t\tand has placed among them a [radiant] lamp and a light-giving\n\t\t\tmoon.<sup class='fn'>48</sup>

And He it is who causes the night and the day to succeed one
			another, [revealing Himself in His works] unto him who has the
			will to take thought-that is,<sup class='fn'>49</sup> has the will to be
			grateful.
For, [true] servants of the Most Gracious are [only] they who\n\t\t\twalk gently on earth, and who, whenever the foolish address\n\t\t\tthem,<sup class='fn'>50</sup> reply with [words of] peace;
and who remember their Sustainer far into the night, prostrating\n\t\t\tthemselves and standing;
and who pray: "O our Sustainer, avert from us the suffering of\n\t\t\thell - for, verily, the suffering caused by it is bound to be a\n\t\t\ttorment dire:
verily, how evil an abode and a station!"-;
and who, whenever they spend on others,<sup class='fn'>51</sup> are neither\n\t\t\twasteful nor niggardly but [remember that] there is always a just\n\t\t\tmean between those [two extremes];

and who never invoke any [imaginary] deity side by side with God,
			and do not take any human being's life-[the life] which God has
			willed to be sacred-otherwise than in [the pursuit of]
			justice,<sup class='fn'>52</sup> and do not commit adultery. And [know that]
			he who commits aught thereof<sup class='fn'>53</sup> shall [not only] meet
			with a full requital
[but] shall have his suffering doubled on Resurrection Day: for\n\t\t\ton that [Day] he shall abide in ignominy.

Excepted, however, shall be they who repent and attain to faith
			and do righteous deeds: for it is they whose [erstwhile] bad
			deeds God will transform into good ones - seeing that God is
			indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace,
and seeing that he who repents and [thenceforth] does what is\n\t\t\tright has truly turned unto God by [this very act of] repentance.

And [know that true servants of God are only] those who never\n\t\t\tbear witness to what is false,<sup class='fn'>54</sup> and [who], whenever\n\t\t\tthey pass by [people engaged in] frivolity, pass on with dignity;
and who, whenever they are reminded of their Sustainer's\n\t\t\tmessages, do not throw themselves upon them [as if] deaf and\n\t\t\tblind;<sup class='fn'>55</sup>

and who pray: "O our Sustainer! Grant that our spouses and our\n\t\t\toffspring be a joy to our eyes,<sup class='fn'>56</sup> and cause us to be\n\t\t\tforemost among those who are conscious of Thee!"
[Such as] these will be rewarded for all their patient endurance\n\t\t\t[in life] with a high station [in paradise], and will be met\n\t\t\ttherein with a greeting of welcome and peace,
therein to abide: [and] how goodly an abode and [how highl a\n\t\t\tstation!

SAY [unto those who believe]: "No weight or value would my
			Sustainer attach to you were it not for your faith [in
			Him]!"<sup class='fn'>57</sup> [And say unto those who deny the truth:] "You
			have indeed given the lie [to God's message], and in time this
			[sin] will cleave unto you!"<sup class='fn'>58</sup>
Ta. Sin. Mim.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
THESE ARE MESSAGES of the divine writ,\tclear in itself and\n\t\t\tclearly showing the truth <sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Wouldst thou, perhaps, torment thyself to death [with grief]\n\t\t\tbecause they [who live around thee] refuse to believe [in\n\t\t\tit]?<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Had We so willed, We could have sent down unto them a message\n\t\t\tfrom the skies, so that their necks would Ibe forced tol bown\n\t\t\tdown before it in humility.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
[But We have not willed it:] and so, whenever there comes unto\n\t\t\tthem any fresh reminder from the Most Gracious, they [who are\n\t\t\tblind of heart] always turn their backs upon it:
thus, indeed, have they given the lie [to this message as well].\n\t\t\tBut [in time] they will come to understand what it was that they\n\t\t\twere wont to deride!<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
Have they, then, never considered the earth-how much of every\n\t\t\tnoble kind [of life] We have caused to grow thereon?
In this, behold, there is a message [unto men], even though most\n\t\t\tof them will not believe [in it].
But, verily, thy Sustainer- He alone - is almighty, a dispenser\n\t\t\tof grace!<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
HENCE, [remember how it was] when thy Sustainer summoned Moses:\n\t\t\t"Go unto those evildoing people,
the people of Pharaoh, who refuse to be conscious of\n\t\t\tMe!"<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
He answered: "O my Sustainer! Behold, I fear that they will give\n\t\t\tme the lie,
and then my breast will be straitened and my tongue will not be\n\t\t\tfree: send, then, [this Thy command] to Aaron.<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
Moreover, they keep a grave charge [pending] against me, and I\n\t\t\tfear that they will slay me."<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
Said He: "Not so, indeed! Go forth, then, both of you, with Our\n\t\t\tmessages: verily, We shall be with you, listening [to your call]!
And go, both of you, unto Pharaoh and say, 'Behold, we bear a\n\t\t\tmessage from the Sustainer of all the worlds:
Let the children of Israel go with us!' "
[But when Moses had delivered his message, Pharaoh] said: "Did we\n\t\t\tnot bring thee up among us when thou wert a child? And didst thou\n\t\t\tnot spend among us years of thy [later] life?
And yet thou didst commit that [heinous] deed of\n\t\t\tthine,<sup class='fn'>10</sup> and [hast thus shown that] thou art one of the\n\t\t\tingrate!"
Replied [Moses!: "I committed it while I was still going astray;

and I fled from you because I feared you. But [since] then my
			Sustainer has endowed me with the ability to judge [between right
			and wrong],<sup class='fn'>11</sup> and has made me one of [His]
			message-bearers.
And [as for] that favour of which thou so tauntingly remindest\n\t\t\tme-[was it not] due to thy having enslaved the children of\n\t\t\tIsrael?"<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
Said Pharaoh: "And what [and who] is that 'Sustainer of all the\n\t\t\tworlds'?"<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
[Moses] answered: "[He is] the Sustainer of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth and all that is between them: if you would but [allow\n\t\t\tyourselves to] be convinced ! " <sup class='fn'>14</sup>
Said [Pharaoh] unto those around him: "Did you hear [what he\n\t\t\tsaid]?"<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
[And Moses] continued: "[He is] your Sus-tainer, [too,] as well\n\t\t\tas the Sustainer of your fore-fathers of old!"
[Pharaoh] exclaimed: "Behold, [this] your 'apostle' who [claims\n\t\t\tthat he] has been sent unto you is mad indeed!"

[But Moses] went on: "[He of whom I speak is] the Sustainer of
			the east and the west and of all that is between the
			two<sup class='fn'>16</sup> - [as you would know] if you would but use your
			reason!"
Said [Pharaoh]: "Indeed, if thou choose to worship any deity\n\t\t\tother than me, I shall most certainly throw thee into\n\t\t\tprison!<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
Said he: "Even if I should bring about before thee something that\n\t\t\tclearly shows the truth?"<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
[Pharaoh] answered: "Produce it, then, if thou art a man of\n\t\t\ttruth!"
Thereupon [Moses] threw down his staff - and lo! it was a\n\t\t\tserpent, plainly visible;
and he drew forth his hand - and lo! it appeared [shining] white\n\t\t\tthe heholders.<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
Said [Pharaoh] unto the great ones around him "Verily, this is\n\t\t\tindeed a sorcerer of great knowledge
who wants to drive you out of your land by his\n\t\t\tsorcery.<sup class='fn'>20</sup> What, then, do you advise?"
They answered: "Let him and his brother wait a while, and send\n\t\t\tunto all cities heralds
who shall assemble before thee all sorcerers of great knowledge."
And so the sorcerers were assembled at a set time on a certain\n\t\t\tday,
and the people were asked: "Are you all present,
so that we might follow [in the footsteps of] the sorcerers if it\n\t\t\tis they who prevail?" <sup class='fn'>21</sup>
Now when the sorcerers came, they said unto Pharaoh: "Verily, we\n\t\t\tought to have a great reward if it is we who prevail."<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
Answered he: "Yea-and, verily, in that case you shall be among\n\t\t\tthose who are near unto me."
[And] Moses said unto them: "Throw whatever you are going to\n\t\t\tthrow!"
Thereupon they threw their [magic] ropes and their staffs, and\n\t\t\tsaid: "By Pharaoh's might, behold, it is we indeed who have\n\t\t\tprevailed!"<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
[But] then Moses threw his staff-and lo! it swallowed up all\n\t\t\ttheir deceptions.<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
And down fell the sorcerers, prostrating them-selves in\n\t\t\tadoration,
[and] exclaimed: "We have come to believe in the Sustainer of all\n\t\t\tthe worlds,
the Sustainer of Moses and Aaron!"

Said [Pharaoh]: "Have you come to believe in him<sup class='fn'>25</sup> ere I
			have given you permission? Verily, he must be your master who has
			taught you magic!<sup class='fn'>26</sup> But in time you shall come to know
			[my revenge]: most certainly shall I cut off your hands and your
			feet great numbers, because of [your] perverseness, and shall
			most certainly crucify you in great numbers, all
			together!"<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
They answered: "No harm [canst thou do to us]: verily, unto our\n\t\t\tSustainer do we turn!
Behold, we [but] ardently desire that our Sustainer forgive us\n\t\t\tour faults in return for our having been foremost among the\n\t\t\tbelievers!"
AND [there came a time<sup class='fn'>28</sup> when] We inspired Moses thus:\n\t\t\t"Go forth with My servants by night: for, behold, you will be\n\t\t\tpursued!"
And Pharaoh sent heralds unto all cities,
[bidding them to call out his troops and to proclaim:] "Behold,\n\t\t\tthese [children of Israel] are but a contemptible\n\t\t\tband;<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
but they are indeed filled with hatred of us
seeing that we are, verily, a nation united, fully prepared\n\t\t\tagainst danger<sup class='fn'>30</sup> -
and so we have [rightly] driven them out of [their] gardens and\n\t\t\tsprings,
and [deprived them of their erstwhile] station of\n\t\t\thonour!"<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
Thus it was: but [in the course of time] We were to bestow all\n\t\t\tthese [things] as a heritage on the children of\n\t\t\tIsrael.<sup class='fn'>32</sup>
And so [the Egyptians] caught up with them at sunrise;
and as soon as the two hosts came in sight of one another, the\n\t\t\tfollowers of Moses exclaimed: "Behold, we shall certainly be\n\t\t\tovertaken [and defeated]!"
He replied: "Nay indeed! My Sustainer is with me, [and] He will\n\t\t\tguide me!"
Thereupon We inspired Moses thus: "Strike the sea with thy\n\t\t\tstaff!" - whereupon it parted, and each part appeared like a\n\t\t\tmountain vast.<sup class='fn'>33</sup>
And We caused the pursuers<sup class='fn'>34</sup> to draw nea unto that\n\t\t\tplace:
and We saved Moses and all who were with him,
and then We caused the others to drown.<sup class='fn'>35</sup>
In this [story], behold, there is a message [unto all men], even\n\t\t\tthough most of them will not believe [in it].
And yet, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a\n\t\t\tdispenser of grace!<sup class='fn'>36</sup>
AND CONVEY unto them<sup class='fn'>37</sup> the story of Abraham
[how it was] when he asked his father and his people, "What is it\n\t\t\tthat you worship?"
They answered: "We worship idols, and we remain ever devoted to\n\t\t\tthem."
Said he: "Do [you really think that] they hear you when you\n\t\t\tinvoke them,
or benefit you or do you harm?"
They exclaimed: "But we found our fore-fathers doing the\n\t\t\tsame!"<sup class='fn'>38</sup>
Said [Abraham]: "Have you, then, ever con-sidered what it is that\n\t\t\tyou have been worshipping-
you and those ancient forebears of yours?
"Now [as for me, I know that,] verily, these [false deities] are\n\t\t\tmy enemies, [and that none is my helper] save the Sustainer of\n\t\t\tall the worlds,
who has created me and is the One who guides me,
and is the One who gives me to eat and to drink,
and when I fall ill, is the One who restores me to health,
and who will cause me to die and then will bring me back to life-
and who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on Judgment Day!
"O my Sustainer! Endow me with the ability to judge [between\n\t\t\tright and wrong], and make me one with the righteous,
and grant me the power to convey the truth unto those who will\n\t\t\tcome after me,<sup class='fn'>39</sup>
and place me among those who shall inherit the garden of bliss!
"And forgive my father - for, verily, he is among those who have\n\t\t\tgone astray<sup class='fn'>40</sup> -
and do not put me to shame on the Day when all shall be raised\n\t\t\tfrom the dead:<sup class='fn'>41</sup>
the Day on which neither wealth will be of any use, nor children,
[and when] only he [will be happy] who comes before God with a\n\t\t\theart free of evil!"
For, [on that Day,] paradise will be brought within sight of the\n\t\t\tGod-conscious,
whereas the blazing fire witl be laid open before those who had\n\t\t\tbeen lost in grievous error;
and they will be asked: "Where now is all that you were wont to\n\t\t\tworship
instead of God?<sup class='fn'>42</sup> Can these [things and beings] be of\n\t\t\tany help to you or to themselves?"
Thereupon they will be hurled into hell<sup class='fn'>43</sup> - they, as\n\t\t\twell as all [others] who had been lost in grievous error,
and the hosts of Iblis - all together.<sup class='fn'>44</sup>
And there and then, blaming one another,<sup class='fn'>45</sup> they [who had\n\t\t\tgrievously sinned in life] will exclaim:
"By God, we were most obviously astray
when we deemed you [false deities] equal to the Sustainer of all\n\t\t\tthe worlds-
yet they who have seduced us [into believing in you] are the\n\t\t\ttruly guilty ones!<sup class='fn'>46</sup>
And now we have none to intercede for us,
nor any loving friend.
Would that we had a second chance [in life],<sup class='fn'>47</sup> so that\n\t\t\twe could be among the believers!"
In all this, behold, there is a message [unto men], even though\n\t\t\tmost of them will not believe [in it].
But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almiahtv, a dispenser\n\t\t\tof grace!<sup class='fn'>48</sup>
THE PEOPLE of Noah [too] gave the lie to [one of God's]\n\t\t\tmessage-bearers
when their brother Noah said unto them: "Will you not be\n\t\t\tconscious of God?
Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore]\n\t\t\tworthy of your trust:
be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
"And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests\n\t\t\twith none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Hence, remain conscious of God. and pay heed unto me!"
They answered: "Shall we place our faith in thee, even though\n\t\t\t[only] the most abject [of people] follow thee?"<sup class='fn'>49</sup>
Said he: "And what knowledge could I have as to what they were\n\t\t\tdoing [before they came to me]?
Their reckoning rests with none but my Sus-tainer: if you could\n\t\t\tbut understand [this]!<sup class='fn'>50</sup>
Hence, I shall not drive away [any of] those [who profess to be]\n\t\t\tbelievers;
I am nothing but a plain warner."
Said they: "Indeed, if thou desist not, O Noah, thou wilt surely\n\t\t\tbe stoned to death!"<sup class='fn'>51</sup>
[Whereupon] he prayed: "O my Sustainer! Behold, my people have\n\t\t\tgiven me the lie:
hence, lay Thou wide open the truth between me and\n\t\t\tthem,<sup class='fn'>52</sup> and save me and those of the believers who are\n\t\t\twith me!"
And so We saved him and those [who were] with him in the\n\t\t\tfully-laden ark,
and then We caused those who stayed behind to drown.<sup class='fn'>53</sup>
In this [story], behold, there is a message [unto\n\t\t\tmen],<sup class='fn'>54</sup> even though most of them will not believe [in\n\t\t\tit].
But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone-is almighty, a dispenser of\n\t\t\tgrace!
[AND the tribe of] Ad gave the lie to [one of God's]\n\t\t\tmessage-bearers
when their brother Hud<sup class='fn'>55</sup> said unto them: "Will you not\n\t\t\tbe conscious of God?
Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore]\n\t\t\tworthy of your trust:
be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!.
"And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests\n\t\t\twith none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
"Will you, in your wanton folly, build [idolatrous] altars on\n\t\t\tevery height,<sup class='fn'>56</sup>
and make for yourselves mighty castles, [hoping] that you might\n\t\t\tbecome immortal?<sup class='fn'>57</sup>
And will you [always], whenever you lay hand [on others], lay\n\t\t\thand [on them] cruelly, without any restraint?<sup class='fn'>58</sup>
"Be, then, conscious of God and pay heed unto me:
and [thus] be conscious of Him who has [so] amply provided you\n\t\t\twith all [the good] that you might think of <sup class='fn'>59</sup> -
amply provided you with flocks, and children,
and gardens, and springs -:
for, verily, I fear lest suffering befall you on an awesome day!"
[But] they answered: "It is all one to us whether thou preaches"\n\t\t\t[something new] or art not of those who [like to] preach.
This [religion of ours] is none other than that to which our\n\t\t\tforebears clung,<sup class='fn'>60</sup>
and we are not going to be chastised [for adhering to it]!"

And so they gave him the lie: and thereupon We destroyed them. In\n\t\t\tthis [story], behold, there is a message [unto men], even though\n\t\t\tmost of them will not believe [in it].<sup class='fn'>61</sup>
But, verily, thy Sustainer-He alone-is almighty. a dispenser of\n\t\t\tgrace!
[AND the tribe of] Thamud gave the lie to [one of God's]\n\t\t\tmessage-bearers
when their brother Salih<sup class='fn'>62</sup> said unto them: "Will you not\n\t\t\tbe conscious of God?
Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore]\n\t\t\tworthy of your trust:
be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
"And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests\n\t\t\twith none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
"Do you think that you will be left secure [forever] in the midst\n\t\t\tof what you have here and now?<sup class='fn'>63</sup> -
amidst [these] gardens and springs
and fields, and [these] palm-trees with slender spathes?-
and that you will [always be able to] hew dwellings out of the\n\t\t\tmountains with [the same] great skill?<sup class='fn'>64</sup>
"Be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me,
and pay no heed to the counsel of those who are given to\n\t\t\texcesses-
those who spread corruption on earth instead of setting things to\n\t\t\trights!"
Said they: "Thou art but one of the bewitched!
Thou art nothing but a mortal like ourselves! Come, then, forward\n\t\t\twith a token [of thy mission]<sup class='fn'>65</sup> if thou art a man of\n\t\t\ttruth!"
Replied he: "This she-camel<sup class='fn'>66</sup> shall have a share of\n\t\t\twater, and you shall have a share of water, on the days appointed\n\t\t\t[therefor];<sup class='fn'>67</sup>
and do her no harm, lest suffering befall you on an awesome day!"
But they cruelly slaughtered her - and then they had cause to\n\t\t\tregret it:<sup class='fn'>68</sup>

for the suffering [predicted by Salih] befell them [then and\n\t\t\tthere]. In this [story], behold, there is a message [unto men],\n\t\t\teven though most of them will not believe [in it].<sup class='fn'>69</sup>
But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone -is almighty, a dispenser\n\t\t\tof grace!
[AND] the people of Lot<sup class='fn'>70</sup> gave the lie to [one of God's]\n\t\t\tmessage-bearers
when their brother Lot said unto them: "Will you not be conscious\n\t\t\tof God?
Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore]\n\t\t\tworthy of your trust:
be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
"And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests\n\t\t\twith none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
"Must you, of all people, [lustfully] approach men,
keeping yourselves aloof from all the [lawful] spouses whom your\n\t\t\tSustainer has created for you? Nay, but you are people who\n\t\t\ttransgress all bounds of what is right!"
Said they: "Indeed, if thou desist not, O Lot, thou wilt most\n\t\t\tcertainly be expelled [from this township]!"
[Lot] exclaimed: "Behold, I am one of those who utterly abhor\n\t\t\tyour doings!"
[And then he prayed:] "O my Sustainer! Save me and my household\n\t\t\tfrom all that they are doing!"
Thereupon We saved him and all his household -
all but an old woman, who was among those that stayed\n\t\t\tbehind;<sup class='fn'>71</sup>
and then We utterly destroyed the others,
and rained down upon them a rain [of destruction]:<sup class='fn'>72</sup> and\n\t\t\tdire is such rain upon all who let themselves be warned [to no\n\t\t\tavail]!<sup class='fn'>73</sup>
In this [story], behold, there is a message [unto men], even\n\t\t\tthough most of them will not be-lieve [in it].
But, verily, thy Sustainer- He alone - is almighty, a dispenser\n\t\t\tof grace!
[AND] the dwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan] gave the lie\n\t\t\tto [one of God's] message-bearers
when their brother Shutayb<sup class='fn'>74</sup> said unto them: "Will you\n\t\t\tnot be conscious of God?
Behold, I am an apostle [sent by Him] to you, [and therefore]\n\t\t\tworthy of your trust:
be, then, conscious of God, and pay heed unto me!
"And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests\n\t\t\twith none but the Sustainer of all the worlds.
"[Always] give full measure, and be not among those who\n\t\t\t[unjustly] cause loss [to others];
and [in all your dealings] weigh with a true balance,
and do not deprive people of what is rightfully\n\t\t\ttheirs;<sup class='fn'>75</sup> and do not act wickedly on earth by spreading\n\t\t\tcorruption,
but be conscious of Him who has created you, just as [He created]\n\t\t\tthose countless generations of old!"<sup class='fn'>76</sup>
Said they: "Thou art but one of the be-witched,
for thou art nothing but a mortal like ourselves! And. behold. we\n\t\t\tthink that thou art a consummate liar!<sup class='fn'>77</sup>
Cause, then, fragments of the sky to fall down upon us, if thou\n\t\t\tart a man of truth!"
Answered [Shu'ayb]: "My Sustainer knows fully well what you are\n\t\t\tdoing."
But they gave him the lie. And thereupon suffering overtook them\n\t\t\ton a day dark with shadows:<sup class='fn'>78</sup> and, verily, it was the\n\t\t\tsuffering of an awesome day!
In this [story], behold, there is a message [unto men], even\n\t\t\tthough most of them will not believe [in it].
But, verily, thy Sustainer - He alone - is almighty, a dispenser\n\t\t\tof grace!<sup class='fn'>79</sup>
NOW, BEHOLD, this [divine writ] has indeed been bestowed from on\n\t\t\thigh by the Sustainer of all the worlds:<sup class='fn'>80</sup>
trustworthy divine inspiration has alighted with it from on high
upon thy heart, [O Muhammad,]<sup class='fn'>81</sup> so that thou mayest be\n\t\t\tamong those who preach
in the clear Arabic tongue.<sup class='fn'>82</sup>
And, verily, [the essence of] this [revelation] is indeed found\n\t\t\tin the ancient books of divine wisdom [as well].<sup class='fn'>83</sup>
Is it not evidence enough for them<sup class='fn'>84</sup> that [so many]\n\t\t\tlearned men from among the children of Israel have recognized\n\t\t\tthis [as true]?<sup class='fn'>85</sup>
But [even] had We bestowed it from on high upon any of the\n\t\t\tnon-Arabs,
and had he recited it unto them [in his own tongue], they would\n\t\t\tnot have believed in it.<sup class='fn'>86</sup>
Thus have We caused this [message] to pass [unheeded] through the\n\t\t\thearts of those who are lost in sin:<sup class='fn'>87</sup>
they will not believe in it till they behold the grievous\n\t\t\tsuffering
that will come upon them [on resurrection,] all of a sudden,\n\t\t\twithout their being aware [of its approach];
and then they will exclaim, "Could we have a respite?"<sup class='fn'>88</sup>
Do they, then, [really] wish that Our chas-tisement be hastened\n\t\t\ton?<sup class='fn'>89</sup>
But hast thou ever considered [this]: If We do allow them to\n\t\t\tenjoy [this life] for some years,
and thereupon that [chastisement] which they were promised\n\t\t\tbefalls them-
of what avail to them will be all their past enjoyments?
And withal, never have We destroyed any community unless it had\n\t\t\tbeen warned
and reminded:<sup class='fn'>90</sup> for, never do We wrong [anyone].
And [this divine writ is such a reminder:] no evil spirits have\n\t\t\tbrought it down:<sup class='fn'>91</sup>
for, neither does it suit their ends, nor is it in their power\n\t\t\t[to impart it to man]:
verily, [even] from hearing it are they utterly debarred!
Hence, [O man,] do not invoke any other deity side by side with\n\t\t\tGod, lest thou find thyself among those who are made to suffer\n\t\t\t[on Judgment Day].<sup class='fn'>92</sup>
And warn [whomever thou canst reach, beginning with] thy\n\t\t\tkinsfolk,<sup class='fn'>93</sup>
and spread the wings of thy tenderness over all of the believers\n\t\t\twho may follow thee;<sup class='fn'>94</sup>
but if they disobey thee, say, "I am free of responsibility for\n\t\t\taught that you may do!"
and place thy trust in the Almighty, the Dispenser of Grace,
who sees thee when thou standest [alone] ,<sup class='fn'>95</sup>
and [sees] thy behaviour among those who prostrate themselves\n\t\t\t[before Him]:<sup class='fn'>96</sup>
for, verily, He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing!
[And] shall I tell you upon whom it is that those evil spirits\n\t\t\tdescend?
They descend upon all sinful self-deceivers<sup class='fn'>97</sup>
who readily lend ear [to every falsehood], and most of whom lie\n\t\t\tto others as well.<sup class='fn'>98</sup>
And as for the poets<sup class='fn'>99</sup> - [they, too, are prone to\n\t\t\tdeceive themselves: and so, only] those who are lost in grievous\n\t\t\terror would follow them.
Art thou not aware that they roam confusedly through all the\n\t\t\tvalleys [of words and thoughts],<sup class='fn'>100</sup>
and that they [so often] say what they do not do [or feel]?

[Most of them are of this kind -] save those who have attained to
			faith, and do righteous deeds, and remember God unceasingly, and
			defend them-selves [only] after having been wronged,<sup class='fn'>101</sup>
			and [trust in God's promise that] those who are bent on
			wrong-doing will in time come to know how evil a turn their
			destinies are bound to take!<sup class='fn'>102</sup>
Ta. Sin.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> THESE ARE MESSAGES of the Qur'an - a divine\n\t\t\twrit clear in itself and clearly showing the truth:<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
a guidance and a glad tiding to the believers
who are constant in prayer and spend in charity: <sup class='fn'>3</sup> for\n\t\t\tit is they, they who in their innermost are certain of the life\n\t\t\tto come!
As for those who will not believe in the life to come - behold,\n\t\t\tgoodly have We made their own doings appear unto them, and so\n\t\t\tthey stumble blindly to and fro.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
It is they whom the worst of suffering awaits: for it is they,\n\t\t\tthey who in the life to come shall be the greatest losers!
But [as for thee, O believer,] verily, thou hast received this\n\t\t\tQur'an out of the grace of One who is wise.\n\t\t\tall-knowine.<sup class='fn'>5</sup>

LO! [While lost in the desert,<sup class='fn'>6</sup> ] Moses said to his
			family: "Behold, I perceive a fire [far away]; I may bring you
			from there some tiding [as to which way we are to pursue], or
			bring you [at least] a burning brand  so that you might warm
			yourselves.";

But when he came close to it, a call was sounded: "Blessed are
			all who are within [reach of] this fire, and all who are near
			it!<sup class='fn'>7</sup> And limitless in His glory is God, the Sustainer of
			all the worlds!"
[And God spoke thus:] "O Moses! Verily, I  alone am God, the\n\t\t\tAlmighty, the Wise!"

[And then He said:] "Now throw down thy staff!"<sup class='fn'>8</sup> But
			when he saw it move rapidly, as if it were a  serpent, he drew
			back [in terror], and did not [dare to] return.<sup class='fn'>9</sup> [And
			God spoke to him again:] "O Moses! Fear not - for, behold, no
			fear need the message-bearers have in My Presence,

and neither<sup class='fn'>10</sup> need anyone who has done wrong and then\n\t\t\thas replaced the wrong with good:<sup class='fn'>11</sup> for, verily, I am\n\t\t\tmuch-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!

"Now Dlace thy hand into thy bosom: it will come forth [shining]
			white, without blemish!<sup class='fn'>12</sup> "[And thou shalt go] with nine
			[of My] messages unto Pharaoh and his people<sup class='fn'>13</sup> - for,
			verily, they are people depraved!"
But when Our light-giving messages came unto them, they said,\n\t\t\t"This is clearly [but] spellbinding deception!"<sup class='fn'>14</sup>

- and in their wickedness and self-exaltation they rejected them,\n\t\t\talthough their minds were convinced of their truth: and behold\n\t\t\twhat hap-pened in the end to those spreaders of corruption!

AND, INDEED, We granted [true] knowledge<sup class='fn'>15</sup> unto David
			and Solomon [as well]; and both were wont to say: "All praise is
			due to God, who has [thus] favoured us above many of His
			believing servants!"

And [in this insight] Solomon was [truly] David's heir; and he
			would say: "O you people! We have been taught the speech of
			birds, and have been given [in abundance] of all [good] things:
			this, behold, is indeed a manifest favour [from God]!"
And [one day] there were assembled before Solomon his hosts of\n\t\t\tinvisible beings,<sup class='fn'>16</sup> and of men, and of birds; and then\n\t\t\tthey were led forth in orderly ranks,
till, when they came upon a valley [full] of ants, an ant\n\t\t\texclaimed: "O you ants! Get into your dwellings, lest Solomon and\n\t\t\this hosts crush you without [even] being aware [of you]!"

Thereupon [Solomon] smiled joyously at her words, and said: "O my
			Sustainer! Inspire me so that I may forever be grateful for those
			blessings of Thine with which Thou hast graced me and my
			parentS,<sup class='fn'>17</sup> and that I may do what is right [in a manner]
			that will please Thee; and include me, by Thy grace, among Thy
			righteous servants!"
And [one day] he looked in vain for [a particular one of] the\n\t\t\tbirds; and so he said: "How is it that I do not see the hoopoe?\n\t\t\tOr could he be among the absent?
[If so,] I will punish him most severely or will kill him unless\n\t\t\the bring me a convincing excuse!"<sup class='fn'>18</sup>

But [the hoopoe] tarried but a short while; and [when it came] it
			said: "I have encompassed [with my knowledge] something that thou
			hast never yet encompassed [with shine] - for I have come to thee
			from Sheba with a tiding sure!<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
"Behold, I found there a woman ruling over them; and she has been\n\t\t\tgiven [abundance] of all [good] things, and hers is a mighty\n\t\t\tthrone.

And I found her and her people adoring the sun instead of God;
			and Satan has made these doings of theirs seem goodly to them,
			and [thus] has barred them from the path [of God], so that they
			cannot find the right way:

[for they have come to believe] that they ought not to adore
			God<sup class='fn'>20</sup> - [although it is He] who brings forth all that is
			hidden in the heavens and on earth,<sup class='fn'>21</sup> and knows all that
			you would conceal as well as all that you bring into the open:
God, save whom there is no deity - the Sustainer, in awesome\n\t\t\talmightiness enthroned!"<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
Said [Solomon]: "We shall see whether thou hast told the truth or\n\t\t\tart one of the liars!
Go with this my letter and convey it to them; and thereafter\n\t\t\twithdraw from them and see what [answer] they return."
[When the Queen had read Solomon's letter,] she said: "O you\n\t\t\tnobles! A truly distinguished letter has been conveyed unto me.
Behold, it is from Solomon, and it says, 'In the name of God, the\n\t\t\tMost Gracious, the Dispenser of Grace:
[God says:] Exalt not yourselves against Me, but come unto Me in\n\t\t\twilling surrender!'''<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
She added: "O you nobles! Give me your opinion on the problem\n\t\t\twith which I am now faced;<sup class='fn'>24</sup> I would never make a\n\t\t\t[weighty] decision unless you are present with me."
They answered: "We are endowed with power and with mighty prowess\n\t\t\tin war - but the command is shine; consider, then, what thou\n\t\t\twouldst command."

Said she: "Verily, whenever kings enter a country they corrupt\n\t\t\tit,<sup class='fn'>25</sup> and turn the noblest of its people into the most\n\t\t\tabject. And this is the way they [always] behave.<sup class='fn'>26</sup>
Hence, behold, I am going to send a gift to those [people], and\n\t\t\tawait whatever [answer] the envoys bring back."

Now when [the Queen's messenger] came unto Solomon, he said: "Do
			you people mean to add to my wealth? But that which God has given
			me<sup class='fn'>27</sup> is [so much] better than all that He has given you!
			Nay, it is [only such as] you<sup class='fn'>28</sup> that would rejoice in
			this gift of yours!

"Go thou back unto them [that have sent thee]! For, [God says:]
			'We shall most certainly come upon them with forces which they
			will never be able to withstand, and shall most certainly cause
			them to be driven from that [land of theirs], despicable and
			humbled!"<sup class='fn'>29</sup>

[WHEN SOLOMON learned that the Queen of Sheba was
			coming,<sup class='fn'>30</sup> he said [to his council]: "O you nobles! Which
			of you can bring me her throne ere she and her followers come
			unto me in willing surrender to God?"<sup class='fn'>31</sup>

Said a bold one of the invisible beings [subject to Solomon]: "I\n\t\t\tshall bring it to thee ere thou rise from thy council-seat - for,\n\t\t\tbehold, I am powerful enough to do it, [and] worthy of trust!"

Answered he who was illumined by revela-tion:<sup class='fn'>32</sup> "[Nay,]
			as for me - I shall bring it to thee ere the twinkling of thy eye
			ceases!"<sup class='fn'>33</sup> And when he saw it truly before
			him,<sup class='fn'>34</sup> he exclaimed: "This is [an outcome] of my
			Sustainer's bounty, to test me as to whether I am grateful or
			ungrateful!<sup class='fn'>35</sup> However, he who is grateful [to God] is
			but grateful for his own good; and he who is ungrate-ful [should
			know that], verily, my Sustainer is self-sufficient, most
			generous in giving!"

[And] he continued: "Alter her throne so that she may not know it
			as hers: let us see whether she allows herself to be guided [to
			the truth] or remains one of those who will not be
			guided."<sup class='fn'>36</sup>

And so, as soon as she arrived, she was asked: "Is thy throne
			like this?" She answered: "It is as though it were the
			same!"<sup class='fn'>37</sup> [And Solomon said to his nobles: "She has
			arrived at the truth without any help from us,<sup class='fn'>38</sup> ]
			although it is we who have been given [divine] knowledge before
			her, and have [long ago] surrendered ourselves unto God!

[And she has recognized the truth] although that which she has
			been wont to worship instead of God<sup class='fn'>39</sup> had kept her away
			[from the right path]: for, behold, she is descended of people
			who deny the truth!" <sup class='fn'>40</sup>

[After a while] she was told: "Enter this court!" - but when she
			saw it, she thought that it was a fathomless exDanse of water.
			and she bared her legs.<sup class='fn'>41</sup> Said he: 'Behold, it is [but]
			a court smoothly paved with glass !" <sup class='fn'>42</sup> Cried she: "O my
			Sustainer! I have been sinning against myself [by worshipping
			aught but Thee]: but [now] I have surrendered myself, with
			Solomon, unto the Sustainer of all the worlds!"

AND [likewise], indeed, We sent unto [the tribe of] Thamud their
			brother Salih [with this message]: "Worship God
			alone!"<sup class='fn'>43</sup> - and, behold, they were [split into] two
			factions contending with one another.

Said [Salih to the erring ones]: "Why do you seek to hasten the
			coming upon you of evil instead of hoping for the
			good?<sup class='fn'>44</sup> Why do you not, God to forgive you your sins, so
			that you might graced with His mercy?"

They answered: "We augur evil from thee and those that follow\n\t\t\tthee!"<sup class='fn'>45</sup> Said he: "Your destiny, good or evil, rests\n\t\t\twith God:<sup class='fn'>46</sup> yea, you are people undergoing a test!"
Now there were in the city nine men<sup class='fn'>47</sup> who were wont to\n\t\t\tcommit deeds of depravity all over the land, and would not\n\t\t\treform;

[and] after having bound one another by an oath in God's
			name,<sup class='fn'>48</sup> they said: "Indeed, we shall suddenly fall upon
			him and his household by night [and slay them all]; and then we
			shall boldly say to his next of kin, 'We did not witness the
			destruction of his household - and, behold, we are indeed men of
			truth!'"
And so they devised an evil scheme; but We devised a subtle\n\t\t\tscheme [of Our own], and they perceived it not.
Behold, then, what all their scheming came to in the end: We\n\t\t\tutterly destroyed them and their people, all of them;
and [now] those dwellings of theirs are empty, [ruined] as an\n\t\t\toutcome of their evil deeds. In this, behold, there is a message\n\t\t\tindeed for peo-ple of [innate] knowledge -
seeing that We saved those who had attained to faith and were\n\t\t\tconscious of Us.

AND [thus, too, did We save] Lot, when he said unto his\n\t\t\tpeople:<sup class='fn'>49</sup> "Would you commit this abomination with your\n\t\t\teyes open [to its being against all nature<sup class='fn'>50</sup> ]?
Must you really approach men with lust instead of women? Nay, but\n\t\t\tyou are people without any awareness [of right and wrong]!"
But his people's only answer was this: "Expel [Lot and] Lot's\n\t\t\tfollowers from your township! Verily, they are folk who make\n\t\t\tthemselves out to be pure!"<sup class='fn'>51</sup>
Thereupon We saved him and his household - all but his wife, whom\n\t\t\tWe willed to be among those that stayed behind<sup class='fn'>52</sup> -
the while We rained a rain [of destruction] upon the others: and\n\t\t\tdire is such rain unon all who let themselves be warned [to no\n\t\t\tavail]!<sup class='fn'>53</sup>

SAY: "All praise is due to God, and peace be upon those servants
			of His whom He chose [to be His message-bearers]!" Is not God far
			better than anything to which men [falsely] ascribe a share in
			His divinity?<sup class='fn'>54</sup>

Nay-who is it that has created the heavens and the earth, and
			sends down for you [life-giving] water from the skies? For it is
			by this means that We cause gardens of shining beauty to grow -
			[whereas] it is not in your power to cause [even one single of]
			its trees to grow! Could there be any divine power besides God?
			Nay, they [who think so] are people who swerve [from the path of
			reason]!

Nay - who is it that has made the earth a fitting
			abode<sup class='fn'>55</sup> [for living things], and has caused running
			waters [to flow] in its midst, and has set upon it mountains
			firm, and has placed a barrier between the two great bodies of
			water?<sup class='fn'>56</sup> Could there be any divine power besides God?
			Nay, most of those [who think so] do not know [what they are
			saying]!

Nay - who is it that responds to the distressed when he calls out
			to Him, and who removes the ill [that caused the distress], and
			has made you inherit the earth?<sup class='fn'>57</sup> Could there be any
			divine power besides God? How seldom do you keep this in mind!

Nay - who is it that guides you in the midst of the deep darkness
			of land and sea,<sup class='fn'>58</sup> and sends forth the winds as a glad
			tiding of His coming grace?<sup class='fn'>59</sup> Could there be any divine
			power besides God? Sublimely exalted is God above anything to
			which men may ascribe a share in His divinity!

Nay - who is it that creates [all life] in the first instance,
			and then brings it forth anew?<sup class='fn'>60</sup> And who is it that
			provides you with sustenance out of heaven and earth?<sup class='fn'>61</sup>
			Could there be any divine power besides God? Say: "[If you think
			so,] produce your evidence - if you truly believe in your
			claim!"<sup class='fn'>62</sup>

Say: "None in the heavens or on earth knows the hidden reality
			[of anything that exists: none knows it] save God."<sup class='fn'>63</sup>
			And neither can they [who are living] perceive when they shall be
			raised from the dead:

nay, their knowledge of the life to come stops short of the\n\t\t\ttruth:<sup class='fn'>64</sup> nay, they are [often] in doubt as to its\n\t\t\treality: nay, they are blind to it.<sup class='fn'>65</sup>
And so, they who are bent on denying the truth are saying: "What!\n\t\t\tAfter we have become dust-we and our forefathers - shall we\n\t\t\t[all], forsooth, be brought forth [from the dead]?
Indeed, we were promised this - we and our forefathers - in the\n\t\t\tpast as well; it is nothing but fables of ancient times!"
Say: "Go all over the earth and behold what happened in the end\n\t\t\tto those [who were thus] lost in sin!"<sup class='fn'>66</sup>
But do not grieve over them, and neither be distressed by the\n\t\t\tfalse arguments which they devise [against God's\n\t\t\tmessages].<sup class='fn'>67</sup>
And [when] they ask, "When is this promise [of resurrection] to\n\t\t\tbe fulfilled? [Answer this, O you who believe in it,] if you are\n\t\t\tmen of truth!" -
say thou: "It may well be that something of that which [in your\n\t\t\tignorance] you so hastily demand<sup class='fn'>68</sup> has already drawn\n\t\t\tclose unto you...."
Now, verily, thy Sustainer is indeed limitless in His bounty unto\n\t\t\tmen - but most of them are bereft of gratitude.
But, verily, thy Sustainer knows all that their hearts conceal as\n\t\t\twell as all that they
for there is nothing [so deeply] hidden in the heavens or on\n\t\t\tearth but is recorded in [His] clear decree.
