			accept their repen-tance:<sup class='fn'>27</sup> for, verily, God is indeed
			much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!

Thus, for all their fury, God repulsed those who were bent on
			denying the truth;<sup class='fn'>28</sup> no advantage did they gain, since
			God was enough to [protect] the believers in battle - seeing that
			God is most powerful, almighty-;

and He brought down from their strongholds those of the followers
			of earlier reve-lation who had aided the aggressors,<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
			and cast terror into their hearts: some you slew, and some you
			made captive;

and He made you heirs to their lands, and their houses, and their\n\t\t\tgoods - and [promised you] lands on which you had never yet set\n\t\t\tfoot:<sup class='fn'>30</sup> for God has indeed the Dower to will anvthine.

O PROPHET! Say unto thy wives: "If you desire [but] the life of\n\t\t\tthis world and its charms - well, then, I shall provide for you\n\t\t\tand release you in a becoming manner;<sup class='fn'>31</sup>

but if you desire God and His Apostle, and [thus the good of] the\n\t\t\tlife in the hereafter, then [know that], verily, for the doers of\n\t\t\tgood among you God has readied a mighty reward!"<sup class='fn'>32</sup>

O wives of the Prophet! If any of you were to become guilty of
			manifestly immoral con luct,<sup class='fn'>33</sup> double [that of other
			sinners] would be her suffering [in the hereafter]: for that is
			indeed easy for God.

But if any of you devoutly obeys God and His Apostle and does
			good deeds, on her shall We bestow her reward twice-over: for We
			shall have readied for her a most excellent sustenance [in the
			life to ccle].<sup class='fn'>34</sup>

O wives of the Prophet! You are not like any of the [other]
			women, provided that you remain [truly] conscious of
			God.<sup class='fn'>35</sup> Hence, be not over-soft in your speech, lest any
			whose heart is diseased should be moved to desire [you]: but,
			withal, speak in a kindly way.

And abide quietly in your homes, and do not flaunt your charms as
			they used to flaunt them in the old days of pagan
			ignorance;<sup class='fn'>36</sup> and be constant in prayer, and render the
			purifying dues, and pay heed unto God and His Apostle: for God
			only wants to remove from you all that might be loathsome, O you
			members of the [Prophet's] household, and to purify you to utmost
			purity.
And bear in mind all that is recited in your homes of God's\n\t\t\tmessages and [His] wisdom: for God is unfathomable [in His\n\t\t\twisdom], all-aware.<sup class='fn'>37</sup>

VERILY, for all men and women who have sur-rendered themselves
			unto God, and all believing men and believing women, and all
			truly devout men and truly devout women, and all men and women
			who are true to their word, and all men and women who are patient
			in adversity, and all men and women who humble themselves [before
			God], and all men and women who give in charity, and all
			self-denying men and self-denying women,<sup class='fn'>38</sup> and all men
			and women who are mindful of their chastity,<sup class='fn'>39</sup> and all
			men and women who remember God unceasingly: for [all of] them has
			God readied forgiveness of sins and a mighty reward.

Now whenever God and His Apostle have decided a
			matter,<sup class='fn'>40</sup> it is not for a believing man or a believing
			woman to claim freedom of choice insofar as they themselves are
			concerned:<sup class='fn'>41</sup> for he who [thus] rebels against God and
			His Apostle has already, most obviously, gone astray.

AND Lo,<sup class='fn'>42</sup> [O Muhammad,] thou didst say unto the one to
			whom God had shown favour and to whom thou hadst shown
			favour,<sup class='fn'>43</sup> "Hold on to thy wife, and remain conscious of
			God!" And [thus] wouldst thou hide within thyself something that
			God was about to bring to light<sup class='fn'>44</sup> - for thou didst stand
			in awe of [what] people [might think], whereas it was God alone
			of whom thou shouldst have stood in awe!<sup class='fn'>45</sup> [But] then,
			when Zayd had come to the end of his union with her,<sup class='fn'>46</sup>
			We gave her to thee in marriage, so that [in future] no blame
			should attach to the be-lievers for [marrying] the spouses of
			their adopted children when the latter have come to the end of
			their union with them.<sup class='fn'>47</sup> And [thus] God's will was done.

[Hence,] no blame whatever attaches to the Prophet for [having
			done] what God has ordained for him.<sup class='fn'>48</sup> [Indeed, such
			was] God's way with those that have passed away
			aforetime<sup class='fn'>49</sup> -and [remember that] God's will is always
			destiny absolute-;

[and such will always be His way with] those who convey God's
			messages [to the world], and stand in awe of Him, and hold none
			but God in awe: for none can take count [of man's doings] as God
			does!

[And know, O believers, that] Muhammad is not the father of any
			one of your men,<sup class='fn'>50</sup> but is God's Apostle and the Seal of
			all Prophets.<sup class='fn'>51</sup> And God has indeed full knowledae of
			evervthina.
O YOU who have attained to faith! Remember God with unceasing\n\t\t\tremembrance,
and extol His limitless glory from morn to evening.<sup class='fn'>52</sup>

He it is who bestows His blessings upon you, with His angels
			[echoing Him], so that He might take you out of the depths of
			darkness into the light. And, indeed, a dispenser of grace is He
			unto the believers.
On the Day when they meet Him, they will be welcomed with the\n\t\t\tgreeting, "Peace"; and He will have readied for them a most\n\t\t\texcellent reward.
[And as for thee,] O Prophet - behold, We have sent thee as a\n\t\t\twitness [to the truth], and as a herald of glad tidings and a\n\t\t\twarner,
and as one who summons [all men] to God by His leave,<sup class='fn'>53</sup>\n\t\t\tand as a light-giving beacon.
And [so,] convey to the believers the glad tiding that a great\n\t\t\tbounty from God awaits them;

and defer not to [the likes and dislikes of] the deniers of the
			truth and the hypocrites, and disregard their hurtful
			talk,<sup class='fn'>54</sup> and place thy trust in God: for none is as
			worthy of trust as God.

O YOU who have attained to faith! If you marry believing women
			and then divorce them ere you have touched them, you have no
			reason to expect, and to calculate, any waiting-period on their
			part:<sup class='fn'>55</sup> hence, make [at once] provision for them, and
			release them in a becoming manner.<sup class='fn'>56</sup>

O PROPHET! Behold, We have made lawful to thee thy wives unto
			whom thou hast paid their dowers,<sup class='fn'>57</sup> as well as those
			whom thy right hand has come to possess from among the captives
			of war whom God has bestowed upon thee.<sup class='fn'>58</sup> And [We have
			made lawful to thee] the daughters of thy paternal uncles and
			aunts, and the daughters of thy maternal uncles and aunts, who
			have migrated with thee [to Yathrib];<sup class='fn'>59</sup> and any
			believing woman who offers herself freely to the Prophet and whom
			the Prophet might be willing to wed:<sup class='fn'>60</sup> [this latter
			being but] a privilege for thee, and not for other believers-
			[seeing that] We have already made known what We have enjoined
			upon them with regard to their wives and those whom their right
			hands may possess.<sup class='fn'>61</sup> [And] in order that thou be not
			burdened with [undue] anxiety - for God is indeed much-forgiving,
			a dispenser of grace-

[know that] thou mayest put off for a time whichever of them thou
			pleases", and mayest take unto thee whichever thou pleases"; and
			[that,] if thou seek out any from whom thou hast kept away [for a
			time], thou wilt incur no sin [thereby]:<sup class='fn'>62</sup> this will
			make it more likely that their eyes are gladdened [whenever they
			see thee],<sup class='fn'>63</sup> and that they do not grieve [whenever they
			are overlooked], and that all of them may find contentment in
			whatever thou hast to give them: for God [alone] knows what is in
			your hearts - and God is indeed all-knowing,
			forbearing.<sup class='fn'>64</sup>

No [other] women shall henceforth be lawful to thee<sup class='fn'>65</sup> -
			nor art thou [allowed] to supplant [any of] them by other
			wives,<sup class='fn'>66</sup> even though their beauty should please thee
			greatly-: [none shall be lawful to thee] beyond those whom thou
			[already] hast come to possess.<sup class='fn'>67</sup> And God keeps watch
			over everything.

0 YOU who have attained to faith! Do not enter the Prophet's
			dwellings unless you are given leave; [and when invited] to a
			meal, do not come [so early as] to wait for it to be readied: but
			whenever you are invited, enter [at the proper time]; and when
			you have partaken of the meal, disperse without lingering for the
			sake of mere talk: that, behold, might give offence to the
			Prophet, and yet he might feel shy of [asking] you [to leave]:
			but God is not shy of [teaching you] what is right.<sup class='fn'>68</sup>
			And [as for the Prophet's wives,] whenever you ask them for
			anything that you need, ask them from behind a screen:<sup class='fn'>69</sup>
			this will but deepen the purity of your hearts and theirs.
			Moreover, it does not behove you to give offence to God's Apostle
			- just as it would not behove you ever to marry his widows after
			he has passed away:<sup class='fn'>70</sup> that. verily, would be an enormity
			in the sight of God.
Whether you do anything openly or in secret, [remember that,]\n\t\t\tverily, God has full knowledge of everything.

[However,] it is no sin for them<sup class='fn'>71</sup> [to appear freely]
			before their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or their
			brothers' sons, or their sisters' sons, or their womenfolk, or
			such [male slaves] as their right hands may possess. But [always,
			O wives of the Prophet,<sup class='fn'>72</sup> ] remain con-scious of God -
			for, behold, God is witness unto everything.
Verily, God and His angels bless the Prophet: [hence,] O you who\n\t\t\thave attained to faith, bless him and give yourselves up [to his\n\t\t\tguidance] in utter self-surrender!

Verily, as for those who [knowingly] affront God and His Apostle\n\t\t\t- God will reject them<sup class='fn'>73</sup> in this world and in the life\n\t\t\tto come; and shameful suffering will He ready for them.

And as for those who malign believing men and believing women
			without their having done any wrong - they surely burden
			themselves with the guilt of calumny, and [thus] with a flagrant
			sin!

O Prophet! Tell thy wives and thy daughters, as well as all
			[other] believing women, that they should draw over themselves
			some of their outer garments [when in public]: this will be more
			con-ducive to their being recognized [as decent women] and not
			annoyed.<sup class='fn'>74</sup> But [withal,] God is indeed much-forgiving, a
			dispenser of grace!<sup class='fn'>75</sup>

THUS IT IS: if <sup class='fn'>76</sup> the hypocrites, and they in whose
			hearts is disease,<sup class='fn'>77</sup> and they who, by spreading false
			rumours, would cause disturbances<sup class='fn'>78</sup> in the City [of the
			Prophet] desist not [from their hostile doings], We shall indeed
			give thee mastery over them, [O Muhammad] - and then they will
			not remain thy neighbours in this [city] for more than a little
			while:<sup class='fn'>79</sup>
bereft of God's grace, they shall be seized wherever they may be\n\t\t\tfound, and slain one and all.<sup class='fn'>80</sup>
Such has been God's way with those who [sinned in like manner\n\t\t\tand] passed away aforetime - and never wilt thou find any change\n\t\t\tin God's way!<sup class='fn'>81</sup>
PEOPLE will ask thee about the Last Hour. Say: "Knowledge thereof\n\t\t\trests with God alone; yet for all thou knowest, the Last Hour may\n\t\t\twell be near!"<sup class='fn'>82</sup>
Verily, God has rejected the deniers of the truth, and has\n\t\t\treadied for them a blazing fire,
therein to abide heyond the count of time: no protec-tor will\n\t\t\tthey find, and none to bring them succour.
On the Day when their faces shall be tossed about in the\n\t\t\tfire,<sup class='fn'>83</sup> they will exclaim, "Oh, would that we had paid\n\t\t\theed unto God, and paid heed unto the Apostle!"
And they will say: O our Sustainer! Behold, we paid heed unto our\n\t\t\tleaders and our great men, and it is they who have led us astray\n\t\t\tfrom the right path!
O our Sustainer! Give them double suffering, and banish them\n\t\t\tutterly from Thy 9race!"<sup class='fn'>84</sup>

O YOU who have attained to faith! Be not like those [children of
			Israel] who gave offence to Moses, and [remember that] God showed
			him to be innocent of whatever they alleged [against him or
			demanded of him j:<sup class='fn'>85</sup> for of great honour was he in the
			sight of God.
O you who have attained to faith! Remain conscious of God, and\n\t\t\t[always] speak with a will to bring out [only] what is just and\n\t\t\ttrue<sup class='fn'>86</sup>
[whereupon! He will cause your deeds to he virtuous. and will\n\t\t\tforgive you your sins. And [know that] whoever pays heed unto God\n\t\t\tand His Apostle has already attained to a mighty triumph.

Verily, We did offer the trust [of reason and volition] to the
			heavens, and the earth, and the mountains:<sup class='fn'>87</sup> but they
			refused to bear it because they were afraid of it. Yet man took
			it up<sup class='fn'>88</sup> - for, verily, he has always been prone to be
			most wicked, most foolish.

[And so it is] that God imposes suffering on the hypocrites, both
			men and women, as well as on the men and women who ascribe
			divinity to aught beside Him.<sup class='fn'>89</sup> And [so, too, it is]
			that God turns in His mercy unto the believing men and believing
			women: for God is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace!

All PRAISE s due to God, to whom all that is in the heavens and
			all that is one on earth belongs; and to Him will be due all
			praise in the life of the come. For He alone is truly wise,
			all-aware:

He knows all that enters the earth, and all that comes out of it,
			as well as all that descends from the skies, and all that ascends
			to them.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> And He alone is a dispenser of grace,
			truly-forgiving.

And yet, they who are bent on denying the truth assert, "Never
			will the Last Hour come upon us!"<sup class='fn'>2</sup> Say: "Nay, by my
			Sustainer! By Him who knows all that is beyond the reach of a
			created being's perception: it will most certainly come upon
			you!" Not an atom's weight [of whatever there is] in the heavens
			or on earth escapes His knowledge; and neither is there anything
			smaller than that, or larger, but is recorded in [His] clear
			decree,
to the end that He may reward those who believe and do right-eous\n\t\t\tdeeds: [for] it is they whom forgiveness of sins awaits, and a\n\t\t\tmost excellent sustenance<sup class='fn'>3</sup> -
whereas for those who strive against Our messages, seeking to\n\t\t\tdefeat their purpose, there is grievous sufferinR in store as an\n\t\t\toutcome of [their] vileness.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>

NOW THEY who are endowed with [innate] knowl-edge are well aware
			that whatever has been be-stowed upon thee from on high by thy
			Sustainer is indeed the truth, and that it guides onto the way
			that leads to the Almighty, the One to whom all praise is due!

As against this, they who are bent on denying the truth say [unto
			all who are of like mind]: "Shall we point out to you a man who
			will tell you that [after your death,] when you will have been
			scattered in countless fragments, you shall-lo and behold!-be
			[restored to life] in a new act of creation?

Does he [knowingly] attribute his own Iying inventions to God -
			or is he a madman?" Nay, [there is no madness in this Prophet-]
			but they who will not believe in the life to come are [bound to
			lose themselves] in suffering and in a profound
			aberration.<sup class='fn'>5</sup>

Are they, then, not aware of how little of the sky and the earth
			lies open before them, and how much is hidden from
			them?<sup class='fn'>6</sup> - [or that,] if We so willed. We could cause the
			earth to swallow them,<sup class='fn'>7</sup> or cause fragments of the sky to
			fall down upon them?<sup class='fn'>8</sup> In all this, behold, there is a
			message indeed for every servant [of God] who is wont to turn
			unto Him [in repentance].<sup class='fn'>9</sup>

AND [thus], indeed, did We grace David with Our
			favour:<sup class='fn'>10</sup> "O you mountains! Sing with him the praise of
			God! And [likewise] you birds!"<sup class='fn'>11</sup> And We softened all
			sharpness in him,<sup class='fn'>12</sup>

[and inspired him thus:] "Do good deeds lavishly, without stint.
			and eive deep thou~ht to their steady flow."<sup class='fn'>13</sup> And [thus
			should you all, O believers,] do righteous deeds: for. verily I
			see all that you do!

AND UNTO Solomon [We made subservient] the wind: its morning
			course [covered the distance of] a month's journey, and its
			evening course, a month's Journey.<sup class='fn'>14</sup> And We caused a
			fountain of molten copper to flow at his behest;<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and
			[even] among the invisible beings there were some that had [been
			constrained] to labour for him<sup class='fn'>16</sup> by his Sustainer's
			leave - and whichever of them deviated from Our command, him
			would We let taste suffering through a blazing flame -:

they made for him whatever he wished of sanctuaries, and statues,
			and basins as [large as] great watering-troughs, and cauldrons
			firmly anchored.<sup class='fn'>17</sup> [And We said:] "Labour, O David's
			people, in gratitude [towards Me]<sup class='fn'>18</sup> - and [remember
			that] few are the truly grateful [even] among My
			servants!"<sup class='fn'>19</sup>

Yet [even Solomon had to die; but] when We decreed that he should
			die, nothing showed them that he was dead except an earthworm
			that gnawed away his staff.<sup class='fn'>20</sup> And when he fell to the
			ground, those invisible beings [subservient to him] saw clearly
			that, had they but understood the reality which was be-yond the
			reach of their perception,<sup class='fn'>21</sup> they would not have
			continued [to toil] in the shameful suffering [of servitude],
			<sup class='fn'>22</sup>

INDEED, in [the luxuriant beauty of] their homeland, the DeoDIe
			of Sheba had an evidence [of God's grace]<sup class='fn'>23</sup> - two [vast
			expanses of] gardens, to the right and to the left, [calling out
			to them, as it were:] "Eat of what your Sustainer has provided
			for you, and render thanks unto Him: a land most goodly, and a
			Sustainer much-forgiving!"

But they turned away [from Us], and so We let loose upon them a
			flood that overwhelmed the dams,<sup class='fn'>24</sup> and changed their two
			[expanses of luxuriant] gardens into a couple of gardens yielding
			bitter fruit, and tamarisks, and some few [wild] lote-trees:
thus We requited them for their having denied the truth. But do\n\t\t\tWe ever requite [thus] any but the utterly ingrate?<sup class='fn'>25</sup>

Now [before their downfall,] We had placed between them and the
			cities which We had blessed<sup class='fn'>26</sup> [many] towns within sight
			of one another; and thus We had made travelling easy [for them,
			as if to say]: "Travel safely in this [land], by night or by
			day!"

But now they would say, "Long has our Sus-tainer made the
			distance between our journey-stages!"<sup class='fn'>27</sup> - for they had
			sinned against themselves. And in the end We caused them to
			become [one of those] tales [of things long past], and scattered
			them in countless fragments.<sup class='fn'>28</sup> Herein, behold, there are
			messages indeed for all who are wholly patient in adversity and
			deeply grate-ful [to God].
Now, indeed, Iblls did prove that his opinion of them had been\n\t\t\tright:<sup class='fn'>29</sup> for [when he called them,] they followed him -\n\t\t\tall but some of the believers [among them].

And yet, he had no power at all over them:<sup class='fn'>30</sup> [for if We
			allow him to tempt man,] it is only to the end that We might make
			a clear distinction between those who [truly] believe in the life
			to come and those who are in doubt thereof:<sup class='fn'>31</sup> for thy
			Sustainer watches over all things.

SAY: "Call upon those [beings] whom you imagine [to be endowed
			with divine powers] beside God: they have not an atom's weight of
			power either in the heavens or on earth, nor have they any share
			in [governing] either, nor does He [choose to] have any helper
			from among them."<sup class='fn'>32</sup>

And, before Him, intercession can be of no avail [to any] save
			one in whose case He may have granted leave
			[therefor]:<sup class='fn'>33</sup> so much so that when the terror [of the
			Last Hour] is lifted from their hearts, they [who have been
			resurrected] will ask [one an-other], "What has your Sustainer
			decreed [for you]?" - [to which] the others will answer,
			"Whatever is true and deserved<sup class='fn'>34</sup> -for He alone is
			exalted, great!"

Say: "Who is it that provides for you tenance out of the heavens
			and the earth?"<sup class='fn'>35</sup> Say: "It is God. And, behold, either
			we [who believe in Him] or you [who deny His oneness] are on the
			right path, or have clearly gone astray!"
Say: "Neither shall you be called to account for whatever we may\n\t\t\thave become guilty of, nor shall we be called to account for\n\t\t\twhatever you are doing."

Say: "Our Sustainer will bring us all together [on Judgment Day],\n\t\t\tand then He will lay open the truth between us, in justice-for He\n\t\t\talone is the One who opens all truth, the All-Knowing!"
Say: "Point out to me those [beings] that you have joined with\n\t\t\tHim [in your minds] as partners [in His divinity]! Nay-nay, but\n\t\t\tHe [alone] is God, the Almighty, the Wise!"
NOW [as for thee, O Muhammad,] We have not sent thee otherwise\n\t\t\tthan to mankind at large, to be a herald of glad tidings and a\n\t\t\twarner; but most people do not understand [this],
and so they ask, "When is this promise [of resurrection and\n\t\t\tjudgment] to be fulfilled? [Answer this, O you who believe in\n\t\t\tit,] if you are men of truth!"<sup class='fn'>36</sup>
Say: "There has been appointed for you a Day which you can\n\t\t\tneither delay nor advance by a single moment."<sup class='fn'>37</sup>

And [yet,] those who are bent on denying the truth do say, "We
			shall never believe in this Qur'an, and neither in whatever there
			still remains of earlier revelations!"<sup class='fn'>38</sup> But if thou
			couldst only see [how it will be on Judgment Day,] when these
			evildoers shall be made to stand before their Sustainer, hurling
			reproaches back and forth at one another! Those [of them] who had
			been weak [on earth] will say unto those who had gloried in their
			arrogance:<sup class='fn'>39</sup> "Had it not been for you, we would
			certainly have been believers!"

[And] those who were wont to glory in their arrogance will say
			unto those who had been weak: "Why - did we keep you [forcibly]
			from following the right path after it had become obvious to
			you?<sup class='fn'>40</sup> Nay, it was but you [yourselves] who were
			guilty!"

But those who had been weak will say unto those who had gloried
			in their arrogance: "Nay, [what kept us away was your] devising
			of false arguments, night and day,<sup class='fn'>41</sup> [against God's
			messages - as you did] when you persuaded us to blaspheme against
			God and to claim that there are powers that could rival Him
			!<sup class='fn'>42</sup> And when they see the suffering [that awaits them],
			they will [all] be unable to express [the full depth of] their
			remorse:<sup class='fn'>43</sup> for We shall have put shackles around the
			necks of those who had been bent on denying the truth:<sup class='fn'>44</sup>
			[and] will this be aught but a [just] requital for what they were
			doing?

For [thus it is:] whenever We sent a warner to any community,
			those of its people who had lost themselves entirely in the
			pursuit of pleasures<sup class='fn'>45</sup> would declare, "Behold, we deny
			that there is any truth in [what you claim to be] your message!"-
and they would add, "Richer [than you] are we in wealth and in\n\t\t\tchildren, and [so] we are not going to be made to\n\t\t\tsuffer!"<sup class='fn'>46</sup>
Say: "Behold, my Sustainer grants abundant sustenance, or gives\n\t\t\tit in scant measure, unto whomever He wills: but most men do not\n\t\t\tunderstand [God's ways]."<sup class='fn'>47</sup>

For, it is neither your riches nor your children that can bring
			you nearer to Us: only he who attains to faith and does what is
			right and just [comes near unto Us]; and it is [such as] these
			whom multiple recompense awaits for all that they have done; and
			it is they who shall dwell secure in the mansions [of paradise] -
whereas all who strive against Our messages, seeking to defeat\n\t\t\ttheir purpose, shall be given over to suffering.

Say: "Behold, my Sustainer grants abundant sustenance, or gives
			it in scant measure, unto whomever He wills of His
			servants;<sup class='fn'>48</sup> and whatever it be that you spend on others,
			He [always] replaces it:<sup class='fn'>49</sup> for He is the best of
			providers."
And [as for those who now deny the truth,] one Day He will gather\n\t\t\tthem all together, and will ask the angels, "Was it you that they\n\t\t\twere wont to worship?"<sup class='fn'>50</sup>

They will answer: "Limitless art Thou in Thy glory! Thou [alone]
			art close unto us, not they!<sup class='fn'>51</sup> Nay, [when they thought
			that they were worshipping us,] they were but [blindly]
			worshipping forces concealed from their senses; most of them
			believed in the,<sup class='fn'>52</sup>

And [on that Day God will say]: "None of you [created beings] has
			today any power to benefit or to harm another!" And [then] We
			shall say unto those who had been bent on evildoing: "Taste [now]
			that suffering through fire which you were wont to call a lie!"

For [thus it is:] whenever Our messages are conveyed unto them in
			all their clarity, they [who are bent on denying the truth] say
			[to one another], "This [Muhammad] is nothing but a man who wants
			to turn you away from what your forefathers were wont to
			worship!" And they say, "This [Qur'an] is nothing but a falsehood
			invented [by man]!" And [finally,] they who are bent on denying
			the truth speak thus of the truth when it comes to them: "This is
			clearly nothing but spellbinding eloquence!"<sup class='fn'>53</sup>
And yet, [O Muhammad,] never have We vouchsafed them any\n\t\t\trevelations which they could quote,<sup class='fn'>54</sup> and neither have\n\t\t\tWe sent unto them any warner before thee.

Thus, too, gave the lie to the truth [many of] those who lived
			before them; and although those [earlier people] had not attained
			to even a tenth of [the evidence of the truth] which We have
			vouch-safed unto these [late successors of theirs], yet when they
			gave the lie to My apostles, how awesome was My
			rejection!<sup class='fn'>55</sup>

Say: "I counsel you one thing only: Be [ever-conscious of]
			standing before God, whether you are in the company of others or
			alone;<sup class='fn'>56</sup> and then bethink yourselves [that] there is no
			madness in [this pro-phet,] your fellow-man:<sup class='fn'>57</sup> he is
			only a warner to you of suffering severe to come."
Say: "No reward have I ever asked of you [out of anything] that\n\t\t\tis yours:<sup class='fn'>58</sup> my reward rests with none but God, and He is\n\t\t\twitness unto everything!"

Say: "Verily, my Sustainer hurls the truth [against all that is\n\t\t\tfalse]<sup class='fn'>59</sup> -He who fully knows all the things that are\n\t\t\tbeyond the reach of a created being's perception!"

Say: "The truth has now come [to light, and falsehood is bound to
			wither away<sup class='fn'>60</sup> ]: for, falsehood cannot bring forth
			anything new, nor can it bring back [what has passed
			away]."<sup class='fn'>61</sup>

Say: "Were I to go astray, I would but go astray [due to my own
			self, and] to the hurt of myself;<sup class='fn'>62</sup> but if I am on the
			right path, it is but by virtue of what my Sustainer reveals unto
			me: for, verily. He is all-hearing. ever-near!"

IF THOU couldst but see [how the deniers of the truth will fare
			on Resurrection Day,] when they will shrink in terror, with
			nowhere to escape - since they will have been seized from so
			close nearby<sup class='fn'>63</sup> -
But how can they [hope to] attain [to salvation] from so far\n\t\t\taway,<sup class='fn'>64</sup>

seeing that aforetime they had been bent on denying the truth,\n\t\t\tand had been wont to cast scorn, from far away, on something that\n\t\t\twas beyond the reach of human perception?<sup class='fn'>65</sup>

And so, a barrier will be set between them and all that they had
			[ever] desired,<sup class='fn'>66</sup> as will be done to such of their kind
			as lived before their time: for, behold, they [too] were lost in
			doubt amounting to suspicion<sup class='fn'>67</sup>

ALL PRAISE is due to God, Originator of the heavens and the
			earth, who causes the angels to be [His] message-bearers, endowed
			with wings, two, or three, or four.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> [Unceasingly] He
			adds to His creation whatever He wills:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> for, verily,
			God has the power to will anything.
Whatever grace God opens up to man, none can withhold it; and\n\t\t\twhatever He withholds, none can henceforth release: for He alone\n\t\t\tis almighty, truly wise.

O men! Call to mind the blessings which God has bestowed upon
			you! Is there any creator, other than God, that could provide for
			you sustenance out of heaven and earth?<sup class='fn'>3</sup> There is no
			deity save Him: and yet, how perverted are your minds!<sup class='fn'>4</sup>

But if they [whose minds are perverted] give thee the lie, [O
			Prophet, remember that] even so, before thy time, have [other]
			apostles been given the lie: for [the unbelievers always refuse
			to admit that] all things go back to God [as their source].

0 MEN! Verily, God's promise [of resurrection] is true indeed:\n\t\t\tlet not, then, the life of this world delude you, and let not\n\t\t\t[your own] deceptive thoughts about God delude you!<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
Behold, Satan is a foe unto you: so treat him as a foe. He but\n\t\t\tcalls on his followers to the end that they might find themselves\n\t\t\tamong such as are des-tined for the blazing flame

[seeing that] for those who are bent on denying the truth there
			is suffering severe in store, just as for those who have attained
			to faith and do righteous deeds there is forgiveness of sins, and
			a great reward.

Is, then, he to whom the evil of his own doings is [so] alluring
			that [in the end] he regards it as good [anything but a follower
			of Satan]? For, verily, God lets go astray him that wills [to go
			astray], just as He guides him that wills [to be
			guided].<sup class='fn'>6</sup> Hence, [O believer,] do not waste thyself in
			sorrowing over them: verily, God has full knowledge of all that
			they do!

AND [remember:] it is God who sends forth the winds, so that they
			raise a cloud, whereupon We drive it towards dead land and
			thereby give life to the earth after it had been lifeless: even
			thus shall resur-rection be!

He who desires might and glory [ought to know that] all might and
			glory belong to God [alone]. Unto Him ascend all good words, and
			the righteous deed does He exalt. But as for those who cunningly
			devise evil deeds - suffering severe awaits them; and all their
			devising is bound to come to nought.<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

And [remember:] God creates [every one of] you out of
			dust,<sup class='fn'>8</sup> then out of a drop of sperm; and then He fashions
			you into either of the two sexes.<sup class='fn'>9</sup> And no female
			conceives or gives birth unless it be with His knowledge; and
			none that is long-lived has his days lengthened - and neither is
			aught lessened of his days-unless it be thus laid down in [God sl
			decree: for, behold, all this is easy for God.

[Easy is it for Him to create likeness and variety:"<sup class='fn'>10</sup>]
			thus, the two great bodies of water [on earth]<sup class='fn'>11</sup> are not
			alike-the one sweet, thirst-allaying, pleasant to drink, and the
			other salty and bitter: and yet, from either of them do you eat
			fresh meat, and [from either] you take gems which you may wear;
			and on either thou canst see ships ploughing through the waves,
			so that you might [be able to] go forth in quest of some of His
			bounty, and thus have cause to be grateful.

He makes the night grow longer by shortening the day, and He
			makes the day grow longer by shortening the night; and He has
			made the sun and the moon subservient [to His laws], each running
			its course for a term set [by Him].<sup class='fn'>12</sup> Thus is God, your
			Sustainer: unto Him belongs all dominion-whereas those whom you
			invoke instead of Him do not own so much as the husk of a
			date-stone!

If you invoke them, they do not hear your call; and even if they
			could hear, they would not [be able to] respond to you. And
			[withal,] on the Day of Resurrection they will utterly disown
			your having associated them with God.<sup class='fn'>13</sup> And none can
			make thee understand [the truth] like the One who is all-aware.
O men! It is you who stand in need of God, whereas He alone is\n\t\t\tself-sufficient, the One to whom all praise is due.
If He so wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new\n\t\t\tmankind [in your stead]:<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
nor is this difficult for God.

AND NO BEARER of burdens shall be made to hear another's
			burden;<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and if one weighed down by his load calls upon
			[another] to help him carry it, nothing thereof may be carried
			[by that other], even if it be one's near of kin.<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
			Hence, thou canst [truly] warn only those who stand in awe of
			their Sustainer although He is beyond the reach of their
			perception,<sup class='fn'>17</sup> and are constant in prayer, and [know
			that] whoever grows in purity, attains to purity but for the good
			of his own self, and [that] with God is all journeys' end.
For [thus it is:] the blind and the seeing are not equal;
nor are the depths of darkness and the light;
nor the [cooling] shade and the scorching heat:

and neither are equal the living and the dead [of heart]. Behold,
			[O Muhammad,] God can make hear whomever He wills, whereas thou
			canst not make hear such as are [dead of heart like the dead] in
			their graves:
thou art nothing but a warner.

Verily, We have sent thee with the truth, as a bearer of glad\n\t\t\ttidings and a warner: for there never was any community but a\n\t\t\twarner has [lived and] passed away in its midst.<sup class='fn'>18</sup>

And if they give thee the lie - even so gave the lie to the truth
			[many of] those who lived before their time, [when] there came
			unto them their apostles with all evidence of the truth, and with
			books of divine wisdom, and with light-giving revelation;
[but] in the end I took to task all those who were bent on\n\t\t\tdenying the truth: and how awesome was My rejection!

ART THOU NOT aware that God sends down water from the skies
			wherehv We bring forth fruits of many hues - just as in the
			mountains there are streaks of white and red of various shades,
			as well as [others] raven-black,

and [as] there are in men, and in crawling beasts, and in cattle,
			too, many hues?<sup class='fn'>19</sup> Of all His servants, only such as are
			endowed with [innate] knowledge<sup class='fn'>20</sup> stand [truly] in awe
			of God: [for they alone comprehend that,] verily, God is
			almighty, much-forgiving.

[It is] they who [truly] follow God's revelation and are constant
			in prayer, and spend on others, secretly and openly, out of what
			We provide for them as sustenance-it is they who may look forward
			to a bargain that can never fail,
since He will grant them their just rewards, and give them yet\n\t\t\tmore out of His bounty: for, verily, He is much-forgiving,\n\t\t\tever-responsive to gratitude.

And [know that] all of the divine writ with which We have
			inspired thee is the very truth, confirming the truth of whatever
			there still remains of earlier revelations<sup class='fn'>21</sup> - for,
			behold, of [the needs of] His servants God is fully aware,
			all-seeing.

And so, We have bestowed this divine writ as a heritage unto such
			of Our servants as We chose: and among them are some who sin
			against themselves; and some who keep half-way [between right and
			wrong];<sup class='fn'>22</sup> and some who, by God's leave, are fore-most in
			deeds of goodness: [and] this, indeed, is a merit most high!
[Hence,] gardens of perpetual bliss will they enter, therein to\n\t\t\tbe adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and therein to be\n\t\t\tclad in raiments of silk;<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
and they will say: "All praise is due to God, who has caused all\n\t\t\tsorrow to leave us: for, verily, our Sustainer is indeed\n\t\t\tmuch-forgiving, ever-responsive to gratitude
He who, out of His bounty, has made us alight in this abode of\n\t\t\tlife enduring, wherein no struggle can assail us, and wherein no\n\t\t\tweariness can touch us!"

But as for those who are bent on denying the truth - the fire of
			hell awaits them: no end shall be put to their lives so that they
			could die, nor shall aught of the suffering caused by that [fire]
			be lightened for them: thus shall We requite all who are bereft
			of gratitude.

And in that [hell] they will cry aloud: "O our Sustainer! Cause
			us to come out [of this suffering]! We shall [henceforth] do good
			deeds, not such as we were wont to do [aforetime]!" [But We shall
			answer:] "Did We not grant you a life long enough so that whoever
			was willing to take thought could bethink himself? And [withal,]
			a war-ner had come unto you! Taste, then, [the fruit of your evil
			deeds]: for evildoers shall have none to succour them"
VERILY, God knows the hidden reality of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth: [and,] behold, He has full knowledge of what is in the\n\t\t\thearts [of men].

He it is who has made you inherit the earth.<sup class='fn'>24</sup> Hence, he
			who is bent on denying the truth [of God's oneness and uniqueness
			ought to know that] this denial of his will fall back upon him:
			for their [per-sistent] denial of this truth does but add to the
			deniers' loathsomeness in their Sustainer's sight and, thus,
			their denial of this truth does but add to the deniers' loss.

Say: "Have you ever [really] considered those beings and forces
			to whom you ascribe a share in God's divinity,<sup class='fn'>25</sup> [and]
			whom you invoke beside God? Show me what it is that they have
			created on earth - or do [you claim that] they have a share in
			[governing] the heavens?"

Verily, it is God [alone] who upholds the celestial
			bodies<sup class='fn'>29</sup> and the earth, lest they deviate [from their
			orbits]-for if they should ever deviate, there is none that could
			uphold them after He will have ceased to do so.<sup class='fn'>30</sup> [But,]
			verily, He is ever-forbearing, much-for-giving!<sup class='fn'>31</sup>

As it is, they [who are averse to the truth often] swear by God
			with their most solemn oaths that if a warner should ever come to
			them, they would follow his guidance better than any of the
			communities [of old had followed the warner sent to
			them]:<sup class='fn'>32</sup> but now that a warner has come unto them, [his
			call] but increases their aversion,

their arrogant behaviour on earth, and their devising of evil
			[arguments against God's messages].<sup class='fn'>33</sup> Yet [in the end,]
			such evil scheming will engulf none but its authors; and can they
			expect anything but [to be made to go] the way of those [sinners]
			of olden times?<sup class='fn'>34</sup> Thus [it is]: no change wilt thou ever
			find in God's way; yea, no deviation wilt thou ever find in God's
			way!

Have they never journeyed about the earth and beheld what
			happened in the end to those [deniers of the truth] who lived
			before their time and were [so much] greater than they in power?
			And [do they not see that the will of] God can never be foiled by
			anything whatever in the heavens or on earth, since, verily, He
			is all-knowing, infinite in His power?

Now if God were to take men [at once] to task for whatever
			[wrong] they commit [on earth], He would not leave a single
			living creature upon its surface. However, He grants them respite
			for a term set [by Him]:<sup class='fn'>35</sup> but when their term comes to
			an end - then, verily, [they come to know that] God sees all that
			is in Ithe hearts ofl His servants.
O THOU human being!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Consider this Qur'an full of wisdom:
verily, thou art indeed one of God's message-bearers,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
pursuing a straight way
by [virtue of] what is being bestowed from on high by the\n\t\t\tAlmighty, the Dispenser of Grace,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
[bestowed upon thee] so that thou mayest warn people whose\n\t\t\tforefathers had not been warned, and who therefore are unaware\n\t\t\t[of the meaning of right and wrong].<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
Indeed, the word [of God's condemnation] is bound to come\n\t\t\ttrue<sup class='fn'>5</sup> against most of them: for they will not believe.
Behold, around their necks We have put shackles,<sup class='fn'>6</sup>\n\t\t\treaching up to their chins, so that their heads are forced\n\t\t\tup;<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
and We have set a barrier before them and a barrier behind\n\t\t\tthem,<sup class='fn'>8</sup> and We have enshrouded them in veils so that they\n\t\t\tcannot see:
thus, it is all one to them whether thou warnest them or cost not\n\t\t\twarn them: they will not believe.

Thou canst [truly] warn only him who is willing to take the
			reminder to heart,<sup class='fn'>9</sup> and who stands in awe of the Most
			Gracious although He is beyond the reach of human perception:
			unto such, then, give the glad tiding of [God's] forgiveness and
			of a most excellent reward!

Verily, We shall indeed bring the dead back to life; and We shall
			record whatever [deeds] they have sent ahead, and the traces [of
			good and evil] which they have left behind: for of all things do
			We take account in a record clear.
AND SET FORTH unto them a parable - [the story of how] the people\n\t\t\tof a township [behaved] when [Our] message-bearers came unto\n\t\t\tthem.

Lo! We sent unto them two [apostles], and they gave the lie to
			both; and so We strengthened [the two] with a third; and
			thereupon they said: "Behold, we have been sent unto you [by
			God]!"<sup class='fn'>10</sup>

[The others] answered: "You are nothing but mortal men like\n\t\t\tourselves; moreover, the Most Gracious has never bestowed aught\n\t\t\t[of revelation] from on high. You do nothing but lie!"<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
Said [the apostles]: "Our Sustainer knows that we have indeed\n\t\t\tbeen sent unto you;
but we are not bound to do more than clearly deliver the message\n\t\t\t[entrusted to us]."

Said [the others]: "Truly, we augur evil from you!<sup class='fn'>12</sup>\n\t\t\tIndeed, if you desist not, we will surely stone you, and grievous\n\t\t\tsuffering is bound to befall you at our hands!"

[The apostles] replied: "Your destiny, good or evil, is [bound
			up] with yourselves!<sup class='fn'>13</sup> [Does it seem evil to you] if you
			are told to take [the truth] to heart? Nay, but you are people
			who have wasted their own selves!"<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
At that, a man came running from the farthest end of the city,\n\t\t\t[and] exclaimed: "O my people! Follow these message-bearers!
Follow those who ask no reward of you, and themselves are rightly\n\t\t\tguided!
"[As for me,] why should I not worship Him who has brought me\n\t\t\tinto being, and to whom you all will be brought back?

Should I take to worshipping [other] deities beside Him? [But
			then,] if the Most Gracious should will that harm befall me,
			their intercession could not in the least avail me, nor could
			they save me:
and so, behold, I would have indeed, most obviously, lost myself\n\t\t\tin error!
"Verily, [O my people,] in the Sustainer of you all have I come\n\t\t\tto believe: listen, then, to me!"
[And] he was told,<sup class='fn'>15</sup> "[Thou shalt] enter\n\t\t\tparadise!"-[whereupon] he exclaimed: "Would that my people knew
how my Sustainer has forgiven me [the sins of my past], and has\n\t\t\tplaced me among the honoured ones!"
And after that, no host out of heaven did We send down against\n\t\t\this people, nor did We need to send down any:
nothing was [needed] but one single blast [of Our punishment] -\n\t\t\tand lo! they hecame as still and silent as ashes.
OH, THE REGRETS that [most] human beings will have to\n\t\t\tbear!<sup class='fn'>16</sup> Never has an apostle come to them without their\n\t\t\tderiding him!
Are they not aware of how many a generation We have destroyed\n\t\t\tbefore their time, [and] that those [that have perished] will\n\t\t\tnever return to them,<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
and [that] all of them, all together, will [in the end] before Us\n\t\t\tbe arraigned?
And [yet,] they have a sign [of Our power to create and to\n\t\t\tresurrect] in the lifeless earth which We make alive, and out of\n\t\t\twhich We bring forth grain, whereof they may eat;
and [how] We make gardens of date-palms and vines [grow] thereon,\n\t\t\tand cause springs to gush [forth] within it,
so that they may eat of the fruit thereof, though it was not\n\t\t\ttheir hands that made it. Will they not, then, be grateful?

Limitless in His glory is He who has created opposites in\n\t\t\twhatever the earth produces, and in men's own selves, and in that\n\t\t\tof which [as yet] they have no knowledge.<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
And [of Our sway over all that exists] they have a sign in the\n\t\t\tnight: We withdraw from it the [light of] day-and lo! they are in\n\t\t\tdarkness.
And [they have a sign in] the sun: it runs in an orbit of its\n\t\t\town<sup class='fn'>19</sup> - [and] that is laid down by the will of the\n\t\t\tAlmighty, the All-Knowing;
and [in] the moon, for which We have determined phases [which it\n\t\t\tmust traverse] till it becomes like an old date-stalk, dried-up\n\t\t\tand curved:<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
[and] neither may the sun overtake the moon, nor can the night\n\t\t\tusurp the time of day,<sup class='fn'>21</sup> since all of them float through\n\t\t\tspace [in accordance with Our laws].
And [it ought to be] a sign for them that We bear their offspring\n\t\t\t[over the seas] in laden ships,<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
and [that] We create for them things of a similar kind, on which\n\t\t\tthey may embark [in their travels];<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
and [that,] if such be Our will, We may cause them to drown, with\n\t\t\tnone to respond to their cry for help: and [then] they cannot be\n\t\t\tsaved,
nless it be by an act of mercy from Us and a grant of life for a\n\t\t\t[further sup of] time.

And [yet,] when they are told, "Beware of [God's insight into]
			all that lies open before you and all that is hidden from
			you,<sup class='fn'>24</sup> so that you might be graced with His mercy,"
			[most men choose to remain deaf;]
and no message of their Sustainer's messages<sup class='fn'>25</sup> ever\n\t\t\treaches them without their turning away from it.

Thus, when they are told, "Spend on others out of what God has
			provided for you as sustenance,"<sup class='fn'>26</sup> those who are bent on
			denying the truth say unto those who believe, "Shall we feed
			anyone whom, if [your] God had so willed, He could have fed
			[Himself]? Clearly, you are but lost in error!"
And they add, "When is this promise [of resurrection] to be\n\t\t\tfulfilled? [Answer this] if you are men of truth!"

[And they are unaware that] nothing awaits them beyond a single\n\t\t\tblast [of God's punishment],<sup class='fn'>27</sup> which will overtake them\n\t\t\twhile they are still arguing [against resurrection]:
and so [sudden will be their end that] no testament will they be\n\t\t\table to make, nor to their own people will they return!
And [then] the trumpet [of resurrection] will be blown - and lo!\n\t\t\tout of their graves towards their Sustainer will they all rush\n\t\t\tforth!
They will say: "Oh, woe unto us! Who has roused us from our sleep\n\t\t\t[of death]?" Most Gracious has promised! And His message-bearers\n\t\t\tspoke the truth!"
Nothing will there have been but one single blast-and lo! before\n\t\t\tUs will all of them be arraigned [and be told]:
"Today, then, no human being shall be wronged in the least, nor\n\t\t\tshall you be requited for aught but what you were doing [on\n\t\t\tearth].
"Behold, those who are destined for paradise shall today have joy\n\t\t\tin whatever they do:
in happiness will they and their spouses on couches\n\t\t\trecline;<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
[only] delight will there be for them, and theirs shall be all\n\t\t\tthat they could ask for:
peace and fulfilment<sup class='fn'>29</sup> through the word of a Sustainer\n\t\t\twho dispenses all grace.
"But stand aside today, O you who were lost in sin!
Did I not enjoin on you, O you children of Adam, that you should\n\t\t\tnot worship Satan-since, verily, he is your open foe <sup class='fn'>30</sup>
and that you shold worship Me [alone]? This would have been a\n\t\t\tstraight way!
And [as far Satan-] he had already led astray agreat many of you:\n\t\t\tcould you not, then, use your reason?
"This, then, is the hell of which you were warned again and\n\t\t\tagain:<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
endure it today as an outcome of your persistent denial of the\n\t\t\ttruth!"
On that Day We shall set a seal on their mouths<sup class='fn'>32</sup> -but\n\t\t\ttheir hands will speak unto Us, and their feet will bear witness\n\t\t\tto whatever they have earned [in life].

NOW HAD IT BEEN Our will [that men should not be able to discern
			between right and wrong], We could surely have deprived them of
			their sight,<sup class='fn'>33</sup> so that they would stray forever from the
			[right] way: for how could they have had insight [into what is
			true]?<sup class='fn'>34</sup>

And had it been Our will [that they should not be free to choose
			between right and wrong], We could surely have given them a
			different nature<sup class='fn'>35</sup> [and created them as beings rooted]
			in their places, so that they would not be able to move forward,
			and could not turn back.<sup class='fn'>36</sup>

But [let them always remember that] if We lengthen a human\n\t\t\tbeing's days, We also cause him to decline in his powers [when he\n\t\t\tgrows old]: will they not, then, use their reason?<sup class='fn'>37</sup>

AND [thus it is:] We have not imparted to this [prophet the gift
			of] poetry, nor would [poetry] have suited this
			[message]:<sup class='fn'>38</sup> it is but a reminder and a [divine]
			discourse, clear in itself and clearly showing the
			truth,<sup class='fn'>39</sup>
to the end that it may warn everyone who is alive [of heart], and\n\t\t\tthat the word [of God] may bear witness<sup class='fn'>40</sup> against all\n\t\t\twho deny the truth.

Are they, then, not aware that it is for them that We have
			created, among all the things which Our hands have
			wrought,<sup class='fn'>41</sup> the domestic animals of which they are [now]
			masters?
and that We have subjected them to men's will,<sup class='fn'>42</sup> so that\n\t\t\tsome of them they may use for riding and of some they may eat,
and may have [yet other] benefits from them, and [milk] to drink?\n\t\t\tWill they not, then, be grateful?
But [nay,] they take to worshipping deities other than\n\t\t\tGod,<sup class='fn'>43</sup> [hoping] to be succoured [by them, and not\n\t\t\tknowing that]
they are unable to succour their devotees,<sup class='fn'>44</sup> even though\n\t\t\tto them they may [appear to] be hosts drawn up [for succour].
However, be not grieved by the sayings of those [who deny the\n\t\t\ttruth]: verily, We know all that they keep secret as well as all\n\t\t\tthat they bring into the open.
IS MAN, then, not aware that it is We who create him out of\n\t\t\t[mere] drop of sperm-whereupon, lo! he shows himself endowed with\n\t\t\tthe power to think and to argue?<sup class='fn'>45</sup>

And [now] he [argues about Us, and] thinks of Us in terms of
			comparison,<sup class='fn'>46</sup> and is oblivious of how he himself was
			created! [And so] he says, "Who could give life to bones that
			have crumbled to dust?"
Say: "He who brought them into being in the first instance will\n\t\t\tgive them life [once again], seeing that He has full knowledge of\n\t\t\tevery act of creation:
He who produces for you fire out of the green tree, so that, lo!\n\t\t\tyou kindle [your fires] therewith."<sup class='fn'>47</sup>
Is, then, He who has created the heavens and the earth not able\n\t\t\tto create [anew] the like of those [who have died]? Yea,\n\t\t\tindeed-for He alone is the all-knowing Creator:
His Being alone<sup class='fn'>48</sup> is such that when He wills a thing to\n\t\t\tbe, He but says unto it, "Be" - and it is.
Limitless, then, in His glory is He in whose hand rests the\n\t\t\tmighty dominion over all things; and unto Him you all will be\n\t\t\tbrought back!
CONSIDER these [messages] ranged in serried ranks,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and restraining [from evil] by a call to restraint,
and conveying [to all the world] a reminder:
Verily, most surely, your God is One
the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and of all that is\n\t\t\tbetween them, and the Sustainer of all the points of sunrise!\n\t\t\t<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Behold, We have adorned the skies nearest to the earth with the\n\t\t\tbeauty of stars,
and have made them secure against every rebellious, satanic\n\t\t\tforce,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
[so that] they [who seek to learn the unknowable] should not be\n\t\t\table to overhear the host on high,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> but shall be\n\t\t\trepelled from all sides,
cast out [from all grace], with lasting suffering in store for\n\t\t\tthem [in the life to come];
but if anyone<sup class='fn'>5</sup> does succeed in snatching a glimpse [of\n\t\t\tsuch knowledge], he is [henceforth! Dursued bv a piercing\n\t\t\tflame.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

AND NOW ask those [who deny the truth] to enlight-en thee: Were
			they more difficult to create than all those [untold marvels]
			that We have created?-for, behold, them have We created out of
			[mere] clay commingled with water!<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
Nay, but whereas thou cost marvel,<sup class='fn'>8</sup> they [only] scoff;
and when they are reminded [of the truth], they refuse to take it\n\t\t\tto heart;
and when they become aware of a [divine] message, they turn it to\n\t\t\tridicule
and say: "This is clearly nothing but [a mortal's] spellbinding\n\t\t\teloquence!
Why-after we have died and become mere dust and bones, shall we,\n\t\t\tforsooth, be raised from the dead? -
and perhaps also our forebears of old?"
Say: "Yea, indeed-and most abject will you then be!" -
for that [resurrection which they deride] will be [upon them of a\n\t\t\tsudden, as if it were] but a single accusing cry - and then, lo!\n\t\t\tthey will begin to see [the truth]
and will say: "Oh, woe unto us! This is the Day of Judgment!"
[And they will be told:] "This is the Day of Distinction [between\n\t\t\tthe true and the false<sup class='fn'>9</sup> the Day] which you were wont to\n\t\t\tcall a lie!"
[And God will thus command:] "Assemble all those who were bent on\n\t\t\tevildoing, together with others of their ilk<sup class='fn'>10</sup> and\n\t\t\t[with] all that they were wont to worship
instead of God, and lead them all onto the way to the blazing\n\t\t\tfire,
and halt them [there]!" [And then,] behold, they shall be asked,
"How is it that [now] you cannot succour one another?"
Nay, but on that Day they would willingly surrender [to God];
but [since it will be too late,] they will turn upon one another,\n\t\t\tdemanding of each other [to relieve them of the burden of their\n\t\t\tpast sins].<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
Some [of them] will say: "Behold; you were wont to approach us\n\t\t\t[deceptively] from the right!"<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
[To which] the others will reply: "Nay, you yourselves were\n\t\t\tbereft of all faith!
Moreover, we had no power at all over you: nay, you were people\n\t\t\tfilled with overweening arrogance!
But now our Sustainer's word has come true against us [as well]:\n\t\t\tverily, we are bound to taste [the fruit of our sins].
So then, [if it be true that] we have caused you to err\n\t\t\tgrievously - behold, we ourselves had been lost in grievous\n\t\t\terror!"<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
And, verily, on that Day they all will share in their common\n\t\t\tsuffering.
Verily, thus shall We deal with all who were lost in sin:
for, behold, whenever they were told, "There is no deity save\n\t\t\tGod," they would glory in their arrogance
and would say, "Shall we, then, give up our deities at the\n\t\t\tbidding of a mad poet?"<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
Nay, but he [whom you call a mad poet] has brought the truth; and\n\t\t\the confirms the truth of [what the earlier of God's]\n\t\t\tmessage-bearers [have taught.<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
Behold, you will indeed taste grievous suffering [in the life to\n\t\t\tcome],
although you shall not be requited for aught but what you were\n\t\t\twont to do.
Not so, however, God's true servants:<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
[in the hereafter,] theirs shall be a sustenance which they will\n\t\t\trecognize<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
as the fruits [of their life on earth]; and honoured shall they\n\t\t\tbe
in gardens of bliss.
facing one another lin love] upon thrones of\n\t\t\thappiness.<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
A cup will be passed round among them [with a drink] from\n\t\t\tunsullied springs,
clear, delightful to those who drink it:
no headiness will be in it, and they will not get drunk thereon.
And with them will be mates of modest gaze,<sup class='fn'>19</sup> most\n\t\t\tbeautiful of eye,
[as free of faults] as if they were hidden [ostrich]\n\t\t\teggs.<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
And they will all turn to one another, asking each other [about\n\t\t\ttheir past lives].<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
One of them speaks thus: "Behold, I had [on earth] a close\n\t\t\tcompanion
who was wont to ask [me], 'Why - art thou really one of those who\n\t\t\tbelieve it to be true
[that] after we have died and become mere dust and bones we\n\t\t\tshall, forsooth, be brought to judgment?'"
[And] he adds: "Would you like to look [and see him]?"
and then he looks and sees that [companion of his] in the midst\n\t\t\tof the blazing fire,
and says: "By God! Verily, thou hast almost destroyed me [too, O\n\t\t\tmy erstwhile companion] -
for had it not been for my Sustainer's favour, I would surely be\n\t\t\t[now] among those who are given over [to suffering]!
But then, [O my friends in paradise,] is it [really] so that we\n\t\t\tare not to die
[again,] beyond our previous death, and that we shall never\n\t\t\tlanainl be made to suffer?
Verily, this - this indeed-is the triumph supreme!"
For the like of this, then, let them labour, those who labour [in\n\t\t\tGod's way]!
Is such [a paradise] the better welcome - or the [hellish] tree\n\t\t\tof deadly fruit?<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
Verily, We have caused it to be a trial for evildoers:<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
for, behold, it is a tree that grows in the very heart of the\n\t\t\tblazing fire [of hell],
its fruit [as repulsive] as satans' heads;<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
and they [who are lost in evil] are indeed bound to eat thereof,\n\t\t\tand to fill their bellies therewith.
And, behold, above all this they will be confounded with burning\n\t\t\tdes-pair!<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
And once again:<sup class='fn'>26</sup> Verily, the blazing fire is their\n\t\t\tultimate goal -
for, behold, they found their forebears on a wrong way,
and [now] they make haste to follow in their\n\t\t\tfootsteps!<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
Thus, indeed, most of the people of old went astray before them,
although, verily, We had sent warners unto them:
and behold what happened in the end to those that had been warned\n\t\t\t[to no avail]!
EXCEPT for God's true servants, [most people are apt to go\n\t\t\tastray].<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
And, indeed, [it was for this reason that] Noah cried unto Us -\n\t\t\tand how excellent was Our response:
for We saved him and his household from that awesome\n\t\t\tcalamity,<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
and caused his offspring to endure [on earth];
and We left him thus to be remembered<sup class='fn'>30</sup> among later\n\t\t\tgenerations:
Peace be upon Noah throughout all the worlds!"
Verily, thus do We reward the doers of good-
for he was truly one of our believing servants:
[and so We saved him and those who followed him] and then We\n\t\t\tcaused the others to drown.
AND, BEHOLD, of his persuasion was Abraham, too,
when he turned to his Sustainer with a heart free of evil,
and [thus] spoke to his father and his people: "What is it that\n\t\t\tyou worship?
Do you want [to bow down before] a lie - [before] deities other\n\t\t\tthan God?
What, then, do you think of the Sustainer of all the\n\t\t\tworlds?"<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
Then he cast a glance at the stars,<sup class='fn'>32</sup>
and said, "Verily, I am sick [at heart]!" <sup class='fn'>33</sup>
and at that they turned their backs on him and went away.
Thereupon he approached their gods stealthily and said, "What!\n\t\t\tYou do not eat [of the offerings placed before you]?
What is amiss with you that you do not speak?"
And then he fell upon them, smiting them with his right\n\t\t\thand.<sup class='fn'>34</sup>
[But] then the others came towards him hur-riedly [and accused\n\t\t\thim of his deed].
He answered: "Do you worship something that you [yourselves] have\n\t\t\tcarved,
the while it is God who has created you and all your handiwork?"
They exclaimed: "Build a pyre<sup class='fn'>35</sup> for him, and cast him\n\t\t\tinto the blazing fire!"
But whereas they sought to do evil unto him, We [frustrated their\n\t\t\tdesigns, and thus] brought them low <sup class='fn'>36</sup>
And [Abraham] said: "Verily, I shall [leave this land and] go\n\t\t\twherever my Sustainer will guide me!"<sup class='fn'>37</sup>
[And he prayed:] "O my Sustainer! Bestow upon me the gift of [a\n\t\t\tson who shall be] one of the righteous!"-
whereupon We gave him the glad tiding of a boy-child gentle [like\n\t\t\thimself].<sup class='fn'>38</sup>

And [one day,] when [the child] had become old enough to share in
			his [father's] endeavours<sup class='fn'>39</sup> the latter said: "O my dear
			son! I have seen in a dream that I should sacrifice thee:
			consider, then, what would be thy view!" [Ishmael] answered: "O
			my father! Do as thou art bidden: thou wilt find me, if God so
			wills, among those who are patient in adversity!"
But as soon as the two had surrendered themselves to [what they\n\t\t\tthought to be] the will of God,<sup class='fn'>40</sup> and [Abraham] had laid\n\t\t\thim down on his face,
We called out to him: "O Abraham,
thou hast already fulfilled [the purpose of] that\n\t\t\tdream-vision!"<sup class='fn'>41</sup> Thus, verily, do We reward the doers of\n\t\t\tgood:
for, behold, all this was indeed a trial, clear in it\n\t\t\t,elf.<sup class='fn'>42</sup>
And We ransomed him with a tremendous sacrifice,<sup class='fn'>43</sup>
and left him thus to be remembered among later\n\t\t\tgenerations:<sup class='fn'>44</sup>
"Peace be upon Abraham!"
Thus do We reward the doers of good-
for he was truly one of our believing servants.
And [in time] We gave him the glad tiding of Isaac, [who, too,\n\t\t\twould be] a prophet, one of the righteous;

and We blessed him and Isaac: but among the offspring of these\n\t\t\ttwo there were [des-tined] to be both doers of good and such as\n\t\t\twould glaringly sin against themselves.<sup class='fn'>45</sup>
THUS, INDEED, did We bestow Our favour upon Moses and\n\t\t\tAaron;<sup class='fn'>46</sup>
and We saved them and their people from the awesome calamity [of\n\t\t\tbondage],
and succoured them, so that [in the end] it was they who achieved\n\t\t\tvictory.
And We gave them the divine writ that made [right and wrong]\n\t\t\tdistinct,<sup class='fn'>47</sup>
and guided them the straight way,
and left them thus to be remem-bered among later generations:
"Peace be upon Moses and Aaron!"
Thus do We reward the doers of good-
for those two were truly among Our believing ser-vants.
AND, BEHOLD, Elijah [too] was indeed one of Our\n\t\t\tmessage-bearers<sup class='fn'>48</sup>
when he spoke [thus] to his people: "Will you not remain\n\t\t\tconscious of God?
Will you invoke Baal and forsake [God,] the best of\n\t\t\tartisans<sup class='fn'>49</sup> -
God, your Sustainer and the Sustainer of your forebears of old?"
But they gave him the lie: and therefore they will most surely be\n\t\t\tarraigned [on Judgment Day],
excepting only [those who were] God's true servants;
and him We left thus to be remem-bered among later generations:
"Peace be upon Elijah and his followers!"<sup class='fn'>50</sup>
Verily, thus do We reward the doers of good
for he was truly one of Our believing servants!
AND, BEHOLD, Lot was indeed one of Our mes-sage-bearers;
[and so,] when [We decreed the doom of his sinful\n\t\t\ttown,<sup class='fn'>51</sup> ] We saved him; and his household,
except an old woman who was among those that stayed\n\t\t\tbehind;<sup class='fn'>52</sup>
and then We utterly destroyed the others:
and, verily, [tO this day] you pass by the remnants of their\n\t\t\tdwellings<sup class='fn'>53</sup> at morning-time
and by night. Will you not, then, use your reason?
AND, BEHOLD, Jonah was indeed one of Our mes-sage-bearers
when he fled like a runaway slave onto a laden ship.<sup class='fn'>54</sup>
And then they cast lots, and he was the one who lost;<sup class='fn'>55</sup>
[and they cast him into the sea,] whereupon the great fish\n\t\t\tswallowed him, for he had been blameworthy.<sup class='fn'>56</sup>
And had he not been of' those who [even in the deep darkness of\n\t\t\ttheir distress are able to] extol God's limitless\n\t\t\tglory,<sup class='fn'>57</sup>
he would indeed have remained in its belly till the Day when all\n\t\t\tshall be raised from the dead:
but We caused him to be cast forth on a desert shore, sick [at\n\t\t\theart] as he was,
and caused a creeping plant to grow over him [out of the barren\n\t\t\tsoil].<sup class='fn'>58</sup>
And [then] We sent him [once again] to [his people,] a hundred\n\t\t\tthousand [souls] or more:
and [this time] they believed [in him]<sup class='fn'>59</sup> -and so We\n\t\t\tallowed them to enjoy their life during the time allotted to\n\t\t\tthem.<sup class='fn'>60</sup>
AND NOW ask them<sup class='fn'>61</sup> to enlighten thee: Has thy Sustainer\n\t\t\tdaughters, whereas they would have [only] sons?<sup class='fn'>62</sup>
- or is it that We have created the angels female, and they [who\n\t\t\tbelieve them to be divine] have witnessed [that act of creation]?
Oh, verily, it is out of their own [inclination to] falsehood\n\t\t\tthat some people<sup class='fn'>63</sup> assert,
"God has begotten [a son]"; and, verily, they are Iying [too,\n\t\t\twhen they say],
"He has chosen daughters in preference to sons"!<sup class='fn'>64</sup>
What is amiss with you and your judgment?<sup class='fn'>65</sup>
Will you not, then, bethink yourselves?
Or have you, perchance, a clear evidence [for your assertions]?
Produce, then, that divine writ of yours, if you are speaking the\n\t\t\ttruth!

And some people<sup class='fn'>66</sup> have invented a kinship between Him
			and all manner of invisible forces<sup class='fn'>67</sup> -although [even]
			these invisible forces know well that, verily, they [who thus
			blaspheme against God] shall indeed be arraigned [before Him on
			Judgment Day:<sup class='fn'>68</sup> for]
limitless is God in His glory, above anything that men may devise\n\t\t\tby way of definition!<sup class='fn'>69</sup>
Not thus, however, [behave] God's true ser-vants:
for, verily, neither you [blasphemers] nor the objects of your\n\t\t\tworship
can cause anyone to fall prey to your temptation
unless it be such as rushes towards the blazing fire [of his own\n\t\t\taccord]!<sup class='fn'>70</sup>
[All forces of nature praise God and say:<sup class='fn'>71</sup> ] "Among us,\n\t\t\ttoo, there is none but has a place assigned to it [by Him];
and, verily, we too are ranged [before Him in worship];
and, verily, we too extol His limitless elory!"
AND, INDEED, they [who deny the truth] have always been wont to\n\t\t\tsay,
"If only we had a tradition Ito this effectl from our\n\t\t\tforebears,<sup class='fn'>72</sup>
we would certainly be true servants of God."
And yet, [now that this divine writ has been placed before them,]\n\t\t\tthey refuse to acknowledge it as true! In time, however, they\n\t\t\twill come to know [what it was that they had rejected]:
for, long ago has Our word gone forth unto Our servants, the\n\t\t\tmessage-bearers,
that, verily, they-they indeed-would be succoured,
and that, verily, Our hosts - they indeed-would [in the end] be\n\t\t\tvictorious!
Hence, turn thou aside for a while from those [who deny the\n\t\t\ttruth],
and see them [for what they are];<sup class='fn'>73</sup> and in time they\n\t\t\t[too] will come to see [what they do not see now].<sup class='fn'>74</sup>
Do they, then, [really] wish that Our chas-tisement be hastened\n\t\t\ton?<sup class='fn'>75</sup>
But then, once it alights upon them, hapless will be the\n\t\t\tawakening of those who were warned [to no avail]!<sup class='fn'>76</sup>
Hence, turn thou aside for a while from them,
and see [them for what they are]; and in time they [too] will\n\t\t\tcome to see [what they do not see now].
LIMITLESS in His glory is thy Sustainer, the Lord of\n\t\t\talmightiness, [exalted] above anything that men may devise by way\n\t\t\tof definition!
And peace be upon all His message-bearers!
And all praise is due to God alone, the Sustainer of all the\n\t\t\tworlds!
Sad.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> CONSIDER<sup class='fn'>2</sup> this Qur'an, endowed with all\n\t\t\tthat one ought to remember!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
But nay - they who are bent on denying the truth are lost in\n\t\t\t[false] pride, and [hence] deeply in the wrong.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>

How many a generation<sup class='fn'>5</sup> have We destroyed before their\n\t\t\ttime [for this very sin]! And [how] they called [unto Us] when it\n\t\t\twas too late to escape!<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

Now these [people] deem it strange that a warner should have come\n\t\t\tunto them from their own midst - and [so] the deniers of the\n\t\t\ttruth are saying: "A [mere] spellbinder is he, a liar!<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
Does he claim that all the deities are [but] one God? Verily, a\n\t\t\tmost strange thing is this!"<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
And their leaders launch forth [thus]: "Go ahead, and hold\n\t\t\tsteadfastly onto your deities: this, behold, is the only thing to\n\t\t\tdo!<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
Never did we hear of [a claim like] this in any faith of latter\n\t\t\tdays!<sup class='fn'>10</sup> It is nothing but [a mortal man's] invention!

What Upon him alone from among all of us should a [divine]
			reminder have been bestowed from on high?" Nay, but it is My Own
			reminder that they distrust!<sup class='fn'>11</sup> Nay, they have not yet
			tasted the suffering which I do impose!<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
Or do they [think that they] own the treasures of thy Sustainer's\n\t\t\tgrace- [the grace] of the Almighty, the Giver of\n\t\t\tGifts?<sup class='fn'>13</sup>

Or [that] the dominion over the heavens and the earth and all\n\t\t\tthat is between them is theirs? Why, then, let them try to ascend\n\t\t\t[to God-like power] by all [conceivable] means!<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
[But] there it is: any and all human beings, however [strongly]\n\t\t\tleagued together,<sup class='fn'>15</sup> are bound to suffer defeat [whenever\n\t\t\tthey refuse to accept the truth].
To the truth gave the lie aforetime<sup class='fn'>16</sup> Noah's people, and\n\t\t\t[the tribe of] Ad, and Pharaoh of the [many]\n\t\t\ttent-poles,<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
and [the tribe of] Thamud, and the people of Lot, and the\n\t\t\tdwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan]: they all were leagued\n\t\t\ttogether, [as it were, in their unbelief:]
not one [was there] but gave the lie to the apostles - and\n\t\t\tthereupon My retribution fell due.
And they [who now deny the truth-they, too,] have but to wait for\n\t\t\tone single blast [of punishment to overtake them]: it shall not\n\t\t\tbe delayed a whit.<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
As it is, they say [mockingly]: "O our Sustainer! Hasten on to us\n\t\t\tour share [of punishment even] before the Day of\n\t\t\tReckoning!"<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
[But] bear thou with patience whatever they may say, and remember\n\t\t\tOur servant David, him who was endowed with [so much] inner\n\t\t\tstrength! He, verily, would always turn unto Us:
[and for this,] behold, We caused<sup class='fn'>20</sup> the mountains to\n\t\t\tjoin him in extolling Our limitless glory at eventide and at\n\t\t\tsun-rise,
and [likewise] the birds in their assemblies:<sup class='fn'>21</sup>\n\t\t\t[together] they all would turn again and again unto Him [who had\n\t\t\tcreated them].
And We streng-thened his dominion, and bestowed upon him wisdom\n\t\t\tand sagacity in judgment.
AND YET, has the story of the litigants come within thy ken- [the\n\t\t\tstory of the two] who surmounted the walls of the sanctuary [in\n\t\t\twhich David prayed ?<sup class='fn'>22</sup>

As they came upon David, and he shrank back in fear from them,
			they said: "Fear not! [We are but] two litigants. One of us has
			wronged the other: so judge thou between us with justice, and
			deviate not from what is right, and show [both of] us the way to
			rectitude.
"Behold, this is my brother: he has ninety-nine ewes, whereas I\n\t\t\thave [only] one ewe - and yet he said, 'Make her over to me,' and\n\t\t\tforcibly prevailed against me in this [our] dispute."

Said [David]: "He has certainly wronged thee by demanding that
			thy ewe be added to his ewes! Thus, behold, do many
			kinsmen<sup class='fn'>23</sup> wrong one another-[all] save those who believe
			[in God] and do righteous deeds: but how few are they!" And
			[suddenly] David understood that We had tried him:<sup class='fn'>24</sup> and
			so he asked his Sustainer to forgive him his sin, and fell down
			in prostration, and turned unto Him in repentance.
And thereupon We forgave him that [sin]: and, verily, nearness to\n\t\t\tUs awaits him [in the life to come], and the most beauteous of\n\t\t\tall goals!

[And We said:] "O David! Behold, We have made thee a [prophet
			and, thus, Our] vicegerent on earth: judge, then, between men
			with justice, and do not follow vain desire, lest it lead thee
			astray from the path of God: verily, for those who go astray from
			the path of God there is suffering severe in store for having
			forgotten the Day of Reckoning!"

AND [thus it is:] We have not created heaven and earth and all
			that is between them without meaning and purpose, as is the
			surmise of those who are bent on denying the truth:<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
			but then, woe from the fire [of hell] unto all who are bent on
			denying the truth!<sup class='fn'>26</sup>

[For,] would We treat those who have attained to faith and do
			righteous deeds in the same manner as [We shall treat] those who
			spread corruption on earth? Would We treat the God-conscious in
			the same manner as the wicked?<sup class='fn'>27</sup>

[All this have We expounded in this] blessed divine writ which We
			have revealed unto thee, [O Muhammad,] so that men may ponder
			over its messages, and that those who are endowed with insight
			may take them to heart.
AND UNTO DAVID We granted Solomon [as a son-and] how excellent a\n\t\t\tservant [of Ours he grew up to be]! Behold, he would always turn\n\t\t\tunto Us<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
[and even] when, towards the close of day, nobly-bred,\n\t\t\tswift-footed steeds were brought before him,

he would say, "Verily, I have come to love the love of all that
			is good because I bear my Sustainer in mind!"<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
			-[repeating these words as the steeds raced away,] until they
			were hidden by the veil [of distance<sup class='fn'>30</sup> whereupon he
			would command],
"Bring them back unto me!" - and would [lovingly] stroke their\n\t\t\tlegs and their necks.<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
But [ere this], indeed, We had tried Solomon by placing upon his\n\t\t\tthrone a [lifeless] body;<sup class='fn'>32</sup> and thereupon he turned\n\t\t\t[towards Us; and]

he prayed: "O my Sustainer! Forgive me my sins, and bestow upon\n\t\t\tme the gift of a kingdom which may not suit anyone after\n\t\t\tme:<sup class='fn'>33</sup> verily, Thou alone art a giver of gifts!"
And so<sup class='fn'>34</sup> We made subservient to him the wind, so that it\n\t\t\tgently sped at his behest withersoever he willed,<sup class='fn'>35</sup>
as well as all the rebellious forces [that We made to work for\n\t\t\thim]-every kind of builder and diver -
and others linked together in fetters.<sup class='fn'>36</sup>
[And We told him:] "This is Our gift, for thee to bestow freely\n\t\t\ton others, or to withhold, without [having to render] account!"
And, verily, nearness to Us awaits him life to comer, and the\n\t\t\tmost beauteous of all goals

AND CALL to mind Our servant Job,<sup class='fn'>37</sup> [how it was] when he\n\t\t\tcried out to his Sustainer, "Behold, Satan has afflicted me with\n\t\t\t[utter] weariness and suffering!"<sup class='fn'>38</sup>
[and thereupon was told:] "Strike [the ground] with thy foot:\n\t\t\there is cool water to wash with and to drink!"<sup class='fn'>39</sup>
And We bestowed upon him new offsprin ,<sup class='fn'>40</sup> doubling their\n\t\t\tnumber as an act of grace from Us, and as a reminder unto all who\n\t\t\tare endowed with insight.

[And finally We told him:] "Now take in thy hand a small bunch of
			grass, and strike therewith, and thou wilt not break shine
			oath!"<sup class='fn'>41</sup> - for, verily, We found him full of patience in
			adversity: how excellent a servant [of Ours], who, behold, would
			always turn unto us
AND CALL to mind Our servants Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, [all\n\t\t\tof them] endowed with inner strength and vision:
for, verily, We purified them by means of a thought most pure:\n\t\t\tthe remembrance of the life to come.<sup class='fn'>42</sup>
