So hold fast to all that has been revealed to thee: for, behold,\n\t\t\tthou art on a straight way;

and, verily, this [revelation] shall indeed become [a source of]
			eminence for thee and thy people:<sup class='fn'>36</sup> but in time you all
			will be called to account [for what you have done with
			it].<sup class='fn'>37</sup>

Yet [above all else,] ask any of Our apostles whom We sent forth\n\t\t\tbefore thy time<sup class='fn'>38</sup> whether We have ever allowed that\n\t\t\tdeities other than the Most Gracious be worshipped!
THUS, INDEED,<sup class='fn'>39</sup> have We sent Moses with Our messages\n\t\t\tunto Pharaoh and his great ones; and he said: "Behold, I am an\n\t\t\tapostle of the Sustainer of all the worlds!"
But as soon as he came before them with Our [miraculous]\n\t\t\tsigns,<sup class='fn'>40</sup> lo! they derided them,

although each sign that We showed them was weightier than the\n\t\t\tpreceding one: and [each time] We took them to task through\n\t\t\tsuffering, so that they might return [to Us].<sup class='fn'>41</sup>

And [every time] they exclaimed: "O thou sorcerer! Pray for us to
			thy Sustainer on the strength of the covenant [of prophethood]
			which He has made with thee: for, verily, we shall now follow the
			right way!"
But whenever We removed the suffering from them, lo! they would\n\t\t\tbreak their word.

And Pharaoh issued a call to his people, saying: "O my people!
			Does not the dominion over Egypt belong to me, since all these
			running waters flow at my feet?<sup class='fn'>42</sup> Can you not, then, see
			[that I am your lord supreme]?
Am I not better than this contemptible man who can hardly make\n\t\t\this meaning clear?<sup class='fn'>43</sup>
"And then - why have no golden armlets been bestowed on\n\t\t\thim?<sup class='fn'>44</sup> - or why have no angels come together with him?"
Thus he incited his people to levity, and they obeyed him: for,\n\t\t\tbehold, they were people depraved!
But when they continued to challenge Us, We inflicted Our\n\t\t\tretribution on them, and drowned them all:
and so We made them a thing of the past, and an example to those\n\t\t\twho would come after them.
NOW WHENEVER [the nature of] the son of Mary is set forth as an\n\t\t\texample, [O Muhammad,] lo! thy people raise an outcry on this\n\t\t\tscore,

and say, "Which is better - our deities or he?"<sup class='fn'>45</sup> [But]\n\t\t\tit is only in the spirit of dispute that they put this comparison\n\t\t\tbefore thee: yea, they are contentious folk!<sup class='fn'>46</sup>
[As for Jesus,] he was nothing but [a human being -] a servant\n\t\t\t[of Ours] whom We had graced [with prophethood], and whom We made\n\t\t\tan example for the children of Israel.
And had We so willed, [O you who worship angels,] We could indeed\n\t\t\thave made you into angels succeeding one another on\n\t\t\tearth!<sup class='fn'>47</sup>

AND, BEHOLD, this [divine writ] is indeed a means to know [that]\n\t\t\tthe Last Hour [is bound to come];<sup class='fn'>48</sup> hence, have no doubt\n\t\t\twhatever about it, but follow Me: this [alone] is a straight way.
And let not Satan bar you [from it] - for, verily, he is your\n\t\t\topen foe!

NOW WHEN Jesus came [to his people] with all evidence of the
			truth, he said: "I have now come unto you with wisdom,<sup class='fn'>49</sup>
			and to make clear unto you some of that on which you are at
			variance:<sup class='fn'>50</sup> hence, be conscious of God, and pay heed
			unto me.
"Verily, God is my Sustainer as well as your Sustainer; so\n\t\t\tworship [none but] Him: this [alone] is a straight way!"

But factions from among those [who came after Jesus] began to
			hold divergent views:<sup class='fn'>51</sup> woe, then, unto those who are
			bent on evildoing - [woe] for the suffering [that will befall
			them] on a grievous Day!
ARE THEY [who are lost in sin] but waiting for the Last Hour -\n\t\t\t[waiting] that it come upon them of a sudden, without their being\n\t\t\taware [of its approach]?
On that Day, [erstwhile] friends will be foes unto one\n\t\t\tanother<sup class='fn'>52</sup> - [all] save the God-conscious.
[And God will say:] "O you servants of Mine! No fear need you\n\t\t\thave today, and neither shall you grieve -
[O you] who have attained to faith in Our messages and have\n\t\t\tsurrendered your own selves unto Us!
Enter paradise, you and your spouses, with happiness blest!"

[And there] they will be waited upon with trays and goblets of
			gold; and there will be found all that the souls might desire,
			and [all that] the eyes might delight in. And therein shall you
			abide, [O you who believe:]
for such will be the paradise which you shall have inherited by\n\t\t\tvirtue of your past deeds:
fruits [of those deeds] shall you have in abundance, [and]\n\t\t\tthereof shall you partake!
[But,] behold, they who are lost in sin shall abide in the\n\t\t\tsuffering of hell:<sup class='fn'>53</sup>
it will not be lightened for them; and therein they will be lost\n\t\t\tin hopeless despair.
And it is not We who will be doing wrong unto them, but it is\n\t\t\tthey who will have wronged themselves.
And they will cry: "O thou [angel] who rulest [over hell]! Let\n\t\t\tthy Sustainer put an end to us!" - [whereupon] he will reply:\n\t\t\t"Verily, you must live on [in this state]...."
INDEED, [O you sinners,] We have conveyed the truth unto you; but\n\t\t\tmost of you abhor the truth.<sup class='fn'>54</sup>
Why - can they [who deny the truth ever] determine what [the\n\t\t\ttruth] should be?<sup class='fn'>55</sup>

Or do they, perchance, think that We do not hear their hidden
			thoughts and their secret confabulations?<sup class='fn'>56</sup> Yea, indeed,
			[We do,] and Our heavenly forces<sup class='fn'>57</sup> are with them,
			recording [all].
Say [O Prophet]: "If the Most Gracious [truly] had a son, I would\n\t\t\tbe the first to worship him!"

Utterly remote, in His glory, is the Sustainer of the heavens and
			the earth - the Sustainer, in almightiness enthroned<sup class='fn'>58</sup> -
			from all that they may attribute to Him by way of
			definition!<sup class='fn'>59</sup>
But leave them to indulge in idle talk and play [with\n\t\t\twords]<sup class='fn'>60</sup> until they face that [Judgment] Day of theirs\n\t\t\twhich they have been promised:
for [then they will come to know that] it is He [alone] who is\n\t\t\tGod in heaven and God on earth, and [that] He alone is truly\n\t\t\twise, all-knowing.

And hallowed be He unto whom the dominion over the heavens and
			the earth and all that is between them belongs, and with whom the
			knowledge of the Last Hour rests, and unto whom you all shall be
			brought back!

And those [beings] whom some invoke beside God<sup class='fn'>61</sup> have it
			not in their power to intercede [on Judgment Day] for any but
			such as have [in their lifetime] borne witness to the truth, and
			have been aware [that God is one and unique].<sup class='fn'>62</sup>
Now if thou ask those [who worship any being other than God] as\n\t\t\tto who it is that has created them, they are sure to answer,\n\t\t\t"God." How perverted, then, are their minds!
[But God has full knowledge of the true believer<sup class='fn'>63</sup>] and\n\t\t\tof his [despairing] cry: "O my Sustainer! Verily, these are\n\t\t\tpeople who will not believe!"
Yet bear thou with them, and say, "Peace [be upon you]!" - for in\n\t\t\ttime they will come to know [the truth].
Ha. Mim.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
CONSIDER this divine writ, clear in itself and clearly showing\n\t\t\tthe truth!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Behold, from on high have We bestowed it on a blessed\n\t\t\tnight:<sup class='fn'>3</sup> for, verily, We have always been warning\n\t\t\t[man].<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
On that [night] was made clear, in wisdom, the distinction\n\t\t\tbetween all things [good and evil]<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
at a behest from Ourselves: for, verily, We have always been\n\t\t\tsending [Our messages of guidance]
in pursuance of thy Sustainer's grace [unto man]. Verily, He\n\t\t\talone is all-hearing, all-knowing,
the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is\n\t\t\tbetween them - if you could but grasp it with inner\n\t\t\tcertainty!<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
There is no deity save Him: He grants life and deals death: He is\n\t\t\tyour Sustainer as well as the Sustainer of your forebears of old.
Nay, but they [who lack inner certainty] are but toying with\n\t\t\ttheir doubts.<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
WAIT, THEN, for the Day when the skies shall bring forth a pall\n\t\t\tof smoke which will make obvious [the approach of the Last Hour],
enveloping all mankind, [and causing the sinners to exclaim:]\n\t\t\t"Grievous is this suffering!
O our Sustainer, relieve us of suffering, for, verily, we [now]\n\t\t\tbelieve [in Thee]!"
[But] how shall this remembrance avail them [at the Last Hour],\n\t\t\tseeing that an apostle had previously come unto them, clearly\n\t\t\texpounding the truth,
whereupon they turned their backs on him and said, "Taught [by\n\t\t\tothers] is he,<sup class='fn'>8</sup> a madman"?
[Still,] behold, We shall postpone<sup class='fn'>9</sup> this suffering for a\n\t\t\tlittle while, although you are bound to revert [to your evil\n\t\t\tways: but]
on the Day when We shall seize [all sinners] with a most mighty\n\t\t\tonslaught, We shall, verily, inflict Our retribution [on you as\n\t\t\twell]!
AND, INDEED, [long] before their time did We try Pharaoh's people\n\t\t\t[in the same way]: for there came unto them a noble apostle, [who\n\t\t\tsaid:]
"Give in unto me, O God's bondmen!<sup class='fn'>10</sup> Verily, I am an\n\t\t\tapostle [sent] unto you, worthy of trust!
"And exalt not yourselves against God: for, verily, I come unto\n\t\t\tyou with a manifest authority [from Him];
and, behold, it is with my Sustainer - and your Sustainer - that\n\t\t\tI seek refuge against all your endeavours to revile\n\t\t\tme.<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
And if you do not believe me, [at least] stand away from me!"
But then, [when they beset him with their enmity,] he called out\n\t\t\tto his Sustainer, "These are [indeed] people lost in sin!"
And [God said]: "Go thou forth with My servants by night, for you\n\t\t\twill surely be pursued;
and leave the sea becalmed<sup class='fn'>12</sup> [between thee and Pharaoh's\n\t\t\tmen]: for, verily, they are a host destined to be drowned!"
[And so they perished: and] how many gardens did they leave\n\t\t\tbehind, and water-runnels,
and fields of grain, and noble dwellings,
and [all that] life of ease in which they used to delight!
Thus it was. And [then] We made another people heirs [to what\n\t\t\tthey had left],
and neither sky nor earth shed tears over them, nor were they\n\t\t\tallowed a respite.<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
And, indeed, We delivered the children of Israel from the\n\t\t\tshameful suffering
[inflicted on them] by Pharaoh, seeing that he was truly\n\t\t\toutstanding among those who waste their own selves;<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
and, indeed, We chose them knowingly above all other\n\t\t\tpeople,<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
and gave them such signs [of Our grace] as would clearly presage\n\t\t\ta test.<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
[Now,] behold, these [people] say indeed:<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
"That [which is ahead of us] is but our first [and only]\n\t\t\tdeath,<sup class='fn'>18</sup> and we shall not be raised to life again.
So then, bring forth our forefathers [as witnesses], if what you\n\t\t\tclaim is true!"<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
Are they, then, better than the people of Tubba' and those before\n\t\t\tthem, whom We destroyed because they were truly lost in [the\n\t\t\tsame] sin?<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
For [thus it is:] We have not created the heavens and the earth\n\t\t\tand all that is between them in mere idle play:<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
none of this have We created without [an inner] truth:<sup class='fn'>22</sup>\n\t\t\tbut most of them understand it not.
VERILY, the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false]\n\t\t\tis the term appointed for all of them:<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
the Day when no friend shall be of the least avail to his friend,\n\t\t\tand when none shall be succoured
save those upon whom God will have bestowed His grace and mercy:\n\t\t\tfor, verily, He alone is almighty, a dispenser of grace.
Verily, [in the life to come] the tree of deadly fruit<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
will be the food of the sinful:<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
like molten lead will it boil in the belly,
like the boiling of burning despair.<sup class='fn'>26</sup>
[And the word will be spoken:] "Seize him, [O you forces of\n\t\t\thell,] and drag him into the midst of the blazing fire:
then pour over his head the anguish of burning despair!
Taste it - thou who [on earth] hast considered thyself so mighty,\n\t\t\tso noble!<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
This is the very thing which you [deniers of the truth] were wont\n\t\t\tto call in question!"<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
[As against this -] verily, the God-conscious will find\n\t\t\tthemselves in a state secure,
amid gardens and springs,
wearing [garments] of silk and brocade, facing one another [in\n\t\t\tlove].<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
Thus shall it be. And We shall pair them with companions pure,\n\t\t\tmost beautiful of eye.<sup class='fn'>30</sup>
In that [paradise] they shall [rightfully] claim all the fruits\n\t\t\t[of their past deeds],<sup class='fn'>31</sup> resting in security;

and neither shall they taste death there after having passed\n\t\t\tthrough their erstwhile death.<sup class='fn'>32</sup> Thus will He have\n\t\t\tpreserved them from all sufferging through the blazing fire -
an act of thy Sustainer's favour:<sup class='fn'>33</sup> and that, that will\n\t\t\tbe the triumph supreme!
THUS, THEN, [O Prophet,] have We made this [divine writ] easy to\n\t\t\tunderstand, in thine own [human] tongue, so that men might take\n\t\t\tit to heart.<sup class='fn'>34</sup>
So wait thou [for what the future will bring]: behold, they, too,\n\t\t\tare waiting.<sup class='fn'>35</sup>
Ha. Mim.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
THE BESTOWAL from on high of this divine writ issues from God,\n\t\t\tthe Almighty, the Wise.
Behold, in the heavens as well as on earth there are indeed\n\t\t\tmessages for all who [are willing to] believe.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
And in your own nature, and in [that of] all the animals which He\n\t\t\tscatters [over the earth] there are messages for people who are\n\t\t\tendowed with inner certainty.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

And in the succession of night and day, and in the means of
			subsistence<sup class='fn'>4</sup> which God sends down from the skies, giving
			life thereby to the earth after it had been lifeless, and in the
			change of the winds: [in all this] there are messages for people
			who use their reason.
These messages of God do We convey unto thee, setting forth the\n\t\t\ttruth. In what other tiding, if not in God's messages,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>\n\t\t\twill they, then, believe?
Woe unto every sinful self-deceiver<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
who hears God's messages when they are conveyed to him, and yet,\n\t\t\tas though he had not heard them, persists in his haughty disdain!\n\t\t\tHence, announce unto him grievous suffering -
for when he does become aware of any of Our messages, he makes\n\t\t\tthem a target of his mockery! For all such there is shameful\n\t\t\tsuffering in store.

Hell is ahead of them; and all that they may have gained [in this
			world] shall be of no avail whatever to them, and neither shall
			any of those things which, instead of God, they have come to
			regard as their protectors:<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

[To pay heed to God's signs and messages:] this is [the meaning
			of] guidance; on the other hand,<sup class='fn'>8</sup> for those who are bent
			on denying the truth of their Sustainer's messages there is
			grievous suffering in store as an outcome of [their]
			vileness.<sup class='fn'>9</sup>

IT IS GOD who has made the sea subservient [to His laws, so that
			it be of use] to you<sup class='fn'>10</sup> so that ships might sail through
			it at His behest, and that you might seek to obtain [what you
			need] of His bounty, and that you might have cause to be
			grateful.

And He has made subservient to you, [as a gift] from Himself, all\n\t\t\tthat is in the heavens and on earth:<sup class='fn'>11</sup> in this, behold,\n\t\t\tthere are messages indeed for people who think!

Tell all who have attained to faith that they should forgive
			those who do not believe in the coming of the Days of
			God,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> [since it is] for Him [alone] to requite people
			for whatever they may have earned.
Whoever does what is just and right, does so for his own good;\n\t\t\tand whoever does evil, does so to his own hurt; and in the end\n\t\t\tunto your Sustainer you all will be brought back.

AND, INDEED, [already] unto the children of Israel did We
			vouchsafe revelation, and wisdom, and prophethood;<sup class='fn'>13</sup> and
			We provided for them sustenance out of the good things of life,
			and favoured them above all other people [of their
			time].<sup class='fn'>14</sup>

And We gave them clear indications of the purpose [of
			faith];<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and it was only after all this knowledge had
			been vouchsafed to them that they began, out of mutual jealousy,
			to hold divergent views:<sup class='fn'>16</sup> [but,] verily, thy Sustainer
			will judge between them on Resurrection Day regarding all whereon
			they were wont to differ.

And, finally,<sup class='fn'>17</sup> [O Muhammad,] We have set thee on a way
			by which the purpose [of faith] may be fulfilled:<sup class='fn'>18</sup> so
			follow thou this [way], and follow not the likes and dislikes of
			those who do not know [the truth].<sup class='fn'>19</sup>

Behold, they could never be of any avail to thee if thou wert to
			defy the will of God<sup class='fn'>20</sup> for, verily, such evildoers are
			but friends and protectors of one another, whereas God is the
			Protector of all who are conscious of Him.
This [revelation, then,]<sup class='fn'>21</sup> is a means of insight for\n\t\t\tmankind, and a guidance and grace unto people who are endowed\n\t\t\twith inner certainty.

Now as for those who indulge in sinful doings - do they think
			that We place them, both in their life and their death, on an
			equal footing with those who have attained to faith and do
			righteous deeds?<sup class='fn'>22</sup> Bad, indeed, is their judgment:

for, God has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with
			[an inner] truth,<sup class='fn'>23</sup> and [has therefore willed] that
			every human being shall be recompensed for what he has earned and
			none shall be wronged.

HAST THOU ever considered [the kind of man] who makes his own
			desires his deity, and whom God has [thereupon] let go astray,
			knowing [that his mind is closed to all guidance],<sup class='fn'>24</sup> and
			whose hearing and heart He has sealed, and upon whose sight He
			has placed a veil?<sup class='fn'>25</sup> Who, then, could guide him after
			God [has abandoned him]? Will you not, then, bethink yourselves?

And yet they say: "There is nothing beyond our life in this
			world. We die as we come to life,<sup class='fn'>26</sup> and nothing but time
			destroys us." But of this they have no knowledge whatever: they
			do nothing but guess.

And [so,] whenever Our messages are conveyed to them in all their
			clarity, their only argument is this:<sup class='fn'>27</sup> "Bring forth our
			forefathers [as witnesses], if what you claim is
			true!"<sup class='fn'>28</sup>

Say: "It is God who gives you life, and then causes you to die;
			and in the end He will gather you together on Resurrection Day,
			[the coming of] which is beyond all doubt - but most human beings
			understand it not."

For, God's is the dominion over the heavens and the earth; and on
			the Day when the Last Hour dawns - on that Day will be lost all
			who [in their lifetime] tried to reduce to nothing [whatever they
			could not understand].<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
And [on that Day] thou wilt see all people kneeling down [in\n\t\t\thumility]: all people will be called upon to [face] their record:\n\t\t\t"Today you shall be requited for all that you ever did!
This Our record speaks of you in all truth: for, verily, We have\n\t\t\tcaused to be recorded all that you ever did!"
Now as for those who have attained to faith and done righteous\n\t\t\tdeeds, their Sustainer will admit them to His grace: that, that\n\t\t\twill be [their] manifest triumph!

But as for those who were bent on denying the truth, [they will\n\t\t\tbe told:] "Were not My messages conveyed to you? And withal, you\n\t\t\tgloried in your arrogance, and so you became people lost in sin:

for when it was said, 'Behold, God's promise always comes true,
			and there can be no doubt about [the coming of] the Last Hour' -
			you would answer, 'We do not know what that Last Hour may be: we
			think it is no more than an empty guess, and [so] we are by no
			means convinced!'"
And [on that Day,] the evil of their doings will become obvious\n\t\t\tto them, and they will be overwhelmed by the very thing which\n\t\t\tthey were wont to deride.<sup class='fn'>30</sup>

And [the word] will be spoken: "Today We shall be oblivious of
			you as you were oblivious of the coming of this your Day [of
			Judgment]; and so your goal is the fire, and you shall have none
			to succour you:

this, because you made God's messages the target of your mockery,
			having allowed the life of this world to beguile you!<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
			On that Day, therefore, they will not be brought out of the
			fire,<sup class='fn'>32</sup> nor will they be allowed to make amends.
AND THUS, all praise is due to God, Sustainer of the heavens and\n\t\t\tSustainer of the earth: the Sustainer of all the worlds!
And His alone is all majesty in the heavens and on earth; and He\n\t\t\talone is almighty, truly wise!
Ha. Mim.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
THE BESTOWAL from on high of this divine writ issues from God,\n\t\t\tthe Almighty, the Wise.

We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is
			between them otherwise than in accordance with [an inner] truth,
			and for a term set [by Us]:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and yet, they who are bent
			on denying the truth turn aside from the warnlng which has been
			conveyed unto them.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

Say: "Have you [really] given thought to what it is that you
			invoke instead of God? Show me what these [beings or forces] have
			created anywhere on earth! Or had they, perchance, a share in
			[creating] the heavens? [If so,] bring me any divine writ
			preceding this one, or any [other] vestige of knowledge<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
			- if what you claim is true!"

And who could be more astray than one who invokes, instead of
			God, such as will not respond to him either now or on the Day of
			Resurrection,<sup class='fn'>5</sup> and are not even conscious of being
			invoked? -
such as, when all mankind is gathered [for judgment], will be\n\t\t\tenemies unto those [who worshipped them], and will utterly reject\n\t\t\ttheir worship?<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

But whenever Our messages are conveyed to them in all their
			clarity, they who are bent on denying the truth speak thus of the
			truth as soon as it is brought to them: "This is clearly nothing
			but spellbinding eloquence!"<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

Or do they say, "He has invented all this"? Say [O Muhammad]:
			"Had I invented it, you would not be of the least help to me
			against God.<sup class='fn'>8</sup> He is fully aware of that [slander] into
			which you so recklessly plunge: enough is He as a witness between
			me and you! And [withal,] He alone is truly-forgiving, a true
			dispenser of grace.<sup class='fn'>9</sup>

Say: "I am not the first of [God's] apostles;<sup class='fn'>10</sup> and\n\t\t\t[like all of them,] I do not know what will be done with me or\n\t\t\twith you<sup class='fn'>11</sup> for I am nothing but a plain warner."

Say: "Have you given thought [to how you will fare] if this be
			truly [a revelation] from God and yet you deny its truth? - even
			though a witness from among the children of Israel has already
			borne witness to [the advent of] one like himself,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> and
			has believed [in him], the while you glory in your arrogance [and
			reject his message]? Verily, God does not grace [such] evildoing
			folk with His guidance!"

But they who are bent on denying the truth speak thus of those
			who have attained to faith: "If this [message] were any good,
			these [people] would not have preceded us in accepting
			it!"<sup class='fn'>13</sup> And since they refuse to be guided by it, they
			will always say, "This<sup class='fn'>14</sup> is [but] an ancient falsehood!"

And yet, before this there was the revelation of Moses, a guide
			and a [sign of God's] grace; and this [Qur'an] is a divine writ
			confirming the truth [of the Torah<sup class='fn'>15</sup>] in the Arabic
			tongue, to warn those who are bent on evildoing, and [to bring] a
			glad tiding to the doers of good:
for, behold, all who say, "Our Sustainer is God", and thereafter\n\t\t\tstand firm [in their faith] - no fear need they have, and neither\n\t\t\tshall they grieve:
it is they who are destined for paradise, therein to abide as a\n\t\t\treward for all that they have done.

NOW [among the best of the deeds which] We have enjoined upon man
			is goodness towards his parents.<sup class='fn'>16</sup> In pain did his
			mother bear him, and in pain did she give him birth; and her
			bearing him and his utter dependence on her took thirty
			months.<sup class='fn'>17</sup> And so, when he attains to full maturity and
			reaches forty years,<sup class='fn'>18</sup> he [that is righteous] prays: "O
			my Sustainer! Inspire me so that I may forever be grateful for
			those blessings of Thine with which Thou hast graced me and my
			parents, and that I may do what is right [in a manner] that will
			meet with Thy goodly acceptance; and grant me righteousness in my
			offspring [as well]. Verily, unto Thee have I turned in
			repentance:<sup class='fn'>19</sup> for, verily, I am of those who have
			surrendered themselves unto Thee!"

It is [such as] these from whom We shall accept the best that
			they ever did,<sup class='fn'>20</sup> and bad deeds We shall overlook: [they
			will find themselves] among those who are destined for paradise,
			in fulfilment of the true promise which they were given [in this
			world].

But [there is many a one] who says to his parents [whenever they
			try to imbue him with faith in God]: "Fie upon both of you! Do
			you promise me that I shall be brought forth [from the dead],
			although [so many] generations have passed away before
			me?"<sup class='fn'>21</sup> And [while] they both pray for God's help [and
			say], "Alas for thee! For, behold, God's promise always comes
			true!" - he but answers, "All this is nothing but fables of
			ancient times!"

It is [such as] these upon whom the sentence [of doom] will fall
			due, together with the [other sinful] communities of invisible
			beings<sup class='fn'>22</sup> and humans that have passed away before their
			time. Verily, they will be lost:

for, [in the life to come,] all shall have their degrees in
			accordance with whatever [good or evil] they did: and
			so,<sup class='fn'>23</sup> He will repay them in full for their doings, and
			none shall be wronged.

And on the Day when those who were bent on denying the truth will
			be brought within sight of the fire, [they will be told:] "You
			have exhausted your [share of] good things in your worldly life,
			having enjoyed them [without any thought of the hereafter]: and
			so today you shall be requited with the suffering of humiliation
			for having gloried on earth in your arrogance,<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
			offending against all that is right, and for all your iniquitous
			doings!"

AND REMEMBER that brother of [the tribe of] 'Ad,<sup class='fn'>25</sup> how -
			seeing that [other] warnings had already come and gone within his
			own knowledge as well as in times beyond his ken<sup class='fn'>26</sup> - he
			warned his people [who lived] among those sand-dunes: "Worship
			none but God! Verily, I fear lest suffering befall you on an
			awesome day!"
They answered: "Hast thou come to seduce us away from our gods?\n\t\t\tBring, then, upon us that [doom] with which thou threatenest us,\n\t\t\tif thou art a man of truth!"

Said he: "Knowledge [of when it is to befall you] rests with God
			alone: I but convey unto you the message with which I have been
			entrusted; but I see that you are people ignorant [of right and
			wrong]!"

And so, when they beheld it<sup class='fn'>27</sup> in the shape of a dense
			cloud approaching their valleys, they exclaimed, "This is but a
			heavy cloud which will bring us [welcome] rain!" [But Hud said:]
			"Nay, but it is the very thing which you [so contemptuously]
			sought to hasten - a wind bearing grievous suffering,

bound to destroy everything at its Sustainer's behest!" And then
			they were so utterly wiped out<sup class='fn'>28</sup> that nothing could be
			seen save their [empty] dwellings: thus do We requite people lost
			in sin.

And yet, We had established them securely in a manner in which We
			have never established you, people of later times;]<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
			and We had endowed them with hearing, and sight, and
			[knowledgeable] hearts:<sup class='fn'>30</sup> but neither their hearing, nor
			their sight, nor their hearts were of the least avail to them,
			seeing that they went on rejecting God's messages; and [in the
			end] they were overwhelmed<sup class='fn'>31</sup> by the very thing which
			they had been wont to deride.

Thus have We destroyed many a [sinful] community living round
			about you;<sup class='fn'>32</sup> and yet, [before destroying them,] We had
			given many facets to [Our warning] messages, so that they might
			turn back [from their evil ways].

But, then, did those [beings] whom they had chosen to worship as
			deities beside God, hoping that they would bring them nearer [to
			Him],<sup class='fn'>33</sup> help them [in the end]? Nay, they forsook them:
			for that [alleged divinity] was but an outcome of their
			self-delusion and all their false imagery.<sup class='fn'>34</sup>

AND Lo!<sup class='fn'>35</sup> We caused a group of unseen beings to incline
			towards thee, [O Muhammad,]<sup class='fn'>36</sup> so that they might give
			ear to the Qur'an; and so, as soon as they became aware of
			it,<sup class='fn'>37</sup> they said [unto one another], "Listen in silence!"
			And when [the recitation] was ended, they returned to their
			people as warners.<sup class='fn'>38</sup>

They said: "O our people! Behold, we have been listening to a
			revelation bestowed from on high after [that of] Moses,
			confirming the truth of whatever there still remains [of the
			Torah]:<sup class='fn'>39</sup> it guides towards the truth, and onto a
			straight way.
"O our people! Respond to God's call, and have faith in Him: He\n\t\t\twill forgive you [whatever is past] of your sins, and deliver you\n\t\t\tfrom grievous suffering [in the life to come].

But he who does not respond to God's call can never elude [Him]\n\t\t\ton earth, nor can he have any protector against Him [in the life\n\t\t\tto come]: all such are most obviously lost in error."<sup class='fn'>40</sup>

ARE, THEN, they [who deny the life to come] not aware that God,
			who has created the heavens and the earth and never been wearied
			by their creation,<sup class='fn'>41</sup> has [also] the power to bring the
			dead back to life? Yea, verily, He has the power to will
			anything!

And so, on the Day when those who were bent on denying the truth
			will be brought within sight of the fire [and will be asked], "Is
			not this the truth?" - they will answer, "Yea, by Our Sustainer!"
			[And] He will say: "Taste, then, this suffering as an outcome of
			your denial of the truth!"

REMAIN, then, [O believer,] patient in adversity, just as all of
			the apostles, endowed with firmness of heart, bore themselves
			with patience. And do not ask for a speedy doom of those [who
			still deny the truth]: on the Day when they see [the fulfilment
			of] what they were promised,<sup class='fn'>42</sup> [it will seem to them] as
			though they had dwelt [on earth] no longer than one hour of [an
			earthly] day!<sup class='fn'>43</sup> [This is Our] message. Will, then, any
			be [really] destroyed save iniquitous folk?<sup class='fn'>44</sup>
AS FOR THOSE who are bent on denying the truth and on barring\n\t\t\t[others] from the path of God - all their [good] deeds will He\n\t\t\tlet go to waste;<sup class='fn'>1</sup>

whereas those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds,
			and have come to believe in what has been bestowed from on high
			on Muhammad - for it is the truth from their Sustainer - [shall
			attain to God's grace:] He will efface their [past] bad deeds,
			and will set their hearts at rest.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>

This, because they who are bent on denying the truth pursue
			falsehood, whereas they who have attained to faith pursue [but]
			the truth [that flows] from their Sustainer. In this way does God
			set forth unto man the parables of their true state.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

NOW WHEN you meet [in war] those who are bent on denying the
			truth,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> smite their necks until you overcome them fully,
			and then tighten their bonds;<sup class='fn'>5</sup> but thereafter [set them
			free,] either by an act of grace or against ransom, so that the
			burden of war may be lifted:<sup class='fn'>6</sup> thus [shall it be]. And
			[know that] had God so willed, He could indeed punish them
			[Himself]; but [He wills you to struggle] so as to test you [all]
			by means of one another.<sup class='fn'>7</sup> And as for those who are slain
			in God's cause, never will He let their deeds go to waste:
He will guide them [in the hereafter as well], and will set their\n\t\t\thearts at rest,
and will admit them to the paradise which He has promised them.
O you who have attained to faith! If you help [the cause of] God,\n\t\t\tHe will help you, and will make firm your steps;
but as for those who are bent on denying the truth, ill fortune\n\t\t\tawaits them, since He will let all their [good] deeds go to\n\t\t\twaste:
this because they hate [the very thought of] what God has\n\t\t\tbestowed from on high<sup class='fn'>8</sup> - and thus He causes all their\n\t\t\tdeeds to come to nought!<sup class='fn'>9</sup>

Have they, then, never journeyed about the earth and beheld what
			happened in the end to those [wilful sinners] who lived before
			their time? God destroyed them utterly: and the like thereof
			awaits all who deny the truth."<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
This, because God is the Protector of all who have attained to\n\t\t\tfaith, whereas they who deny the truth have no protector.

Verily, God will admit all who attain to faith and do righteous
			deeds into gardens through which running waters flow, whereas
			they who are bent on denying the truth shall have - even though
			they may enjoy their life [in this world] and eat as cattle eat -
			the fire [of the hereafter] for their abode.
And how many a community<sup class='fn'>11</sup> of greater power than this\n\t\t\tthy community which has driven thee out, [O Muhammad,] have We\n\t\t\tdestroyed, with none to succour them!

CAN, THEN, he who takes his stand on a clear evidence from his
			Sustainer be likened unto one<sup class='fn'>12</sup> to whom the evil of his
			own doings [always] seems goodly, and unto such as would follow
			but their own lusts?

[And can] the parable of the paradise which the God-conscious are
			promised<sup class='fn'>13</sup> - [a paradise] where in there are rivers of
			water which time does not corrupt, and rivers of milk the taste
			whereof never alters, and rivers of wine delightful to those who
			drink it,<sup class='fn'>14</sup> and rivers of honey of all impurity
			cleansed, and the enjoyment<sup class='fn'>15</sup> of all the fruits [of
			their good deeds] and of forgiveness from their Sustainer -: can
			this [parable of paradise] be likened unto [the parable of the
			recompense of<sup class='fn'>16</sup>] such as are to abide in the fire and be
			given waters of burning despair<sup class='fn'>17</sup> to drink, so that it
			will tear their bowels asunder?

Now among those [hapless sinners] are such as [pretend to] listen
			to thee, [O Muhammad,]<sup class='fn'>18</sup> and then, as soon as they leave
			thy presence, speak [with scorn] unto those who have understood
			[thy message]:<sup class='fn'>19</sup> "What is it that he has said just now?"
			It is such as these whose hearts God has sealed because they
			[always] followed but their own lusts<sup class='fn'>20</sup> -
just as for those who are [willing to be] guided, He increases\n\t\t\ttheir [ability to follow His] guidance and causes them to grow in\n\t\t\tGod-consciousness.<sup class='fn'>21</sup>

Are, then, they [whose hearts are sealed] waiting for the Last
			Hour - [waiting] that it come upon them of a sudden? But it has
			already been foretold!<sup class='fn'>22</sup> And what will their remembrance
			[of their past sins] avail them, once it has come upon
			them?<sup class='fn'>23</sup>

Know, then, [O man,] that there is no deity save God, and [while
			there is yet time,] ask forgiveness for thy sins and for [the
			sins of] all other believing men and women: for God knows all
			your comings and goings as well as your abiding [at
			rest].<sup class='fn'>24</sup>

NOW THOSE who have attained to faith say, "Would that a
			revelation [allowing us to fight] were bestowed from on
			high!"<sup class='fn'>25</sup> But now that a revelation clear in and by
			itself,<sup class='fn'>26</sup> mentioning war, has been bestowed from on
			high, thou canst see those in whose hearts is disease looking at
			thee, [O Muhammad,] with the look of one who is about to faint
			for fear of death! And yet, far better for them would be

obedience [to God's call] and a word that could win [His]
			approval:<sup class='fn'>27</sup> for, since the matter has been resolved [by
			His revelation], it would be but for their own good to remain
			true to God.

[Ask them:] "Would you, perchance, after having turned away [from
			God's commandment, prefer to revert to your old ways, and] spread
			corruption on earth, and [once again] cut asunder your ties of
			kinship?"<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
It is such as these whom God rejects, and whom He makes deaf [to\n\t\t\tthe voice of truth], and whose eyes He blinds [to its\n\t\t\tsight]!<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
Will they not, then, ponder over this Qur'an? - or are there\n\t\t\tlocks upon their hearts?
VERILY, those who turn their backs [on this message] after\n\t\t\tguidance has been vouchsafed to them, [do it because] Satan has\n\t\t\tembellished their fancies and filled them with false hopes:

[they do turn their backs on it] inasmuch as<sup class='fn'>30</sup> they are
			wont to say unto those who abhor all that God has revealed, "We
			will comply with your views on some points."<sup class='fn'>31</sup> But God
			knows their secret thoughts:
hence, how [will they fare] when the angels gather them in death,\n\t\t\tstriking their faces and their backs?<sup class='fn'>32</sup>

This, because they were wont to pursue what God condemns, and to\n\t\t\thate [whatever would meet with] His goodly acceptance:<sup class='fn'>33</sup>\n\t\t\tand so He has caused all their [good] deeds to come to nought.
Or do they in whose hearts is disease think, perchance, that God\n\t\t\twould never bring their moral failings to light?<sup class='fn'>34</sup>

Now had We so willed, We could have shown them clearly to thee,
			so that thou wouldst know them for sure as by a visible
			mark:<sup class='fn'>35</sup> but [even so,] thou wilt most certainly
			reconnize them by the tone of their voice.<sup class='fn'>36</sup> And God
			knows all that you do, [O men;]

and most certainly We shall try you all, so that We might mark
			out<sup class='fn'>37</sup> those of you who strive hard [in Our cause] and
			are patient in adversity: for We shall put to a test [the truth
			of] all your assertions.<sup class='fn'>38</sup>

Verily, they who are bent on denying the truth and on barring
			[others] from the path of God, and [who thus] cut themselves off
			from the Apostle<sup class='fn'>39</sup> after guidance has been vouchsafed to
			them, can in no wise harm God; but He will cause all their deeds
			to come to nought.
O you who have attained to faith! Pay heed unto God, and pay heed\n\t\t\tunto the Apostle, and let not your [good] deeds come to nought!
Verily, as for those who are bent on denying the truth and on\n\t\t\tbarring [others] from the path of God, and then die as deniers of\n\t\t\tthe truth - indeed,God will not grant them forgiveness!

AND SO, [when you fight in a just cause,] do not lose heart and
			[never] beg for peace: for, seeing that God is with you, you are
			bound to rise high [in the end];<sup class='fn'>40</sup> and never will He let
			your [good] deeds go to waste.

The life of this world is but a play and a passing delight: but
			if you believe [in God] and are conscious of Him, He will grant
			you your deserts. And withal, He does not demand of you [to
			sacrifice in His cause all of] your possessions:<sup class='fn'>41</sup>

[for,] if He were to demand of you all of them, and urge\n\t\t\tyou,<sup class='fn'>42</sup> you would niggardly cling [to them], and so He\n\t\t\twould [but] bring out your moral failings.<sup class='fn'>43</sup>

Behold, [O believers,] it is you who are called upon to spend
			freely in God's cause: but [even] among you are such as turn out
			to be niggardly! And yet, he who acts niggardly [in God's cause]
			is but niggardly towards his own self: for God is indeed
			self-sufficient, whereas you stand in need [of Him]; and if you
			turn away [from Him], He will cause other people to take your
			place, and they will not be the likes of you!
VERILY, [O Muhammad,] We have laid before thee a manifest\n\t\t\tvictory,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>

so that God might show His forgiveness of all thy faults, past as
			well as future,<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and [thus] bestow upon thee the full
			measure of His blessings, and guide thee on a straight
			way,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
and [show] that God will succour thee with [His] mighty succour.

It is He who from on high has bestowed inner peace upon the
			hearts of the believers,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> so that seeing that God's are
			all the forces of the heavens and the earth, and that God is
			all-knowing, truly wise - they might grow yet more firm in their
			faith,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>

[and] that He might admit the believers, both men and women, into
			gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide, and
			that He might efface their [past bad] deeds: and that is, in the
			sight of God, indeed a triumph supreme!

And [God has willed] to impose suffering [in the life to come] on
			the hypocrites, both men and women, and on those who ascribe
			divinity to aught beside Him, both men and women: all who
			entertain evil thoughts about God.<sup class='fn'>6</sup> Evil encompasses
			them from all sides, and God's condemnation rests upon them; and
			He has rejected them [from His grace], and has readied hell for
			them: and how evil a journey's end!
For, God's are all the forces of the heavens and the earth; and\n\t\t\tGod is indeed almighty, truly wise!
VERILY, [O Muhammad,] We have sent thee as a witness [to the\n\t\t\ttruth], and as a herald of glad tidings and a warner -
so that you [O men] might believe in God and His Apostle, and\n\t\t\tmight honour Him, and rever Him, and extol His limitless glory\n\t\t\tfrom morn to evening.<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

Behold, all who pledge their allegiance to thee pledge their
			allegiance to God: the hand of God is over their hands.<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
			Hence, he who breaks his oath, breaks it only to his own hurt;
			whereas he who remains true to what he has pledged unto God, on
			him will He bestow a reward supreme.

Those of the bedouin who stayed behind<sup class='fn'>9</sup> will say unto
			thee: "[The need to take care of] our chattels and our families
			kept us busy: do then, [O Prophet,] ask God to forgive us!"
			[Thus,] they will utter with their tongues something that is not
			in their hearts.<sup class='fn'>10</sup> Say: "Who, then, has it in his power
			to avert from you aught that God may have willed,<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
			whether it be His will to harm you or to confer a benefit on you?
			Nay, but God is fully aware of what you do!

Nay, you thought that the Apostle and the believers would never
			return to their kith and kin: and this seemed goodly to your
			hearts.<sup class='fn'>12</sup> And you entertained [such] evil thoughts
			because you have always been people devoid of all good!"
Now as for those who will not believe in God and His Apostle -\n\t\t\tverily, We have readied a blazing flame for all [such] deniers of\n\t\t\tthe truth!

But God's is the dominion over the heavens and the earth: He
			forgives whomever He wills, and imposes suffering on whomever He
			wills - and [withal,] He is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of
			grace.<sup class='fn'>13</sup>

As soon as you [O believers] are about to set forth on a war that
			promises booty,<sup class='fn'>14</sup> those who stayed behind [aforetime]
			will surely say, "Allow us to go with you" - [thus showing that]
			they would like to alter the Word of God.<sup class='fn'>15</sup> Say: "By no
			means shall you go with us: God has declared aforetime<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
			[to whom all spoils shall belong]." Thereupon they will [surely]
			answer, "Nay, but you begrudge us [our share of booty]!" Nay,
			they can grasp but so little of the truth!

Say unto those bedouin who stayed behind: "In time you will be
			called upon [to fight] against people of great prowess in
			war:<sup class='fn'>17</sup> you will have to fight against them [until you
			die] or they surrender. And then, if you heed [that call], God
			will bestow on you a goodly reward; but if you turn away as you
			turned away this time,<sup class='fn'>18</sup> He will chastise you with
			grievous chastisement.

No blame attaches to the blind, nor does blame attach to the
			lame, nor does blame attach to the sick [for staying away from a
			war in God's cause];<sup class='fn'>19</sup> but whoever heeds [the call of]
			God and His Apostle [in deed or in heart<sup class='fn'>20</sup>], him will He
			admit into gardens through which running waters flow; whereas him
			who turns away will He chastise with grievous chastisement.

INDEED, well-pleased was God with the believers when they pledged
			their allegiance unto thee [O Muhammad] under that
			tree,<sup class='fn'>21</sup> for He knew what was in their hearts; and so He
			bestowed inner peace upon them from on high, and rewarded them
			with [the glad tiding of] a victory soon to come<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
and [of] many war-gains which they would achieve: for God is\n\t\t\tindeed almighty, wise.

[O you who believe!] God has promised you many war-gains which
			you shall yet achieve; and He has vouchsafed you these [worldly
			gains] well in advance,<sup class='fn'>23</sup> and has stayed from you the
			hands of [hostile] people, so that this [your inner strength] may
			become a symbol to the believers [who will come after
			you<sup class='fn'>24</sup>], and that He may guide you all on a straight way.
And there are yet other [gains] which are still beyond your\n\t\t\tgrasp,<sup class='fn'>25</sup> [but] which God has already encompassed [for\n\t\t\tyou]: for God has the power to will anything.

And [now,] if they who are bent on denying the truth should fight
			against you, they will indeed turn their backs [in flight], and
			will find none to protect them and none to bring them
			succour:<sup class='fn'>26</sup>
such being God's way which has ever obtained in the past - and\n\t\t\tnever wilt thou find any change in God's way!<sup class='fn'>27</sup>

And He it is who, in the valley of Mecca, stayed their hands from\n\t\t\tyou, and your hands from them, after He had enabled you to\n\t\t\tvanquish them; and God saw indeed what you were doing.<sup class='fn'>28</sup>

[It was not for your enemies' sake that He stayed your hands from
			them:<sup class='fn'>29</sup> for] it was they who were bent on denying the
			truth, and who debarred you from the Inviolable House of
			Worship<sup class='fn'>30</sup> and prevented your offering from reaching its
			destination.<sup class='fn'>31</sup> And had it not been for the believing men
			and believing women [in Mecca], whom you might have unwittingly
			trampled underfoot,<sup class='fn'>32</sup> and on whose account you might
			have become guilty, without knowing it, of a grievous wrong -:
			[had it not been for this, you would have been allowed to fight
			your way into the city: but you were forbidden to
			fight<sup class='fn'>33</sup>] so that [in time] God might admit to His grace
			whomever He wills.<sup class='fn'>34</sup> Had they [who deserve Our mercy and
			they whom We have condemned] been clearly discernible [to
			you],<sup class='fn'>35</sup> We would indeed have imposed grievous suffering
			[at your hands] on such of them as were bent on denying the
			truth.

Whereas they who are bent on denying the truth harboured a
			stubborn disdain in their hearts - the stubborn disdain [born] of
			ignorance<sup class='fn'>36</sup> - God bestowed from on high His [gift of]
			inner peace upon His Apostle and the believers, and bound them to
			the spirit of God-consciousness:<sup class='fn'>37</sup> for they were most
			worthy of this [divine gift], and deserved it well. And God has
			full knowledge of all things.

Indeed, God has shown the truth in His Apostle's true
			vision:<sup class='fn'>38</sup> most certainly shall you enter the Inviolable
			House of Worship, if God so wills, in full security, with your
			heads shaved or your hair cut short,<sup class='fn'>39</sup> without any fear:
			for He has [always] known that which you yourselves could not
			know.<sup class='fn'>40</sup> And He has ordained [for you], besides this, a
			victory soon to come.<sup class='fn'>41</sup>

He it is who has sent forth His Apostle with the [task of
			spreading] guidance and the religion of truth, to the end that He
			make it prevail over every [false] religion; and none can bear
			witness [to the truth] as God does.<sup class='fn'>42</sup>

MUHAMMAD is God's Apostle; and those who are [truly] with him are
			firm and unyielding<sup class='fn'>43</sup> towards all deniers of the truth,
			[yet] full of mercy towards one another.<sup class='fn'>44</sup> Thou canst
			see them bowing down, prostrating themselves [in prayer], seeking
			favour with God and [His] goodly acceptance: their marks are on
			their faces, traced by prostration.<sup class='fn'>45</sup> This is their
			parable in the Torah as well as their parable in the
			Gospel:<sup class='fn'>46</sup> [they are] like a seed that brings forth its
			shoot, and then He strengthens it, so that it grows stout, and
			[in the end] stands firm upon its stem, delighting the sowers....
			[Thus will God cause the believers to grow in strengh,] so that
			through them He might confound<sup class='fn'>47</sup> the deniers of the
			truth. [But] unto such of them as may [yet] attain to faith and
			do righteous deeds, God has promised forgiveness and a reward
			supreme.<sup class='fn'>48</sup>

O you who have attained to faith! Do not put yourselves
			forward<sup class='fn'>1</sup> in the presence of [what] God and His Apostle
			[may have ordained], but remain conscious of God: for, verily,
			God is all-hearing, all-knowing!

O you who have attained to faith! Do not raise your voices above
			the voice of the Prophet,<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and neither speak loudly to
			him, as you would speak loudly to one another,<sup class='fn'>3</sup> lest all
			your [good] deeds come to nought without your perceiving it.

Behold, they who lower their voices in the presence of God's
			Apostle - it is they whose hearts God has tested [and opened] to
			consciousness of Himself; [and] theirs shall be forgiveness and a
			reward supreme.
Verily, [O Prophet,] as for those who call thee from without thy\n\t\t\tprivate apartments<sup class='fn'>4</sup> most of them do not use their\n\t\t\treason:
for, if they had the patience [to wait] until thou come forth to\n\t\t\tthem [of thine own accord], it would be for their own good.\n\t\t\tStill, God is much forgiving, a dispenser of grace.

O YOU who have attained to faith! If any iniquitous person comes
			to you with a [slanderous] tale, use your discernment,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
			lest you hurt people unwittingly and afterwards be filled with
			remorse for what you have done.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

And know that God's Apostle is among you:<sup class='fn'>7</sup> were he to
			comply with your inclinations in each and every case,<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
			you would be bound to come to harm [as a community]. But as it
			is, God has caused [your] faith to be dear to you, and has given
			it beauty in your hearts, and has made hateful to you all denial
			of the truth, and all iniquity, and all rebellion [against what
			is good]. Such indeed are they who follow the right course
through God's bounty and favour; and God is all-knowing, truly\n\t\t\twise.

Hence, if two groups of believers fall to fighting,<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
			make peace between them; but then, if one of the two [groups]
			goes on acting wrongfully towards the other, fight against the
			one that acts wrongfully until it reverts to God's
			commandment;<sup class='fn'>10</sup> and if they revert, make peace between
			them with justice, and deal equitably [with them]: for verily,
			God loves those who act equitably!

All believers are but brethren.<sup class='fn'>11</sup> Hence, [whenever they\n\t\t\tare at odds,] make peace between your two brethren, and remain\n\t\t\tconscious of God, so that you might be graced with His mercy.

O YOU who have attained to faith! No men shall deride [other]
			men: it may well be that those [whom they deride] are better than
			themselves; and no women [shall deride other] women: it may well
			be that those [whom they deride] are better than
			themselves.<sup class='fn'>12</sup> And neither shall you defame one another,
			nor insult one another by [opprobrious] epithets: evil is all
			imputation of iniquity after [one has attained to]
			faith;<sup class='fn'>13</sup> and they who [become guilty thereof and] do not
			repent - it is they, they who are evildoers!

O you who have attained to faith! Avoid most guesswork [about one
			another]<sup class='fn'>14</sup> for, behold, some of [such] guesswork is [in
			itself] a sin; and do not spy upon one another, and neither allow
			yourselves to speak ill of one another behind your backs. Would
			any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? Nay, you
			would loathe it! And be conscious of God. Verily, God is an
			acceptor of repentance, a dispenser of grace!

O men! Behold, We have created you all out of a male and a
			female,<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and have made you into nations and tribes, so
			that you might come to know one another.<sup class='fn'>16</sup> Verily, the
			noblest of you in the sight of God is the one who is most deeply
			conscious of Him. Behold, God is all-knowing, all-aware.

THE BEDOUIN say, "We have attained to faith." Say [unto them, O
			Muhammad]: "You have not [yet] attained to faith; you should
			[rather] say, 'We have [outwardly] surrendered' - for [true]
			faith has not yet entered your hearts.<sup class='fn'>17</sup> But if you
			[truly] pay heed unto God and His Apostle, He will not let the
			least of your deeds<sup class='fn'>18</sup> go to waste: for, behold, God is
			much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace."

[Know that true] believers are only those who have attained to
			faith in God and His Apostle and have left all doubt
			behind,<sup class='fn'>19</sup> and who strive hard in God's cause with their
			possessions and their lives: it is they, they who are true to
			their word!

Say: "Do you, perchance, [want to] inform God of [the nature of]
			your faith<sup class='fn'>20</sup> - although God knows all that is in the
			heavens and all that is on earth? Indeed, God has full knowledge
			of everything!"

Many people<sup class='fn'>21</sup> think that they have bestowed a favour
			upon thee [O Prophet] by having surrendered [to thee].<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
			Say thou: "Deem not your surrender a favour unto me: nay, but it
			is God who bestows a favour upon you by showing you the way to
			faith - if you are true to your word!"
Verily, God knows the hidden reality of the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth; and God sees all that you do.
Qaf<sup class='fn'>1</sup> CONSIDER this sublime Qur'an!

But nay - they deem it strange that a warner should have come\n\t\t\tunto them from their own midst;<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and so these deniers of\n\t\t\tthe truth are saying, "A strange thing is this!
Why -[how could we be resurrected] after we have died and become\n\t\t\tmere dust? Such a return seems far-fetched indeed!"
Well do We know how the earth consumes their bodies,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>\n\t\t\tfor with Us is a record unfailing.

Nay, but they [who refuse to believe in resurrection] have been\n\t\t\twont to give the lie to this truth whenever it was proffered to\n\t\t\tthem; and so they are in a state of confusion.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
Do they not look at the sky above them - now We have built it and\n\t\t\tmade it beautiful and free of all faults?<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
And the earth - We have spread it wide, and set upon it mountains\n\t\t\tfirm, and caused it to bring forth plants of all beauteous kinds,
thus offering an insight and a reminder unto every human being\n\t\t\twho willingly turns unto God.
And We send down from the skies water rich in blessings, and\n\t\t\tcause thereby gardens to grow, and fields of grain,
and tall palm-trees with their thickly-clustered dates,
as sustenance apportioned to men; and by [all] this We bring dead\n\t\t\tland to life: [and] even so will be [man's] coming-forth from\n\t\t\tdeath.
[Long] before those [who now deny resurrection] did Noah's people\n\t\t\tgive the lie to this truth, and [so did] the folk of\n\t\t\tAr-Rass,<sup class='fn'>6</sup> and [the tribes of] Thamud
and 'Ad, and Pharaoh, and Lot's brethren,<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

and the dwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan], and the people\n\t\t\tof Tubba':<sup class='fn'>8</sup> they all gave the lie to the apostles - and\n\t\t\tthereupon that whereof I had warned [them] came true.

Could We, then, be [thought of as being] worn out by the first\n\t\t\tcreation?<sup class='fn'>9</sup> Nay - but some people<sup class='fn'>10</sup> are [still]\n\t\t\tlost in doubt about [the possibility of] a new creation!
NOW, VERILY, it is We who have created man, and We know what his\n\t\t\tinnermost self whispers within him: for We are closer to him than\n\t\t\this neck-vein.
[And so,] whenever the two demands [of his nature] come face to\n\t\t\tface, contending from the right and from the left,<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
not even a word can he utter but there is a watcher with him,\n\t\t\tever-present.<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
And [then,] the twilight of death brings with it the [full]\n\t\t\ttruth<sup class='fn'>13</sup> - that [very thing, O man,] from which thou\n\t\t\twouldst always look away! -
and [in the end] the trumpet [of resurrection] will be blown:\n\t\t\tthat will be the Day of a warning fulfilled.
And every human being will come forward with [his erstwhile]\n\t\t\tinner urges and [his] conscious mind,<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
[and will be told:] "Indeed, unmindful hast thou been of this\n\t\t\t[Day of Judgement]; but now We have lifted from thee thy veil,\n\t\t\tand sharp is thy sight today!"
And one part<sup class='fn'>15</sup> of him will say: "This it is that has\n\t\t\tbeen ever-present with me!"<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
[Whereupon God will command:] "Cast, cast<sup class='fn'>17</sup> into hell\n\t\t\tevery [such] stubborn enemy of the truth,
[every] withholder of good [and] sinful aggressor [and] fomentor\n\t\t\tof distrust [between man and man - everyone]
who has set up another deity beside God:<sup class='fn'>18</sup> cast him,\n\t\t\tthen, cast him into suffering severe!"

Man's other self<sup class='fn'>19</sup> will say: "O our Sustainer! It was\n\t\t\tnot I that led his conscious mind<sup class='fn'>20</sup> into evil [nay,] but\n\t\t\tit had gone far astray [of its own accord]!"<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
[And] He will say: "Contend not before Me, [O you sinners,] for I\n\t\t\tgave you a forewarning [of this Day of Reckoning].
The judgment passed by Me shall not be altered; but never do I do\n\t\t\tthe least wrong unto My creatures!"
On that Day We will ask hell, "Art thou filled?" - and it will\n\t\t\tanswer, "[Nay,] is there yet more [for me]?"
And [on that Day] paradise will be brought within the sight\n\t\t\tof<sup class='fn'>22</sup> the God-conscious, and will no longer be far away;\n\t\t\t[and they will be told:]
"This is what you were promised - [promised] unto everyone who\n\t\t\twas wont to turn unto God and to keep Him always in mind -

[everyone] who stood in awe of the Most Gracious although He is\n\t\t\tbeyond the reach of human perception, and who has come [unto Him]\n\t\t\twith a heart full of contrition.<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
Enter this [paradise] in peace; this is the Day on which life\n\t\t\tabiding begins!"<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
In that [paradise] they shall have whatever they may desire - but\n\t\t\tthere is yet more with Us.

AND HOW MANY a generation have We destroyed before those [who now
			deny the truth]<sup class='fn'>25</sup> - people of greater might than theirs
			-: but [when Our chastisement befell them,] they became wanderers
			on the face of the earth, seeking no more than a place of
			refuge.<sup class='fn'>26</sup>

In this, behold, there is indeed a reminder for everyone whose\n\t\t\theart is wide-awake<sup class='fn'>27</sup> that is, [everyone who] lends ear\n\t\t\twith a conscious mind<sup class='fn'>28</sup> -
and [who knows that] We have indeed created the heavens and the\n\t\t\tearth and all that is between them in six aeons, and [that] no\n\t\t\tweariness could ever touch Us.<sup class='fn'>29</sup>

HENCE, [O believer,] bear thou with patience whatever they may
			say,<sup class='fn'>30</sup> and extol thy Sustainer's limitless glory and
			praise before the rising of the sun and before its
			setting;<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
and in the night, too, extol His glory, and at every prayer's\n\t\t\tend.<sup class='fn'>32</sup>
And [always] listen for the day when He who issues the call [of\n\t\t\tdeath] shall call [thee] from close by;<sup class='fn'>33</sup>
[and bethink thyself, too, of] the Day on which all [human\n\t\t\tbeings] will in truth hear the final blast - that Day of [their]\n\t\t\tcoming-forth [from death].
Verily, it is We who grant life and deal death; and with Us will\n\t\t\tbe all journeys' end
on the Day when the earth is riven asunder all around them as\n\t\t\tthey hasten forth [towards God's judgment]: that gathering will\n\t\t\tbe easy for Us [to encompass].

Fully aware are We of what they [who deny resurrection] do say;
			and thou canst by no means force them [to believe in it]. Yet
			none the less, remind, through this Qur'an, all such as may fear
			My warning.
CONSIDER the winds that scatter the dust far and wide,
and those that carry the burden [of heavy clouds],
and those that speed along with gentle ease,
and those that apportion [the gift of life] at [God's]\n\t\t\tbehest!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Verily, that which you are promised<sup class='fn'>2</sup> is true indeed,
and, verily, judgment is bound to come!
CONSIDER the firmament full of starry paths!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Verily, [O men,] you are deeply at variance as to what to\n\t\t\tbelieve:<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
perverted in his views thereon is he who would deceive\n\t\t\thimself!<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
They but destroy themselves,<sup class='fn'>6</sup> they who are given to\n\t\t\tguessing at what they cannot ascertain<sup class='fn'>7</sup> -
they who blunder along, in ignorance lost -
they who [mockingly] ask, "When is that Day of Judgment to be?"
[It will be] a Day when they will be sorely tried by the\n\t\t\tfire,<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
[and will be told:] "Taste this your trial! It is this that you\n\t\t\twere so hastily asking for!"<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
[But,] behold, the God-conscious will find themselves amid\n\t\t\tgardens and springs,
enjoying all that their Sustainer will have granted them\n\t\t\t[because], verily, they were doers of good in the\n\t\t\tpast:<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
they would lie asleep during but a small part of the night,
from their innermost hearts;<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
and [would assign] in all that they possessed a due share unto\n\t\t\tsuch as might ask [for help] and such as might suffer\n\t\t\tprivation.<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
AND ON EARTH there are signs [of God's existence, visible] to all\n\t\t\twho are endowed with inner certainty,
just as [there are signs thereof] within your own\n\t\t\tselves:<sup class='fn'>13</sup> can you not, then, see?
And in heaven is [the source of] your sustenance [on\n\t\t\tearth]<sup class='fn'>14</sup> and [of] all that you are promised [for your\n\t\t\tlife after death]:
for, by the Sustainer of heaven and earth, this [life after\n\t\t\tdeath] is the very truth - as true as that you are endowed with\n\t\t\tspeech!<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
AND HAS the story of Abraham's honoured guests ever come within\n\t\t\tthy ken?<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
When those [heavenly messengers] came unto him and bade him\n\t\t\tpeace, he answered, "[And upon you be] peace!" - [saying to\n\t\t\thimself,] "They are strangers."<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
Then he turned quietly to his household, and brought forth a fat\n\t\t\t[roasted] calf,
and placed it before them, saying, "Will you not eat?"

[And when he saw that the guests would not eat,] he became
			apprehensive of them;<sup class='fn'>18</sup> [but] they said, "Fear not" -
			and gave him the glad tiding of [the birth of] a son who would be
			endowed with deep knowledge.<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
Thereupon his wife approached [the guests] with a loud cry, and\n\t\t\tstruck her face [in astonishment] and exclaimed: "A barren old\n\t\t\twoman [like me]!"
They answered: "Thus has thy Sustainer decreed; and, verily, He\n\t\t\talone is truly wise, all-knowing!"
Said [Abraham]: "And what [else] may you have in view, O you\n\t\t\t[heavenly] messengers?"
They answered: "Behold, we have been sent unto a people lost in\n\t\t\tsin,<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
to let loose upon them stone-hard blows of\n\t\t\tchastisement,<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
marked out in thy Sustainer's sight for [the punishment of] such\n\t\t\tas have wasted their own selves."<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
And in the course of time<sup class='fn'>23</sup> We brought out [of Lot's\n\t\t\tcity] such [few] believers as were there:
for apart from one [single] house<sup class='fn'>24</sup> We did not find\n\t\t\tthere any who had surrendered themselves to Us.
And so We left therein<sup class='fn'>25</sup> a message for those who fear\n\t\t\tthe grievous suffering [which awaits all evildoers].
AND IN [the story of Pharaoh and] Moses, too, [We left the same\n\t\t\tmessage:<sup class='fn'>26</sup> for] when We sent him unto Pharaoh with [Our]\n\t\t\tmanifest authority,
and he turned away in [the pride of] his power and said, "A\n\t\t\tsorcerer [is this Moses], or a madman!" -
We seized him and his hosts, and cast them all into the sea: and\n\t\t\t[none but Pharaoh] himself was to blame [for what\n\t\t\thappened].<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
And [you have the same message] in [what happened to the tribe\n\t\t\tof] 'Ad, when We let loose against them that life-destroying wind
which spared nothing of what it came upon, but caused [all of] it\n\t\t\tto become like bones dead and decayed.<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
And in [the story of the tribe of] Thamud, too, when they were\n\t\t\ttold, "You shall enjoy your life for [but] a little\n\t\t\twhile,"<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
after they had turned with disdain from their Sustainer's\n\t\t\tcommandment - whereupon the thunderbolt of punishment overtook\n\t\t\tthem while they were [helplessly] looking on:
or they were unable even to rise, and could not defend\n\t\t\tthemselves.
And [thus, too, We destroyed] Noah's people aforetime: for they\n\t\t\twere iniquitous folk.
AND IT IS We who have built the universe<sup class='fn'>30</sup> with [Our\n\t\t\tcreative] power; and, verily, it is We who are steadily expanding\n\t\t\tit.<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
And the earth have We spread out wide and how well have We\n\t\t\tordered it!<sup class='fn'>32</sup>
And in everything have We created opposite,<sup class='fn'>33</sup> so that\n\t\t\tyou might bear in mind [God alone is one].<sup class='fn'>34</sup>
And so, [O Muhammad, say unto them:] "Flee unto God [from all\n\t\t\tthat is false and evil]! Verily, I am a plain warner to you from\n\t\t\tHim!
And do not ascribe divinity to aught<sup class='fn'>35</sup> side by side with\n\t\t\tGod: verily, I am a plain warner to you from Him!"
[But] thus it is: never yet came any apostle to those who lived\n\t\t\tbefore their time but they said, "A spellbinder<sup class='fn'>36</sup> [is\n\t\t\the], or a madman!"
Have they, perchance, handed down this [way of thinking] as a\n\t\t\tlegacy unto one another? Nay, they are people filled with\n\t\t\toverweening arrogance!
Turn, then, away from them, and thou shalt incur no blame;
yet go on reminding [all who would listen]: for, verily, such a\n\t\t\treminder will profit the believers.
And [tell them that] I have not created the invisible\n\t\t\tbeings<sup class='fn'>37</sup> and men to any end other than that they may\n\t\t\t[know and] worship Me.<sup class='fn'>38</sup>
[But withal,] no sustenance do I ever demand of them, nor do I\n\t\t\tdemand that they feed Me:
for, verily, God Himself is the Provider of all sustenance, the\n\t\t\tLord of all might, the Eternal!

And, verily, they who are bent on doing evil shall have their\n\t\t\tshare [of evil] like unto the share of their fellows [of\n\t\t\told]:<sup class='fn'>39</sup> so let them not ask Me to hasten [their doom]!
For, woe unto those who are bent on denying the truth - [woe] on\n\t\t\tthe Day which they have been promised!
CONSIDER Mount Sinai!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Consider [God's] revelation, inscribed
on wide-open scrolls.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Consider the long-enduring house [of worship]!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Consider the vault [of heaven] raised high!
Consider the surf-swollen sea!<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
VERILY, [O man,] the suffering decreed by thy Sustainer [for the\n\t\t\tsinners] will indeed come to pass:
here is none who could avert it.
[It will come to pass] on the Day when the skies will be\n\t\t\tconvulsed in [a great] convulsion,
and the mountains will move with [an awesome] movement.
Woe, then, on that Day to all who give the lie to the truth -
all those who [throughout their lives] but idly played with\n\t\t\tthings vain -
on the Day when they shall be thrust into the fire with [an\n\t\t\tirresistible] thrust, [and will be told:]
"This is the fire which you were wont to call a lie!
Was it, then, a delusion<sup class='fn'>5</sup> - or is it that you failed to\n\t\t\tsee [its truth]?

Endure it [now]! But [whether you] bear yourselves with patience\n\t\t\tor without patience, it will be the same to you: you are but\n\t\t\tbeing requited for what you were wont to do."<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
[But,] verily, the God-conscious will find themselves [on that\n\t\t\tDay] in gardens and in bliss,
rejoicing in all that their Sustainer will have granted them: for\n\t\t\ttheir Sustainer will have warded off from them all suffering\n\t\t\tthrough the blazing fire.
[And they will be told:] "Eat and drink with good cheer as an\n\t\t\toutcome of what you were wont to do,
reclining on couches [of happiness] ranged in rows!"<sup class='fn'>7</sup>\n\t\t\tAnd [in that paradise] We shall mate them with companions pure,\n\t\t\tmost beautiful of eye.<sup class='fn'>8</sup>

And as for those who have attained to faith and whose offspring
			will have followed them in faith We shall unite them with their
			offspring; and We shall not let aught of their deeds go to
			waste:<sup class='fn'>9</sup> [but] every human being will be held in pledge
			for whatever he has earned.<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
And We shall bestow on them fruit and meat in abundance -\n\t\t\twhatever they may desire:
and in that [paradise] they shall pass on to one another a cup\n\t\t\twhich will not give rise to empty talk, and neither incite to\n\t\t\tsin.<sup class='fn'>11</sup>

And they will be waited upon by [immortal] youths,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> [as\n\t\t\tif they were children] of their own,<sup class='fn'>13</sup> [as pure] as if\n\t\t\tthey were pearls hidden in their shells.
And they [who are thus blest] will turn to one another, asking\n\t\t\teach other [about their past lives].<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
They will say: "Behold, aforetime - when we were [still living]\n\t\t\tin the midst of our kith and kin - we were full of fear [at the\n\t\t\tthought of God's displeasure]:<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
and so God has graced us with His favour, and has warded off from\n\t\t\tus all suffering through the scorching winds [of frustration].
Verily, we did invoke Him [alone] ere this: [and now He has shown\n\t\t\tus<sup class='fn'>16</sup>] that He alone is truly benign, a true dispenser of\n\t\t\tgrace!"
EXHORT, then, [O Prophet, all men:] for, by thy Sustainer's\n\t\t\tgrace, thou art neither a soothsayer nor a madman.
Or do they say, "[He is but] a poet - let us await what time will\n\t\t\tdo unto him"?<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
Say thou: "Wait, [then,] hopefully; behold, I, too, shall\n\t\t\thopefully wait with you!"<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
Is it their minds that bid them [to take] this [attitude] - or\n\t\t\tare they [simply] people filled with overweening\n\t\t\tarrogance?<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
Or do they say, "He himself has composed this [message]"? Nay,\n\t\t\tbut they are not willing to believe!
But then, [if they deem it the work of a mere mortal,] let them\n\t\t\tproduce another discourse like it - if what they say be true!

[Or do they deny the existence of God?<sup class='fn'>20</sup>] Have they
			themselves been created without anything [that might have caused
			their creation]?<sup class='fn'>21</sup> - or were they, perchance, their own
			creators?
[And] have they created the heavens and the earth?<sup class='fn'>22</sup>\n\t\t\tNay, but they have no certainty of anything!
[How could they?] Are thy Sustainer's treasures with\n\t\t\tthem?<sup class='fn'>23</sup> Or are they in charge [of destiny]?

Or have they a ladder by which they could [ascend to ultimate
			truths and] listen [to what is beyond the reach of human
			perception]? Let, then, any of them who has listened [to it]
			produce a manifest proof [of his knowledge]!
Or, [if you believe in God, how can you believe that] He has\n\t\t\t[chosen to have] daughters, whereas you yourselves would have\n\t\t\t[only] sons?<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
Or is it that [they who reject thy message, O Muhammad, fear\n\t\t\tlest] thou ask of them a reward, so that they would be burdened\n\t\t\twith debt [if they should listen to thee]?
Or [do they think] that the hidden reality [of all that exists]\n\t\t\tis almost within their grasp, so that [in time] they can write it\n\t\t\tdown?<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
Or do they want to entrap [thee in contradictions]? But they who\n\t\t\tare bent on denying the truth - it is they who are truly\n\t\t\tentrapped!<sup class='fn'>26</sup>
Have they, then, any deity other than God? Utterly remote is God,\n\t\t\tin His limitless glory, from anything to which men may ascribe a\n\t\t\tshare in His divinity!
AND YET, if they [who refuse to see the truth] were to see part\n\t\t\tof the sky falling down, they would [only] say, "[It is but] a\n\t\t\tmass of clouds!"
Hence, leave them alone until they face that [Judgment] Day of\n\t\t\ttheirs, when they will be stricken with terror:
the Day when none of their scheming will be of the least avail to\n\t\t\tthem, and they will receive no succour....

But. verily, for those who are bent on doing evil, there is
			suffering in store [even] closer at hand than that [supreme
			suffering in the hereafter]:<sup class='fn'>27</sup> but most of them are not
			aware of it.

And so, await in patience thy Sustainer's judgment, for thou art\n\t\t\twell within Our sight.<sup class='fn'>28</sup> And extol thy Sustainer's\n\t\t\tlimitless glory and praise whenever thou risest up,
and extol His glory at night, and at the time when the stars\n\t\t\tretreat.
CONSIDER this unfolding [of God's message], as it comes down from\n\t\t\ton high!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
This fellow-man of yours has not gone astray, nor is he\n\t\t\tdeluded,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
and neither does he speak out of his own desire:
that [which he conveys to you] is but [a divine] inspiration with\n\t\t\twhich he is being inspired -
something that a very mighty one<sup class='fn'>3</sup> has imparted to him:
[an angel] endowed with surpassing power, who in time manifested\n\t\t\thimself in his true shape and nature,
appearing in the horizon's loftiest part,<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and then drew near, and came close,
until he was but two bow-lengths away, or even nearer.<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
And thus did [God] reveal unto His servant whatever He deemed\n\t\t\tright to reveal.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
The [servant's] heart did not give the lie to what he\n\t\t\tsaw:<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
will you, then, contend with him as to what he saw?<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
And, indeed, he saw him<sup class='fn'>9</sup> a second time
by the lote-tree of the farthest limit,<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
near unto the garden of promise,
with the lote-tree veiled in a veil of nameless\n\t\t\tsplendour....<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
[And withal,] the eye did not waver, nor yet did it stray:
truly did he see some of the most profound of his Sustainer's\n\t\t\tsymbols.<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
HAVE YOU, then, ever considered [what you are worshipping in]\n\t\t\tAl-Lat and Al-'Uzza,
as well as [in] Manat, the third and last [of this\n\t\t\ttriad]?<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
Why - for yourselves [you would choose only] male offspring,\n\t\t\twhereas to Him [you assign] female:<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
that, lo and behold, is an unfair division!

These [allegedly divine beings] are nothing but empty names which
			you have invented - you and your forefathers - [and] for which
			God has bestowed no warrant from on high.<sup class='fn'>15</sup> They [who
			worship them] follow nothing but surmise and their own wishful
			thinking<sup class='fn'>16</sup> - although right guidance has now indeed come
