			unto them from their Sustainer.
Does man imagine that it is his due to have<sup class='fn'>17</sup> all that\n\t\t\the might wish for,
despite the fact that [both] the life to come and this present\n\t\t\t[one] belong to God [alone]?<sup class='fn'>18</sup>

For, however many angels there be in the heavens, their
			intercession can be of no least avail [to anyone] - except after
			God has given leave [to intercede] for whomever He wills and with
			whom He is well-pleased.<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
Behold, it is [only] such as do not [really] believe in the life\n\t\t\tto come that regard the angels as female beings;<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
and [since] they have no knowledge whatever thereof,<sup class='fn'>21</sup>\n\t\t\tthey follow nothing but surmise: yet, behold, never can surmise\n\t\t\ttake the place of truth.
Avoid thou, therefore, those who turn away from all remembrance\n\t\t\tof Us and care for no more than the life of this world,

which, to them, is the only thing worth knowing.<sup class='fn'>22</sup>\n\t\t\tBehold, thy Sustainer is fully aware as to who has strayed from\n\t\t\tHis path, and fully aware is He as to who follows His guidance.

Indeed, unto God belongs all that is in the heavens and all that
			is on earth: and so He will reward those who do evil in
			accordance with what they did, and will reward those who do good
			with ultimate good.<sup class='fn'>23</sup>

As for those who avoid the [truly] grave sins and shameful deeds
			- even though they may sometimes stumble<sup class='fn'>24</sup> - behold, thy
			Sustainer is abounding in forgiveness. He is fully aware of
			you<sup class='fn'>25</sup> when He brings you in to being out of
			dust,<sup class='fn'>26</sup> and when you are still hidden in your mothers'
			wombs: do not, then, consider yourselves pure - [for] He knows
			best as to who is conscious of Him.<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
HAST THOU, then, ever considered him who turns away [from\n\t\t\tremembering Us, and cares for no more than the life of this\n\t\t\tworld],
and gives so little [of himself for the good of his soul], and so\n\t\t\tgrudgingly?<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
Does he [claim to] have knowledge of something that is beyond the\n\t\t\treach of human perception, so that he can see [it\n\t\t\tclearly]?<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
Or has he never yet been told of what was [said] in the\n\t\t\trevelations of Moses,
and of Abraham, who to his trust was true:<sup class='fn'>30</sup>
that no bearer of burdens shall be made to bear another's\n\t\t\tburden;<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
and that nought shall be accounted unto man but what he is\n\t\t\tstriving for;<sup class='fn'>32</sup>
and that in time [the nature of] all his striving will be shown\n\t\t\t[to him in its true light],<sup class='fn'>33</sup>
whereupon he shall be requited for it with the fullest requital;
and that with thy Sustainer is the beginning and the end [of all\n\t\t\tthat exits];<sup class='fn'>34</sup>
and that it is He alone who causes [you] to laugh and to weep;
and that it is He alone who deals death and grants life;
and that it is He who creates the two kinds - the male and the\n\t\t\tfemale -
out of a [mere] drop of sperm as it is poured forth,
and that [therefore] it is within His power to bring about a\n\t\t\tsecond life;<sup class='fn'>35</sup>
and that it is He alone who frees from want and causes to\n\t\t\tpossess;
and that it is He alone who sustains the brightest\n\t\t\tstar;<sup class='fn'>36</sup>
and that it is He who destroyed the ancient [tribes of] 'Ad
and Thamud, leaving no trace [of them],<sup class='fn'>37</sup>
as well as the people of Noah before them - [since,] verily, they\n\t\t\tall had been most wilful in their evildoing and most overweening\n\t\t\t-
just as He thrust into perdition those cities that were\n\t\t\toverthrown
and then covered them from sight forever.<sup class='fn'>38</sup>
About which, then, of thy Sustainer's powers canst thou [still]\n\t\t\tremain in doubt?<sup class='fn'>39</sup>
HIS IS a warning like those warnings of old:<sup class='fn'>40</sup>
that [Last Hour] which is so near draws ever nearer,
[although] none but God can unveil it....
Do you, perchance, find this tiding strange?
And do you laugh instead of weeping,
and divert yourselves all the while?
[Nay,] but prostrate yourselves before God, and worship [Him\n\t\t\talone]!
THE LAST HOUR draws near, and the moon split asunder!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
But if they [who reject all thought of the Last Hour] were to see\n\t\t\ta sign [of its approach], they would turn aside and say, "An\n\t\t\tever-recurring delusion!" -
for they are bent on giving it the lie<sup class='fn'>2</sup> being always\n\t\t\twont to follow their own desires. Yet everything reveals its\n\t\t\ttruth in the end.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
And withal, there has come unto them many a tiding that should\n\t\t\thave restrained [their arrogance]:<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
far-reaching wisdom [was held out to them]: but [since] all\n\t\t\twarnings have been of no avail,
turn thou away from them. On the Day when the Summoning Voice\n\t\t\twill summon [man] unto something that the mind cannot.\n\t\t\tconceive,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
they will come forth from their graves, with their eyes downcast,\n\t\t\t[swarming about] like locusts scattered [by the wind],
running in confusion towards the Summoning Voice; [and] those who\n\t\t\t[now] deny the truth will exclaim, "Calamitous is this Day!"

[LONG] BEFORE those [who now deny resurrection] did Noah's people\n\t\t\tcall it a lie; and they gave the lie to Our servant and said,\n\t\t\t"Mad is he!" - and he was repulsed.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
Thereupon he called out to his Sustainer, "Verily, I am defeated;\n\t\t\tcome Thou, then, to my succour!"
And so We caused the gates of heaven to open with water pouring\n\t\t\tdown in torrents,
and caused the earth to burst forth with springs, so that the\n\t\t\twaters met for a purpose pre-ordained
but him We bore on that [vessel] made of [mere] planks and nails,
and it floated under Our eyes:<sup class='fn'>7</sup> a recompense for him who\n\t\t\thad been rejected with ingratitude.

And, indeed, We have caused such [floating vessels] to remain\n\t\t\tforever a sign [of Our grace unto man]:<sup class='fn'>8</sup> who, then, is\n\t\t\twilling to take it to heart?<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
And how severe is the suffering which I inflict when My warnings\n\t\t\tare disregarded!<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
Hence, indeed, We made this Qur'an easy to bear in\n\t\t\tmind:<sup class='fn'>11</sup> who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
TO THE TRUTH gave the lie [the tribe of] 'Ad: and how severe was\n\t\t\tthe suffering which I inflicted when My warnings were\n\t\t\tdisregarded!
Behold, We let loose upon them a raging stormwind on a day of\n\t\t\tbitter misfortune:
it swept the people away as though they were palm-trunks\n\t\t\tuprooted:<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
for, how severe is the suffering which I inflict when My warnings\n\t\t\tare disregarded!
Hence, indeed, We made this Qur'an easy to hear in mind: who,\n\t\t\tthen, is willing to take it to heart?
[AND the tribe of] Thamud gave the lie to all [Our] warnings;
and they said: "Are we to follow one single mortal, one from\n\t\t\tamong ourselves?<sup class='fn'>13</sup> In that case, behold, we would\n\t\t\tcertainly sink into error and folly!
Why - on him alone from among all of us should a [divine]\n\t\t\treminder have been bestowed? Nay, but he is a boastful liar!"
[And God said:] "On the morrow<sup class='fn'>14</sup> they will come to know\n\t\t\twho the boastful liar is!
Behold, [O Salih,] We are letting loose this she-camel as a test\n\t\t\tfor them;<sup class='fn'>15</sup> and thou but watch them, and contain thyself\n\t\t\tin patience.
And let them know that the water [of their wells] is to be\n\t\t\tdivided between them,<sup class='fn'>16</sup> with each share of water\n\t\t\tequitably apportioned."
But they summoned their [boldest] companion, and he ventured\n\t\t\t[upon the evil deed], and cruelly slaughtered [the\n\t\t\tanimal]:<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
and how severe was the suffering which I inflicted when My\n\t\t\twarnings were disregarded!
Behold, We let loose upon them one single blast [of Our\n\t\t\tpunishment],<sup class='fn'>18</sup> and they became like the dried-up,\n\t\t\tcrumbling twigs of a sheepfold.
Hence, indeed, We made this Qur'an easy to hear in mind: who,\n\t\t\tthen, is willing to take it to heart?
LOT'S PEOPLE [too] gave the lie to all [Our] warnings:
[and so,] behold, We let loose upon them a deadly\n\t\t\ttempest;<sup class='fn'>19</sup> and only Lot's kinsfolk did We save at the\n\t\t\tbreak of dawn,
as a blessing from Us: thus do We reward all who are grateful.
For he had truly warned them of Our punishing might; but they\n\t\t\tstubbornly cast doubt on these warnings,

and even demanded that he give up his guests [to
			them]:<sup class='fn'>20</sup> whereupon We deprived them of their sight [and
			thus told them, as it were]:<sup class='fn'>21</sup> "Taste, then, the
			suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!"
And, indeed, abiding suffering did befall them early on the\n\t\t\tmorrow:
"Taste, then, the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are\n\t\t\tdisregarded!"
Hence, indeed, We made this Qur'an easy to bear in mind: who,\n\t\t\tthen, is willing to take it to heart?
Now surely, unto Pharaoh's folk [too] came such warnings;
they, too, gave the lie to all Our messages: and thereupon We\n\t\t\ttook them to task as only the Almighty, who determines all\n\t\t\tthings, can take to task.<sup class='fn'>22</sup>

ARE, THEN, those of you who [now] deny the truth<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
			better than those others - or have you, perchance, [been
			promised] immunity in the [ancient] books of [divine]
			wisdom?<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
Or do they say, "We are a group united, [and therefore] bound to\n\t\t\tprevail"?<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
[Yet] the hosts [of those who deny the truth] shall be routed,\n\t\t\tand they shall turn their backs [in night]!<sup class='fn'>26</sup>
But nay - the Last Hour is the time when they shall truly meet\n\t\t\ttheir fate;<sup class='fn'>27</sup> and that Last Hour will be most\n\t\t\tcalamitous, and most bitter:
for, behold, those who are lost in sin [will at that time come to\n\t\t\tknow that it is they who] were sunk in error and\n\t\t\tfolly!<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
On the Day when they shall be dragged into the fire on their\n\t\t\tfaces,<sup class='fn'>29</sup> [they will be told:] "Taste now the touch of\n\t\t\thell-fire!"
BEHOLD, everything have We created in due measure and proportion;
and Our ordaining [a thing and its coming into being] is but one\n\t\t\t[act], like the twinkling of an eye.<sup class='fn'>30</sup>
Thus, indeed, did We destroy people llke you [in the past]: who,\n\t\t\tthen, is willing to take it to heart?
[They were truly guilty] because all [the evil] that they ever\n\t\t\tdid had been [revealed to them as such] in the [ancient] books of\n\t\t\t[divine] wisdom;<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
and everthing [that man does], be it small or great, is recorded\n\t\t\t[with God].
[Hence, too,] behold, the God-conscious will find themselves in\n\t\t\t[a paradise of] gardens and running waters,
in a seat of truth, in the presence of a Sovereign who determines\n\t\t\tall things....
THE MOST GRACIOUS
has imparted this Qur'an [unto man].
He has created man:
He has imparted unto him articulate thought and speech.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
[At His behest] the sun and the moon run their appointed\n\t\t\tcourses;<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
[before Him] prostrate themselves the stars and the trees.
And the skies has He raised high, and has devised [for all\n\t\t\tthings] a measure,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
so that you [too, O men,] might never transgress the measure [of\n\t\t\twhat is right]:
weigh, therefore, [your deeds] with equity, and cut not the\n\t\t\tmeasure short!
And the earth has He spread out for all living beings,
with fruit thereon, and palm trees with sheathed clusters [of\n\t\t\tdates],
and grain growing tall on its stalks, and sweet-smelling plants.
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you\n\t\t\tdisavow?<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
He has created man out of sounding clay, like pottery,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
whereas the invisible beings He has created out of a confusing\n\t\t\tflame of fire.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
[He is] the Sustainer of the two farthest points of sunrise, and\n\t\t\tthe Sustainer of the two farthest points of sunset.<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
He has given freedom to the two great bodies of water, so that\n\t\t\tthey might meet:
[yet] between them is a barrier which they may not\n\t\t\ttransgress.<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
Out of these two [bodies of water] come forth pearls, both great\n\t\t\tand small.
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
And His are the lofty ships that sail like [floating] mountains\n\t\t\tthrough the seas.<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
All that lives on earth or in the heavens<sup class='fn'>10</sup> is bound to\n\t\t\tpass away:
but forever will abide thy Sustainer's Self,<sup class='fn'>11</sup> full of\n\t\t\tmajesty and glory.
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
On Him depend all creatures<sup class='fn'>12</sup> in the heavensn and on\n\t\t\tearth; [and] every day He manifests Himself in yet another\n\t\t\t[wondrous] way.
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
[ONE DAY] We shall take you to task,<sup class='fn'>13</sup> O you sin-laden\n\t\t\ttwo!<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?

O you who live in close communion with [evil] invisible beings
			and humans!<sup class='fn'>15</sup> If you [think that you] can pass beyond
			the regions of the heavens and the earth,<sup class='fn'>16</sup> pass beyond
			them! [But] you cannot pass beyond them, save by a sanction [from
			God]!<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
A flash of fire will be let loose upon you, and smoke, and you\n\t\t\twill be left without succour!
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
And when the sky is rent asunder and becomes red like [burning]\n\t\t\toil<sup class='fn'>18</sup> -
which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
For on that Day neither man nor invisible being will be asked\n\t\t\tabout his sins.<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
All who were lost in sin shall by their marks be known, and shall\n\t\t\tby their forelocks and their feet be seized!<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
This will be the hell which those who are lost in sin [now] call\n\t\t\ta lie:
between it and [their own] burning-hot despair will they wander\n\t\t\tto and fro!<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
BUT FOR THOSE who of their Sustainer's Presence stand in fear,\n\t\t\ttwo gardens [of paradise are readied]<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
[two gardens] of many wondrous hues.<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
In [each of] these two [gardens] two springs will\n\t\t\tflow.<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
In [each of] these two will two kinds of every fruit be\n\t\t\t[found].<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
[In such a paradise the blest will dwell,] reclining upon carpets\n\t\t\tlined with rich brocade;<sup class='fn'>26</sup> and the fruit of both these\n\t\t\tgardens will be within easy reach.
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
In these [gardens] will be mates of modest gaze, whom neither man\n\t\t\tnor invisible being will have touched ere then.<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
[When you are promised splendours] as though [of] rubies and [of]\n\t\t\tpearls -
which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
Could the reward of good be aught but good?
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
And besides those two will be yet two [other] gardens<sup class='fn'>28</sup>\n\t\t\t-
which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow? -
two [gardens] of the deepest green.<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
In [each of] these two [gardens] will two springs gush forth.
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
In both of them will be [all kinds of] fruit, and date-palms and\n\t\t\tpomegranates.
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
In these [gardens] will be [all] things most excellent and\n\t\t\tbeautiful.
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
[There the blest will live with their] companions pure<sup class='fn'>30</sup>\n\t\t\tand modest, in pavillions [splendid] -
which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow? -
[companions] whom neither man nor invisible being will have\n\t\t\ttouched ere then.
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
[In such a paradise will they dwell,] reclining upon meadows\n\t\t\tgreen and carpets rich in beauty.
Which, then, of your Sustainer's powers can you disavow?
HALLOWED be thy Sustainer's name, full of majesty and glory!
WHEN THAT which must come to pass<sup class='fn'>1</sup> [at last] comes to\n\t\t\tpass,
there will be nought that could give the lie to its having come\n\t\t\tto pass,
abasing [some], exalting [others]!
When the earth is shaken with a shaking [severe],
and the mountains are shattered into [countless] shards,
so that they become as scattered dust -
[on that Day,] then, shall you be [divided into] three kinds.
Thus, there shall be such as will have attained to what is\n\t\t\tright:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> oh, how [happy] will be they who have attained\n\t\t\tto what is right!
And there shall be such as will have lost themselves in\n\t\t\tevil:<sup class='fn'>3</sup> oh, how [unhappy] will be they who have lost\n\t\t\tthemselves in evil!
But the foremost shall be [they who in life were] the foremost\n\t\t\t[in faith and good works]:
they who were [always] drawn close unto God!
In gardens of bliss [will they dwell] -
a good many of those of olden times,
but [only] a few of later times.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
[They will be seated] on gold-encrusted thrones of happiness,
reclining upon them, facing one another [in love].<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
Immortal youths will wait upon them
with goblets, and ewers, and cups filled with water from\n\t\t\tunsullied springs<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
by which their minds will not be clouded and which will not make\n\t\t\tthem drunk;
and with fruit of any kind that they may choose,
and with the flesh of any fowl that they may desire.<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
And [with them will be their] companions pure, most beautiful of\n\t\t\teye,<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
like unto pearls [still] hidden in their shells.
[And this will be] a reward for what they did [in life].
No empty talk will they hear there, nor any call to sin,
but only the tiding of inner soundness and peace.<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
NOW AS FOR those who have attained to righteousness - what of\n\t\t\tthose who have attained to righteousness?<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
[They, too, will find themselves] amidst fruitladen\n\t\t\tlote-trees,<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
and acacias flower-clad,
and shade extended,<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
and waters gushing,
and fruit abounding,
never-failing and never out of reach.
And [with them will be their] spouses, raised high:<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
for, behold, We shall have brought them into being in a life\n\t\t\trenewed,
having resurrected them as virgins,<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
full of love, well-matched
with those who have attained to righteousness:<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
a good many of olden times,
and a good many of later time.<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
BUT AS FOR those who have persevered in evil - what of those who\n\t\t\thave persevered in evil?<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
[They will find themselves] in the midst of scorching winds, and\n\t\t\tburning despair,<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
and the shadows of black smoke -
[shadows] neither cooling nor soothing.
For, behold, in times gone by they were wont to abandon\n\t\t\tthemselves wholly to the pursuit of pleasures,<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
and would persist in heinous sinning,
and would say, "What! After we have died and become mere dust and\n\t\t\tbones, shall we, forsooth, be raised from the dead? -
and perhaps, too, our forebears of old?"
Say: "Verily, those of olden times and those of later times
will indeed be gathered together at an appointed time on a Day\n\t\t\tknown [only to God]:
and then, verily, O you who have gone astray and called the truth\n\t\t\ta lie,
you will indeed have to taste of the tree of deadly\n\t\t\tfruit,<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
and will have to fill your bellies therewith,
and will thereupon have to drink [many a draught] of burning\n\t\t\tdespair -
drink it as the most insatiably thirsty camels drink!"
Such will be their welcome on Judgment Day!
IT IS WE who have created you, [O men:] why, then, do you not\n\t\t\taccept the truth?
Have you ever considered that [seed] which you emit?<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
Is it you who create it - or are We the source of its creation?
We have [indeed] decreed that death shall be [ever-present] among\n\t\t\tyou: but there is nothing to prevent Us
from changing the nature of your existence<sup class='fn'>22</sup> and\n\t\t\tbringing you into being [anew] in a manner [as yet] unknown to\n\t\t\tyou.
And [since] you are indeed aware of the [miracle of your] coming\n\t\t\tinto being in the first instance - why, then, do you not bethink\n\t\t\tyourselves [of Us]?
Have you ever considered the seed which you cast upon the soil?
Is it you who cause it to grow - or are We the cause of its\n\t\t\tgrowth?
[For,] were it Our will, We could indeed turn it into chaff, and\n\t\t\tyou would be left to wonder [and to lament],
"Verily, we are ruined!
Nay, but we have been deprived [of our livelihood]!"
Have you ever considered the water which you drink?
Is it you who cause it to come down from the clouds - or are We\n\t\t\tthe cause of its coming down?
[It comes down sweet - but] were it Our will, We could make it\n\t\t\tburningly salty and bitter: why, then, do you not give thanks\n\t\t\t[unto Us]?
Have you ever considered the fire which you kindle?
Is it you who have brought into being the tree that serves as its\n\t\t\tfuel<sup class='fn'>23</sup> - or are We the cause of its coming into being?

It is We who have made it a means to remind [you of\n\t\t\tUs],<sup class='fn'>24</sup> and a comfort for all who are lost and hungry in\n\t\t\tthe wilderness [of their lives].<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
Extol, then, the limitless glory of thy Sustainer's mighty name!
NAY, I call to witness the coming-down in parts [of this\n\t\t\tQur'an]<sup class='fn'>26</sup>
and, behold, this is indeed a most solemn affirmation, if you but\n\t\t\tknew it!
Behold, it is a truly noble discourse,
[conveyed unto man] in a well-guarded divine writ
Which none but the pure [of heart] can touch:<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
a revelation from the Sustainer of all the worlds!
Would you, now, look down with disdain on a tiding like\n\t\t\tthis,<sup class='fn'>28</sup>
and make it your daily bread [as it were] to call the truth a\n\t\t\tlie?
Why, then,<sup class='fn'>29</sup> when [the last breath] comes up to the\n\t\t\tthroat [of a dying man],
the while you are [helplessly] looking on -
and while We are closer to him than you, although you see [Us]\n\t\t\tnot-:
why, then, if [you think that] you are not truly dependent [on\n\t\t\tUs],
can you not cause that [ebbing life] to return - if what you\n\t\t\tclaim is true?
[ALL OF YOU are destined to die.] Now if one happens to be of\n\t\t\tthose who are drawn close unto God,<sup class='fn'>30</sup>
happiness [awaits him in the life to come], and inner fulfilment,\n\t\t\tand a garden of bliss.
And if one happens to be of those who have attained to\n\t\t\trighteousness,<sup class='fn'>31</sup>
[he, too, will be welcomed into paradise with the words,] "Peace\n\t\t\tbe unto thee [that art] of those who have attained to\n\t\t\trighteousness!"
But if one happens to be of those who are wont to call the truth\n\t\t\ta lie, and [thus] go astray,
a welcome of burning despair [awaits him in the life to come,]
and the heat of a blazing fire!
Verily, this is indeed the truth of truths!<sup class='fn'>32</sup>
Extol, then, the limitless glory of thy Sustainer's mighty name!
ALL THAT IS in the heavens and on earth extols God's limitless\n\t\t\tglory: for He alone is almighty, truly wise!
His is the dominion over the heavens and the earth; He grants\n\t\t\tlife and deals death; and He has the power to will anything.
He is the First and the Last,<sup class='fn'>1</sup> and the Outward as well\n\t\t\tas the Inward:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and He has full knowledge of everything.

He it is who has created the heavens and the earth in six aeons,
			and is established on the throne of His almightiness.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
			He knows all that enters the earth, and all that comes out of it,
			as well as all that descends from the skies, and all that ascends
			to them.<sup class='fn'>4</sup> And He is with you wherever you may be; and
			God sees all that you do.
His is the dominion over the heavens and the earth; and all\n\t\t\tthings go back unto God [as their source].
He makes the night grow longer by shortening the day, and makes\n\t\t\tthe day grow longer by shortening the night; and He has full\n\t\t\tknowledge of what is in the hearts [of men].

BELIEVE in God and His Apostle, and spend on others out of that
			of which He has made you trustees:<sup class='fn'>5</sup> for, those of you
			who have attained to faith and who spend freely [in God's cause]
			shall have a great reward.

And why should you not believe in God, seeing that the Apostle
			calls you to believe in [Him who is] your Sustainer, and [seeing
			that] He has taken a pledge from you?<sup class='fn'>6</sup> [Why should you
			not believe in Him] if you are able to believe [in
			anything]?<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

It is He who bestows from on high clear messages unto [this] His
			servant, to lead you out of the deep darkness into the light:
			for, behold, God is most compassionate towards you, a dispenser
			of grace.

And why should you not spend freely in the cause of God, seeing
			that God's [alone] is the heritage of the heavens and the
			earth?<sup class='fn'>8</sup> Not equal are those of you who spent and fought
			[in God's cause] before the Victory<sup class='fn'>9</sup> [and those who did
			not do so]: they are of a higher rank than those who would spend
			and fight [only] after it - although God has promised the
			ultimate good to all [who strive in His cause].<sup class='fn'>10</sup> And
			God is aware of all that you do.
WHO IS IT that will offer up unto God a goodly loan, which He\n\t\t\twill amply repay?<sup class='fn'>11</sup> For, such [as do so] shall have a\n\t\t\tnoble reward

on the Day when thou shalt see all believing men and believing
			women, with their light spreading rapidly before them and on
			their right,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> [and with this welcome awaiting them:] "A
			glad tiding for you today gardens through which running waters
			flow, therein to abide! This, this is the triumph supreme!"

On that Day shall the hypocrites, both men and women,<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
			speak [thus] unto those who have attained to faith: "Wait for us!
			Let us have a [ray of] light from your light!" [But] they will be
			told: "Turn back, and seek a light [of your own]!"<sup class='fn'>14</sup> And
			thereupon a wall will be raised between them [and the believers],
			with a gate in it: within it will be grace and mercy, and against
			the outside thereof, suffering.<sup class='fn'>15</sup>

They [who will remain without] will call out to those [within],
			"Were we not with you? - [to which]; the others will answer: "So
			it was! But you allowed yourselves to succumb to
			temptation,<sup class='fn'>16</sup> and you were hesitant [in your
			faith<sup class='fn'>17</sup> ], and you were doubtful [of resurrection]; and
			your wishful thinking beguiled you until God's command came to
			pass:<sup class='fn'>18</sup> for, [indeed, your own] deceptive thoughts about
			God deluded you!<sup class='fn'>19</sup>

"And so, no ransom<sup class='fn'>20</sup> shall be accepted today from you,
			and neither from those who were [openly] bent on denying the
			truth. Your goal is the fire: it is your [only] refuge<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
			- and how evil a journey's end!"

IS IT NOT time that the hearts of all who have attained to faith
			should feel humble at the remembrance of God and of all the truth
			that has been bestowed [on them] from on high,<sup class='fn'>22</sup> lest
			they become like those who were granted revelation
			aforetime,<sup class='fn'>23</sup> and whose hearts have hardened with the
			passing of time so that many of them are [now]
			depraved?<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
[But] know that God gives life to the earth after it has been\n\t\t\tlifeless!<sup class='fn'>25</sup> We have indeed made Our messages clear unto\n\t\t\tyou, so that you might use your reason.

Verily, as for the men and women who accept the truth as
			true,<sup class='fn'>26</sup> and who [thus] offer up unto God a goodly loan,
			they will be amply repaid,<sup class='fn'>27</sup> and shall have a noble
			reward [in the life to come].

For, they who have attained to faith in God and His Apostle - it
			is they, they who uphold the truth, and they who bear witness
			[thereto] before God:<sup class='fn'>28</sup> [and so] they shall have their
			reward and their light! But as for those who are bent on denying
			the truth and on giving the lie to Our messages - it is they who
			are destined for the blazing fire!

KNOW [O men] that the life of this world is but a play and a
			passing delight, and a beautiful show, and [the cause of] your
			boastful vying with one another, and [of your] greed for more and
			more riches and children.<sup class='fn'>29</sup> Its parable is that
			of<sup class='fn'>30</sup> [life-giving] rain: the herbage which it causes to
			grow delights the tillers of the soil;<sup class='fn'>31</sup> but then it
			withers, and thou canst see it turn yellow; and in the end it
			crumbles into dust. But [the abiding truth of man's condition
			will become fully apparent] in the life to come: [either]
			suffering severe, or<sup class='fn'>32</sup> God's forgiveness and His goodly
			acceptance: for the life of this world is nothing but an
			enjoyment of self-delusion.

[Hence,] vie with one another in seeking to attain to your
			Sustainer's forgiveness,<sup class='fn'>33</sup> and [thus] to a paradise as
			vast as the heavens and the earth, which has been readied for
			those who have attained to faith in God and His
			Apostle:<sup class='fn'>34</sup> such is the bounty of God which He grants
			unto whomever He wills - for God is limitless in His great
			bounty.

NO CALAMITY can ever befall the earth, and neither your own
			selves,<sup class='fn'>35</sup> unless it be [laid down] in Our decree before
			We bring it into being: verily, all this,<sup class='fn'>36</sup> is easy for
			God.

[Know this,] so that you may not despair over whatever [good] has
			escaped you nor exult [unduly] over whatever [good] has come to
			you:<sup class='fn'>37</sup> for, God does not love any of those who, out of
			self-conceit, act in a boastful manner<sup class='fn'>38</sup> -

those who are niggardly [with God's bounty] and bid others to be
			niggardly!<sup class='fn'>39</sup> And he who turns his back [on this
			truth<sup class='fn'>40</sup> ought to know that], verily, God alone is
			self-sufficient, the One to whom all praise is due!

Indeed, [even aforetime] did We send forth Our apostles with all
			evidence of [this] truth; and through them<sup class='fn'>41</sup> We bestowed
			revelation from on high, and [thus gave you] a balance [wherewith
			to weigh right and wrong], so that men might behave with equity;
			and We bestowed [upon you] from on high [the ability to make use
			of] iron, in which there is awesome power as well as [a source
			of] benefits for man:<sup class='fn'>42</sup> and [all this was given to you]
			so that God might mark out those who would stand up for him and
			His Apostle,<sup class='fn'>43</sup> even though He [Himself] is beyond the
			reach of human perception.<sup class='fn'>44</sup> Verily, God is powerful,
			almighty!

And, indeed, [to the same end<sup class='fn'>45</sup>] We sent forth Noah and
			Abraham [as Our message-bearers], and established prophethood and
			revelation among their descendants; and some of them were on the
			right way, but many were iniquitous.

And thereupon We caused [other of] Our apostles to follow in
			their footsteps; and [in the course of time] We caused them to be
			followed by Jesus, the son of Mary, upon whom We bestowed the
			Gospel;<sup class='fn'>46</sup> and in the hearts of those who [truly]
			followed him We engendered compassion and mercy. But as for
			monastic asceticism<sup class='fn'>47</sup> - We did not enjoin it upon them:
			they invented it themselves out of a desire for God's goodly
			acceptance.<sup class='fn'>48</sup> But then, they did not [always] observe it
			as it ought to have been observed:<sup class='fn'>49</sup> and so We granted
			their recompense unto such of them as had [truly] attained to
			faith, whereas many of them became iniquitous.<sup class='fn'>50</sup>

O YOU who have attained to faith!<sup class='fn'>51</sup> Remain conscious of
			God, and believe in His Apostle, [and] He will grant you doubly
			of His grace, and will light for you a light wherein you shall
			walk, and will forgive you [your past sins]: for God is
			much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.

And the followers of earlier revelation should know<sup class='fn'>52</sup>
			that they have no power whatever over any of God's
			bounty,<sup class='fn'>53</sup> seeing that all bounty is in God's hand
			[alone]: He grants it unto whomever He wills for God is limitless
			in His great bounty.

God has indeed heard the words of her who pleads with thee
			concerning her husband, and complains unto God.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> And God
			does hear what you both have to say:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> verily, God is
			all-hearing, all-seeing.

As for those of you who [henceforth] separate themselves from
			their wives by saying, "Thou art as unlawful to me as my
			mother",<sup class='fn'>3</sup> [let them bear in mind that] they can never be
			[as] their mothers: none are their mothers save those who gave
			them birth: and so, behold, they but utter a saying that runs
			counter to reason,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> and is [therefore] false. But,
			behold, God is indeed an absolver of sins, much-forgiving:

hence, as for those who would separate themselves from their
			wives by saying, "Thou art as unlawful to me as my mother", and
			thereafter would go back on what they have said, [their
			atonement] shall be the freeing of a human being from
			bondage<sup class='fn'>5</sup> before the couple may touch one another again:
			this you are [hereby] exhorted to do for God is fully aware of
			all that you do.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

However, he who does not have the wherewithal shall fast
			[instead] for two consecutive months<sup class='fn'>7</sup> before the couple
			may touch one another again; and he who is unable to do it shall
			feed sixty needy ones:<sup class='fn'>8</sup> this, so that you might prove
			your faith in God and His Apostle.<sup class='fn'>9</sup> Now these are the
			bounds set by God; and grievous suffering [in the life to come]
			awaits all who deny the truth.

Verily, those who contend against God and His Apostle shall be
			brought low even as those [evildoers] who lived before them were
			brought low after We had bestowed [on them] clear messages from
			on high.<sup class='fn'>10</sup> And [so,] for those who deny the truth there
			will be shameful suffering in store

on the Day when God will raise them all from the dead and will
			make them truly understand all that they did [in life]: God will
			have taken [all of] it into account, even though they
			[themselves] may have forgotten it - for God is witness unto
			everything.

ART THOU NOT aware that God knows all that is in the heavens and
			all that is on earth? Never can there be a secret confabulation
			between three persons without His being the fourth of them, nor
			between five without His being the sixth of them; and neither
			between less than that, or more, without His being with them
			wherever they may be. But in the end, on Resurrection Day, He
			will make them truly understand what they did: for, verily, God
			has full knowledge of evervthing.

Art thou not aware of such as have been forbidden [to intrigue
			through] secret confabulations,<sup class='fn'>11</sup> and yet [always]
			revert to that which they have been forbidden, and conspire with
			one another with a view to sinful doings, and aggressive conduct,
			and disobedience to the Apostle?<sup class='fn'>12</sup> Now whenever such
			[people] approach thee, [O Muhammad,]<sup class='fn'>13</sup> they salute thee
			with a greeting which God has never countenanced;<sup class='fn'>14</sup> and
			they say to themselves, "Why does not God chastise us for what we
			are saying?"<sup class='fn'>15</sup> Hell shall be their allotted portion:
			they shall [indeed] enter it - and how vile a journey's end!

[Hence,] O you who have attained to faith, when you do hold
			secret confabulations, do not conspire with one another with a
			view to sinful doings, and aggressive conduct, and disobedience
			to the Apostle,<sup class='fn'>16</sup> but [rather] hold counsel in the cause
			of virtue and God-consciousness: and [always] remain conscious of
			God, unto whom you all shall be gathered.

[All other kinds of] secret confabulations are but of Satan's
			doing, so that he might cause grief to those who have attained to
			faith; yet he cannot harm them in the least, unless it be by
			God's leave:<sup class='fn'>17</sup> in God, then, let the believers place
			their trust!

O YOU who have attained to faith! When you are told, "Make room
			for one another in your collective life",<sup class='fn'>18</sup> do make
			room: [and in return,] God will make room for you [in His
			grace].<sup class='fn'>19</sup> And whenever you are told, "Rise up [for a
			good deed]", do rise up;<sup class='fn'>20</sup> [and] God will exalt by
			[many] degrees those of you who have attained to faith and,
			[above all,] such as have been vouchsafed [true]
			knowledge:<sup class='fn'>21</sup> for God is fully aware of all that you do.

O YOU who have attained to faith! Whenever you [intend to]
			consult the Apostle, offer up something in charity on the
			occasion of your consultation:<sup class='fn'>22</sup> this will be for your
			own good, and more conducive to your [inner] purity. Yet if you
			are unable to do so,<sup class='fn'>23</sup> [know that,] verily, God is
			much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.

Do you, perchance, fear lest [you may be sinning if] you cannot
			offer up anything in charity on the occasion of your consultation
			[with the Apostle]? But if you fail to do it [for lack of
			opportunity], and God turns unto you in His mercy, remain but
			constant in prayer and render [no more than] the purifying
			dues,<sup class='fn'>24</sup> and [thus] pay heed unto God and His Apostle:
			for God is fully aware of all that you do.

ART THOU NOT aware of those who would be friends with people whom
			God has condemned?<sup class='fn'>25</sup> They are neither of you [O
			believers] nor of those [who utterly reject the truth]: and so
			they swear to a falsehood the while they know [it to be false].
God has readied for them suffering severe [in the life to come].\n\t\t\tBehold, evil indeed is what they are wont to do:
they have made their oaths a cover [for their falseness], and\n\t\t\tthus they turn others away from the path of God:<sup class='fn'>26</sup>\n\t\t\thence, shameful suffering awaits them.
Neither their worldly possessions nor their offspring will be of\n\t\t\tthe least avail to them against God: it is they who are destined\n\t\t\tfor the fire, therein to abide!

On the Day when God will raise them all from the dead, they will
			swear before Him as they [now] swear before you, thinking that
			they are on firm ground [in their assumptions].<sup class='fn'>27</sup> Oh,
			verily, it is they, they who are the [greatest] liars!<sup class='fn'>28</sup>

Satan has gained mastery over them, and has caused them to remain
			oblivious of the remembrance of God. Such as these are Satan's
			partisans: oh, verily, it is they, the partisans of Satan, who
			will truly be the losers!
Verily, those who contend against God and His Apostle - it is\n\t\t\tthey who [on Judgment Day] shall find themselves among the most\n\t\t\tabject.
[For] God has thus ordained: "I shall most certainly prevail, I\n\t\t\tand My apostles!" Verily, God is powerful, almighty!

Thou canst not find people who [truly] believe in God and the
			Last Day and [at the same time] love anyone who contends against
			God and His Apostle - even though they be their fathers, or their
			sons, or their brothers, or [others of] their kindred.<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
			[As for the true believers,] it is they in whose hearts He has
			inscribed faith, and whom He has strengthened with inspiration
			from Himself,<sup class='fn'>30</sup> and whom [in time] He will admit into
			gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide.
			Well-pleased is God with them, and well-pleased are they with
			Him. They are God's partisans: oh, verily, it is they, the
			partisans of God, who shall attain to a happy state!
ALL THAT IS in the heavens and all that is on earth extols God's\n\t\t\tlimitless glory: for He alone is almighty, truly wise.

He it is who turned out of their homes, at the time of [their]
			first gathering [for war], such of the followers of earlier
			revelation as were bent on denying the truth.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> You did
			not think [O believers] that they would depart [without
			resistance] - just as they thought that their strongholds would
			protect them against God: but God came upon them in a manner
			which they had not expected,<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and cast terror into their
			hearts; [and thus] they destroyed their homes by their own hands
			as well as the hands of the believers.<sup class='fn'>3</sup> Learn a lesson,
			then, O you who are endowed with insight!

And had it not been for God's having ordained banishment for
			them, He would indeed have imposed [yet greater] suffering on
			them in this world: still, in the life to come there awaits them
			suffering through fire:

this, because they cut themselves off from God and His\n\t\t\tApostle:<sup class='fn'>4</sup> and as for him who cuts himself off from God\n\t\t\tand His Apostle - verily, God is severe in retribution!

Whatever [of their] palm trees you may have cut down, [O
			believers,] or left standing on their roots, was [done] by God's
			leave,<sup class='fn'>5</sup> and in order that He might confound the
			iniquitous.

Yet [remember:] whatever [spoils taken] from the enemy<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
			God has turned over to His Apostle, you did not have to spur
			horse or riding-camel for its sake:<sup class='fn'>7</sup> but God gives His
			apostles mastery over whomever He wills - for God has the power
			to will anything.

Whatever [spoils taken] from the people of those villages God has
			turned over to His Apostle [all of it] belongs to God and the
			Apostle,<sup class='fn'>8</sup> and the near of kin [of deceased believers],
			and the orphans, and the needy, and the wayfarer,<sup class='fn'>9</sup> so
			that it may not be [a benefit] going round and round among such
			of you as may [already] be rich. Hence, accept [willingly]
			whatever the Apostle<sup class='fn'>10</sup> gives you [thereof], and refrain
			from [demanding] anything that he withholds from you; and remain
			conscious of God: for, verily, God is severe in retribution.

[Thus, part of such war-gains shall be given] to the poor among
			those who have forsaken the domain of evil:<sup class='fn'>11</sup> those who
			have been driven from their homelands and their possessions,
			seeking favour with God and [His] goodly acceptance, and who aid
			[the cause of] God and His Apostle: it is they, they who are true
			to their word!

And [it shall be offered, too, unto the poor from among] those
			who, before them,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> had their abode in this realm and in
			faith - [those] who love all that come to them in search of
			refuge, and who harbour in their hearts no grudge for whatever
			the others may have been given, but rather give them preference
			over themselves, even though poverty be their own lot:<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
			for, such as from their own covetousness are saved - it is they,
			they that shall attain to a happy state!<sup class='fn'>14</sup>

And so, they who come after them<sup class='fn'>15</sup> pray: "O our
			Sustainer! Forgive us our sins, as well as those of our brethren
			who preceded us in faith, and let not our hearts entertain any
			unworthy thoughts or feelings against [any of] those who have
			attained to faith. O our Sustainer! Verily, Thou art
			compassionate, a dispenser of grace!"

ART THOU NOT aware of how those who would always dissemble [their
			real feelings]<sup class='fn'>16</sup> speak to their truth-denying brethren
			from among the followers of earlier revelation:<sup class='fn'>17</sup> "If
			you are driven away, we shall most certainly go forth with you,
			and shall never pay heed to anyone against you; and if war is
			waged against you, we shall most certainly come to your succour."
			But God bears witness that they are most flagrantly lying:

[for] if those [to whom they have pledged themselves] are indeed
			driven away, they will not go forth with them; and if war is
			waged against them, they will not come to their succour; and even
			if they [try to] succour them, they will most certainly turn
			their backs [in flight], and in the end will [themselves] find no
			succour.
Nay, [O believers,] you arouse in their bosoms a fear more\n\t\t\tintense than [even their fear of] God: this, because they are\n\t\t\tpeople who fail to grasp the truth.<sup class='fn'>18</sup>

Never will they fight you, [even] in unison, otherwise than from
			within fortified strongholds or from behind walls.<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
			Severe is their warlike discord among themselves: thou wouldst
			think that they are united, whereas [in fact] their hearts are at
			odds [with one another]: this, because they are people who will
			not use their reason.<sup class='fn'>20</sup>

[To both kinds of your enemies,<sup class='fn'>21</sup> O believers, is bound
			to happen] the like of [what happened to] those who, a short
			while before them, had to taste the evil that came from their own
			doings,<sup class='fn'>22</sup> with [yet more] grievous suffering awaiting
			them [in the life to come]:

the like of [what happens] when Satan says unto man, "Deny the
			truth!" - but as soon as [man] has denied the truth, [Satan]
			says, "Behold, I am not responsible for thee: behold, I fear God,
			the Sustainer of all the worlds!"<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
Thus, in the end, both [the deniers of the truth and the\n\t\t\thypocrites]<sup class='fn'>24</sup> will find themselves in the fire, therein\n\t\t\tto abide: for such is the recompense of evildoers.

O YOU who have attained to faith! Remain conscious of God; and
			let every human being look to what he sends ahead for the morrow!
			And [once again]: Remain conscious of God, for God is fully aware
			of all that you do;

and be not like those who are oblivious of God, and whom He\n\t\t\ttherefore causes to be oblivious of [what is good for] their own\n\t\t\tselves: [for] it is they, they who are truly depraved!<sup class='fn'>25</sup>

Not equal are those who are destined for the fire and those who\n\t\t\tare destined for paradise: those who are destined for paradise -\n\t\t\tit is they, they [alone] who shall triumph [on Judgment Day]!

HAD WE bestowed this Qur'an from on high upon a mountain, thou
			wouldst indeed see it humbling itself, breaking asunder for awe
			of God.<sup class='fn'>26</sup> And [all] such parables We propound unto men,
			so that they might [learn to] think.

GOD IS HE save whom there is no deity: the One who knows all that
			is beyond the reach of a created being's perception, as well as
			all that can be witnessed by a creature's senses or
			mind:<sup class='fn'>27</sup> He, the Most Gracious, the Dispenser of Grace.

God is He save whom there is no deity: the Sovereign Supreme, the
			Holy, the One with whom all salvation rests,<sup class='fn'>28</sup> the Giver
			of Faith, the One who determines what is true and
			false,<sup class='fn'>29</sup> the Almighty, the One who subdues wrong and
			restores right,<sup class='fn'>30</sup> the One to whom all greatness belongs!
			Utterly remote is God, in His limitless glory, from anything to
			which men may ascribe a share in His divinity!

He is God, the Creator, the Maker who shapes all forms and
			appearances!<sup class='fn'>31</sup> His [alone] are the attributes of
			perfection.<sup class='fn'>32</sup> All that is in the heavens and on earth
			extols His limitless glory: for He alone is almighty, truly wise!

O YOU who have attained to faith! Do not take My enemies - who
			are your enemies as well<sup class='fn'>1</sup> - for your friends, showing
			them affection even though they are bent on denying whatever
			truth has come unto you, [and even though] they have driven the
			Apostle and yourselves away, [only] because you believe in God,
			your Sustainer!<sup class='fn'>2</sup> If [it be true that] you have gone
			forth [from your homes] to strive in My cause, and out of a
			longing for My goodly acceptance, [do not take them for your
			friends,] inclining towards them in secret affection: for I am
			fully aware of all that you may conceal as well as of all that
			you do openly. And any of you who does this has already strayed
			from the right path.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

If they could but overcome you, they would [still] remain your
			foes, and would stretch forth their hands and tongues against you
			with evil intent: for they desire that you [too] should deny the
			truth.

But [bear in mind that] neither your kinsfolk nor [even] your own
			children will be of any benefit to you on Resurrection Day, [for
			then] He will decide between you [on your merit alone]: and God
			sees all that you do.

Indeed, you have had a good example in Abraham and those who
			followed him, when they said unto their [idolatrous] people:
			"Verily, we are quit of you and of all that you worship instead
			of God: we deny the truth of whatever you believe; and between us
			and you there has arisen enmity and hatred, to last until such a
			time<sup class='fn'>4</sup> as you come to believe in the One God!" The only
			exception was<sup class='fn'>5</sup> Abraham's saying to his father, "I shall
			indeed pray for [God's] forgiveness for thee,<sup class='fn'>6</sup> although
			I have it not in my power to obtain anything from God in thy
			behalf." [And Abraham and his followers prayed:] "O our
			Sustainer! In Thee have we placed our trust, and unto Thee do we
			turn: for unto Thee is all journeys' end.

O our Sustainer! Make us not a plaything<sup class='fn'>7</sup> for those who\n\t\t\tare bent on denying the truth! And forgive us our sins, O our\n\t\t\tSustainer: for Thou alone art almighty, truly wise!"

In them, indeed, you have a good example for everyone who looks
			forward [with hope and awe<sup class='fn'>8</sup>] to God and the Last Day.
			And if any turns away, [let him know that] God is truly
			self-sufficient, the One to whom all praise is due.

[But] it may well be that God will bring about [mutual] affection
			between you [O believers] and some of those whom you [now] face
			as enemies: for, God is all-powerful - and God is much-forgiving,
			a dispenser of grace.

As for such [of the unbelievers] as do not fight against you on
			account of [your] faith, and neither drive you forth from your
			homelands, God does not forbid you to show them kindness and to
			behave towards them with full equity:<sup class='fn'>9</sup> for, verily, God
			loves those who act equitably.

God only forbids you to turn in friendship towards such as fight
			against you because of [your] faith, and drive you forth from
			your homelands, or aid [others] in driving you forth and as for
			those [from among you] who turn towards them in friendship, it is
			they, they who are truly wrongdoers!

O YOU who have attained to faith! Whenever believing women come
			unto you, forsaking the domain of evil,<sup class='fn'>10</sup> examine them,
			[although only] God is fully aware of their faith;<sup class='fn'>11</sup> and
			if you have thus ascertained that they are believers, do not send
			them back to the deniers of the truth, [since] they are [no
			longer] lawful to their erstwhile husbands,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> and these
			are [no longer] lawful to them. None the less, you shall return
			to them whatever they have spent [on their wives by way of
			dower];<sup class='fn'>13</sup> and [then, O believers,] you will be
			committing no sin if you marry them after giving them their
			dowers. On the other hand, hold not to the marriage-tie with
			women who [continue to] deny the truth,<sup class='fn'>14</sup> and ask but
			for [the return of] whatever you have spent [by way of dower] -
			just as they [whose wives have gone over to you] have the right
			to demand<sup class='fn'>15</sup> [the return of] whatever they have spent.
			Such is God's judgment: He judges between you [in equity] - for
			God is all-knowing, wise.

And if any of your wives should go over to the deniers of the
			truth, and you are thus afflicted in turn,<sup class='fn'>16</sup> then give
			unto those whose wives have gone away the equivalent of what they
			had spent [on their wives by way of dower],<sup class='fn'>17</sup> and remain
			conscious of God, in whom you believe!

O Prophet! Whenever believing women come unto thee to pledge
			their allegiance to thee,<sup class='fn'>18</sup> [pledging] that [henceforth]
			they would not ascribe divinity, in any way, to aught but God,
			and would not steal,<sup class='fn'>19</sup> and would not commit adultery,
			and would not kill their children,<sup class='fn'>20</sup> and would not
			indulge in slander, falsely devising it out of
			nothingness,<sup class='fn'>21</sup> and would not disobey thee in anything
			[that thou declarest to be] right - then accept their pledge of
			allegiance, and pray to God to forgive them their [past] sins:
			for, behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.

O YOU who have attained to faith! Be not friends with people whom
			God has condemned!<sup class='fn'>22</sup> They [who would befriend them] are
			indeed bereft of all hope of a life to come<sup class='fn'>23</sup> - just as
			those deniers of the truth are bereft of all hope of [ever again
			seeing] those who are [now] in their graves.<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
ALL THAT IS in the heavens and all that is on earth extols God's\n\t\t\tlimitless glory: for He alone is almighty, truly wise!
O YOU who have attained to faith! Why do you say one thing and do\n\t\t\tanother?<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Most loathsome is it in the sight of God that you say what you do\n\t\t\tnot do!
Verily, God loves [only] those who fight in His cause in [solid]\n\t\t\tranks,<sup class='fn'>2</sup> as though they were a building firm and compact.

Now when Moses spoke to his people, [it was this same truth that
			he had in mind:] "O my people! Why do you cause me
			grief,<sup class='fn'>3</sup> the while you know that I am an apostle of God
			sent unto you?" And so, when they swerved from the right way, God
			let their hearts swerve from the truth:<sup class='fn'>4</sup> for God does
			not bestow His guidance upon iniquitous folk.

And [this happened, too,] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said: "O
			children of Israel! Behold, I am an apostle of God unto you,
			[sent] to confirm the truth of whatever there still
			remains<sup class='fn'>5</sup> of the Torah, and to give [you] the glad tiding
			of an apostle who shall come after me, whose name shall be
			Ahmad."<sup class='fn'>6</sup> But when he [whose coming Jesus had foretold]
			came unto them<sup class='fn'>7</sup> with all evidence of the truth, they
			said: "This [alleged message of his] is [nothing but]
			spellbinding eloquence!<sup class='fn'>8</sup>

And who could be more wicked than one who invents [such] a lie
			about [a message from] God, seeing that he is [but] being called
			to self-surrender unto Him? But God does not bestow His guidance
			upon evildoing folk.

They aim to extinguish God's light with their
			utterances:<sup class='fn'>9</sup> but God has willed to spread His light in
			all its fullness, however hateful this may be to all who deny the
			truth.

He it is who has sent forth His Apostle with [the task of]
			spreading guidance and the religion of truth, to the end that He
			make it prevail over all [false] religion,<sup class='fn'>10</sup> however
			hateful this may be to those who ascribe divinity to aught but
			God.
O YOU who have attained to faith! Shall I point out to you a\n\t\t\tbargain that will save you from grievous suffering [in this world\n\t\t\tand in the life to come]?<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
You are to believe in God and His Apostle, and to strive hard in\n\t\t\tGod's cause with your possessions and your lives: this is for\n\t\t\tyour own good - if you but knew it!

[If you do so,] He will forgive you your sins, and [in the life
			to come] will admit you into gardens through which running waters
			flow, and into goodly mansions in [those] gardens of perpetual
			bliss:<sup class='fn'>12</sup> that [will be] the triumph supreme!

And [withal, He will grant you] yet another thing that you dearly
			love: succour from God [in this world], and a victory soon to
			come:<sup class='fn'>13</sup> and [thereof, O Prophet,] give thou a glad
			tiding to all who believe.

O YOU who have attained to faith! Be helpers [in the cause of God
			- even as Jesus, the son of Mary, said unto the white-garbed
			ones,<sup class='fn'>14</sup> "Who will be my helpers in God's cause?" -
			whereupon the white-garbed [disciples] replied, "We shall be
			[thy] helpers [in the cause] of God!" And so [it happened that]
			some of the children of Israel came to believe [in the
			apostleship of Jesus], whereas others denied the
			truth.<sup class='fn'>15</sup> But [now] We have given strength against their
			foes unto those who have [truly] attained to faith:<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
			and they have become the ones that shall prevail.
ALL THAT IS in the heavens and all that is on earth extols the\n\t\t\tlimitless glory of God, the Sovereign Supreme, the Holy, the\n\t\t\tAlmighty, the Wise!

He it is who has sent unto the unlettered people an apostle from
			among themselves,<sup class='fn'>1</sup> to convey unto them His messages, and
			to cause them to grow in purity, and to impart unto them the
			divine writ as well as wisdom - whereas before that they were
			indeed, most obviously, lost in error-;
and [to cause this message to spread] from them unto other people\n\t\t\tas soon as they come into contact with them:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> for He\n\t\t\talone is almighty, truly wise!.
Such is God's bounty: He grants it to anyone who is willing [to\n\t\t\treceive it]:<sup class='fn'>3</sup> for God is limitless in His great bounty.

THE PARABLE of those who were graced with the burden of the
			Torah, and thereafter failed to bear this burden,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> is
			that of an ass that carries a load of books [but cannot benefit
			from them]. Calamitous is the parable of people who are bent on
			giving the lie to God's messages - for God does not bestow His
			guidance upon such evildoing folk!

Say: "O you who follow the Jewish faith!<sup class='fn'>5</sup> If you claim
			that you [alone] are close to God, to the exclusion of all other
			people, then you should be longing for death - if what you say is
			true!"<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
But never will they long for it, because [they are aware] of what\n\t\t\ttheir hands have wrought in this world;<sup class='fn'>7</sup> and God has\n\t\t\tfull knowledge of evildoers.

Say: "Behold, the death from which you are fleeing<sup class='fn'>8</sup> is
			bound to overtake you - and then you will be brought back unto
			Him who knows all that is beyond the reach of a created being's
			perception as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature's
			senses or mind,<sup class='fn'>9</sup> whereupon He will make you truly
			understand all that you were doing [in life].

O YOU who have attained to faith! When the call to prayer is
			sounded on the day of congregation,<sup class='fn'>10</sup> hasten to the
			remembrance of God, and leave all worldly commerce: this is for
			your own good, if you but knew it.

And when the prayer is ended, disperse freely on earth<sup class='fn'>11</sup>\n\t\t\tand seek to obtain [something] of God's bounty; but remember God\n\t\t\toften, so that you might attain to a happy state!

Yet [it does happen that] when people<sup class='fn'>12</sup> become aware of
			[an occasion for] worldly gain<sup class='fn'>13</sup> or a passing delight,
			they rush headlong towards it, and leave thee standing [and
			preaching].<sup class='fn'>14</sup> Say: "That which is with God is far better
			than all passing delight and all gain! And God is the best of
			providers!"

WHEN THE HYPOCRITES come unto thee, they say, "We bear witness
			that thou art indeed God's Apostle!" But God knows that thou art
			truly His Apostle; and He bears witness that the hypocrites are
			indeed false [in their declaration of faith].
They have made their oaths a cover [for their falseness], and\n\t\t\tthus they turn others away from the path of God.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> Evil,\n\t\t\tindeed, is all that they are wont to do:

this, because [they profess that] they have attained to faith,
			whereas<sup class='fn'>2</sup> [inwardly] they deny the truth - and so, a seal
			has been set on their hearts, so that they can no longer
			understand [what is true and what false].<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

Now when thou seest them, their outward appearance may please
			thee; and when they speak, thou art inclined to lend ear to what
			they say.<sup class='fn'>4</sup> [But though they may seem as sure of
			themselves] as if they were timbers [firmly] propped up, they
			think that every shout is [directed] against them. They are the
			[real] enemies [of all faith], so beware of them. [They deserve
			the imprecation,] "May God destroy them!"<sup class='fn'>5</sup> How perverted
			are their minds!<sup class='fn'>6</sup> -
for, when they are told, "Come, the Apostle of God will pray\n\t\t\t[unto God] that you be forgiven", they turn their heads away, and\n\t\t\tthou canst see how they draw back in their false pride.

As for them, it is all the same whether thou dost pray that they
			be forgiven or dost not pray for them: God will not forgive them
			- for, behold, God does not bestow His guidance upon such
			iniquitous folk.<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

It is they who say [to their compatriots<sup class='fn'>8</sup>], "Do not
			spend anything on those who are with God's Apostle, so that they
			[may be forced to] leave."<sup class='fn'>9</sup> However, unto God belong the
			treasures of the heavens and the earth: but this truth the
			hypocrites cannot grasp.

[And] they say, "Indeed, when we return to the City,<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
			[we,] the ones most worthy of honour, will surely drive out
			therefrom those most contemptible ones!" However, all honour
			belongs to God, and [thus] to His Apostle and those who believe
			[in God]: but of this the hypocrites are not aware.<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
O YOU who have attained to faith! Let not your worldly goods or\n\t\t\tyour children make you oblivious of the remembrance of God: for\n\t\t\tif any behave thus - it is they, they who are the losers!

And spend on others out of what We have provided for you as
			sustenance,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> ere there come a time when death
			approaches any of you, and he then says, "O my Sustainer! If only
			Thou wouldst grant me a delay for a short while,<sup class='fn'>13</sup> so
			that I could give in charity and be among the righteous!"
But never does God grant a delay to a human being when his term\n\t\t\thas come; and God is fully aware of all that you do.
ALL THAT IS in the heavens and all that is on earth extols God's\n\t\t\tlimitless glory: His is all dominion, and to Him all praise is\n\t\t\tdue; and He has the power to will anything.
He it is who has created you: and among you are such as deny this\n\t\t\ttruth, and among you are such as believe [in it].<sup class='fn'>1</sup> And\n\t\t\tGod sees all that you do.

He has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with [an\n\t\t\tinner] truth<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and has formed you - and formed you so\n\t\t\twell;<sup class='fn'>3</sup> and with Him is your journey's end.

He knows all that is in the heavens and on earth; and He knows
			all that you keep secret as well as all that you bring into the
			open: for God has full knowledge of what is in the hearts [of
			men].

HAVE THE STORIES of those who, in earlier times, refused to
			acknowledge the truth never yet come within your ken? [They
			denied it - and so they had to taste the evil outcome of their
			own doings,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> with [more] grievous suffering awaiting
			them [in the life to come]:

this, because time and again there came unto them their
			apostles<sup class='fn'>5</sup> with all evidence of the truth, but they
			[always] replied, "Shall mere mortal men be our
			guides?"<sup class='fn'>6</sup> And so they denied the truth and turned away.
			But God was not in need [of them]: for God is self-sufficient,
			ever to be praised.

They who are bent on denying the truth claim that they will never
			be raised from the dead!<sup class='fn'>7</sup> Say: "Yea, by my Sustainer!
			Most surely will you be raised from the dead, and then, most
			surely, will you be made to understand what you did [in life]!
			For, easy is this for God!"
Believe, then, [O men,] in God and His Apostle, and in the light\n\t\t\t[of revelation] which We have bestowed [on you] from on high! And\n\t\t\tGod is fully aware of all that you do.

[Think of<sup class='fn'>8</sup>] the time when He shall gather you all
			together unto the Day of the [Last] Gathering - that Day of Loss
			and Gain! For, as for him who shall have believed in God and done
			what is just and right, He will [on that Day] efface his bad
			deeds, and will admit him into gardens through which running
			waters flow, therein to abide beyond the count of time: that will
			be a triumph supreme!
But as for those who are bent on denying the truth and on giving\n\t\t\tthe lie to Our messages - they are destined for the fire, therein\n\t\t\tto abide: and how vile a journey's end!

NO CALAMITY can ever befall [man] unless it be by God's leave:\n\t\t\thence, whoever believes in God guides his [own] heart [towards\n\t\t\tthis truth];<sup class='fn'>9</sup> and God has full knowledge of everything.
Pay heed, then, unto God, and pay heed unto the Apostle; and if\n\t\t\tyou turn away, [know that] Our Apostle's only duty is a clear\n\t\t\tdelivery of this message:
God - there is no deity save Him!<sup class='fn'>10</sup> In God, then, let\n\t\t\tthe believers place their trust.

O YOU who have attained to faith! Behold, some of your
			spouses<sup class='fn'>11</sup> and your children are enemies unto you: so
			beware of them!<sup class='fn'>12</sup> But if you pardon [their faults], and
			forbear, and forgive - then, behold, God will be much-forgiving,
			a dispenser of grace.
Your worldly goods and your children are but a trial and a\n\t\t\ttemptation<sup class='fn'>13</sup> whereas with God there is a tremendous\n\t\t\treward.

Remain, then, conscious of God as best you can, and listen [to
			Him], and pay heed. And spend in charity for the good of your own
			selves: for, such as from their own covetousness are saved - it
			is they, they that shall attain to a happy state!<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
If you offer up to God a goodly loan, He will amply repay you for\n\t\t\tit, and will forgive you your sins: for God is ever responsive to\n\t\t\tgratitude, forbearing,

knowing all that is beyond the reach of a created being's\n\t\t\tperception as well as all that can be witnessed by a creature's\n\t\t\tsenses or mind<sup class='fn'>15</sup> - the Almighty, the Wise!

O PROPHET! When you<sup class='fn'>1</sup> [intend to] divorce women, divorce
			them with a view to the waiting-period appointed for
			them,<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and reckon the period [carefully], and be
			conscious of God, your Sustainer. Do not expel them from their
			homes;<sup class='fn'>3</sup> and neither shall they [be made to]
			leave<sup class='fn'>4</sup> unless they become openly guilty of immoral
			conduct.<sup class='fn'>5</sup> These, then, are the bounds set by God - and
			he who transgresses the bounds set by God does indeed sin against
			himself: [for, O man, although] thou knowest it not, after that
			[first breach] God may well cause something new to come
			about.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

And so, when they are about to reach the end of their
			waiting-term, either retain them in a fair manner or part with
			them in a fair manner. And let two persons of [known] probity
			from among your own community<sup class='fn'>7</sup> witness [what you have
			decided]; and do yourselves bear true witness before
			God:<sup class='fn'>8</sup> thus are admonished all who believe in God and the
			Last Day. And unto everyone who is conscious of God, He [always]
			grants a way out [of unhappiness],

and provides for him in a manner beyond all
			expectation;<sup class='fn'>9</sup> and for everyone who places his trust in
			God, He [alone] is enough. Verily, God always attains to His
			purpose: [and] indeed, unto everything has God appointed its
			[term and] measure.

Now as for such of your women as are beyond the age of monthly
			courses, as well as for such as do not have any
			courses,<sup class='fn'>10</sup> their waiting-period - if you have any doubt
			[about it] - shall be three [calendar] months; and as for those
			who are with child, the end of their waiting-term shall come when
			they deliver their burden. And for everyone who is conscious of
			God, He makes it easy to obey His commandment:<sup class='fn'>11</sup>

[for] all this is God's commandment, which He has bestowed upon
			you from on high. And unto everyone who is conscious of God will
			He pardon [some of] his bad deeds, and will grant him a vast
			reward.

[Hence,] let the women [who are undergoing a waiting-period] live
			in the same manner as you live yourselves<sup class='fn'>12</sup> in
			accordance with your means; and do not harass them with a view to
			making their lives a misery. And if they happen to be with child,
			spend freely on them until they deliver their burden; and if they
			nurse your offspring [after the divorce has become final], give
			them their [due] recompense; and take counsel with one another in
			a fair manner [about the child's future]. And if both of you find
			it difficult [that the mother should nurse the child],<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
			let another woman nurse it on behalf of him [who has begotten
			it].<sup class='fn'>14</sup>

[In all these respects,] let him who has ample means spend in
			accordance with<sup class='fn'>15</sup> his amplitude; and let him whose means
			of subsistence are scanty spend in accordance with what God has
			given him: God does not burden any human being with more than He
			has given him - [and it may well be that] God will grant, after
			hardship, ease.

AND HOW MANY a community has turned with disdain from the
			commandment of its Sustainer and His apostles!<sup class='fn'>16</sup> -
			whereupon We called them all to account with an accounting
			severe, and caused them to suffer with a suffering unnameable:
and thus they had to taste the evil outcome of their own\n\t\t\tdoing:<sup class='fn'>17</sup> for, [in this world,] the end of their doings\n\t\t\twas ruin,

[the while] God has readied for them [yet more] suffering severe
			[in the life to come]. Hence, remain conscious of God, O you who
			are endowed with insight - [you] who have attained to faith! God
			has indeed bestowed on you reminder from on high:

[He has sent] an apostle who conveys unto you God's clear
			messages, so that He might lead those who have attained to faith
			and do righteous deeds out of the depths of darkness into the
			light. And whoever believes in God and does what is right and
			just, him will He admit into gardens through which running waters
			flow, therein to abide beyond the count of time: indeed, a most
			goodly provision will God have granted him!

GOD is He who has created seven heavens,<sup class='fn'>18</sup> and, like
			them, [the many aspects] of the earth. Through all of them flows
			down from on high, unceasingly, His [creative] will,<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
			so that you might come to know that God has the power to will
			anything, and that God encompasses all things with His knowledge.

O PROPHET! Why dost thou, out of a desire to please [one or
			another of] thy wives, impose [on thyself] a prohibition of
			something that God has made lawful to thee?<sup class='fn'>1</sup> But God is
			much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace:

God has already enjoined upon you [O believers] the breaking and
			expiation of [such of] your oaths [as may run counter to what is
			right and just]:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> for, God is your Lord Supreme, and He
			alone is all-knowing, truly wise.

And lo!<sup class='fn'>3</sup> [It so happened that] the Prophet told
			something in confidence to one of his wives; and when she
			thereupon divulged it, and God made this known to him, he
			acquainted [others] with some of it and passed over some of
			it.<sup class='fn'>4</sup> And as soon as he let her know it, she asked, "Who
			has told thee this?"<sup class='fn'>5</sup> - [to which] he replied, "The
			All-Knowing, the All-Aware has told me."

[Say, O Prophet:<sup class='fn'>6</sup>] "Would that you two turn unto God in
			repentance, for the hearts of both of you have swerved [from what
			is right]!<sup class='fn'>7</sup> And if you uphold each other against him
			[who is God's message-bearer, know that] God Himself is his
			Protector, and [that,] therefore,<sup class='fn'>8</sup> Gabriel, and all the
			righteous among the believers, and all the [other] angels will
			come to his aid."

[O wives of the Prophet!] Were he to divorce [any of] you, God
			might well give him in your stead spouses better than you - women
			who surrender themselves unto God, who truly believe, devoutly
			obey His will, turn [unto Him] in repentance [whenever they have
			sinned], worship [Him alone], and go on and on [seeking His
			goodly acceptance]<sup class='fn'>9</sup> - be they women previously married
			or virgins.<sup class='fn'>10</sup>

O YOU who have attained to faith! Ward off from yourselves and
			those who are close to you<sup class='fn'>11</sup> that fire [of the
			hereafter] whose fuel is human beings and stones:<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
			[fording] over it are angelic powers awesome [and]
			severe,<sup class='fn'>13</sup> who do not disobey God in whatever He has
			commanded them, but [always] do what they are bidden to
			do.<sup class='fn'>14</sup>

[Hence,] O you who are bent on denying the truth, make no [empty]\n\t\t\texcuses today:<sup class='fn'>15</sup> [in the life to come] you shall be but\n\t\t\trecompensed for what you were doing [in this world].

O you who have attained to faith! Turn unto God in sincere
			repentance:<sup class='fn'>16</sup> it may well be that your Sustainer will
			efface from you your bad deeds, and will admit you into gardens
			through which running waters flow, on a Day on which God will not
			shame the Prophet and those who share his faith:<sup class='fn'>17</sup> their
			light will spread rapidly before them, and on their
			right;<sup class='fn'>18</sup> [and] they will pray: "O our Sustainer! Cause
			this our light to shine for us forever,<sup class='fn'>19</sup> and forgive us
			our sins: for, verily, Thou hast the power to will anything!"

O PROPHET! Strive hard against the deniers of the truth and the
			hypocrites, and be adamant with them.<sup class='fn'>20</sup> And [if they do
			not repent,] their goal shall be hell - and how vile a journey's
			end!

For those who are bent on denying the truth God has propounded a
			parable in [the stories of] Noah's wife and Lot's wife: they were
			wedded to two of Our righteous servants, and each one betrayed
			her husband;<sup class='fn'>21</sup> and neither of the two [husbands] will be
			of any avail to these two women when they are told [on Judgment
			Day], "Enter the fire with all those [other sinners] who enter
			it!"<sup class='fn'>22</sup>

And for those who have attained to faith God has propounded a
			parable in [the story of] Pharaoh's wife<sup class='fn'>23</sup> as she
			prayed, "O my Sustainer! Build Thou for me a mansion in the
			paradise [that is] with Thee, and save me from Pharaoh and his
			doings, and save me from all evildoing folk!"

And [We have propounded yet another parable of God-consciousness
			in the story of] Mary, the daughter of 'Imran,<sup class='fn'>24</sup> who
			guarded her chastity, whereupon We breathed of Our spirit into
			that [which was in her womb],<sup class='fn'>25</sup> and who accepted the
			truth of her Sustainer's words - and [thus,] of His
			revelations<sup class='fn'>26</sup> - and was one of the truly devout.
HALLOWED be He in whose hand all dominion rests, since He has the\n\t\t\tpower to will anything:

He who has created death as well as life,<sup class='fn'>1</sup> so that He
			might put you to a test [and thus show] which of you is best in
			conduct, and [make you realize that] He alone is almighty, truly
			forgiving.

[Hallowed be] He who has created seven heavens in full harmony
			with one another:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> no fault wilt thou see in the
			creation of the Most Gracious. And turn thy vision [upon it] once
			more: canst thou see any flaw?
