Yea, turn thy vision [upon it] again and yet again: [and every\n\t\t\ttime] thy vision will fall back upon thee, dazzled and truly\n\t\t\tdefeated....<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

And, indeed, We have adorned the skies nearest to the earth with
			lights,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> and have made them the object of futile guesses
			for the evil ones [from among men]:<sup class='fn'>5</sup> and for them have
			We readied suffering through a blazing flame -
for, suffering in hell awaits all who are [thus] bent on\n\t\t\tblaspheming against their Sustainer:<sup class='fn'>6</sup> and how vile a\n\t\t\tjourney's end!
When they are cast into that [hell], they will hear its breath\n\t\t\tindrawing as it boils up,
well-nigh bursting with fury; [and] every time a host [of such\n\t\t\tsinners] is flung into it, its keepers will ask them, "Has no\n\t\t\twarner ever come to you?"

They will reply: "Yea, a warner did indeed come unto us, but we
			gave him the lie and said, 'Never has God sent down anything [by
			way of revelation]! You [self-styled warners] are but lost in a
			great delusion!'"<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

And they will add: "Had we but listened [to those warnings], or\n\t\t\t[at least] used our own reason, we would not [now] be among those\n\t\t\twho are destined for the blazing flame!"<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
Thus will they come to realize their sins: but [by that time,]\n\t\t\tremote will have become all good from those who are destined for\n\t\t\tthe blazing flame.

[As against this,] behold, for those who stand in awe of God\n\t\t\talthough He is beyond the reach of their perception,<sup class='fn'>9</sup>\n\t\t\tthere is forgiveness in store and a great reward.

AND [know, O men, that] whether you keep your beliefs<sup class='fn'>10</sup>\n\t\t\tsecret or state them openly, He has full knowledge indeed of all\n\t\t\tthat is in [your] hearts.<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
How could it be that He who has created [all] should not know\n\t\t\t[all]?<sup class='fn'>12</sup> Yea, He alone is unfathomable [in His wisdom],\n\t\t\tall-aware!<sup class='fn'>13</sup>

He it is who has made the earth easy to live upon:<sup class='fn'>14</sup> go
			about, then, in all its regions, and partake of the sustenance
			which He provides: but [always bear in mind that] unto Him you
			shall be resurrected.
Can you ever feel secure that He who is in heaven<sup class='fn'>15</sup> will\n\t\t\tnot cause the earth to swallow you up when, lo and behold, it\n\t\t\tbegins to quake?

Or can you ever feel secure that He who is in heaven will not let\n\t\t\tloose against you a deadly stormwind,<sup class='fn'>16</sup> whereupon you\n\t\t\twould come to know how [true] My warning was?
And, indeed, [many of] those who lived aforetime<sup class='fn'>17</sup> did\n\t\t\tgive the lie [to My warnings]: and how awesome was My rejection\n\t\t\t[of them]!
Have they, then, never beheld the birds above them, spreading\n\t\t\ttheir wings and drawing them in? None but the Most Gracious\n\t\t\tupholds them: for, verily, He keeps all things in His sight.

[And] is there any, beside the Most Gracious, that could be a\n\t\t\tshield<sup class='fn'>18</sup> for you, and succour you [against danger]? They\n\t\t\twho deny this truth are but lost in self-delusion!

Or is there any that could provide you with sustenance if He
			should withhold His provision [from you]? Nay, but they [who are
			bent on denying the truth] stubbornly persist in their disdain
			[of God's messages] and in their headlong flight [from Him]!
But then, is he that goes along with his face close to the\n\t\t\tground<sup class='fn'>19</sup> better guided than he that walks upright on a\n\t\t\tstraight way?
SAY: "[God is] He who has brought you [all] into being, and has\n\t\t\tendowed you with hearing, and sight, and hearts:<sup class='fn'>20</sup> [yet]\n\t\t\thow seldom are you grateful!"
Say: "It is He who has multiplied you on earth; and it is unto\n\t\t\tHim that you shall be gathered [on resurrection]."
But they [only] ask, "When is this promise to be fulfilled?\n\t\t\t[Answer this, O you who believe in it,] if you are men of truth!"
Say thou, [O Prophet:] "Knowledge thereof rests with God alone;\n\t\t\tand I am only a plain warner."

Yet in the end, when they shall see that [fulfilment] close at
			hand, the faces of those who were bent on denying the truth will
			be stricken with grief; and they will be told, "This it is that
			you were [so derisively] calling for!"

SAY [O Prophet]: "What do you think? Whether God destroys me and
			those who follow me, or graces us with His mercy<sup class='fn'>21</sup> - is
			there anyone that could protect [you] deniers of the truth from
			grievous suffering [in the life to come]?"
Say: "He is the Most Gracious: we have attained to faith in Him,\n\t\t\tand in Him have we placed our trust; and in time you will come to\n\t\t\tknow which of us was lost in manifest error."

Say [unto those who deny the truth]: "What do you think? If of a
			sudden all your water were to vanish underground, who [but God]
			could provide you with water from [new] unsullied
			springs?"<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
Nun.<sup class='fn'>1</sup> CONSIDER the pen, and all that they write\n\t\t\t[therewith]!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Thou art not, by thy Sustainer's grace, a madman!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
And, verily, thine shall be a reward neverending -
for, behold, thou keepest indeed to a sublime way of\n\t\t\tlife;<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and [one day] thou shalt see, and they [who now deride thee]\n\t\t\tshall see,
which of you was bereft of reason.
Verily, thy Sustainer alone is fully aware as to who has strayed\n\t\t\tfrom His path, just as He alone is fully aware of those who have\n\t\t\tfound the right way.
Hence, defer not to [the likes and dislikes of] those who give\n\t\t\tthe lie to the truth:
they would like thee to be soft [with them], so that they might\n\t\t\tbe soft [with thee].<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
Furthermore,<sup class='fn'>6</sup> defer not to the contemptible swearer of\n\t\t\toaths,
[or to] the slanderer that goes about with defaming tales,
[or] the withholder of good, [or] the sinful aggressor,
[or] one who is cruel, by greed possessed,<sup class='fn'>7</sup> and, in\n\t\t\taddition to all this, utterly useless [to his\n\t\t\tfellow-men].<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
Is it because he is possessed of worldly goods and children
that, whenever Our messages are conveyed to him, such a one says,\n\t\t\t"Fables of ancient times"?<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
[For this] We shall brand him with indelible disgrace!<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
[As for such sinners,] behold, We [but] try them<sup class='fn'>11</sup> as We\n\t\t\ttried the owners of a certain garden who vowed that they would\n\t\t\tsurely harvest its fruit on the morrow,
and made no allowance [for the will of God]:<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
whereupon a visitation from thy Sustainer came upon that [garden]\n\t\t\twhile they were asleep,
so that by the morrow it became barren and bleak.
Now when they rose at early morn, they called unto one another,
"Go early to your tilth if you want to harvest the fruit!"
Thus they launched forth, whispering unto one another,
"Indeed, no needy person shall enter it today [and come] upon you\n\t\t\t[unawares]!"<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
- and early they went, strongly bent upon their purpose.
But as soon as they beheld [the garden and could not recognize]\n\t\t\tit, they exclaimed, "Surely we have lost our way!"
- [and then,] "Nay, but we have been rendered destitute!"
Said the most right-minded among them: "Did I not tell you, 'Will\n\t\t\tyou not extol God's limitless glory?'"<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
They answered: "Limitless in His glory is our Sustainer! Verily,\n\t\t\twe were doing wrong!"
- and then they turned upon one another with mutual reproaches.
[In the end] they said: "Oh, woe unto us! Verily, we did behave\n\t\t\toutrageously!
[But] it may be that our Sustainer will grant us something better\n\t\t\tinstead:<sup class='fn'>15</sup> for, verily, unto our Sustainer do we turn\n\t\t\twith hope!"

SUCH is the suffering [with which We try some people in this
			world];<sup class='fn'>16</sup> but greater by far will be the suffering
			[which sinners shall have to bear] in the life to come - if they
			but knew it!
For, behold, it is the God-conscious [alone] whom gardens of\n\t\t\tbliss await with their Sustainer:
or should We, perchance, treat those who surrender themselves\n\t\t\tunto Us<sup class='fn'>17</sup> as [We would treat] those who remain lost in\n\t\t\tsin?
What is amiss with you?<sup class='fn'>18</sup> On what do you base your\n\t\t\tjudgment [of right and wrong]?
Or have you perchance, a [special] divine writ which you study?
and in which you find all that you may wish to find?<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
Or have you received a solemn promise, binding on Us till\n\t\t\tResurrection Day, that yours will assuredly be whatever you judge\n\t\t\t[to be your rightful due]?
Ask them which of them is able to vouch for this!
Or have they, perchance, any sages to support their\n\t\t\tviews?<sup class='fn'>20</sup> Well, then, if they are sincere in this their\n\t\t\tclaim, let them produce those supporters of theirs

on the Day when man's very being shall be bared to the
			bone,<sup class='fn'>21</sup> and when they [who now deny the truth] shall be
			called upon to prostrate themselves [before God],<sup class='fn'>22</sup> and
			shall be unable to do so:

downcast will be their eyes, with ignominy overwhelming them -\n\t\t\tseeing that they had been called upon [in vain] to prostrate\n\t\t\tthemselves [before Him] while they were yet sound [and alive].

Hence, leave Me alone with such as give the lie to this\n\t\t\ttiding.<sup class='fn'>23</sup> We shall bring them low, step by step, without\n\t\t\ttheir perceiving how it has come about:<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
for, behold, though I may give them rein for a while, My subtle\n\t\t\tscheme is exceedingly firm!<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
Or is it that [they fear lest] thou ask them for a reward, [O\n\t\t\tProphet,] so that they would be burdened with debt [if they\n\t\t\tlistened to thee]?
Or [do they think] that the hidden reality [of all that exists]\n\t\t\tis within their grasp, so that [in time] they can write it\n\t\t\tdown?<sup class='fn'>26</sup>
BEAR, THEN, with patience thy Sustainer's will, and be not like\n\t\t\thim of the great fish, who cried out [in distress] after having\n\t\t\tgiven in to anger.<sup class='fn'>27</sup>

[And remember:] had not grace from his Sustainer reached\n\t\t\thim,<sup class='fn'>28</sup> he would indeed have been cast forth upon that\n\t\t\tbarren shore in a state of disgrace:<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
but [as it was,] his Sustainer had elected him and placed him\n\t\t\tamong the righteous.

Hence, [be patient,] even though they who are bent on denying the
			truth would all but kill thee with their eyes whenever they hear
			this reminder, and [though] they say, "[As for Muhammad,] behold,
			most surely he is a madman!"
[Be patient:] for this is nought else but reminder [from God] to\n\t\t\tall mankind.
OH, THE LAYING-BARE of the truth!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
How awesome that laying-bare of the truth!
And what could make thee conceive what that laying-bare of the\n\t\t\ttruth will be?<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
THE LIE gave [the tribes of] Thamud and 'Ad to [all tidings of]\n\t\t\tthat sudden calamity!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Now as for the Thamud - they were destroyed by a violent upheaval\n\t\t\t[of the earth];<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and as for the 'Ad - they were destroyed by a stormwind furiously\n\t\t\traging,

which He willed against them for seven nights and eight days
			without cease, so that in the end thou couldst see those people
			laid low [in death], as though they were so many [uprooted]
			trunks of hollow palm trees:
and dost thou now see any remnant of them?
And there was Pharaoh, too, and [many of] those who lived before\n\t\t\thim, and the cities that were overthrown<sup class='fn'>5</sup> - [all of\n\t\t\tthem] indulged in sin upon sin
and rebelled against their Sustainer's apostles: and so He took\n\t\t\tthem to task with a punishing grasp exceedingly severe!
[And] behold: when the waters [of Noah's flood] burst beyond all\n\t\t\tlimits, it was We who caused you<sup class='fn'>6</sup> to be borne [to\n\t\t\tsafety] in that floating ark,
so that We might make all this<sup class='fn'>7</sup> a [lasting] reminder to\n\t\t\tyou all, and that every wide-awake ear might consciously take it\n\t\t\tin.
Hence, [bethink yourselves of the Last Hour,] when the trumpet\n\t\t\t[of judgment] shall be sounded with a single blast,
and the earth and the mountains shall be lifted up and crushed\n\t\t\twith a single stroke!
And so, that which must come to pass<sup class='fn'>8</sup> will on that Day\n\t\t\thave come to pass;
and the sky will be rent asunder<sup class='fn'>9</sup> for, frail will it\n\t\t\thave become on that Day -;

and the angels [will appear] at its ends,<sup class='fn'>10</sup> and, above\n\t\t\tthem, eight will bear aloft on that Day the throne of thy\n\t\t\tSustainer's almightiness....<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
On that Day you shall be brought to judgment: not [even] the most\n\t\t\thidden of your deeds will remain hidden.
Now as for him whose record shall be placed in his right\n\t\t\thand,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> he will exclaim: "Come you all! Read this my\n\t\t\trecord!
Behold, I did know that [one day] I would have to face my\n\t\t\taccount!"<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
And so he will find himself in a happy state of life,
in a lofty paradise,
with its fruits within easy reach.
[And all who are thus blest will be told:] "Eat and drink with\n\t\t\tgood cheer in return for all [the good deeds] that you have sent\n\t\t\tahead in days gone by!"
But as for him whose record shall be placed in his left\n\t\t\thand,<sup class='fn'>14</sup> he will exclaim: "Oh, would that I had never\n\t\t\tbeen shown this my record,
and neither known this my account!
Oh, would that this [death of mine] had been the end of me!
Of no avail to me is all that I have [ever] possessed,
[and] all my power of argument has died away from me!"<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
[Thereupon the command will go forth:] "Lay hold of him, and\n\t\t\tshackle him,<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
and then let him enter hell,
and then thrust him into a chain [of other sinners like\n\t\t\thim<sup class='fn'>17</sup> - a chain] the length whereof is seventy\n\t\t\tcubits:<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
for, behold, he did not believe in God, the Tremendous,
and did not feel any urge<sup class='fn'>19</sup> to feed the needy:
and so, no friend has he here today,
nor any food save the filth
which none but the sinners eat!"<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
BUT NAY! I call to witness all that you can see,
as well as all that you cannot see!<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
Behold, this [Qur'an] is indeed the [inspired] word of a noble\n\t\t\tapostle,
and is not - however little you may [be prepared to] believe it -\n\t\t\tthe word of a poet;
and neither is it - however little you may [be prepared to] take\n\t\t\tit to heart - the word of a soothsayer:
[it is] a revelation from the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Now if he [whom We have entrusted with it] had dared to attribute\n\t\t\tsome [of his own] sayings unto Us,
We would indeed have seized him by his right hand,<sup class='fn'>22</sup>
and would indeed have cut his life-vein,
and none of you could have saved him!
And, verily, this [Qur'an] is a reminder to all the\n\t\t\tGod-conscious.<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
And, behold, well do We know that among you are such as will give\n\t\t\tthe lie to it:
yet, behold, this [rejection] will indeed become a source of\n\t\t\tbitter regret for all who deny the truth [of God's revelation] -
for, verily, it is truth absolute!
Extol, then, the limitless glory of thy Sustainer's mighty name!
ONE who is minded to ask might ask<sup class='fn'>1</sup> about the suffering\n\t\t\twhich [in the hereafter] is bound to befall
those who deny the truth.<sup class='fn'>2</sup> [Know, then, that] nothing\n\t\t\tcan ward it off,
[since it will come] from God, unto whom there are many ways of\n\t\t\tascent:<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

all the angels and all the inspiration [ever granted to man]\n\t\t\tascend unto Him<sup class='fn'>4</sup> [daily,] in a day the length whereof is\n\t\t\t[like] fifty thousand years....<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
Therefore, [O believer,] endure all adversity with goodly\n\t\t\tpatience:
behold, men<sup class='fn'>6</sup> look upon that [reckoning] as something far\n\t\t\taway -
but We see it as near!
[It will take place] on a Day when the sky will be like molten\n\t\t\tlead,
and the mountains will be like tufts of wool,
and [when] no friend will ask about his friend,
though they may be in one another's sight: [for,] everyone who\n\t\t\twas lost in sin will on that Day but desire to ransom himself\n\t\t\tfrom suffering at the price of his own children,
and of his spouse, and of his brother,
and of all the kinsfolk who ever sheltered him,
and of whoever [else] lives on earth, all of them - so that he\n\t\t\tcould but save himself.
But nay! Verily, all [that awaits him] is a raging flame,
tearing away his skin!
It will claim all such as turn their backs [on what is right],\n\t\t\tand turn away [from the truth],
and amass [wealth] and thereupon withhold [it from their\n\t\t\tfellow-men].
VERILY, man is born with a restless disposition.<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
[As a rule,] whenever misfortune touches him, he is filled with\n\t\t\tself-pity;<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
and whenever good fortune comes to him, he selfishly withholds it\n\t\t\t[from others].
Not so, however, those who consciously turn towards God in\n\t\t\tprayer,<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
[and] who incessantly persevere in their prayer;
and in whose possessions there is a due share, acknowledged [by\n\t\t\tthem],
for such as ask [for help] and such as are deprived [of what is\n\t\t\tgood in life];<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
and who accept as true the [coming of the] Day of Judgment;
and who stand in dread of their Sustainer's chastisement -
for, behold, of their Sustainer's chastisement none may ever feel\n\t\t\t[wholly] secure;<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
and who are mindful of their chastity,<sup class='fn'>12</sup>

[not giving way to their desires] with any but their spouses -\n\t\t\tthat is, those whom they rightfully possess [through wedlock]\n\t\t\t-:<sup class='fn'>13</sup> for then, behold, they are free of all blame,
whereas such as seek to go beyond that [limit] are truly\n\t\t\ttransgressors;
and who are faithful to their trusts and to their pledges;
and who stand firm whenever they bear witness;
and who guard their prayers [from all worldly intent].
These it is who in the gardens [of paradise] shall be honoured!
WHAT, THEN, is amiss with such as are bent on denying the truth,\n\t\t\tthat they run about confusedly to and fro before thee,
[coming upon thee] from the right and from the left, in\n\t\t\tcrowds?<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
Does every one of them hope to enter [by this means] a garden of\n\t\t\tbliss?<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
Never! For, behold, We have created them out of something that\n\t\t\tthey know [only too well]!<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
But nay! I call to witness [Our being] the Sustainer of all the\n\t\t\tpoints of sunrise and sunset:<sup class='fn'>17</sup> verily, well able are We
to replace them with [people] better than they are; for there is\n\t\t\tnothing to prevent Us [from doing what We will].<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
Hence, leave them to indulge in idle talk and play [with\n\t\t\twords]<sup class='fn'>19</sup> until they face that [Judgment] Day of theirs\n\t\t\twhich they have been promised -
the Day when they shall come forth in haste from their graves, as\n\t\t\tif racing towards a goal-post,
with downcast eyes, with ignominy overwhelming them: that Day\n\t\t\twhich they were promised again and again....<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
BEHOLD, We sent Noah unto his people, [saying:] "Warn thy people\n\t\t\tere grievous suffering befall them!"
[And Noah] said: "O my people! I am but a plain warner to you,\n\t\t\t[sent to tell you]
that you should worship God [alone] and be conscious of Him. "Now\n\t\t\tdo pay heed unto me,

so that He may forgive you some of your sins, and grant you
			respite until a term known [to Him alone]:<sup class='fn'>1</sup> but, behold,
			when the term appointed by God does come, it can never be put
			back - if you but knew it!"
[And after a time, Noah] said: "O my Sustainer! Verily, I have\n\t\t\tbeen calling unto my people night and day,
but my call has only caused them to flee farther and farther away\n\t\t\t[from Thee].<sup class='fn'>2</sup>

And, behold, whenever I called unto them with a view to Thy
			granting them forgiveness, they put their fingers into their
			ears, and wrapped themselves up in their garments [of
			sin],<sup class='fn'>3</sup> and grew obstinate, and became [yet more]
			arrogant in their false pride.
"And, behold, I called unto them openly;
and, behold, I preached to them in public; and I spoke to them\n\t\t\tsecretly, in private;
and I said: "'Ask your Sustainer to forgive you your sins - for,\n\t\t\tverily, He is all-forgiving!
He will shower upon you heavenly blessings abundant,<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and will aid you with worldly goods and children, and will bestow\n\t\t\tupon you gardens, and bestow upon you running waters.<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
"What is amiss with you that you cannot look forward to God's\n\t\t\tmajesty,<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
seeing that He has created [every one of] you in successive\n\t\t\tstages?<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
"Do you not see how God has created seven heavens in full harmony\n\t\t\twith one another,<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
and has set up within them the moon as a light [reflected], and\n\t\t\tset up the sun as a [radiant] lamp?<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
"And God has caused you to grow out of the earth in [gradual]\n\t\t\tgrowth;<sup class='fn'>10</sup> and thereafter He will return you to it [in\n\t\t\tdeath]:
and [then] He will bring you forth [from it] in\n\t\t\tresurrection.<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
"And God has made the earth a wide expanse for you,
so that you might walk thereon on spacious paths.'"<sup class='fn'>12</sup>

[And] Noah continued: "O my Sustainer! Behold, they have opposed\n\t\t\tme [throughout], for they follow people whose wealth and children\n\t\t\tlead them increasingly into ruin,<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
and who have devised a most awesome blasphemy [against Thee],
inasmuch as they said [to their followers], 'Do not ever abandon\n\t\t\tyour gods: abandon neither Wadd nor Suwa', and neither Yaghuth\n\t\t\tnor Ya'uq nor Nasr!'<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
"And so they have led many a one astray: hence, ordain Thou that\n\t\t\tthese evildoers stray but farther and farther away [from all that\n\t\t\tthey may desire]!"<sup class='fn'>15</sup>

And so, because of their sins, they were drowned [in the great
			flood], and were doomed to suffer the fire [of the
			hereafter];<sup class='fn'>16</sup> and they found none who could succour them
			against God.
And Noah prayed: "O my Sustainer! Leave not on earth any of those\n\t\t\twho deny the truth:

for, behold, if Thou dost leave them, they will [always try to]\n\t\t\tlead astray those who worship Thee, and will give birth to\n\t\t\tnothing but wickedness and stubborn ingratitude.<sup class='fn'>17</sup>

"O my Sustainer! Grant Thy forgiveness unto me and unto my
			parents, and unto everyone who enters my house as a believer, and
			unto all believing men and believing women [of later times]; and
			grant Thou that the doers of evil shall increasingly meet with
			destruction!"<sup class='fn'>18</sup>

SAY: "It has been revealed to me that some of the unseen beings
			gave ear [to this divine writ],<sup class='fn'>1</sup> and thereupon said
			funto their fellow-beings]: "'Verily, we have heard a wondrous
			discourse,
guiding towards consciousness of what is right; and so We have\n\t\t\tcome to believe in it. And we shall never ascribe divinity to\n\t\t\tanyone beside our Sustainer,
for [we know] that sublimely exalted is our Sustainer's majesty:\n\t\t\tno consort has He ever taken unto Himself, nor a son!
"And [now we know] that the foolish among us were wont to say\n\t\t\toutrageous things about God,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
and that [we were mistaken when] we thought that neither man nor\n\t\t\t[any of] the invisible forces would ever tell a lie about\n\t\t\tGod.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>

Yet [it has always happened] that certain kinds of humans would\n\t\t\tseek refuge with certain kinds of [such] invisible\n\t\t\tforces:<sup class='fn'>4</sup> but these only increased their confusion -
so much so that they came to think, as you [once] thought, that\n\t\t\tGod would never [again] send forth anyone [as His\n\t\t\tapostle].<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
"And [so it happened] that we reached out towards\n\t\t\theaven:<sup class='fn'>6</sup> but we found it filled with mighty guards and\n\t\t\tflames,<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

notwithstanding that we were established in positions [which we
			had thought well-suited] to listening to [whatever secrets might
			be in] it:<sup class='fn'>8</sup> and anyone who now [or ever] tries to listen
			will [likewise] find a flame lying in wait for him!<sup class='fn'>9</sup>

"And [now we have become aware] that we [created beings] may not
			know whether evil fortune is intended for [any of] those who live
			on earth, or whether it is their Sustainer's will to endow them
			with consciousness of what is right:<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
just as [we do not know how it happens] that some from among us\n\t\t\tare righteous, while some of us are [far] below that: we have\n\t\t\talways followed widely divergent paths.
And, withal, we have come to know that we can never elude God\n\t\t\t[while we live] on earth, and that we can never elude Him by\n\t\t\tescaping [from life].
Hence, as soon as we heard this [call to His] guidance, we came\n\t\t\tto believe in it: and he who believes in his Sustainer need never\n\t\t\thave fear of loss or injustice.

"Yet [it is true] that among us are such as have surrendered
			themselves to God - just as there are among us such as have
			abandoned themselves to wrongdoing. Now as for those who
			surrender themselves to Him - it is they that have attained to
			consciousness of what is right;
but as for those who abandon themselves to wrongdoing - they are\n\t\t\tindeed but fuel for [the fires of] hell!'"<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
[KNOW,] THEN, that if they [who have heard Our call] keep firmly\n\t\t\tto the [right] path, We shall certainly shower them with\n\t\t\tblessings abundant,<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
so as to test them by this means: for he who shall turn away from\n\t\t\tthe remembrance of his Sustainer, him will He cause to undergo\n\t\t\tsuffering most grievous.<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
And [know] that all worship<sup class='fn'>14</sup> is due to God [alone]:\n\t\t\thence, do not invoke anyone side by side with God!

Yet [thus it is] that whenever a servant of God stands up in\n\t\t\tprayer to Him, they [who are bent on denying the truth] would\n\t\t\tgladly overwhelm him with their crowds.<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
Say: "I invoke my Sustainer alone, for I do not ascribe divinity\n\t\t\tto anyone beside Him."
Say: "Verily, it is not in my power to cause you harm or to endow\n\t\t\tyou with consciousness of what is right."
Say: "Verily, no one could ever protect me from God, nor could I\n\t\t\tever find a place to hide from Him

if I should fail to convey<sup class='fn'>16</sup> [to the world whatever
			illumination comes to me] from God and His messages." Now as for
			him who rebels against God and His Apostle - verily, the fire of
			hell awaits him, therein to abide beyond the count of
			time.<sup class='fn'>17</sup>

[Let them, then, wait] until the time when they behold that
			[doom] of which they were forewarned:<sup class='fn'>18</sup> for then they
			will come to understand which [kind of man] is more helpless and
			counts for less!<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
Say: "I do not know whether that [doom] of which you were\n\t\t\tforewarned is near, or whether my Sustainer has set for it a\n\t\t\tdistant term."

He [alone] knows that which is beyond the reach of a created\n\t\t\tbeing's perception, and to none does He disclose aught of the\n\t\t\tmysteries of His Own unfathomable knowledge,<sup class='fn'>20</sup>

unless it be to an apostle whom He has been pleased to elect
			[therefor]:<sup class='fn'>21</sup> and then He sends forth [the forces of
			heaven] to watch over him in whatever lies open before him and in
			what is beyond his ken<sup class='fn'>22</sup> -

so as to make manifest that it is indeed [but] their Sustainer's
			messages that these [apostles] deliver: for it is He who
			encompasses [with His knowledge] all that they have [to
			say],<sup class='fn'>23</sup> just as He takes count, one by one, of
			everything [that exists].
O THOU enwrapped one!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Keep awake [in prayer] at night, all but a small part
of one-half thereof<sup class='fn'>2</sup> - or make it a little less than\n\t\t\tthat,
or add to it [at will]; and [during that time] recite the Qur'an\n\t\t\tcalmly and distinctly, with thy mind attuned to its\n\t\t\tmeaning.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Behold, We shall bestow upon thee a weighty message -
[and,] verily, the hours of night impress the mind most strongly\n\t\t\tand speak with the clearest voice,<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
whereas by day a long chain of doings is thy portion.
But [whether by night or by day,] remember thy Sustainer's name,\n\t\t\tand devote thyself unto Him with utter devotion.
The Sustainer of the east and the west [is He]: there is no deity\n\t\t\tsave Him: hence, ascribe to Him alone the power to determine thy\n\t\t\tfate,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
and endure with patience whatever people may say [against thee],\n\t\t\tand avoid them with a comely avoidance.

And leave Me alone [to deal] with those who give the lie to the\n\t\t\ttruth<sup class='fn'>6</sup> - those who enjoy the blessings of life [without\n\t\t\tany thought of God] - and bear thou with them for a little while:
for, behold, heavy fetters [await them] with Us, and a blazing\n\t\t\tfire,
and food that chokes, and grievous sufferings<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
on the Day when the earth and the mountains will be convulsed,\n\t\t\tand the mountains will [crumble and] become like a sand-dune on\n\t\t\tthe move!<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
BEHOLD, [O men,] We have sent unto you an apostle who shall bear\n\t\t\twitness to the truth before you, even as We sent an apostle unto\n\t\t\tPharaoh:<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
and Pharaoh rebelled against the apostle, whereupon We took him\n\t\t\tto task with a crushing grip.
How, then, if you refuse to acknowledge the truth, will you\n\t\t\tprotect yourselves on that Day which shall turn the hair of\n\t\t\tchildren grey,<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
[the Day] on which the skies shall be rent asunder, [and] His\n\t\t\tpromise [of resurrection] fulfilled?
This, verily, is a reminder: let him who wills, then set out on a\n\t\t\tway to his Sustainer!

BEHOLD, [O Prophet,] thy Sustainer knows that thou keenest awake
			[in prayer] nearly two-thirds of the night, or one-half of it, or
			a third of it, together with some of those who follow
			thee.<sup class='fn'>11</sup> And God, who determines the measure of night and
			day, is aware that you would never grudge it:<sup class='fn'>12</sup> and
			therefore He turns towards you in His grace. Recite, then, as
			much of the Qur'an as you may do with ease. He knows that in time
			there will be among you sick people, and others who will go about
			the land in search of God's bounty, and others who will fight in
			God's cause.<sup class='fn'>13</sup> Recite, then, [only] as much of it as you
			may do with ease, and be constant in prayer, and spend in
			charity,<sup class='fn'>14</sup> and [thus] lend unto God a goodly loan: for
			whatever good deed you may offer up in your own behalf, you shall
			truly find it with God - yea, better, and richer in reward. And
			[always] seek God's forgiveness: behold, God is much-forgiving, a
			dispenser of grace!
O THOU [in thy solitude] enfolded!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Arise and warn!
And thy Sustainer's greatness glorify!
And thine inner self purify!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
And all defilement shun!
And do not through giving seek thyself to gain,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
but unto thy Sustainer turn in patience.
And [warn all men that] when the trumpet-call [of resurrection]\n\t\t\tis sounded,
that very Day shall be a day of anguish,
not of ease, for all who [now] deny the truth!<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
LEAVE Me alone [to deal] with him whom I have created\n\t\t\talone,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
and to whom I have granted resources vast,
and children as [love's] witnesses,
and to whose life I gave so wide a scope:<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
and yet, he greedily desires that I give yet more!
Nay, verily, it is against Our messages that he knowingly,\n\t\t\tstubbornly sets himself<sup class='fn'>7</sup> -
[and so] I shall constrain him to endure a painful uphill\n\t\t\tclimb!<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
Behold, [when Our messages are conveyed to one who is bent on\n\t\t\tdenying the truth,] he reflects and meditates [as to how to\n\t\t\tdisprove them] -
and thus he destroys himself,<sup class='fn'>9</sup> the way he meditates:
yea, he destroys himself, the way he meditates!
and then he looks [around for new arguments],
and then he frowns and glares,<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
and in the end he turns his back [on Our message], and glories in\n\t\t\this arrogance,
and says, "All this is mere spellbinding eloquence handed down\n\t\t\t[from olden times]!<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
This is nothing but the word of mortal man!"
[Hence,] I shall cause him to endure hell-fire [in the life to\n\t\t\tcome]!<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
And what could make thee conceive what hell-fire is?
It does not allow to live, and neither leaves [to die],
making [all truth] visible to mortal man.<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
Over it are nineteen [powers].<sup class='fn'>15</sup>

For We have caused none but angelic powers to lord over the fire
			[of hell];<sup class='fn'>16</sup> and We have not caused their number to be
			aught but a trial for those who are bent on denying the
			truth<sup class='fn'>17</sup> - to the end that they who have been granted
			revelation aforetime might be convinced [of the truth of this
			divine writ];<sup class='fn'>18</sup> and that they who have attained to faith
			[in it] might grow yet more firm in their faith; and that [both]
			they who have been granted the earlier revelation and they who
			believe [in this one] might be freed of all doubt; and that they
			in whose hearts is disease<sup class='fn'>19</sup> and they who deny the truth
			outright might ask, "What does [your] God mean by this
			parable?"<sup class='fn'>20</sup> In this way God lets go astray him that
			wills [to go astray],and guides aright him that wills [to be
			guided].<sup class='fn'>21</sup> And none can comprehend thy Sustainer's
			forces save Him alone: and all this<sup class='fn'>22</sup> is but a reminder
			to mortal man.
NAY, but consider the moon!<sup class='fn'>23</sup>
Consider the night when it departs,
and the morn when it dawns!
Verily, that [hell-fire] is indeed one of the great\n\t\t\t[forewarnings] -
a warning to mortal man -
to every one of you, whether he chooses to come forward or to\n\t\t\thang back!<sup class='fn'>24</sup>
[On the Day of Judgment,] every human being will be held in\n\t\t\tpledge for whatever [evil] he has wrought -
save only those who shall have attained to\n\t\t\trighteousness:<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
[dwelling] in gardens [of paradise], they will inquire
of those who were lost in sin:
"What has brought you into hell-fire?"
They will answer: "We were not among those who prayed,<sup class='fn'>26</sup>
and neither did we feed the needy;
and we were wont to indulge in sinning together with all [the\n\t\t\tothers] who indulged in it;
and the Day of Judgment we were wont to call a lie -
until certainty came upon us [in death]."
And so, of no benefit to them could be the intercession of any\n\t\t\tthat would intercede for them.<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
WHAT, THEN, is amiss with them<sup class='fn'>28</sup> that they turn away\n\t\t\tfrom all admonition
as though they were terrified asses
fleeing from a lion?
Yea, every one of them claims that he [himself] ought to have\n\t\t\tbeen given revelations unfolded!<sup class='fn'>29</sup>
Nay, but they do not [believe in and, hence, do not] fear the\n\t\t\tlife to come.
Nay, verily, this is an admonition -
and whoever wills may take it to heart.

But they [who do not believe in the life to come] will not take\n\t\t\tit to heart unless God so wills:<sup class='fn'>30</sup> [for] He is the Fount\n\t\t\tof all God-consciousness, and the Fount of all forgiveness.
NAY! I call to witness the Day of Resurrection!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
But nay! I call to witness the accusing voice of man's own\n\t\t\tconscience!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Does man think that We cannot [resurrect him and] bring his bones\n\t\t\ttogether again?
Yea indeed, We are able to make whole his very finger-tips!
None the less, man chooses to deny what lies ahead of him,
asking [derisively], "When is that Resurrection Day to be?"
But [on that Day,] when the eyesight is by fear confounded,
and the moon is darkened,
and the sun and the moon are brought together<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
on that Day will man exclaim, "Whither to flee?"
But nay: no refuge [for thee, O man]!
With thy Sustainer, on that Day, the journey's end will be!
Man will be apprised, on that Day, of what he has done and what\n\t\t\the has left undone:<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
nay, but man shall against himself be an eye-witness,
even though he may veil himself in excuses.<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
MOVE NOT thy tongue in haste, [repeating the words of the\n\t\t\trevelation:]<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
for, behold, it is for Us to gather it [in thy heart,] and to\n\t\t\tcause it to be read [as it ought to be read].<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
Thus, when We recite it, follow thou its wording [with all thy\n\t\t\tmind]:<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
and then, behold, it will be for Us to make its meaning\n\t\t\tclear.<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
NAY, but [most of] you love this fleeting life,
and give no thought to the life to come [and to Judgment Day]!
Some faces will on that Day be bright with happiness,
looking up to their Sustainer;
and some faces will on that Day be overcast with despair,
knowing that a crushing calamity is about to befall them.
NAY, but when [the last breath] comes up to the throat [of a\n\t\t\tdying man],
and people ask, "Is there any wizard [that could save\n\t\t\thim]?"<sup class='fn'>10</sup> -
the while he [himself] knows that this is the parting,
and is enwrapped in the pangs of death<sup class='fn'>11</sup> -:
at that time towards thy Sustainer does he feel impelled to\n\t\t\tturn!<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
[Useless, though, will be his repentance:<sup class='fn'>13</sup>] for [as\n\t\t\tlong as he was alive] he did not accept the truth, nor did he\n\t\t\tpray [for enlightenment],
but, on the contrary, he gave the lie to the truth and turned\n\t\t\taway [from it],
and then went arrogantly back to what he had come\n\t\t\tfrom.<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
[And yet, O man, thine end comes hourly] nearer unto thee, and\n\t\t\tnearer -
and ever nearer unto thee, and nearer!
DOES MAN, then, think that he is to be left to himself, to go\n\t\t\tabout at will?<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
Was he not once a [mere] drop of sperm that had been spilt,
and thereafter became a germcell - whereupon He created and\n\t\t\tformed [it] in accordance with what [it] was meant to\n\t\t\tbe,<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
and fashioned out of it the two sexes, the male and the female?
Is not He, then, able to bring the dead back to life?
HAS THERE [not] been an endless sup of time<sup class='fn'>1</sup> before man\n\t\t\t[appeared - a time] when he was not yet a thing to be thought\n\t\t\tof?<sup class='fn'>2</sup>

Verily, it is We who have created man out of a drop of sperm
			intermingled,<sup class='fn'>3</sup> so that We might try him [in his later
			life]: and therefore We made him a being endowed with hearing and
			sight.
Verily, We have shown him the way:<sup class='fn'>4</sup> [and it rests with\n\t\t\thim to prove himself] either grateful or ungrateful.
[Now,] behold, for those who deny the truth<sup class='fn'>5</sup> We have\n\t\t\treadied chains and shackles, and a blazing flame<sup class='fn'>6</sup> -
[whereas,] behold, the truly virtuous shall drink from a cup\n\t\t\tflavoured with the calyx of sweet smelling flowers:<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
a source [of bliss] whereof God's servants shall drink, seeing it\n\t\t\tflow in a flow abundant.<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
[The truly virtuous are] they [who] fulfil their vows,<sup class='fn'>9</sup>\n\t\t\tand stand in awe of a Day the woe of which is bound to spread far\n\t\t\tand wide,
and who give food - however great be their own want of\n\t\t\tit<sup class='fn'>10</sup> - unto the needy, and the orphan, and the\n\t\t\tcaptive,<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
[saying, in their hearts,] "We feed you for the sake of God\n\t\t\talone: we desire no recompense from you, nor thanks:
behold, we stand in awe of our Sustainer's judgment<sup class='fn'>12</sup> on\n\t\t\ta distressful, fateful Day!,
And so, God will preserve them from the woes of that Day, and\n\t\t\twill bestow on them brightness and joy,
and will reward them for all their patience in adversity with a\n\t\t\tgarden [of bliss] and with [garments of] silk.<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
In that [garden] they will on couches recline, and will know\n\t\t\ttherein neither [burning] sun nor cold severe,
since its [blissful] shades will come down low over\n\t\t\tthem,<sup class='fn'>14</sup> and low will hang down its clusters of fruit,\n\t\t\tmost easy to reach.<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
And they will be waited upon with vessels of silver and goblets\n\t\t\tthat will [seem to] be crystal -
crystal-like, [but] of silver - the measure whereof they alone\n\t\t\twill determine.<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
And in that [paradise] they will be given to drink of a cup\n\t\t\tflavoured with ginger,
[derived from] a source [to be found] therein, whose name is\n\t\t\t"Seek Thy Way".<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
And immortal youths will wait upon them:<sup class='fn'>18</sup> when thou\n\t\t\tseest them, thou wouldst deem them to be scattered pearls;
and when thou seest [anything that is] there, thou wilt see\n\t\t\t[only] bliss and a realm transcendent.

Upon those [blest] will be garments of green silk and brocade;
			and they will be adorned with bracelets of silver.<sup class='fn'>19</sup> And
			their Sustainer will give them to drink of a drink most
			pure.<sup class='fn'>20</sup>
[And they will be told:] "Verily, all this is your reward, since\n\t\t\tyour endeavour [in life] has met with [God's] goodly acceptance!"
VERILY, [O believer,] it is We who have bestowed from on high\n\t\t\tthis Qur'an upon thee, step by step<sup class='fn'>21</sup> truly a bestowal\n\t\t\tfrom on high!
Await, then, in all patience thy Sustainer's judgment,<sup class='fn'>22</sup>\n\t\t\tand pay no heed to any of them who is a wilful sinner or an\n\t\t\tingrate;
and bear in mind thy Sustainer's name<sup class='fn'>23</sup> at morn and\n\t\t\tevening
and during some of the night,<sup class='fn'>24</sup> and prostrate thyself\n\t\t\tbefore Him, and extol His limitless glory throughout the long\n\t\t\tnight.<sup class='fn'>25</sup>
Behold, they [who are unmindful of God] love this fleeting life,\n\t\t\tand leave behind them [all thought of] a grief-laden Day.

[They will not admit to themselves that] it is We who have
			created them and strengthened their make<sup class='fn'>26</sup> - and [that],
			if it be Our will, We can replace them entirely with others of
			their kind.<sup class='fn'>27</sup>
VERILY, all this is an admonition: whoever, then, so wills, may\n\t\t\tunto his Sustainer find a way.
But you cannot will it unless God wills [to show you that\n\t\t\tway]:<sup class='fn'>28</sup> for, behold, God is indeed all-seeing, wise.
He admits unto His grace everyone who wills [to be\n\t\t\tadmitted];<sup class='fn'>29</sup> but as for the evildoers - for them has He\n\t\t\treadied grievous suffering [in the life to come].
CONSIDER these [messages,] sent forth in waves<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and then storming on with a tempest's force!
Consider these [messages] that spread [the truth] far and wide,
thus separating [right and wrong] with all clarity,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
and then giving forth a reminder,
[promising] freedom from blame or [offering] warning!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
BEHOLD, all that you are told to expect<sup class='fn'>4</sup> will surely\n\t\t\tcome to pass.
Thus, [it will come to pass] when the stars are effaced,
and when the sky is rent asunder,
and when the mountains are scattered like dust,
and when all the apostles are called together at a time\n\t\t\tappointed....<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
For what day has the term [of all this] been set?
For the Day of Distinction [between the true and the\n\t\t\tfalse]!<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
And what could make thee conceive what that Day of Distinction\n\t\t\twill be?
Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
Did We not destroy [so many of] those [sinners] of olden days?
And We shall let them be followed by those of later\n\t\t\ttimes:<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
[for] thus do We deal with such as are lost in sin.
Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
Did We not create you out of a humble fluid,
which We then let remain in [the womb's] firm keeping
for a term pre-ordained?
Thus have We determined [the nature of man's creation]: and\n\t\t\texcellent indeed is Our power to determine [what is to\n\t\t\tbe]!<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
Have We not caused the earth to hold within itself
the living and the dead?<sup class='fn'>9</sup> -
and have We not set on it proud, firm mountains, and given you\n\t\t\tsweet water to drink?<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
GO ON towards that [resurrection] which you were wont to call a\n\t\t\tlie!
Go on towards the threefold shadows<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
that will offer no [cooling] shade and will be of no avail\n\t\t\tagainst the flame
which - behold! - will throw up sparks like [burning] logs,
like giant fiery ropes!<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth -
that Day on which they will not [be able to] utter a word,
nor be allowed to proffer excuses!
Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth
that Day of Distinction [between the true and the false, when\n\t\t\tthey will be told]: "We have brought you together with those\n\t\t\t[sinners] of olden times;
and if you [think that you] have a subterfuge left, try to outwit\n\t\t\tMe!"
Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
[AS AGAINST this,] behold, the God-conscious shall dwell amidst\n\t\t\t[cooling] shades and springs,
and [partake of] whatever fruit they may desire;
[and they will be told:] "Eat and drink in good cheer in return\n\t\t\tfor what you did [in life]!"<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
Thus, behold, do We reward the doers of good;
[but] woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
EAT [your fill] and enjoy your life for a little while, O you who\n\t\t\tare lost in sin!<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
[But] woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth,
and when they are told, "Bow down [before God]", do not bow down:
woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth!
In what other tiding, then, will they, after this, believe?
ABOUT WHAT do they [most often] ask one another?
About the awesome tiding [of resurrection],
on which they [so utterly] disagree.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Nay, but in time they will come to understand [it]!
And once again:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> Nay, but in time they will come to\n\t\t\tunderstand!
HAVE WE NOT made the earth a resting-place [for you],
and the mountains [its] pegs?<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
And We have created you in pairs;<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and We have made your sleep [a symbol of] death<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
and made the night [its] cloak
and made the day [a symbol of] life.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
And We have built above you seven firmaments,<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
and have placed [therein the sun,] a lamp full of blazing\n\t\t\tsplendour.
And from the wind-driven clouds We send down waters pouring in\n\t\t\tabundance,
so that We might bring forth thereby grain, and herbs,
and carders dense with foliage.<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
VERILY, the Day of Distinction [between the true and the\n\t\t\tfalse]<sup class='fn'>9</sup> has indeed its appointed time:
the Day when the trumpet [of resurrection] is sounded and you all\n\t\t\tcome forward in multitudes;
and when the skies are opened and become [as wideflung]\n\t\t\tgates;<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
and when the mountains are made to vanish as if they had been a\n\t\t\tmirage.<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
[On that Day,] verily, hell will lie in wait [for those who deny\n\t\t\tthe truth] -
a goal for all who are wont to transgress the bounds of what is\n\t\t\tright!
In it shall they remain for a long time.<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
Neither coolness shall they taste therein nor any\n\t\t\t[thirst-quenching] drink -
only burning despair and ice-cold darkness:<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
a meet requital [for their sins]!
Behold, they were not expecting to be called to account?
having given the lie to Our messages one and all:
but We have placed on record every single thing [of what they\n\t\t\tdid].
[And so We shall say:] "Taste, then, [the fruit of your evil\n\t\t\tdoings,] for now We shall bestow on you nothing but more and more\n\t\t\tsuffering!"<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
[But,] verily, for the God-conscious there is supreme fulfilment\n\t\t\tin store:<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
luxuriant gardens and vinyards,
and splendid companions well-matched,<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
and a cup [of happiness] overflowing.
No empty talk will they hear in that [paradise], nor any lie.
[All this will be] a reward from thy Sustainer, a gift in\n\t\t\taccordance with [His Own] reckoning<sup class='fn'>17</sup> -
[a reward from] the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and\n\t\t\tall that is between them, the Most Gracious! [And] none shall\n\t\t\thave it in their power to raise their voices unto Him

on the Day when all [human] souls<sup class='fn'>18</sup> and all the angels
			will stand up in ranks: none will speak but he to whom the Most
			Gracious will have given leave; and [everyone] will say [only]
			what is right.<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
That will be the Day of Ultimate Truth<sup class='fn'>20</sup> whoever wills,\n\t\t\tthen, let him take the path that leads towards his Sustainer!

Verily, We have warned you of suffering near at hand -
			[suffering] on the Day when man shall [clearly] see what his
			hands have sent ahead, and when he who has denied the truth shall
			say, "Oh, would that I were mere dust...!"<sup class='fn'>21</sup>
CONSIDER those [stars] that rise only to set,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and move [in their orbits] with steady motion,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
and float [through space] with floating serene,
and yet overtake [one another] with swift overtaking:<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
and thus they fulfil the [Creator's] behest!
[HENCE,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> think of] the Day when a violent convulsion\n\t\t\twill convulse [the world],
to be followed by further [convulsions]!
On that Day will [men's] hearts be throbbing,
[and] their eyes downcast....
[And yet,] some say, "What! Are we indeed to be restored to our\n\t\t\tformer state -
even though we may have become [a heap of] crumbling bones?"
[And] they add, "That, then, would be a return with\n\t\t\tloss!"<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
[But,] then, that [Last Hour] will be [upon them of a sudden, as\n\t\t\tif it were] but a single accusing cry -
and then, lo, they will be fully awakened [to the truth]!
HAS THE STORY of Moses ever come within thy ken?<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
Lo! His Sustainer called out to him in the twice-hallowed\n\t\t\tvalley:<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
"Go unto Pharaoh - for, verily, he has transgressed all bounds of\n\t\t\twhat is right -
and say [unto him], 'Art thou desirous of attaining to purity?
[If so,] then I shall guide thee towards [a cognition of] thy\n\t\t\tSustainer, so that [henceforth] thou wilt stand in awe [of\n\t\t\tHim].'"<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
And thereupon he [went to Pharaoh and] made him aware of the\n\t\t\tgreat wonder [of God's grace].<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
But [Pharaoh] gave him the lie and rebelliously rejected [all\n\t\t\tguidance],
and brusquely turned his back [on Moses];
and then he gathered [his great ones], and called [unto his\n\t\t\tpeople],
and said, "I am your Lord All-Highest!"<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
And thereupon God took him to task, [and made him] a warning\n\t\t\texample in the life to come as well as in this world.<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
In this, behold, there is a lesson indeed for all who stand in\n\t\t\tawe [of God].
[O MEN!] Are you more difficult to create than the heaven which\n\t\t\tHe has built?<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
High has He reared its vault and formed it in accordance with\n\t\t\twhat it was meant to be;<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
and He has made dark its night and brought forth its light of\n\t\t\tday.
And after that, the earth: wide has He spread its expanse,
and has caused its waters to come out of it, and its\n\t\t\tpastures,<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
and has made the mountains firm:
[all this] as a means of livelihood for you and your\n\t\t\tanimals.<sup class='fn'>15</sup>
AND SO, when the great, overwhelming event [of resurrection]\n\t\t\tcomes to pass -
on that Day man will [clearly] remember all that he has ever\n\t\t\twrought;
and the blazing fire [of hell] will be laid open before all who\n\t\t\t[are destined to] see it.<sup class='fn'>16</sup>
For, unto him who shall have transgressed the bounds of what is\n\t\t\tright,
and preferred the life of this world [to the good of his soul],
that blazing fire will truly be the goal!
But unto him who shall have stood in fear of his Sustainer's\n\t\t\tPresence, and held back his inner self from base desires,
paradise will truly be the goal!
THEY WILL ASK thee [O Prophet] about the Last Hours "When will it\n\t\t\tcome to pass?"
[But] how couldst thou tell anything about it,<sup class='fn'>17</sup>
[seeing that] with thy Sustainer alone rests the beginning and\n\t\t\tthe end [of all knowledge] thereof?<sup class='fn'>18</sup>
Thou art but [sent] to warn those who stand in awe of it.
On the Day when they behold it, [it will seem to them] as if they\n\t\t\thad tarried [in this world] no longer than one evening or [one\n\t\t\tnight, ending with] its morn!<sup class='fn'>19</sup>
HE FROWNED and turned away
because the blind man approached him!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Yet for all thou didst know, [O Muhammad,] he might perhaps have\n\t\t\tgrown in purity,
or have been reminded [of the truth], and helped by this\n\t\t\treminder.
Now as for him who believes himself to be\n\t\t\tself-sufficient<sup class='fn'>2</sup> -
to him didst thou give thy whole attention,
although thou art not accountable for his failure to attain to\n\t\t\tpurity;<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
but as for him who came unto thee full of eagerness
and in awe [of God]
him didst thou disregard!
NAY, VERILY, these [messages] are but a reminder:<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and so, whoever is willing may remember Him
in [the light of His] revelations blest with dignity,
lofty and pure,
[borne] by the hands of messengers
noble and most virtuous.
[But only too often] man destroys himself:<sup class='fn'>5</sup> how\n\t\t\tstubbornly does he deny the truth!
[Does man ever consider] out of what substance [God] creates him?
Out of a drop of sperm He creates him, and thereupon determines\n\t\t\this nature,<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
and then makes it easy for him to go through life;<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
and in the end He causes him to die and brings him to the grave;
and then, if it be His will, He shall raise him again to life.
Nay, but [man] has never yet fulfilled what He has enjoined upon\n\t\t\thim!<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
Let man, then, consider [the sources of] his food:
[how it is] that We pour down water, pouring it down abundantly;
and then We cleave the earth [with new growth], cleaving it\n\t\t\tasunder,
and thereupon We cause grain to grow out of it,
and vines and edible plants,
and olive trees and date-palms,
and gardens dense with foliage,
and fruits and herbage,
for you and for your animals to enjoy.<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
AND SO,<sup class='fn'>10</sup> when the piercing call [of resurrection] is\n\t\t\theard
on a Day when everyone will [want to] flee from his brothers
and from his mother and father,
and from his spouse and his children:
on that Day, to every one of them will his own state be of\n\t\t\tsufficient concern.
Some faces will on that Day be bright with happiness,
laughing, rejoicing at glad tidings.
And some faces will on that Day with dust be covered,
with darkness overspread:
these, these will be the ones who denied the truth and were\n\t\t\timmersed in iniquity!
WHEN THE SUN is shrouded in darkness,
and when the stars lose their light,
and when the mountains are made to vanish,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and when she-camels big with young, about to give birth, are left\n\t\t\tuntended,
and when all beasts are gathered together,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
and when the seas boil over,
and when all human beings are coupled [with their\n\t\t\tdeeds],<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
and when the girl-child that was buried alive is made to ask
for what crime she had been slain,<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and when the scrolls [of men's deeds] are unfolded,
and when heaven is laid bare,
and when the blazing fire [of hell] is kindled bright,
and when paradise is brought into view:
[on that Day] every human being will come to know what he has\n\t\t\tprepared [for himself].
BUT NAY! I call to witness the revolving stars,
the planets that run their course and set,
and the night as it darkly falls,
and the morn as it softly breathes:
behold, this [divine writ] is indeed the [inspired] word of a\n\t\t\tnoble apostle,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
with strength endowed, secure with Him who in almightiness is\n\t\t\tenthroned<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
[the word] of one to be heeded, and worthy of trust!
For, this fellow-man of yours is not a madman:<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
he truly beheld [the angel - beheld] him on the clear\n\t\t\thorizon;<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
and he is not one to begrudge others the knowledge [of whatever\n\t\t\thas been revealed to him] out of that which is beyond the reach\n\t\t\tof human perception.<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
Nor is this [message] the word of any satanic force\n\t\t\taccursed.<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
Whither, then, will you go?
This [message] is no less than a reminder to all mankind -
to every one of you who wills to walk a straight way.
But you cannot will it unless God, the Sustainer of all the\n\t\t\tworlds, wills [to show you that way].<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
WHEN THE SKY is cleft asunder,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and when the stars are scattered,
and when the seas burst beyond their bounds,
and when the graves are overturned
every human being will [at last] comprehend what he has sent\n\t\t\tahead and what he has held back [in this world].<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
O MAN! What is it that lures thee away from thy bountiful\n\t\t\tSustainer,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
who has created thee, and formed thee in accordance with what\n\t\t\tthou art meant to be,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> and shaped thy nature in just\n\t\t\tproportions,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
having put thee together in whatever form He willed [thee to\n\t\t\thave]?
Nay, [O men,] but you [are lured away from God whenever you are\n\t\t\ttempted to] give the lie to [God's] Judgment!<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
And yet, verily, there are ever-watchful forces over you,
noble, recording,
aware of whatever you do!<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
Behold, [in the life to come] the truly virtuous will indeed be\n\t\t\tin bliss,
whereas, behold, the wicked will indeed be in a blazing fire -
[a fire] which they shall enter on Judgment Day,
and which they shall not [be able to] evade.
And what could make thee conceive what that Judgment Day will be?
And once again: What could make thee conceive what that Judgment\n\t\t\tDay will be?<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
[It will be] a Day when no human being shall be of the least\n\t\t\tavail to another human being: for on that Day [it will become\n\t\t\tmanifest that] all sovereignty is God's alone.
WOE UNTO THOSE who give short measure:
those who, when they are to receive their due from [other]\n\t\t\tpeople, demand that it be given in full -
but when they have to measure or weigh whatever they owe to\n\t\t\tothers, give less than what is due!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Do they not know that they are bound to be raised from the dead
[and called to account] on an awesome Day -
the Day when all men shall stand before the Sustainer of all the\n\t\t\tworlds?
NAY, VERILY, the record of the wicked is indeed [set down] in a\n\t\t\tmode inescapable!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
And what could make thee conceive what that mode inescapable will\n\t\t\tbe?
A record [indelibly] inscribed!
Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth -
those who give the lie to the [coming of] Judgment Day:
for, none gives the lie to it but such as are wont to transgress\n\t\t\tagainst all that is right [and are] immersed in sin:<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
[and so,] whenever Our messages are conveyed to them, they but\n\t\t\tsay, "Fables of ancient times!"
Nay, but their hearts are corroded by all [the evil] that they\n\t\t\twere wont to do!<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
Nay, verily, from [the grace of] their Sustainer shall they on\n\t\t\tthat Day be debarred;
and then, behold, they shall enter the blazing fire
and be told: "This is the [very thing] to which you were wont to\n\t\t\tgive the lie!"
NAY, VERILY, the record of the truly virtuous is [set down] in a\n\t\t\tmode most lofty!<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
And what could make thee conceive what that mode most lofty will\n\t\t\tbe?
A record [indelibly] inscribed,
witnessed by all who have [ever] been drawn close unto\n\t\t\tGod.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
Behold, [in the life to come] the truly virtuous will indeed be\n\t\t\tin bliss:
[resting] on couches, they will look up [to God]:<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
upon their faces thou wilt see the brightness of bliss.
They will be given a drink of pure wine whereon the seal [of God]\n\t\t\twill have been set,
pouring forth with a fragrance of musk.<sup class='fn'>8</sup> To that [wine\n\t\t\tof paradise], then, let all such aspire as [are willing to]\n\t\t\taspire to things of high account:
for it is composed of all that is most exalting<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
a source [of bliss] whereof those who are drawn close unto God\n\t\t\tshall drink.<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
BEHOLD, those who have abandoned themselves to sin are wont to\n\t\t\tlaugh at such as have attained to faith;<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
and whenever they pass by them, they wink at one another\n\t\t\t[derisively];
and whenever they return to people of their own kind,<sup class='fn'>12</sup>\n\t\t\tthey return full of jests;
and whenever they see those [who believe,] they say, "Behold,\n\t\t\tthese [people] have indeed gone astray!"
And, withal, they have no call to watch over [the beliefs of]\n\t\t\tothers....<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
But on the Day [of Judgment], they who had attained to faith will\n\t\t\t[be able to] laugh at the [erstwhile] deniers of the\n\t\t\ttruth:<sup class='fn'>14</sup>
[for, resting in paradise] on couches, they will look on [and say\n\t\t\tto themselves]:
"Are these deniers of the truth being [thus] requited for [aught\n\t\t\tbut] what they were wont to do?"
WHEN THE SKY is split asunder,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
obeying its Sustainer, as in truth it must;
and when the earth is levelled,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
and casts forth whatever is in it, and becomes utterly\n\t\t\tvoid,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
obeying its Sustainer, as in truth it must -:
[then,] O man - thou [that] hast, verily, been toiling towards\n\t\t\tthy Sustainer in painful toil<sup class='fn'>4</sup> - then shalt thou meet\n\t\t\tHim!
And as for him whose record shall be placed in his right\n\t\t\thand,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
he will in time be called to account with an easy accounting,
and will [be able to] turn joyfully to those of his own\n\t\t\tkind.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
But as for him whose record shall be given to him behind his\n\t\t\tback,<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
he will in time pray for utter destruction:
but he will enter the blazing flame.
Behold, [in his earthly life] he lived joyfully among people of\n\t\t\this own kind<sup class='fn'>8</sup> -
for, behold, he never thought that he would have to return [to\n\t\t\tGod].
Yea indeed! His Sustainer did see all that was in him!
BUT NAY! I call to witness the sunset's [fleeting] afterglow,
and the night, and what it [step by step] unfolds,
and the moon, as it grows to its fullness:<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
[even thus, O men,] are you bound to move onward from stage to\n\t\t\tstage.<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
What, then, is amiss with them that they will not believe [in a\n\t\t\tlife to come]?<sup class='fn'>11</sup> -
and [that], when the Qur'an is read unto them, they do not fall\n\t\t\tdown in prostration?<sup class='fn'>12</sup>
Nay, but they who are bent on denying the truth give the lie [to\n\t\t\tthis divine writ]!
Yet God has full knowledge of what they conceal [in their\n\t\t\thearts].<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
Hence, give them the tiding of grievous suffering [in the life to\n\t\t\tcome] -
unless it be such [of them] as [repent, and] attain to faith, and\n\t\t\tdo good works: for theirs shall be a reward unending!
CONSIDER the sky full of great constellations,
and [then bethink thyself of] the promised Day,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and [of] Him who witnesses [all], and [of] that unto which\n\t\t\twitness is borne [by Him]!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
THEY DESTROY [but] themselves,<sup class='fn'>3</sup> they who would ready a\n\t\t\tpit
of fire fiercely burning [for all who have attained to\n\t\t\tfaith]!<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
Lo! [With glee do] they contemplate that [fire],
fully conscious of what they are doing to the\n\t\t\tbelievers,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
whom they hate for no other reason than that they believe in God,\n\t\t\tthe Almighty, the One to whom all praise is due,
[and] to whom the dominion of the heavens and the earth belongs.\n\t\t\tBut God is witness unto everything!

Verily, as for those who persecute believing men and believing\n\t\t\twomen, and thereafter do not repent, hell's suffering awaits\n\t\t\tthem: yea, suffering through fire awaits them!<sup class='fn'>6</sup>

[But,] verily, they who attain to faith and do righteous deeds\n\t\t\tshall [in the life to come] have gardens through which running\n\t\t\twaters flow - that triumph most great!<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
VERILY, thy Sustainer's grip is exceedingly strong!
Behold, it is He who creates [man] in the first instance, and He\n\t\t\t[it is who] will bring him forth anew.
And He alone is truly-forgiving, all-embracing in His love,
in sublime almightiness enthroned,<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
a sovereign doer of whatever He wills.
HAS IT ever come within thy ken, the story of the [sinful] hosts
of Pharaoh, and of [the tribe of] Thamud?<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
And yet, they who are bent on denying the truth persist in giving\n\t\t\tit the lie:
but all the while God encompasses them [with His knowledge and\n\t\t\tmight] without their being aware of it.<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
Nay, but this [divine writ which they reject] is a discourse\n\t\t\tsublime,
upon an imperishable tablet [inscribed].<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
CONSIDER the heavens and that which comes in the night!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
And what could make thee conceive what it is that comes in the\n\t\t\tnight?
It is the star that pierces through [life's] darkness:
[for] no human being has ever been left unguarded.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
LET MAN, then, observe out of what he has been created:
he has been created out of a seminal fluid
issuing from between the loins [of man] and the pelvic arch [of\n\t\t\twoman].<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Now, verily, He [who thus creates man in the first instance] is\n\t\t\twell able to bring him back [to life]
on the Day when all secrets will be laid bare,
and [man] will have neither strength nor helper!
Consider<sup class='fn'>4</sup> the heavens, ever-revolving,
and the earth, bursting forth with plants!
BEHOLD, this [divine writ] is indeed a word that cuts between\n\t\t\ttruth and falsehood,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
and is no idle tale.
Behold, they [who refuse to accept it] devise marry a false\n\t\t\targument<sup class='fn'>6</sup> [to disprove its truth];
but I shall bring all their scheming to nought.<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
Let, then, the deniers of the truth have their will: let them\n\t\t\thave their will for a little while!
EXTOL the limitless glory of thy Sustainer's name: [the glory of]\n\t\t\tthe All-Highest,
who creates [every thing], and thereupon forms it in accordance\n\t\t\twith what it is meant to be,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and who determines the nature [of all that exists],<sup class='fn'>2</sup> and\n\t\t\tthereupon guides it [towards its fulfilment],
and who brings forth herbage,
and thereupon causes it to decay into rust-brown\n\t\t\tstubble!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
WE SHALL teach thee, and thou wilt not forget [aught of what thou\n\t\t\tart taught],

save what God may will [thee to forget]<sup class='fn'>4</sup> - for, verily,\n\t\t\tHe [alone] knows all that is open to [man's] perception as well\n\t\t\tas all that is hidden [from it]<sup class='fn'>5</sup> -:
and [thus] shall We make easy for thee the path towards\n\t\t\t[ultimate] ease.<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
REMIND, THEN, [others of the truth, regardless of] whether this\n\t\t\treminding [would seem to] be of use [or not]:<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
in mind will keep it he who stands in awe [of God],
but aloof from it will remain that most hapless wretch -
he who [in the life to come] shall have to endure the great fire
wherein he will neither die nor remain alive.<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
To happiness [in the life to come] will indeed attain he who\n\t\t\tattains to purity [in this world],
and remembers his Sustainer's name, and prays [unto Him].
But nay, [0 men,] you prefer the life of this world,
although the life to come is better and more enduring
Verily, [all] this has indeed been [said] in the earlier\n\t\t\trevelations -
the revelations of Abraham and Moses.<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
HAS THERE COME unto thee the tiding of the Overshadowing\n\t\t\tEvent?<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Some faces will on that Day be downcast,
toiling [under burdens of sin], worn out [by fear],
about to enter a glowing fire,
given to drink from a boiling spring.
No food for them save the bitterness of dry thorns,
which gives no strength and neither stills hunger.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
[And] some faces will on that Day shine with bliss,
well-pleased with [the fruit of] their striving,
in a garden sublime,
wherein thou wilt hear no empty talk.
Countless springs<sup class='fn'>3</sup> will flow therein,
[and] there will be thrones [of happiness] raised high,<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and goblets placed ready,
and cushions ranged,
and carpets spread out....
DO, THEN, they [who deny resurrection] never gaze at the clouds\n\t\t\tpregnant with water, [and observe] how they are\n\t\t\tcreated?<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
And at the sky, how it is raised aloft?
And at the mountains, how firmly they are reared?
And at the earth, how it is spread out?
And so, [O Prophet,] exhort them; thy task is only to exhort:
thou canst not compel them [to believe].<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
However, as for him who turns away, being bent on denying the\n\t\t\ttruth,
him will God cause to suffer the greatest suffering [in the life\n\t\t\tto come]:
for, behold, unto Us will be their return,
and, verily, it is for Us to call them to account.
CONSIDER the daybreak
and the ten nights!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Consider the multiple and the One!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Consider the night as it runs its course!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Considering all this - could there be, to anyone endowed with\n\t\t\treason, a [more] solemn evidence of the truth?<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
ART THOU NOT aware of how thy Sustainer has dealt with [the tribe\n\t\t\tof] 'Ad,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
[the people of] Iram the many-pillared,
the like of whom has never been reared in all the land? -
and with [the tribe of] Thamud,<sup class='fn'>6</sup> who hollowed out rocks\n\t\t\tin the valley? -
and with Pharaoh of the [many] tent-poles?<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
[It was they] who transgressed all bounds of equity all over\n\t\t\ttheir lands,
and brought about great corruption therein:
and therefore thy Sustainer let loose upon them a scourge of\n\t\t\tsuffering:
for, verily, thy Sustainer is ever on the watch!

BUT AS FOR man,<sup class='fn'>8</sup> whenever his Sustainer tries him by His\n\t\t\tgenerosity and by letting him enjoy a life of ease, he says, "My\n\t\t\tSustainer has been [justly] generous towards me";<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
whereas, whenever He tries him by straitening his means of\n\t\t\tlivelihood, he says, "My Sustainer has disgraced me!"<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
But nay, nay, [O men, consider all that you do and fail to do:]\n\t\t\tyou are not generous towards the orphan,
and you do not urge one another to feed the needy,<sup class='fn'>11</sup>
and you devour the inheritance [of others] with devouring greed,
and you love wealth with boundless love!
Nay, but [how will you fare on Judgment Day,] when the earth is\n\t\t\tcrushed with crushing upon crushing,
and [the majesty of] thy Sustainer stands revealed,<sup class='fn'>12</sup> as\n\t\t\twell as [the true nature of] the angels, rank upon rank?
And on that Day hell will be brought [within sight]; on that Day\n\t\t\tman will remember [all that he did and failed to do]: but what\n\t\t\twill that remembrance avail him?
He will say, "Oh, would that I had provided beforehand for my\n\t\t\tlife [to come]!"
For, none can make suffer as He will make suffer [the sinners] on\n\t\t\tthat Day,
and none can bind with bonds like His.<sup class='fn'>13</sup>
[But unto the righteous God will say,] "O thou human being that\n\t\t\thast attained to inner peace!
Return thou unto thy Sustainer, well-pleased [and] pleasing\n\t\t\t[Him]:
enter, then, together with My [other true] servants -
yea, enter thou My paradise!"
NAY! I call to witness this land -
this land in which thou art free to dwell<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and [I call to witness] parent and offspring:<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Verily, We have created man into [a life of] pain, toil and\n\t\t\ttrial.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Does he, then, think that no one has power over him?
He boasts, "I have spent wealth abundant!"<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
Does he, then, think that no one sees him?<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
Have We not given him two eyes,
and a tongue, and a pair of lips,<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
and shown him the two highways [of good and evil]?
But he would not try to ascend the steep uphill road....
And what could make thee conceive what it is, that steep uphill\n\t\t\troad?
[It is] the freeing of one's neck [from the burden of\n\t\t\tsin],<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
or the feeding, upon a day of [one's own] hunger,
of an orphan near of kin,
or of a needy [stranger] lying in the dust -
and being, withal, of those who have attained to faith, and who\n\t\t\tenjoin upon one another patience in adversity, and enjoin upon\n\t\t\tone another compassion.
Such are they that have attained to righteousness;<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
whereas those who are bent on denying the truth of Our messages -\n\t\t\tthey are such as have lost themselves in evil,
[with] fire closing in upon them.<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
CONSIDER the sun and its radiant brightness,
and the moon as it reflects the sun!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Consider the day as it reveals the world,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
and the night as it veils it darkly!
Consider the sky and its wondrous make,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
and the earth and all its expanse!
Consider the human self,<sup class='fn'>4</sup> and how it is formed in\n\t\t\taccordance with what it is meant to be,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
and how it is imbued with moral failings as well as with\n\t\t\tconsciousness of God!<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
To a happy state shall indeed attain he who causes this [self] to\n\t\t\tgrow in purity,
and truly lost is he who buries it [in darkness].
TO [THIS] TRUTH gave the lie, in their overweening arrogance,\n\t\t\t[the tribe of] Thamud,<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
when that most hapless wretch from among them rushed forward [to\n\t\t\tcommit his evil deed],
although God's apostle had told them, "It is a she-camel\n\t\t\tbelonging to God, so let her drink [and do her no\n\t\t\tharm]!"<sup class='fn'>8</sup>

But they gave him the lie, and cruelly slaughtered her<sup class='fn'>9</sup>\n\t\t\t- whereupon their Sustainer visited them with utter destruction\n\t\t\tfor this their sin, destroying them all alike:
for none [of them] had any fear of what might befall\n\t\t\tthem.<sup class='fn'>10</sup>
CONSIDER the night as it veils [the earth] in darkness,
and the day as it rises bright!
Consider the creation of the male and the female!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Verily, [O men,] you aim at most divergent ends!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Thus, as for him who gives [to others] and is conscious of God,
and believes in the truth of the ultimate good<sup class='fn'>3</sup> -
for him shall We make easy the path towards [ultimate]\n\t\t\tease.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
But as for him who is niggardly, and thinks that he is\n\t\t\tself-sufficient,<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
and calls the ultimate good a lie -
for him shall We make easy the path towards hardship:
and what will his wealth avail him when he goes down [to his\n\t\t\tgrave]?<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
BEHOLD, it is indeed for Us to grace [you] with guidance;
and, behold, Ours is [the dominion over] the life to come as well\n\t\t\tas [over] this earlier part [of your life]:<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
and so I warn you of the raging fire -
[the fire] which none shall have to endure but that most hapless\n\t\t\twretch
who gives the lie to the truth and turns away [from it].
For, distant from it shall remain he who is truly conscious of\n\t\t\tGod:
he that spends his possessions [on others] so that he might grow\n\t\t\tin purity -
not as payment for favours received,<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
but only out of a longing for the countenance of his Sustainer,\n\t\t\tthe All-Highest:
and such, indeed, shall in time be well-pleased.
CONSIDER the bright morning hours,
and the night when it grows still and dark.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Thy Sustainer has not forsaken thee, nor does He scorn\n\t\t\tthee:<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
for, indeed, the life to come will be better for thee than this\n\t\t\tearlier part [of thy life]!
And, indeed, in time will thy Sustainer grant thee [what thy\n\t\t\theart desires], and thou shalt be well-pleased.
