Has He not found thee an orphan, and given thee\n\t\t\tshelter?<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
And found thee lost on thy way, and guided thee?
And found thee in want, and given thee sufficiency?
Therefore, the orphan shalt thou never wrong,
and him that seeks [thy] help shalt thou never chide,<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and of thy Sustainer's blessings shalt thou [ever]\n\t\t\tspeak.<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
HAVE WE NOT opened up thy heart,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and lifted from thee the burden
that had weighed so heavily on thy back?<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
And [have We not] raised thee high in dignity?<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
And, behold, with every hardship comes ease:
verily, with every hardship comes ease!
Hence, when thou art freed [from distress], remain steadfast,
and unto thy Sustainer turn with love.
CONSIDER the fig and the olive,
and Mount Sinai,
and this land secure!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Verily, We create man in the best conformation,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
and thereafter We reduce him to the lowest of low -<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
excepting only such as attain to faith and do good works: and\n\t\t\ttheirs shall be a reward unending!
What, then, [O man,] could henceforth cause thee to give the lie\n\t\t\tto this moral law?<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
Is not God the most just of judges?
READ<sup class='fn'>1</sup> in the name of thy Sustainer, who has created -
created man out of a germ-cell!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Read - for thy Sustainer is the Most Bountiful One
who has taught [man] the use of the pen -
taught man what he did not know!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Nay, verily, man becomes grossly overweening
whenever he believes himself to be self-sufficient:
for, behold, unto thy Sustainer all must return.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
HAST THOU ever considered him who tries to prevent
a servant [of God] from praying?<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
Hast thou considered whether he is on the right way,
or is concerned with God-consciousness?<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
Hast thou considered whether he may [not] be giving the lie to\n\t\t\tthe truth and turning his back [upon it]?<sup class='fn'>7</sup>
Does he, then, not know that God sees [all]?
Nay, if he desist not, We shall most surely drag him down upon\n\t\t\this forehead -<sup class='fn'>8</sup>
the lying, rebellious, forehead! -
and then let him summon [to his aid] the counsels of his own\n\t\t\t[spurious] wisdom,<sup class='fn'>9</sup>
[the while] We shall summon the forces of heavenly chastisement!
Nay, pay thou no heed to him, but prostrate thyself [before God]\n\t\t\tand draw close [unto Him]!
BEHOLD, from on high have We bestowed this [divine writ] on the\n\t\t\tNight of Destiny.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
And what could make thee conceive what it is, that Night of\n\t\t\tDestiny?
The Night of Destiny is better than a thousand months:<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
in hosts descend in it the angels,<sup class='fn'>3</sup> bearing divine\n\t\t\tinspiration<sup class='fn'>4</sup> by their Sustainer's leave; from all [evil]\n\t\t\tthat may happen
does it make secure,<sup class='fn'>5</sup> until the rise of dawn.

IT IS NOT [conceivable] that such as are bent on [denying the
			truth - be they] from among the followers of earlier revelation
			or from among those who ascribe divinity to aught beside
			God<sup class='fn'>1</sup> - should ever be abandoned [by Him] ere there comes
			unto them the [full] evidence of the truth:
an apostle from God, conveying [unto them] revelations blest with\n\t\t\tpurity,
wherein there are ordinances of ever-true soundness and\n\t\t\tclarity.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>

Now those who have been vouchsafed revelation aforetime<sup class='fn'>3</sup>\n\t\t\tdid break up their unity [of faith] after such an evidence of the\n\t\t\ttruth had come to them.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>

And withal, they were not enjoined aught but that they should
			worship God, sincere in their faith in Him alone, turning away
			from all that is false;<sup class='fn'>5</sup> and that they should be
			constant in prayer; and that they should spend in
			charity:<sup class='fn'>6</sup> for this is a moral law endowed with ever-true
			soundness and clarity.<sup class='fn'>7</sup>

Verily, those who [despite all evidence] are bent on denying the
			truth<sup class='fn'>8</sup> - [be they] from among the followers of earlier
			revelation or from among those who ascribe divinity to aught
			beside God - will find themselves in the fire of hell, therein to
			abide: they are the worst of all creatures.
[And,] verily, those who have attained to faith and do righteous\n\t\t\tdeeds - it is they, they who are the best of all creatures.

Their reward [awaits them] with God: gardens of perpetual bliss,
			through which running waters flow, therein to abide beyond the
			count of time; well-pleased is God with them, and well-pleased
			are they with Him: all this awaits him who of his Sustainer
			stands in awe!
WHEN THE EARTH quakes with her [last] mighty quaking,
and [when] the earth yields up her burdens,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
and man cries out, "What has happened to her?"
on that Day will she recount all her tidings,
as thy Sustainer will have inspired her to do.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
On that Day will all men come forward, cut off from one\n\t\t\tanother,<sup class='fn'>3</sup> to be shown their [past] deeds.
And so, he who shall have done an atom's weight of good, shall\n\t\t\tbehold it;
and he who shall have done an atom's weight of evil, shall behold\n\t\t\tit.
Oh,<sup class='fn'>1</sup> the chargers that run panting,
sparks of fire striking,
rushing to assault at morn,
thereby raising clouds of dust,
thereby storming [blindly] into any host!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
VERILY, towards his Sustainer man is most ungrateful<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
and to this, behold, he [himself] bears witness indeed:
for, verily, to the love of wealth is he most ardently devoted.
But does he not know that [on the Last Day,] when all that is in\n\t\t\tthe graves is raised and brought out,
and all that is [hidden] in men's hearts is bared -
that on that Day their Sustainer [will show that He] has always\n\t\t\tbeen fully aware of them?
OH, the sudden calamity!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
How awesome the sudden calamity!
And what could make thee conceive what that sudden calamity will\n\t\t\tbe?
[It will occur] on the Day when men will be like moths swarming\n\t\t\tin confusion,
and the mountains will be like fluffy tufts of wool....
And then, he whose weight [of good deeds] is heavy in the balance
shall find himself in a happy state of life;
whereas he whose weight is light in the balance
shall be engulfed by an abyss.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
And what could make thee conceive what that [abyss] will be?
A fire hotly burning!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
YOU ARE OBSESSED by greed for more and more
until you go down to your graves.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Nay, in time you will come to understand!
And once again:<sup class='fn'>2</sup> Nay, in time you will come to\n\t\t\tunderstand!
Nay, if you could but understand [it] with an understanding\n\t\t\t[born] of certainty,
you would indeed, most surely, behold the blazing fire [of\n\t\t\thell]!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
In the end you will indeed, most surely, behold it with the eye\n\t\t\tof certainty:<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
and on that Day you will most surely be called to account for\n\t\t\t[what you did with] the boon of life!
CONSIDER the flight of time!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Verily, man is bound to lose himself
unless he be of those<sup class='fn'>2</sup> who attain to faith, and do good\n\t\t\tworks, and enjoin upon one another the keeping to truth, and\n\t\t\tenjoin upon one another patience in adversity.
WOE unto every slanderer, fault-finder!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
[Woe unto him<sup class='fn'>2</sup>] who amasses wealth and counts it a\n\t\t\tsafeguard,
thinking that his wealth will make him live forever!<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
Nay, but [in the life to come such as] he shall indeed be\n\t\t\tabandoned to crushing torment!<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
And what could make thee conceive what that crushing torment will\n\t\t\tbe?
A fire kindled by God,
which will rise over the [guilty] hearts:<sup class='fn'>5</sup>
verily, it will close in upon them
in endless columns!<sup class='fn'>6</sup>
ART THOU NOT aware of how thy Sustainer dealt with the Army of\n\t\t\tthe Elephant?<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Did He not utterly confound their artful planning?
Thus, He let loose upon them great swarms of flying creatures
which smote them with stone-hard blows of chastisement\n\t\t\tpre-ordained,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
and caused them to become like a field of grain that has been\n\t\t\teaten down to stubble -<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
SO THAT the Quraysh might remain secure,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
secure in their winter and summer journeys.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
Let them, therefore, worship the Sustainer of this\n\t\t\tTemple,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
who has given them food against hunger, and made them safe from\n\t\t\tdanger.<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
HAST THOU ever considered [the kind of man] who gives the lie to\n\t\t\tall moral law?<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
Behold, it is this [kind of man] that thrusts the orphan away,
and feels no urge<sup class='fn'>2</sup> to feed the needy.
Woe, then, unto those praying ones
whose hearts from their prayer are remote -<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
those who want only to be seen and praised,
and, withal, deny all assistance [to their fellowmen]!<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
BEHOLD, We have bestowed upon thee good in abundance:<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
hence, pray unto thy Sustainer [alone], and sacrifice [unto Him\n\t\t\talone].
Verily, he that hates thee has indeed been cut off [from all that\n\t\t\tis good]!<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
SAY: "O you who deny the truth!<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
"I do not worship that which you worship,
and neither do you worship that which I worship.
"And I will not worship that which you have [ever] worshipped,
and neither will you [ever] worship that which I\n\t\t\tworship.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
"Unto you, your moral law, and unto me, mine!"<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
WHEN GOD'S SUCCOUR comes, and victory,
and thou seest people enter God's religion<sup class='fn'>1</sup> in hosts,
extol thy Sustainer's limitless glory, and praise Him, and seek\n\t\t\tHis forgiveness: for, behold, He is ever an acceptor of\n\t\t\trepentance.<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
DOOMED are the hands of him of the glowing countenance<sup class='fn'>1</sup>\n\t\t\tand doomed is he!
What will his wealth avail him, and all that he has gained?
[In the life to come] he shall have to endure a fire fiercely\n\t\t\tglowing,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
together with his wife, that carrier of evil tales,<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
[who bears] around her neck a rope of twisted strands!<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
SAY: "He is the One God:
"God the Eternal, the Uncaused Cause of All Being.<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
"He begets not, and neither is He begotten;
"and there is nothing that could be compared with Him."<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
SAY: "I seek refuge with the Sustainer of the rising\n\t\t\tdawn,<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
"from the evil of aught that He has created,
"and from the evil of the black darkness whenever it\n\t\t\tdescends,<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
"and from the evil of all human beings bent on occult\n\t\t\tendeavours.<sup class='fn'>3</sup>
"and from the evil of the envious when he envies."<sup class='fn'>4</sup>
SAY: "I seek refuge with the Sustainer of men,
"the Sovereign of men,
"the God of men,
"from the evil of the whispering, elusive tempter
"who whispers in the hearts of men<sup class='fn'>1</sup>
"from all [temptation to evil by] invisible forces as well as\n\t\t\tmen."<sup class='fn'>2</sup>
